name_location: Cargill · EMEA Reposted  1 week ago  · 168 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 157 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive.
Job Purpose and Impact
The Biostatistician and Aquatic Animal Modeler will design clinical and research studies and review protocols and reports. In this role, you will conduct analysis on biological and science trial data, including collection and interpretation of data from various sources such as surveys, experiments and studies. You will partner with other statistics professionals to provide advanced statistical and analytical expertise to Aqua research and development teams and businesses. You will design, support, and model aquatic fish and crustacean growth biology and nutritional physiology, working in conjunction with researchers, to lead Cargill in aquatic nutrition and welfare during development.

The position can be 100% remote. Location is subject to compliance check and approval. 

Key Accountabilities
Apply complex statistical methods to analyze results and reports and make appropriate inference for scientific research.
Prepare data and build reports, charts and tables based on appropriate statistical methods.
Provide expertise for designing experiments for complex trials and statistical evaluation to Cargill global research community.
Implement programs to establish methodologies in data quality within the organization.
Apply knowledge of business practices to select statistical methods for appropriate decision making for the organization.
Monitor and participate in external field of research to keep up with best practices and advocate for their appropriate internal use.
Design and support the development of aquatic models to evaluate nutrition, welfare, and biomass
Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff.
Other duties as assigned. 

Qualifications
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience (statistics, aquaculture, marine biology, zoology, or related).
Knowledge and experience in developing code in R or Python.
Proven related work experience.
Prior experience in aquatic biology or aquaculture.
Fluent in English language, written and oral.
Travel requirement up to 15%.
Flexible to work from time to time with colleagues across multiple time zones. 
Preferred Qualifications
Prior statistical expertise in comprehensive statistical meta-analysis of data.
Prior statistical expertise in programming of common statistical methods in related research, including Markov chain Monte Carlo and Bayesian statistics.
Experience in providing solutions and recommendations for a variety of technical problems of moderate scope and complexity.
Prior expertise in aquatic biological systems and aquaculture nutrition. 

 Our Offer
We provide a fast paced stimulating international environment, which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents. We also offer competitive salary and benefits combined with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest and most solid private companies in the world.
Interested? Then make sure to send us your CV and cover letter in English today: 
Follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/cargill
Cargill is committed to being an inclusive employer. Click here to find out more https://careers.cargill.com/diversity/

name_location: Appear · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 45 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Are you ready to dive into an extraordinary summer filled with innovation, learning and fun? Look no further!
Appear, a trailblazing employer, is looking for motivated students who want to work as FPGA or software developers for the summer of 2024!
Company overview
Headquartered in Oslo, Norway, and with customers in over 100 countries, Appear is a award winning, leading supplier of media processing and delivery technology—providing the backbone that production companies, telcos and broadcasters trust to make immersive live experiences possible for their viewers.
Founded in 2004, by 11 former Tandberg Television employees, Appear has earned a strong reputation in the market for its exceptional products and expertise. Our core values center around modularity, quality and efficiency, and we are dedicated to minimizing the environmental footprint of our products and their operation.
We have been honored with numerous national and international awards for our achievements in revenue growth, international expansion and technological innovation. In 2021, we proudly received TVBEurope's prestigious Best of Show award and secured a grant from Innovation Norway for our groundbreaking NEO Series, a cutting-edge line of software compression products.
As the consumer demand for content on various devices continues to grow, we actively engage with industry organizations and technology partners to drive standardization and foster ongoing innovation. This enables our customers to remain at the forefront of an ever-evolving market where expectations and demands are constantly changing.

Software Student Developers
As a summer intern with us, you will be part of our development department, which is dedicated to crafting products for multi-platform TV delivery. You will find yourself in an environment with colleagues fueled by a passion for innovation and technological progress
 Areas you will explore: 
Software design
Programming in Rust, Typescript, Python and/or C++
Linux, Docker, JSON
Project execution

 FPGA Student Developers
As a summer intern with us, you will be working with highly skilled FPGA developers in one of the most extensive FPGA communities in Norway. You will find yourself in an environment with colleagues fueled by a passion for innovation and technological progress.
 Areas you will explore:
FPGA design
Programming in VHDL and/or Python
Simulation and testing

 What kind of student are you?
You consider yourself to be a good team player with a strong interest in either FPGA design or Software development. 
You are genuinely enthusiastic about participating in an 8-week summer internship
You possess a natural sense of curiosity and recognize the significance of acquiring new knowledge
You take pleasure in uncovering solutions and enhancing anything you believe can be improved
You like to share your ideas and perspective with other people

Why Appear? 
Immerse yourself in an environment that fosters continuous learning, creativity and growth
Collaborate with experienced professionals who genuinely care about your development
Career opportunities in an international and engaged working environment
The opportunity to strategically lead, impact, and shape the future of a thriving company in a global and dynamic industry
In-house gym and subsidized cafeteria with a multitude of temptations
Free parking incl. free charging of electric car at our premises centrally located at Lysaker
We are an informal organization that fosters inclusivity and diversity. At Appear, you will experience the entrepreneurial spirit of a medium-sized company, collaborating closely with decision-makers and customers, all while engaging with world-class, cutting-edge technology.

Application Details:
Please attach your diploma to the application. 
Application Deadline: As soon as possible!

job_title: We are looking for Tech graduates to our IT/Tech track in Norway!
name_location: Tietoevry · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  1 day ago  · 3 applicants
job_description:
About the job
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.

Would you like to kickstart your career in a place where you can impact society, for good?  

Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive. Whether you are a strategist, coder, analyst, or a future-enthusiast, you will find your place here. 

Our five end-to-end business units are Create, Industry, Care, Tech Services & Banking. This recruitment round we are looking for graduates to join Tietoevry Create and Tietoevry Industry. Click the links to read more about the business units!

We are now recruiting graduates for the fall of 2024 in Norway! Become a part of our team consisting of 24,000 experts globally, helping businesses and societies meet their full potential – while you are also reaching yours.

The Program 

The Graduate Program will give you a comprehensive introduction to our company and culture, as well as markets and customer projects. On top of that our Graduate program offers networking and development opportunities with your fellow Graduates. 

What we offer? 

Once onboard you will get full access to a personal mentor for all work-related questions, and a buddy who is your best friend, and shows you the best coffee machine, Nordic graduate networking events, young professional network activities & gatherings. You are immediately enrolled into our well-established learning communities and experience from collaborating with multiple digital disciplines. Apart from this we offer: 

Professional and personal growth. We believe that learning and growing together helps us to become better every day. You get to challenge yourself as you will get onboarded to work in our tech company with the support of your leader, team, and personal mentor. 
Work-life-balance. We offer you professional growth, purposeful and meaningful engagements, and an outstanding work-life balance, all backed by competitive compensation. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. 
Community of professionals and friends. Ask anyone, the number one reason to join us is people! You will have a chance to build your network across the company through our learning communities and together with other graduates! As part of our team, you will take part in creating the future of a growing and fast-developing tech sector as part of a team whose culture is built upon a strong sense of support, fun & belonging. 
Genuinely impact our society's future by working on meaningful projects that will impact millions of people. You get to influence how digitalization serves millions of people, today and tomorrow. We work with customers of all sizes, and both in the private and public sector. 
You become part of a community where people are respected and valued. Come as you are and work the way you want. Our communities are nurtured and driven by passionate people at the front line. For us, diversity and inclusion are fundamental in the creation of an inspirational workplace and being different is how we drive innovation forwards. 


Who might you be? 

We are looking for people with a background or competence in tech-related fields. You get to work with a range of different technologies, from Software development (ex. Java, .Net), UX Design, AI/robotics, business intelligence, and so much more.

More specifically you: 

Have recently graduated, or you are about to graduate from your final year of studies. 
Have a minimum of a bachelor’s degree within specific tech-related subjects, For example, programming, data engineering, informatics, and information processing. We are also interested in a wider it-related competencies, such as information systems science. 
Are fluent in English, and Norwegian. 


 

Location? 

We are in many locations in Norway so you will have the opportunity to specify your desired locations when you apply! You will be asked to choose multiple locations and we will match you with open graduate positions based on your answer. 

The cities we are recruiting to this round: Oslo, Stavanger, Bergen & Trondheim.

 

The recruitment process:

In our business we are solving our customers’ challenges every day. Diversity enables innovation – and innovation is what we live on in this highly dynamic technology sector. Diverse teams enable creating best user experiences for the diverse users of digital services and solutions. We achieve this by offering a thought through and fair recruitment process. 

 Your gateway to us will be through our gamified recruitment process. This process is tailored to give you a fair and objective screening that is also fun to experience. 
 We use your assessment results, video response, questionnaire answers and CV to match you with the open Graduate positions available. 
 Based on this, selected candidates will be invited to our digital speed interviews, followed by in-depth interviews. Our Graduate Program 2024 kicks off in September, employment start date can be earlier based on individual agreement and depending on the position. 


Please write your CV in English. In addition to your CV, we ask that you also upload a copy of university and/or college grade transcripts. For applicants with ongoing studies, a preliminary grade transcript for completed courses should be submitted. 

Please note, you will not be able to edit your application after it has been submitted, please make sure all attachment and information is correct before submitting your application.  

We will start the recruiting process after the end date of the application which is 15th of October 2023. In case of any questions, please contact graduatenorway@tietoevry.com

Looking forward to hearing from you!

name_location: H5P Group AS · Tromsø, Troms og Finnmark, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 23 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Do you want to help students all over the world get a better education? And get the opportunity to develop the tools that your lecturer uses to create next generation interactive content for your class? Do you want to experience how it is working in a fast growing product-based start-up where everyone is passionate and proud of what they are creating? - If the answer is “yes”, you should definitely keep reading this post..

We are a tech company experiencing strong growth. To support this growth, we are actively on the lookout for new additions to our team; someone who is passionate about technology, and is smart and friendly! We have extensive experience in onboarding summer interns and later on successfully reboarding them as full time employees after they have finished their studies.

We are very happy that our company is being built by fun, down-to-earth, hardworking, talented and ambitious people. This is the place for you to start your career if you have aspirations of working with a high degree of professional freedom, space for creativity, shaping your own workday while creating immense value for millions of people.

As a summer intern at H5P Group you will work on an exciting project in a team with other students, while being followed up by a dedicated mentor. Previous summer interns have taken great pride in working with on this content type as an example Image Choice | H5P- As a summer intern at H5P Group you will get the opportunity to fail, improve and most importantly learn. Being a developer at our team takes you through all the stages of the development life cycle: discussing the idea together with others, designing and workshopping, development, testing, and finally release.

We Offer

The opportunity to be a part of changing the future for Internet content.
A rich variation of challenges where the results of your efforts will be used by millions of people around the world.
Flextime with core time from 9:00 - 15:00.
Competitive salary and incentives like free lunch and snacks.
In Tromsø we’re at the popular “Flow Coworking Space” and warm lunches are made every day by Flow’s chefs. 
The ability to influence the development of our products, and a place where you will quickly see your work realized and recognized.
The ability to work with great colleagues in a pleasant and modern office, centrally situated in Tromsø. We also offer the flexibility of working some days from home.
You will have great opportunities for career development through internal workshops, training and various work tasks.
An Inclusive, International and creative workplace, where we give our employees responsibility and trust, along with the opportunity to shape their own working day.

When and where

You will work 6-7 weeks starting from mid june to mid august and the possibility to take 2 weeks of vacation somewhere in the middle. This summer internship is set to be located via our offices in Tromsø.

Who are you?

In 4th or 3rd year studying computer science, communication technology, informatics or related degree.
A student passionate about programming, with future aspirations about becoming a great software developer.
Knowledge and experience with JavaScript, CSS3,HTML5, React is a plus but not a requirement.
You must be team-player, eager to learn and review feedback as an opportunity to improve.
Located/Living in Norway and able to spend your summer in Tromsø. 
In possession of a valid working permit to be able to work in Norway. 
You must write and speak English well, and be comfortable communicating in English, as English is our business language

In The “cover Letter” Area We Want You To Answer In Writing (English) These 4 Questions

All Applications must be sent in via our gohire recruitment platform.

Why did you find this job post interesting?
If we talked to your best friends, how would they describe you? 
What about your studies/so far in your studies have excited you the most?
If you are to evaluate your previous work experience, what would you state is the most relevant to become successful in this internship? 

In addition to answering these questions, please make sure to upload your CV and grades (in one file).

We try to do our best to ensure a quick and timely application process and process applications as they come in, we encourage candidates to hand in their applications no later than 9th of October 2023. We only accept applications via formal application platforms (Gohire), not by email. If you have any questions about this role or working at H5P Group, feel free to reach out to Hanne Kristiansen by sending an email to: hanne.kristiansen@h5p.group

About Our Company

H5P Group (previously Joubel) is a fast-growing software provider. We improve the lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world by empowering educators to create better e-learning content faster.

Our award winning software is called H5P. H5P is a framework made to allow everyone to create, share and reuse interactive HTML5 content and is easily integrated in different sites. H5P offers templates allowing users to create rich and engaging content without any design or programming skills. We currently offer over 50 templates including Interactive Video, Virtual 360 Tours and Branching Scenario. H5P.com is our SaaS version of H5P, which is hosted on AWS. It scales automatically, has automatic failovers for most components and we perform rolling updates with no downtime.

H5P has, in a short period of time, grown to become one of the most widely used ed-tech solutions in the world, with customers that include Ivy League Universities, leading car manufacturers and publishers world-wide. We’re at the beginning of building the most significant ecosystem for interactive content in the world, so this is the perfect time for you to join.

job_description:
About the job
We are looking for a UI/UX Designer (internship)

The candidate for the UX/UI designer internship will be responsible for designing user interfaces for various mobile applications and websites, creating prototypes, conducting user testing, and analyzing data obtained from tests.

They will have the opportunity to gain valuable experience in design and improve their skills using graphic design and prototyping tools.

By working with a team, they will have the chance to see what it's like to work in the UX/UI design industry and learn best practices applied in this field.

Details

 We are looking for someone interested in interning in the UX/UI design department
 The internship will last for a period of 3 months
 Required skills include proficiency in graphic design tools and basic prototyping tools
 The candidate should have a high-quality portfolio that showcases projects in the field of UX/UI design
 Experience in designing mobile applications and websites will be an additional advantage
 The intern will participate in designing user interfaces, creating prototypes, conducting user testing, and analyzing data
 We offer compensation and the opportunity to gain valuable experience in a dynamic team
 Interested individuals are requested to submit their CV and portfolio (if exist)

name_location: Nigel Frank International · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 40 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are looking for a machine learning engineer in Oslo!

Joining a growing team based in central Oslo, working alongside some talented data scientists, machine learning engineers and developers, you will work with the latest technologies, and work completely end to end on ML projects.

You will research, develop and evaluate ML models, and explore large/unstructured data sets from a range of sources

You can work with data from various sources, and be tasked with identifying trends and anomalies whilst coming up with solutions to provide the analysis and insights customers need to solve their problems

As a company with data-driven insights at the very centre of it's offerings, you can be sure you'll be working as part of a dedicated team with all of the resources and tools you need to be productive

With an innovative working culture, and plenty of encouragement to experiment, it is a safe place to grow your skillset and develop professionally whilst working on some of the most cutting edge ML projects

We are looking for you to have some of the following skills:

 Strong academic background in computer science, maths, physics, or similar
 At least 3+ years of professional experience
 Proficiency in Python and related libraries
 Experience with Tensorflow/Keras
 Experience with cloud platforms is beneficial
 Experience working end-to-end on ML solutions
 Particular expertise in areas such as NLP or computer vision can be beneficial

In return, you can expect:

 Enhanced pension & insurances
 Excellent funded training programmes and courses
 Flexible working hours with option to work from home
 Modern central Oslo office
 Senior team to spar with and share knowledge
 Have a voice within the company and contribute to decision-making at all levels

For any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@frankgroup.com

name_location: Capgemini · Trondheim Region  1 month ago  · 16 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Ferdigutdannet innen IT høsten 2024 med ønsker om en karrierestart i konsulentbransjen?

Ønsker du å starte din karriere i konsulentbransjen og bli en del av et felleskap med andre unge og engasjerte talenter som vil bygge en spennende karriere innen IT? Da er Ignite-programmet til Capgemini den perfekte starten for deg! Som Igniter vil du få muligheten til å delta i spennende kundeprosjekter, lære av erfarne konsulenter og utvikle deg innenfor teknologi og moderne dataanalyse, samtidig som du får muligheten til å delta på sosiale eventer og etterspurte kurs.

Om Capgemini Og Ignite-programmet

Capgemini er et ledende konsulentselskap som jobber med å omstille bransjer, effektivisere samfunnskritiske tjenester gjennom å ta i bruk ny teknologi for en bærekraftig fremtid. Vi jobber blant annet med å transformere oljeindustrien til grønn energi, forbedre helsevesenet og sikre tryggere veier gjennom digitaliserings- og innovasjonsprosjekter.

Ignite er vårt skreddersydde Graduate-program for nyutdannede IT-studenter som ønsker å kickstarte sin karriere som konsulent. Gjennom 12 måneder tilbyr vi deg en unik mulighet til å kombinere praktisk arbeid på spennende kundeprosjekter med et omfattende faglig tilbud av relevante kurs og sertifiseringer. Gjennom Ignite-programmet får du virkelig oppleve hva det vil si å være konsulent, utvikle en bred forståelse av bransjen og utforske ulike karriereveier innenfor Capgemini. I tillegg vil du opparbeide deg et nettverk og relasjoner med Ignitere og konsulentkollegaer gjennom varierte sosiale arrangementer som strekker seg gjennom hele tidsperioden.

Insights and Data – Nordens ledende fagmiljø for innsikt og analyse

Insights & Data har et av Nordens største og ledende fagmiljøer innen moderne data- og innsiktsplattformer. Vi leverer tjenester innenfor Data Engineering, Arkitektur, Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, Master Data Management (MDM) og Data Governance. Vi bistår våre kunder med å få kontroll på og innsikt i sine data, slik at de kan skape forretningsverdi. Dette oppnår vi ved å kombinere strategi og teknologi.

Hvem ser vi etter?

Nyutdannet innen IT-fag (bachelor- eller mastergrad). 
Interesse og basiskunnskaper innen programmering og/eller data og analyse. 
Evnen til å analysere komplekse problemer, identifisere løsninger og ta informerte beslutninger. 
Evne til å jobbe i team, dele ideer og kunnskap og bidra til kollektive mål. 
Evne til å ta initiativ, arbeide selvstendig og ta ansvar for oppgaver. 

Høres dette spennende ut? Søk nå og bli en del av Ignite-programmet hos Capgemini i 2024!

Vi ser frem til å møte deg og hjelpe deg med å forme din karriere innen IT-konsulentbransjen. Søknadsfrist er 30 oktober 2023.

Ved søknaden ønsker vi at du legger ved CV, søknadsbrev, karakterutskrift og eventuelle attester. Vi kontakter aktuelle kandidater fortløpende for intervju.

I vår rekrutteringsprosess vil du bli spurt om å ta en test når du søker og den vil bli tatt med i vurderingen. Alle søkere må gjennomføre denne for å bli evaluert.

Interessert i å bli bedre kjent med oss? Besøk bloggen vårher.

job_description:
About the job
If you are a student, graduate or career change aspirant, and you are missing out on the skills to work in your dream job, this bootcamp is for you. Get trained and work on hands-on projects in our bootcamp to upskill yourself!

Program: 4 weeks (28hrs) hands-on training for Microsoft MD102 certification (Program language – English)

Modules

– IT fundamentals

– Compatia A+

– Microsoft MD 102 Certification

– Deploying Windows Client

– Managing Identity and Compliance

– Manage, Maintain, and Protect devices

– Manage Applications

– Microsoft MS 900 and Microsoft AZ 900 (Cloud)

– Get ready for MD 102 Certification

– Get sample tests for the certification

Career Guidance

Get guidance on how to land a job in IT Domain

– Career sessions

– Job search platforms intro

– CV preparation

– Cover letter preparation

– Interview tips

Why join our IT Training Program?

– Skill development: Learn the fundamentals of IT Support

– Career advancement: Get the confidence and training to switch your career to IT

– Job opportunities: Increase your job opportunities, get referred by us to our clients and partners

– Real startup projects: Work directly with our CPO on real startup projects

– Networking Join our GATE community and build your network

A Bootcamp is an intensive training program where you will learn skills, tools, and technologies to tackle the needs of a job market. In addition to theoretical knowledge, you will mainly take part in working on hands-on projects which are from real startups which provide you with experience. Bootcamp is a skill certification program.

name_location: Bakken & Bæck · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  6 months ago  · 449 applicants
job_description:
About the job
If you are interested in working with us but cannot find the right opening, leave us an open application!

About BB

Building digital products, brands and businesses, we help ambitious companies identify, explore and respond to new opportunities. From defining the future home with IKEA to building decentralised platforms with Coinbase; we are in the business of breaking new grounds. As one international team across offices, we have all the skill-sets needed to help businesses adapt to an increasingly complex world.

We are committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels comfortable, regardless of your identity, experiences and beliefs. We want BB to be a place where you can try out new things with the risk of failing, where you can take ownership over your own work without being micromanaged, and where there’s a low barrier for coming up with ideas — no matter your job title or discipline.

Work-life balance shouldn’t be a perk, but a given. We strongly believe in flexibility, knowing that creativity doesn’t always happen between 9 and 5. At BB you’ll be given a lot of freedom, which means managing your own priorities, trying out new things and working a flexible hours’ scheme.

How does this work?

Tell us a little about yourself, what kind of role you are interested in, where you'd like to work, and how you’d like to contribute at BB. If we see that your profile could be a good fit, we’ll connect with you to discuss this further. Please include your CV and portfolio (wherever relevant), and feel free to add links to a personal website, projects or similar.

To get a better feel for what we care about as a company, our perks and work philosophy, check out our A-Z.

name_location: Columbus · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Studerer du og har lyst på en relevant og spennende sommerjobb innen Customer Experience & Engagement? Da er vårt summer internship noe for deg! 

Summer Internshipet gir deg en unik mulighet til å bygge bred og sterk erfaring ved siden av studiene, noe som vil ruste deg til en vellykket overgang til arbeidslivet.

Hva kan du forvente som intern hos Columbus? 

I Columbus jobber vi med forretningsutvikling og rådgivning i store nasjonale og internasjonale virksomheter innen privat sektor. Vi har flere forretningsområder og dette internshipet vil finne sted innenfor Customer Experience & Engagement. Her vil du jobbe i et inkluderende miljø hvor humor og en uformell tone kombinert med høy profesjonalitet danner grunnlaget for kulturen i vår avdeling. I rollen som intern vil du få inngående forståelse for konsulent-faget og erfaring innen relevante områder som prosjektmetodikk og presentasjonsteknikk. Implementering av løsninger står også sentralt i vår daglige jobb og bygger på Microsoft Power Platform med fokus på CE-porteføljen fra Dynamics 365.

Hvorfor velge internship? 

 Praktisk erfaring: Du får verdifull forretningsforståelse og arbeidserfaring gjennom å jobbe i et reelt prosjekt for en av våre kunder.
 Innsikt i konsulentrollen: Du får førstehånds innsikt i hva det innebærer å jobbe som konsulent i Customer Experience & Engagement. Dette er en unik sjanse til å forstå konsulentyrket i bransjen
 God oppfølging: Vi tilbyr god oppfølging og veiledning gjennom hele internship-perioden for å sikre at du får mest mulig ut av opplevelsen
 Nettverksbygging: Du vil ha sjansen til å bygge nye relasjoner og utvide ditt faglige nettverk, noe som kan åpne dører for fremtidige muligheter
 Mulig fast ansettelse: Etter fullført internship og studier, kan det være mulighet for fast ansettelse.

Vi ser for oss at du 

Har ett eller to år igjen av masteren, gjerne innen IT, ledelse, økonomi, logistikk eller lignende
Kan vise til gode akademiske resultater
Interesserer deg for feltene AI og maskinlæring, prosjektledelse og digital markedsføring
Har en lidenskap for å hjelpe og veilede kunder i å strømlinjeforme de ulike forretningsprosessene
Er nysgjerrig på hvordan teknologi kan skape forretningsverdi og ønsker å prøve deg som konsulent
Du har gode kommunikasjonsferdigheter og er ikke redd for å ta ordet i et prosjektteam
Liker en utfordring og trives i et miljø med høyt tempo og stor takhøyde

Hvem er så vi? 

Columbus er et globalt konsulentselskap som skaper varige verdier gjennom digital transformasjon av større selskaper innen bransjene retail, distribusjon, produksjon og næringsmiddel. Med strategisk digital rådgivning, innovativ bruk av AI og datadreven innsikt skaper vi nye, bærekraftige forretningsmuligheter for våre kunder. Vi optimaliserer verdikjeder og forretningsprosesser gjennom implementering og forvaltning av forretningskritiske løsninger innen cloud ERP, modern commerce og CRM. Minst like viktig er det at vi skaper effektive og gode bruker- og kundeopplevelser som begeistrer, og samtidig øker verdiskapingen for våre kunder.

Praktisk informasjon 

Vi tilbyr summer internship for perioden juni - august 2024 og det vil primært være på vårt kontor i Oslo. Internshipet strekker seg utover 8 uker, hvorav 3 av disse går til ferieavvikling i juli. Kort sagt blir det totalt 6 uker med normal arbeidstid.

Søknad og neste steg 

Vi ønsker at alle kandidater benytter vår elektroniske søknadsportal. Her kan du søke gjennom å laste opp din LinkedIn og/eller CV og du behøver ikke å fylle ut lange spørsmålsformuleringer. Din søknad må inneholde karakterutskrifter fra nåværende utdannelse. Ta gjerne kontakt med oss dersom du har noen spørsmål.

Siste søknadsfrist er 01.12.23

name_location: Amby · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 30 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Join Coop's Supply Chain team as a Data Analyst and enhance our operations with your valuable insights! 

Coop is owned by 2 million co-owners. This sets us apart from competitors and is reflected in our vision - choosing Coop should be rewarding. Ownership offers the opportunity to influence and to share in the profits generated. 150 years after the establishment of the first consumer cooperative, Coop is still working towards the same goal - rooted in the same values. The cooperative societies collectively own the umbrella organization, Coop Norge SA, which is responsible for Coop's joint procurement, wholesale and logistics operations, chain management, brand-building, and membership program.

Supply Chain at Coop

Coop Norge introduced our Supply Chain department in August 2022. The department consists of four main areas: inbound supply management, forecasting & replenishment, store ordering, and ordering solutions. The department was established to bring together expertise and ensure the implementation of inventory management from supplier to store based on store sales forecasts (Multi-Echelon).

The Supply Chain department is integrated within the broader Logistics Department at Coop Norge, which is renowned as one of Norway's premier logistics entities. Logistics operations are at the core of the flow of goods - from supplier to warehouse and store. Our logistics operations consist of a fully automated logistics center at Gardermoen and 5 local warehouse units; together with the transportation operations, this forms the backbone of our value chain.

For the road ahead, the strategy is clear - by prioritizing customer service and increased cost-effectiveness, we aim to continue our growth. To achieve this goal, we need to strengthen our capacity in the field of analysis.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in providing insight for decision-making in key focus areas for Coop Norge. As part of the tech environment in Data & Analysis team, you will work closely with other Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Software Developers. We are seeking someone who is motivated to contribute to one of Coop Norge's key areas of focus going forward, with an emphasis on holistic value chain and forecasts.

We Believe Your Day-to-day Will Look Somewhat Like This

Build insight products like dashboards, input to data-driven products, ad hoc data analysis, self-service analytics and effect analysis 
Perform tasks like data transformations, data analysis and visualization 
Communicate insights and make actionable recommendations to different teams, business units, leader groups etc. 
Explore data analytics opportunities and define measures of success in different areas and purposes of our business 
Explore our data sets to identify opportunities and improve data quality, pipelines and efficiency of end-to-end data flow 
Be a contributor in defining, building, exploring and improving our analytics technology stack, and contribute in our data mesh journey 
Contribute to a more data driven culture in Coop 

To succeed in this role, you will need to have:

Some years of relevant experience (4+ years)
Solid industry or consulting experience as data analyst or other analytics roles like business analyst or data engineer 
Solid knowledge of SQL and modern analytics tools, preferably some experience in Python 
Experience in cloud, we use GCP and Azure 
Experience with data visualization tools such as SAP Analytics Cloud or Looker Studio and Streamlit 
Excellent analytical skills, strategic thinking, and ability to find creative solutions to problems 
Ability to communicate analytical concepts to business users 
Ability to show initiative, work independently and be self-driven 

It Would Also Be Beneficial If You

Can work in a structured, systematic, and independent manner 
Can effectively communicate complex analyses and findings to team members and others in the organization. 
Are analytical and rational, with a strong numerical reasoning ability 
Demonstrate an enquiring mind and a keen ability to uncover hidden insights. 
Are eager to learn and possesses a high level of professional commitment 
Has a strong motivation to deliver value to end-users 
Are skilled in communication, both in Norwegian and English 
Higher education, preferably a master's degree within relevant fields. 

What can we offer you?

Opportunity to solve complex challenges that not only boost top-line revenue, but also benefit the environment, such as reducing food waste. You'll be part of an ambitious and diverse team where you get to impact the way of working and contribute to organizational guidelines. 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development (e.g., conferences, training, time to work on own projects/upskilling, etc.). 
Modern office spaces at our HQ at Grorud with a high degree of flexibility on working hours and location. 
Gear and equipment (Mac/Windows/Linux) are provided when you begin your adventure with us. 
Competitive compensation package in addition to good pension and insurance schemes. 
Other benefits like mobile phone and internet coverage, company cabins, and discounts in all Coop stores. 

Working At Coop Norge

Coop Norge as a workplace is designed to foster your growth and well-being. Coop Norge is a large and intricate organization, with diverse expertise in countless fields. You will become part of an exciting ecosystem where you will have a direct influence on our human-centered endeavors. In a newly renovated building in Grorud, Oslo, you'll encounter numerous engaging colleagues and collaborate across disciplines. You can engage in conversations over a cup of coffee with freshly baked treats in the barista area or enjoy a fine lunch in our newly refurbished cafeteria. If the abundance gets overwhelming, you can have a workout session in the fitness center or opt for a relaxing massage. All within Coop Norge's headquarters. We have an active sponsorship department that entices with various events tied to our sponsorships, and we also have a corporate sports club with different offerings. 'Cooperaktiv' provides additional activities in the realms of art, theater, and performances. Should you require a relaxing weekend, our company cabins are at your disposal. Working at Coop is more than just a job. We are a small community that warmly welcomes you!

name_location: MindPal · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  1 month ago  · 54 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are looking for a UI/UX Designer (internship)

The candidate for the UX/UI designer internship will be responsible for designing user interfaces for various mobile applications and websites, creating prototypes, conducting user testing, and analyzing data obtained from tests.

They will have the opportunity to gain valuable experience in design and improve their skills using graphic design and prototyping tools.

By working with a team, they will have the chance to see what it's like to work in the UX/UI design industry and learn best practices applied in this field.

Details

 We are looking for someone interested in interning in the UX/UI design department
 The internship will last for a period of 3 months
 Required skills include proficiency in graphic design tools and basic prototyping tools
 The candidate should have a high-quality portfolio that showcases projects in the field of UX/UI design
 Experience in designing mobile applications and websites will be an additional advantage
 The intern will participate in designing user interfaces, creating prototypes, conducting user testing, and analyzing data
 We offer compensation and the opportunity to gain valuable experience in a dynamic team
 Interested individuals are requested to submit their CV and portfolio (if exist)

name_location: Nigel Frank International · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 40 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are looking for a machine learning engineer in Oslo!

Joining a growing team based in central Oslo, working alongside some talented data scientists, machine learning engineers and developers, you will work with the latest technologies, and work completely end to end on ML projects.

You will research, develop and evaluate ML models, and explore large/unstructured data sets from a range of sources

You can work with data from various sources, and be tasked with identifying trends and anomalies whilst coming up with solutions to provide the analysis and insights customers need to solve their problems

As a company with data-driven insights at the very centre of it's offerings, you can be sure you'll be working as part of a dedicated team with all of the resources and tools you need to be productive

With an innovative working culture, and plenty of encouragement to experiment, it is a safe place to grow your skillset and develop professionally whilst working on some of the most cutting edge ML projects

We are looking for you to have some of the following skills:

 Strong academic background in computer science, maths, physics, or similar
 At least 3+ years of professional experience
 Proficiency in Python and related libraries
 Experience with Tensorflow/Keras
 Experience with cloud platforms is beneficial
 Experience working end-to-end on ML solutions
 Particular expertise in areas such as NLP or computer vision can be beneficial

In return, you can expect:

 Enhanced pension & insurances
 Excellent funded training programmes and courses
 Flexible working hours with option to work from home
 Modern central Oslo office
 Senior team to spar with and share knowledge
 Have a voice within the company and contribute to decision-making at all levels

For any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@frankgroup.com

name_location: Capgemini · Trondheim Region  1 month ago  · 16 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Ferdigutdannet innen IT høsten 2024 med ønsker om en karrierestart i konsulentbransjen?

Ønsker du å starte din karriere i konsulentbransjen og bli en del av et felleskap med andre unge og engasjerte talenter som vil bygge en spennende karriere innen IT? Da er Ignite-programmet til Capgemini den perfekte starten for deg! Som Igniter vil du få muligheten til å delta i spennende kundeprosjekter, lære av erfarne konsulenter og utvikle deg innenfor teknologi og moderne dataanalyse, samtidig som du får muligheten til å delta på sosiale eventer og etterspurte kurs.

Om Capgemini Og Ignite-programmet

Capgemini er et ledende konsulentselskap som jobber med å omstille bransjer, effektivisere samfunnskritiske tjenester gjennom å ta i bruk ny teknologi for en bærekraftig fremtid. Vi jobber blant annet med å transformere oljeindustrien til grønn energi, forbedre helsevesenet og sikre tryggere veier gjennom digitaliserings- og innovasjonsprosjekter.

Ignite er vårt skreddersydde Graduate-program for nyutdannede IT-studenter som ønsker å kickstarte sin karriere som konsulent. Gjennom 12 måneder tilbyr vi deg en unik mulighet til å kombinere praktisk arbeid på spennende kundeprosjekter med et omfattende faglig tilbud av relevante kurs og sertifiseringer. Gjennom Ignite-programmet får du virkelig oppleve hva det vil si å være konsulent, utvikle en bred forståelse av bransjen og utforske ulike karriereveier innenfor Capgemini. I tillegg vil du opparbeide deg et nettverk og relasjoner med Ignitere og konsulentkollegaer gjennom varierte sosiale arrangementer som strekker seg gjennom hele tidsperioden.

Insights and Data – Nordens ledende fagmiljø for innsikt og analyse

Insights & Data har et av Nordens største og ledende fagmiljøer innen moderne data- og innsiktsplattformer. Vi leverer tjenester innenfor Data Engineering, Arkitektur, Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, Master Data Management (MDM) og Data Governance. Vi bistår våre kunder med å få kontroll på og innsikt i sine data, slik at de kan skape forretningsverdi. Dette oppnår vi ved å kombinere strategi og teknologi.

Hvem ser vi etter?

Nyutdannet innen IT-fag (bachelor- eller mastergrad). 
Interesse og basiskunnskaper innen programmering og/eller data og analyse. 
Evnen til å analysere komplekse problemer, identifisere løsninger og ta informerte beslutninger. 
Evne til å jobbe i team, dele ideer og kunnskap og bidra til kollektive mål. 
Evne til å ta initiativ, arbeide selvstendig og ta ansvar for oppgaver. 

Høres dette spennende ut? Søk nå og bli en del av Ignite-programmet hos Capgemini i 2024!

Vi ser frem til å møte deg og hjelpe deg med å forme din karriere innen IT-konsulentbransjen. Søknadsfrist er 30 oktober 2023.

Ved søknaden ønsker vi at du legger ved CV, søknadsbrev, karakterutskrift og eventuelle attester. Vi kontakter aktuelle kandidater fortløpende for intervju.

I vår rekrutteringsprosess vil du bli spurt om å ta en test når du søker og den vil bli tatt med i vurderingen. Alle søkere må gjennomføre denne for å bli evaluert.

Interessert i å bli bedre kjent med oss? Besøk bloggen vårher.

job_title: IT Support Engineer: Bootcamp and Project work (remote-part time)
name_location: Moyyn · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  6 days ago  · 16 applicants
job_description:
About the job
If you are a student, graduate or career change aspirant, and you are missing out on the skills to work in your dream job, this bootcamp is for you. Get trained and work on hands-on projects in our bootcamp to upskill yourself!

Program: 4 weeks (28hrs) hands-on training for Microsoft MD102 certification (Program language – English)

Modules

– IT fundamentals

– Compatia A+

– Microsoft MD 102 Certification

– Deploying Windows Client

– Managing Identity and Compliance

– Manage, Maintain, and Protect devices

– Manage Applications

– Microsoft MS 900 and Microsoft AZ 900 (Cloud)

– Get ready for MD 102 Certification

– Get sample tests for the certification

Career Guidance

Get guidance on how to land a job in IT Domain

– Career sessions

– Job search platforms intro

– CV preparation

– Cover letter preparation

– Interview tips

Why join our IT Training Program?

– Skill development: Learn the fundamentals of IT Support

– Career advancement: Get the confidence and training to switch your career to IT

– Job opportunities: Increase your job opportunities, get referred by us to our clients and partners

– Real startup projects: Work directly with our CPO on real startup projects

– Networking Join our GATE community and build your network

A Bootcamp is an intensive training program where you will learn skills, tools, and technologies to tackle the needs of a job market. In addition to theoretical knowledge, you will mainly take part in working on hands-on projects which are from real startups which provide you with experience. Bootcamp is a skill certification program.

name_location: Bakken & Bæck · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  6 months ago  · 449 applicants
job_description:
About the job
If you are interested in working with us but cannot find the right opening, leave us an open application!

About BB

Building digital products, brands and businesses, we help ambitious companies identify, explore and respond to new opportunities. From defining the future home with IKEA to building decentralised platforms with Coinbase; we are in the business of breaking new grounds. As one international team across offices, we have all the skill-sets needed to help businesses adapt to an increasingly complex world.

We are committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels comfortable, regardless of your identity, experiences and beliefs. We want BB to be a place where you can try out new things with the risk of failing, where you can take ownership over your own work without being micromanaged, and where there’s a low barrier for coming up with ideas — no matter your job title or discipline.

Work-life balance shouldn’t be a perk, but a given. We strongly believe in flexibility, knowing that creativity doesn’t always happen between 9 and 5. At BB you’ll be given a lot of freedom, which means managing your own priorities, trying out new things and working a flexible hours’ scheme.

How does this work?

Tell us a little about yourself, what kind of role you are interested in, where you'd like to work, and how you’d like to contribute at BB. If we see that your profile could be a good fit, we’ll connect with you to discuss this further. Please include your CV and portfolio (wherever relevant), and feel free to add links to a personal website, projects or similar.

To get a better feel for what we care about as a company, our perks and work philosophy, check out our A-Z.

name_location: Columbus · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Studerer du og har lyst på en relevant og spennende sommerjobb innen Customer Experience & Engagement? Da er vårt summer internship noe for deg! 

Summer Internshipet gir deg en unik mulighet til å bygge bred og sterk erfaring ved siden av studiene, noe som vil ruste deg til en vellykket overgang til arbeidslivet.

Hva kan du forvente som intern hos Columbus? 

I Columbus jobber vi med forretningsutvikling og rådgivning i store nasjonale og internasjonale virksomheter innen privat sektor. Vi har flere forretningsområder og dette internshipet vil finne sted innenfor Customer Experience & Engagement. Her vil du jobbe i et inkluderende miljø hvor humor og en uformell tone kombinert med høy profesjonalitet danner grunnlaget for kulturen i vår avdeling. I rollen som intern vil du få inngående forståelse for konsulent-faget og erfaring innen relevante områder som prosjektmetodikk og presentasjonsteknikk. Implementering av løsninger står også sentralt i vår daglige jobb og bygger på Microsoft Power Platform med fokus på CE-porteføljen fra Dynamics 365.

Hvorfor velge internship? 

 Praktisk erfaring: Du får verdifull forretningsforståelse og arbeidserfaring gjennom å jobbe i et reelt prosjekt for en av våre kunder.
 Innsikt i konsulentrollen: Du får førstehånds innsikt i hva det innebærer å jobbe som konsulent i Customer Experience & Engagement. Dette er en unik sjanse til å forstå konsulentyrket i bransjen
 God oppfølging: Vi tilbyr god oppfølging og veiledning gjennom hele internship-perioden for å sikre at du får mest mulig ut av opplevelsen
 Nettverksbygging: Du vil ha sjansen til å bygge nye relasjoner og utvide ditt faglige nettverk, noe som kan åpne dører for fremtidige muligheter
 Mulig fast ansettelse: Etter fullført internship og studier, kan det være mulighet for fast ansettelse.

Vi ser for oss at du 

Har ett eller to år igjen av masteren, gjerne innen IT, ledelse, økonomi, logistikk eller lignende
Kan vise til gode akademiske resultater
Interesserer deg for feltene AI og maskinlæring, prosjektledelse og digital markedsføring

Du har gode kommunikasjonsferdigheter og er ikke redd for å ta ordet i et prosjektteam
Liker en utfordring og trives i et miljø med høyt tempo og stor takhøyde

Hvem er så vi? 

Columbus er et globalt konsulentselskap som skaper varige verdier gjennom digital transformasjon av større selskaper innen bransjene retail, distribusjon, produksjon og næringsmiddel. Med strategisk digital rådgivning, innovativ bruk av AI og datadreven innsikt skaper vi nye, bærekraftige forretningsmuligheter for våre kunder. Vi optimaliserer verdikjeder og forretningsprosesser gjennom implementering og forvaltning av forretningskritiske løsninger innen cloud ERP, modern commerce og CRM. Minst like viktig er det at vi skaper effektive og gode bruker- og kundeopplevelser som begeistrer, og samtidig øker verdiskapingen for våre kunder.

name_location: Funcom ZPX  · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  5 days ago  · 18 applicants
job_description:
About the job
From critically acclaimed The Longest Journey to the very first sci-fi MMO Anarchy Online, to the brutal trials of Conan Exiles, our 30-year history has set our players uniquely up for a journey to the harsh world of Dune, where the continual battle for survival and spice will bring a challenge that is Legendary.

If you’re entering your final BA semester within a game dev-related program and want to step into the exciting world making games, then joining our Oslo studio might be the right choice for you.

You will not only get the chance to work with seasoned experts and mentors, but also have a real impact on games like Conan: Exiles, or on our ambitious upcoming Open World Survival MMO, Dune: Awakening.

Time, place, and extra information

Your internship will span from January to May 2024 (exact timing to be determined by your university), and will take place in our Oslo studio, located on Kirkegata 15, 0153. Unfortunately, we cannot provide accommodation

About Us

We’re the oldest and biggest game developer in Norway, with 30 years of experience and more than 25 titles published, such as Metal: Hellsinger, Conan Exiles, or Secret World Legends, just to name a few.

Now, more than 470 people from about 36 different nationalities work and play at Funcom across our five studios located in Oslo, Lisbon, North Carolina, Stockholm, and Bucharest.

What You Will Be Doing

Learn and deepen your gameplay programming skills while contributing to one of our SOC games.

You will become a small part of the team. You will receive guidance and something to contribute with.

Exactly what this ends up being is something we'd love to work with you to find out.

What would you like to see in our game?

What Skills/tech Will Be Used
English
Working as a member of a team
C++
Unreal Engine
3D Math skills
Realtime multiplayer with a client <-> server setup
Expectations/who We're Looking For
You are highly motivated to learn
You are eager to try new things
You work well with others
You are a gamer, and have a feeling for what makes a feature in a game good
A perfect candidate is already working on their own game as a hobby project, modding games, or in some other way shows they have a hunger for more.

We evaluate candidates on an ongoing basis and recommend candidates to apply as soon as possible!

Please apply in English.

Why Funcom?

We are a Scandinavian company and follow Scandinavian work values. For you, that means a flat structure where you can thrive, be yourself, leave a mark in the studio and become an ambassador for our company values. We focus on Agile/Scrum methodology and heavily value the importance of work-life balance in employee culture. Funcom values close-knit, collaborative individuals who crave creative ownership, a drive for constructive input, and a never-ending pursuit of evolution and quality.

The Funcom Oslo studio is a professional working environment with international work culture, with more than 100 people from over 25 different nationalities in one of the happiest countries in the world. Funcom is an international and varied environment in which people have one thing in common – their love for making and playing video games.

Located in central downtown Oslo, the studio is in a modern office building surrounded by a cozy area with many sights, restaurants, and cafés.

We have a diverse, dynamic, inclusive , challenging, and engaging culture, with a basis of continued training and career development opportunities, and w e encourage candidates from all walks of life to apply. Join us in a friendly environment of enthusiastic professionals  willing to go the extra mile to deliver world-class games.

job_title: Open Applications to Unacast in Oslo
name_location: Unacast · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  6 months ago  · 154 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are always looking for kind talents to join our Software and Data Science teams

Didn’t you find the tech position of your dreams? Or do you have some tech skills that did not fit the current positions at Unacast? In Unacast we cultivate the talent. If you have any tech skills that you think we could benefit from we want to hear from you. Please pitch what position or what tech talent you possess and we will happily talk to you.

Women and racialised minorities especially, should apply

We particularly encourage applications from women, disabled and Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic (BAME) candidates, as these groups are underrepresented throughout the technology industry.

Who is Unacast?

Verified, actionable data facilitates fundamental insights in industries such as research, retail, real-estate, finance, advertising technology, city planning, transportation, and artificial intelligence. Location data is a key component, the core intelligence, that creates value for the players in these industries.

Unacast is a leader in transparent, contextualized location data. Like Google indexed the web, Unacast is indexing the physical world, designing products that merge multiple types of data on human mobility to empower companies and individuals alike to make smarter decisions. 

Unacast is a fast-growing Nordic company based on Nordic values with offices in Oslo (Norway), NYC (United States), and Pilsen (Czech Republic). We have been named "The #1 Small Company To Work At In NYC" and have been featured everywhere from Techcrunch to Forbes .

Our company values are deeply embedded into everything we are and everything we do:

Be your own CEO:  Everyone at Unacast can and is expected to take charge of their own situation, and make sure the company as a whole moves forward. Waiting for some feedback? Go get it! Want something done? Do it!

Trust through transparency:  Dare to be vulnerable and show ourselves and the world who we really are. The trust we build through transparency will help to lift us all higher than we can rise alone.

Have fun, seriously:  Create an unexpected moment that surprises and delights team members and partners. Everyone needs fun in their life, especially while doing something important.

Read more about our company and culture at https:// www.unacast.com/careers

job_title: We are looking for Tech graduates to our IT/Tech track in Norway!
name_location: Tietoevry · Bergen, Vestland, Norway  1 day ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.

Would you like to kickstart your career in a place where you can impact society, for good?  

Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive. Whether you are a strategist, coder, analyst, or a future-enthusiast, you will find your place here. 

Our five end-to-end business units are Create, Industry, Care, Tech Services & Banking. This recruitment round we are looking for graduates to join Tietoevry Create and Tietoevry Industry. Click the links to read more about the business units!

We are now recruiting graduates for the fall of 2024 in Norway! Become a part of our team consisting of 24,000 experts globally, helping businesses and societies meet their full potential – while you are also reaching yours.

The Program 

The Graduate Program will give you a comprehensive introduction to our company and culture, as well as markets and customer projects. On top of that our Graduate program offers networking and development opportunities with your fellow Graduates. 

What we offer? 

Once onboard you will get full access to a personal mentor for all work-related questions, and a buddy who is your best friend, and shows you the best coffee machine, Nordic graduate networking events, young professional network activities & gatherings. You are immediately enrolled into our well-established learning communities and experience from collaborating with multiple digital disciplines. Apart from this we offer: 

Professional and personal growth. We believe that learning and growing together helps us to become better every day. You get to challenge yourself as you will get onboarded to work in our tech company with the support of your leader, team, and personal mentor. 
Work-life-balance. We offer you professional growth, purposeful and meaningful engagements, and an outstanding work-life balance, all backed by competitive compensation. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. 
Community of professionals and friends. Ask anyone, the number one reason to join us is people! You will have a chance to build your network across the company through our learning communities and together with other graduates! As part of our team, you will take part in creating the future of a growing and fast-developing tech sector as part of a team whose culture is built upon a strong sense of support, fun & belonging. 
Genuinely impact our society's future by working on meaningful projects that will impact millions of people. You get to influence how digitalization serves millions of people, today and tomorrow. We work with customers of all sizes, and both in the private and public sector. 
You become part of a community where people are respected and valued. Come as you are and work the way you want. Our communities are nurtured and driven by passionate people at the front line. For us, diversity and inclusion are fundamental in the creation of an inspirational workplace and being different is how we drive innovation forwards. 


Who might you be? 

We are looking for people with a background or competence in tech-related fields. You get to work with a range of different technologies, from Software development (ex. Java, .Net), UX Design, AI/robotics, business intelligence, and so much more.

More specifically you: 

Have recently graduated, or you are about to graduate from your final year of studies. 
Have a minimum of a bachelor’s degree within specific tech-related subjects, For example, programming, data engineering, informatics, and information processing. We are also interested in a wider it-related competencies, such as information systems science. 
Are fluent in English, and Norwegian. 


 

Location? 

We are in many locations in Norway so you will have the opportunity to specify your desired locations when you apply! You will be asked to choose multiple locations and we will match you with open graduate positions based on your answer. 

The cities we are recruiting to this round: Oslo, Stavanger, Bergen & Trondheim.

 

The recruitment process:

In our business we are solving our customers’ challenges every day. Diversity enables innovation – and innovation is what we live on in this highly dynamic technology sector. Diverse teams enable creating best user experiences for the diverse users of digital services and solutions. We achieve this by offering a thought through and fair recruitment process. 

 Your gateway to us will be through our gamified recruitment process. This process is tailored to give you a fair and objective screening that is also fun to experience. 
 We use your assessment results, video response, questionnaire answers and CV to match you with the open Graduate positions available. 
 Based on this, selected candidates will be invited to our digital speed interviews, followed by in-depth interviews. Our Graduate Program 2024 kicks off in September, employment start date can be earlier based on individual agreement and depending on the position. 


Please write your CV in English. In addition to your CV, we ask that you also upload a copy of university and/or college grade transcripts. For applicants with ongoing studies, a preliminary grade transcript for completed courses should be submitted. 

Please note, you will not be able to edit your application after it has been submitted, please make sure all attachment and information is correct before submitting your application.  

We will start the recruiting process after the end date of the application which is 15th of October 2023. In case of any questions, please contact graduatenorway@tietoevry.com

Looking forward to hearing from you!

job_title: Working Student - Deltidsstudent for a new opening in Oslo (December.2023)
name_location: PAPER & TEA · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 months ago  · 74 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Who we're looking for?

Paper & Tea is more than just a brand – we create meeting places where people can exchange ideas and together explore the beauty of life with all their senses. With the highest standards of quality, aesthetics, and the mission to enrich life itself, we aim to create an extraordinary experience of well-being for our customers.

If you are as passionate about tea as we are and are always eager to learn something new, then you will certainly bring a smile to our customers' faces with high-quality teas & accessories. We are looking for you and your open personality, with which you enjoy approaching people and engaging in exciting conversations.

Do you want to be part of a creative, open, and motivated team and shape the future of our exciting brand through exceptional customer service? Then join our retail team as a working student now!

Your mission

You are an enthusiastic host: and immerse your customers in the world of P & T.
You advise individual preferences and sell high-quality teas, accessories, paper products, and more from P & T.
With your open and warm nature, you enchant our customers by preparing and serving our Cold Brew beverages.
You joyfully accompany Tea Tastings & Events on-site together with your team.

Your profile

Communication is your strength; you are lively, open, and warm-hearted, and you enjoy approaching people.
You take pleasure in working in a motivated team.
You enjoy learning new things and sharing your knowledge willingly.
Weekend work, especially on Saturdays, suits you and your flexible lifestyle.
You are currently enrolled in a university degree program.
You are fluent in English, Norwegian is a plus.
You have the time to start with us at the store as a working student for 15 to 20 hours per week. 

That sounds just like you? Then send us your CV in English along with your cover letter. We are looking forward to getting to know you.

Why us?

We believe there are many good reasons to work with us:

Our corporate culture is based on co-creation, individual proactive action, as well as collective support and appreciation.
Working time is living time that we share together - we collaborate in a friendly manner, exchange ideas, and celebrate our joint successes.
We operate with flat hierarchies, transparency, trust, and a culture of mutual respect, as working together on an equal footing is essential for us.
We are a diverse, open-minded team in a dynamic lifestyle company that aims to set new standards: Our brand cannot be categorized.
Employee discount on our products, travel allowance and corporate benefits program.

About Us

Paper & Tea stands for inspiration, creativity, and enjoyment. We want to enrich everyday life with high-quality products that inspire quality and unique design. Celebrate the little things, create wonderful moments, and consume consciously: whether with a cup of soothing tea or a timelessly beautiful notebook. The world of Paper & Tea invites you to enjoy. With 16 stores in currently three countries (Germany, Austria, Switzerland), an international online store, and a team of over 220 employees, we carry our mission of enriching life to the outside world.

name_location: CoreTrek · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 41 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Dine arbeidsoppgaver:

Du får jobbe på kundeprosjekter i samarbeid med seniorer/tech-leads i CoreTrek.
Du vil få kjenne på hvordan det er å jobbe i team og vil jobbe med utviklere, løsningsarkitekter, prosjektledere m.fler. 
Du vil få kjennskap til implementering på CMS-systemer / Laravel eller andre tilsvarende webapplikasjoner som kjører på LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP).

Vi tror om deg:

Du ønsker å jobbe som utvikler på LAMP-stacken - PHP, Laravel, Javascript/Typescript mm. vil ikke være ukjent for deg.
Kjenner til objektorientert programmering
Kjennskap til følgende er et pluss: VUE, ReactNative, REST API, jQueri, Twig, Bootstrap, SASS/SCSS, Composer.

Når du jobber som utvikler i CoreTrek har du disse egenskapene:

Nr. 1 Samarbeidsorientert og en lagspiller

Du har gode samarbeidsevner og stiller på jobb med godt humør. 
Evner å jobbe frem de beste løsningene for kunden sammen med andre. 

Nr. 2 Autonom og strukturert 

Evner å jobbe strukturert, effektivt og konsentrert på egenhånd.

Nr. 3 Kundefokus og forståelse for kundens forretning

Du har forretningsforståelse, og med det menes det at du lar kundens behov komme først ved å se løsningene fra brukerens ståsted.

Praktisk informasjon

Arbeidssted: Sandnes/Sandefjord/Oslo/Remote

Om CoreTrek

Ønsker du å jobbe i et av Norges sterkeste fagmiljøer innen kundeopplevelse, webapplikasjoner og kommunikasjon?

I CoreTrek har man en “just do it” kultur. Her er det færre beslutningsledd og gjerne korte beslutningsprosesser.

CoreTrek er Great Place to Work sertifisert. Faktisk sier 100% av medarbeidere at det er et flott sted å jobbe, sammenlignet med nasjonal tillitsindeks som ligger på 77%.

På arbeidsplassen hos CoreTrek er man opptatt av psykologisk trygghet og det er fokus på kontinuerlig læring.

Vi samarbeider på tvers av lokasjoner og styrker oss gjennom faglig, sosial og personlig utvikling.

Motiverte og glade medarbeidere presterer bedre. Derfor søker vi det beste i alle mennesker på tvers av faglig, sosial & etnisk bakgrunn.

Vi har flere sosiale arrangement i løpet av året og er en fin sammensetning av forskjellige folk i ulik alder som har mye moro sammen.

CoreTrek er en av Norges ledende leverandører av webapplikasjoner, nettløsninger og markedsføring for alle digitale flater til bedrifter, offentlig virksomhet og organisasjoner. Vi har kontor både i Oslo, Sandefjord og Sandnes/Stavanger.

We are searching for a Machine Learning Engineer to help build & run models in a production environment to optimise the power industry across Norway!

job_title: Student analyst – Carbon and renewable energy markets
name_location: Veyt · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 146 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are constantly looking for students to join our carbon and energy analytics team in Oslo. If you are interested in applying your university skills to practice and have a genuine interest in peeking into the future of energy and carbon markets, this is for you.

We are looking for a broad range of support, including a study background in engineering, statistics, mathematics, political science, economy, or similar subjects.

At Veyt we have the world's leading experts on the carbon and renewable energy certificate markets and closely follow the value chains end to end. As an independent market intelligence provider our vision is to empower decision makers towards a net zero world.

Using data and predictive analytics to forecast supply and demand, prices, and market developments we help clients make more informed decisions. Our end-to-end coverage of these markets is of value to clients within multiple sectors, including energy producers, traders and brokers, investors, financial analysts and globally active manufacturing sectors. You will have the opportunity to make a significant difference for all our clients.

What You Will Do

As a student analyst at Veyt, you will work on your own project, develop your own ideas and will contribute significantly to our products. You work closely with our experienced analyst team to create and shape our modelling environment, maintain and improve our analysis platform or research the latest developments on the policy side.

We offer our students a high degree of flexibility, accounting for your university schedule – you can organize your working hours independently.

Typical work includes data management and validation, writing analytical reports, preparation and participation in podcasts, webinars, meetings and workshops, and support in the improvement of our predictive models. Your work will give you exposure to Veyt’s comprehensive research, data, and tools, as well as our can-do culture, performing different types of analysis to extract relevant insights/findings.

We seek enthusiastic students who aim to advance their knowledge, skills and careers in data and policy analytics and insights of carbon and renewable energy markets. Ideally, you have some prior knowledge of environmental and/or energy markets and policy.

What you will need:

Current enrollment in a master’s or other relevant advance degree.
Intellectual curiosity, with the ability to develop creative solutions and strategies to solve problems
Embracing best practices and feedback for continuous improvement
Comfort taking direction from experts and senior executives, and ability to build trust-based, value-added relationships quickly
Being a true team-player with full commitment to the success of your team
Positive mindset with a learning attitude in the face of challenges 

What we offer:

25 days holiday per annum
Flexible working policy
Competitive terms and conditions
An international work environment
Central office location in Oslo 
Flexible office hours and location
Lunch and gym facility

The location:

This role is based in Oslo, Norway with the flexibility to work remotely as part of our agile working policy.

About the job
If you are a student, graduate or career change aspirant, and you are missing out on the skills to work in your dream job, this bootcamp is for you. Get trained and work on hands-on projects in our bootcamp to upskill yourself!

Training: 4 weeks training certification, and project work at our German AI startup – Moyyn

What you will get from this program?

– Four weeks hands-on training and projects – in a German AI startup

– Learn and work – directly with founders and potential clients from Germany

– Do practical group Project work and build up experience in product management

Modules
 Hands-on training and projects:

and many more exciting projects

8 hours training by experienced product managers incl. guest speakers from Europe

Bootcamp is a skill certification program.
