name_location: Bouvet ASA · Stavanger, Rogaland, Norway  2 months ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Data Engineer Konsulent

Vi trenger deg som er selvgående, analytisk og som kan oversette forretningsbehov til velfungerende tekniske løsninger. Hos oss er det lagspill og du får jobbe sammen med utviklere, rådgivere og arkitekter innenfor moderne dataplattformer. Sammen utvikler vi virksomhetskritiske og samfunnsnyttige løsninger innen privat- og offentlig sektor.

Her Er Utvalg Av Gulrøtter Vi Tilbyr

🥕 Vi har en sterk delingskultur. Det gjennomsyrer måten vi jobber sammen i prosjektene på, hvordan vi jobber mot et felles mål, våre lite spisse albuer, og at vi hjelper og deler kunnskap med hverandre.

🥕 Vi har byttet ut karrierestigen med en faglig rulletrapp. Ta steget, og vi vil gi deg kurset, mentoren eller sertifiseringen du trenger for å lære noe nytt. Hos oss er kunnskap og erfaring veien til nye prosjekter og mer ansvar, ikke spisse albuer og antall fakturerbare timer.

🥕 Alle ansatte har fast lønn knyttet til stillingen sin. Prestasjonsbasert lønn og individuelle bonuser er ikke noe for oss. Vi vil gi deg trygghet med fast lønn og overskuddsdeling (felles bonusordning), og du får selvsagt betalt for overtid i perioder du må stå på litt ekstra.

🥕 Bærekraft er noe vi tar på alvor. Vår visjon «Vi går foran og bygger fremtidens samfunn» viser at vi ønsker å bidra til langsiktig verdiskapning med fokus på miljø og klima, sosiale og økonomiske forhold. Våre medarbeidere driver oss videre med nødvendig utålmodighet og krever at vi holder orden i eget hus.

Vi har selvfølgelig mange flere gulrøtter. De finner du i vår Gulrotindeks her 🥕

Dette Håper Vi Du Vil Jobbe Med

Å hjelpe våre kunder med å bli datadrevne
Hele datareisen, fra innhenting av data til verdiskaping
Strukturere og bearbeide store datamengder for analytiske formål
Å rådgi kunder på teknologi- og arkitekturvalg
Moderne og skybaserte teknologier

Her er et utvalg av noen prosjekter vi jobber med innen dataplattform:

 Digi Rogaland 
 Kolumbus 
 Stavanger kommune 

Denne rollen er midt i blinken for deg, om du har ...

 relevant utdanning fra universitetet eller høyskole
 erfaring som utvikler, data engineer eller dataplattformarkitekt

… kunnskaper innen SQL, Python og Azure-løsninger

… interesse for ny teknologi

 motivasjon til å skape et team som trives og leverer gode resultater

… gode norskkunnskaper, både muntlig og skriftlig (minst B2 nivå)

Vi tar intervjuer fortløpende og oppfordrer deg til å sende søknad så snart som mulig.

Vi gleder oss til å høre fra deg!

job_title: We are looking for Tech graduates to our IT/Tech track in Norway!
name_location: Tietoevry · Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 9 applicants
job_description:
About the job
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.

Would you like to kickstart your career in a place where you can impact society, for good?  

Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive. Whether you are a strategist, coder, analyst, or a future-enthusiast, you will find your place here. 

Our five end-to-end business units are Create, Industry, Care, Tech Services & Banking. This recruitment round we are looking for graduates to join Tietoevry Create and Tietoevry Industry. Click the links to read more about the business units!

We are now recruiting graduates for the fall of 2024 in Norway! Become a part of our team consisting of 24,000 experts globally, helping businesses and societies meet their full potential – while you are also reaching yours.

The Program 

The Graduate Program will give you a comprehensive introduction to our company and culture, as well as markets and customer projects. On top of that our Graduate program offers networking and development opportunities with your fellow Graduates. 

What we offer? 

Once onboard you will get full access to a personal mentor for all work-related questions, and a buddy who is your best friend, and shows you the best coffee machine, Nordic graduate networking events, young professional network activities & gatherings. You are immediately enrolled into our well-established learning communities and experience from collaborating with multiple digital disciplines. Apart from this we offer: 

Professional and personal growth. We believe that learning and growing together helps us to become better every day. You get to challenge yourself as you will get onboarded to work in our tech company with the support of your leader, team, and personal mentor. 
Work-life-balance. We offer you professional growth, purposeful and meaningful engagements, and an outstanding work-life balance, all backed by competitive compensation. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. 
Community of professionals and friends. Ask anyone, the number one reason to join us is people! You will have a chance to build your network across the company through our learning communities and together with other graduates! As part of our team, you will take part in creating the future of a growing and fast-developing tech sector as part of a team whose culture is built upon a strong sense of support, fun & belonging. 
Genuinely impact our society's future by working on meaningful projects that will impact millions of people. You get to influence how digitalization serves millions of people, today and tomorrow. We work with customers of all sizes, and both in the private and public sector. 
You become part of a community where people are respected and valued. Come as you are and work the way you want. Our communities are nurtured and driven by passionate people at the front line. For us, diversity and inclusion are fundamental in the creation of an inspirational workplace and being different is how we drive innovation forwards. 


Who might you be? 

We are looking for people with a background or competence in tech-related fields. You get to work with a range of different technologies, from Software development (ex. Java, .Net), UX Design, AI/robotics, business intelligence, and so much more.

More specifically you: 

Have recently graduated, or you are about to graduate from your final year of studies. 
Have a minimum of a bachelor’s degree within specific tech-related subjects, For example, programming, data engineering, informatics, and information processing. We are also interested in a wider it-related competencies, such as information systems science. 
Are fluent in English, and Norwegian. 


 

Location? 

We are in many locations in Norway so you will have the opportunity to specify your desired locations when you apply! You will be asked to choose multiple locations and we will match you with open graduate positions based on your answer. 

The cities we are recruiting to this round: Oslo, Stavanger, Bergen & Trondheim.

 

The recruitment process:

In our business we are solving our customers’ challenges every day. Diversity enables innovation – and innovation is what we live on in this highly dynamic technology sector. Diverse teams enable creating best user experiences for the diverse users of digital services and solutions. We achieve this by offering a thought through and fair recruitment process. 

 Your gateway to us will be through our gamified recruitment process. This process is tailored to give you a fair and objective screening that is also fun to experience. 
 We use your assessment results, video response, questionnaire answers and CV to match you with the open Graduate positions available. 
 Based on this, selected candidates will be invited to our digital speed interviews, followed by in-depth interviews. Our Graduate Program 2024 kicks off in September, employment start date can be earlier based on individual agreement and depending on the position. 


Please write your CV in English. In addition to your CV, we ask that you also upload a copy of university and/or college grade transcripts. For applicants with ongoing studies, a preliminary grade transcript for completed courses should be submitted. 

Please note, you will not be able to edit your application after it has been submitted, please make sure all attachment and information is correct before submitting your application.  

We will start the recruiting process after the end date of the application which is 15th of October 2023. In case of any questions, please contact graduatenorway@tietoevry.com

Looking forward to hearing from you!

name_location: TSMG · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  5 months ago  · 104 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Company Description

Terry Soot Management Group (TSMG) is a field data collection company founded in 2017 in Europe.

We collect data where automation is not possible. We count features, take pictures, make videos, record speech, and scan areas for every detail you need to make more informed decisions. Our field data collection teams are spread across Europe and North America, ready to accept new challenges.

Project objective

The goal of the project is to help collect images of streets, main points of interest and public areas in the EU countries. The project is performed on cars with 360 cameras mounted on top that image the area around the vehicle and store those images on computers inside the vehicle. Later, this data will be used to enhance one the most popular online maps in the world.

The data collectors will be given specific routes around public streets and areas, specifically targeting commercial districts and historical sites. Due to poor weather conditions some areas will be visited multiple times in order to collect the best quality of imaging. The project is expected to last at least 3 months and will cover different city/state zones.

The ideal candidate enjoys driving, knows well the area, traffic trends, is highly responsible and reliable.

The schedule expected on the project is Monday-Friday, 8 hours/day 40 hours per week. You can work more than 8 hours if you will.

Requirements

Must have a valid Driver License (driving experience, 3 yrs minimum)
Must have parking for vehicle
Enjoys driving, with flexible schedule
Available for a minimum of 3 months
Responsible & Reliable
Good driving skills
Great communication skills
High level of responsibility
General car knowledge
Tech savvy (smartphone and basic apps)
Basic computer skills
Self-motivated and detailed oriented

We would be happy to get to know you and your skills better and see how we can support each other's growth.

Please apply and let's meet!

name_location: FRG Technology Consulting · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 months ago  · 56 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are looking to grow a BI & data team in Oslo!

Beginning as a small Norwegian product company seeking to help others become more data-driven in the most efficient way, this core vision is still in place today to help teams automate and simplify their journey in the Cloud

Over the years the product and service range, along with the headcount, has grown significantly and there is room to grow further!

There are a variety of tasks you can get involved in across the business, from working with new features and discussing ideas with the team, to meeting with customers and tailoring solutions to suit their needs

You will be based in-house working amongst some very talented colleagues - both senior and junior - who you can learn from and share knowledge with

There is no requirement to travel to client sites as work can typically be done remotely, but if you prefer to visit then trips can be arranged.

There are many customers who use the products to facilitate everything from analysis and reporting, to big data, and AI/ML projects

Projects typically consist of multiple consultants so you can work alongside technical product specialists, engineers, and BI experts to deliver solutions

We encourage flexible working hours to suit your lifestyle, and have a hybrid home/office working policy. We have tried to maintain a social working space with multiple sporting and social activities, such as team-building trips, employee events, and company gaming clubs.

We Are Looking For You To Have

 Strong academic background
 Experience with MS SQL Server, SQL
 Experience with report development / visualisation tools / Power BI
 Experience with ETL tools
 Knowledge of Azure tools such as Data Factory, Data Flows, and various data storage types

We hope that you also bring an interest in new technologies and methodologies, and a positive & solution focused attitude

Quality is extremely important and we hope that you will be diligent in your work, and be able to see & understand customers' needs

For any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@jeffersonfrank.com

name_location: Columbus · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 26 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Studerer du og har lyst på en relevant og spennende sommerjobb innen Digital Commerce? Da er vårt summer internship noe for deg! 

Summer Internshipet gir deg en unik mulighet til å bygge bred og sterk erfaring ved siden av studiene, noe som vil ruste deg godt for en vellykket overgang til arbeidslivet.

Hva kan du forvente som intern hos Columbus? 

Columbus jobber med noen av landets største kunder - der vi leverer digitale løsninger innenfor flere ulike aspekter innenfor e-handel og brukeropplevelser. Digital Commerce består av ca 230 personer fordelt over 6 land, og det er i Norge internshipet vil ta plass. Her vil du jobbe i et inkluderende miljø hvor humor og en uformell tone kombinert med høy profesjonalitet danner grunnlaget for kulturen i vår avdeling. I rollen som intern blir du en del av et tverrfaglig og internasjonalt team bestående av UX-designere, utviklere, rådgiver og prosjektleder, samt roller med spisskompetanse. Sammen leverer dere en digital løsning, etter krav og ønske fra våre kunder. Gjennom internshipet vil du få erfaring med nyttige verktøy som Jira, Confluence, Azure devops - i tillegg til ulike e-handelsløsninger, PIM og CMS verktøy.

For å sikre faglig og personlig utvikling vil du få utnevnt en dedikert mentor - en senior konsulent, som vil følge deg opp gjennom hele perioden. Mentoren vil gi deg feedback og være tilgjengelig for de spørsmålene du måtte ha.

Hvorfor velge internship? 

 Praktisk erfaring: Du får reell arbeidserfaring gjennom å jobbe i et reelt prosjekt for en av våre kunder 
 Innsikt i konsulentrollen: Du får førstehånds innsikt i hva det innebærer å jobbe som konsulent i Digital Commerce. Dette er en unik sjanse til å forstå konsulentyrket i bransjen 
 God oppfølging: Vi tilbyr god oppfølging og veiledning gjennom hele internship-perioden for å sikre at du får mest mulig ut av opplevelsen 
 Nettverksbygging: Du vil ha sjansen til å bygge nye relasjoner og utvide ditt faglige nettverk, noe som kan åpne dører for fremtidige muligheter 
 Mulig fast ansettelse: Etter fullført internship og studier, kan det være mulighet for fast ansettelse. 

Vi ser for oss at du

Studerer innen interaksjon-/tjeneste/industridesign, industriell økonomi, markedsføring, prosjektledelse, strategi/innovasjon eller lignende 
 Har ett eller to år igjen av masteren din
Ønsker å bli konsulent etter endt utdannelse og brenner for gode digitale løsninger 
Du har gode kommunikasjonsferdigheter og er ikke redd for å ta ordet i et prosjektteam 

Praktisk informasjon

Vi tilbyr summer internship for perioden juni - august 2024. Det strekker seg utover 9 uker, hvorav 3 av disse går til ferieavvikling i juli. Kort sagt blir det totalt 6 uker med normal arbeidstid.

Søknad og neste steg 

Vi ønsker at alle kandidater benytter vår elektroniske søknadsportal. Her kan du søke gjennom å laste opp din LinkedIn og/eller CV og du behøver ikke å fylle ut lange spørsmålsformuleringer. Din søknad må inneholde karakterutskrifter fra nåværende utdannelse.

Ta gjerne kontakt med oss dersom du har noen spørsmål.

Siste søknadsfrist er 22.10.2023

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 3 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.

We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.

This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.

Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.

What you'll do

Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code
Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability
Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure
Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community
Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code
Follow agile software development practices
Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values
Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events

Who you are

You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations
You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud
You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes
You are an experienced Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects
You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation
You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

#Stack

name_location: Strawberry (formerly Nordic Choice Hotels) · Stavanger, Rogaland, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 13 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We’re Comfort Hotel® – a hotel chain that promises to give our guests what they need, and skip the unnecessary. We have great locations, urban design and we’re offering selected services, but the service we give is great. We aim to be Easy on the wallet, have Easy access, be Easy to enjoy and last but definitely not least – be Easy on the planet. Comfort Hotel® is part of Strawberry.

Comfort Hotel Square proves that being budget doesn’t have to be boring. The common areas are designed to offer space and comfort - all in an urban setting. We want entrepreneurs, startups, freelancers, guests and locals to spend time with us. Comfort also value diversity within the company and everyone should feel welcome, both guests and employees. We have room for all!

The hotel is located next to Stavanger Svømmehall and close to nature. We have 194 rooms, gym, breakfast, laundromat and last but not least - our Barception. The heart of the hotel where guests can check in, chill out in the bar and grab something to eat.

As Night Audit Crew at Comfort Hotel Square you work in our combined reception and bar. Responsibility tasks include:

Administrative tasks 
Deliver extraordinary personal service 
Dealing with check in- & outs and serving in the bar

As a member of the Night Audit Crew you are a hero of the night. You are considered a responsible person who takes action when the stakes are high. As you will be mostly working alone during the night, you are able to handle the safety & security of a large hotel, and are considered a real problem-solver. You’re spreading joy and warmth around you, and your laughter is contagious. So is your energy. You are a responsible person and take ownership of your tasks to achieve the best results. You need knowledge in Norwegian and English. Knowledge of other languages is meritorious.

Does this feel like a perfect match?

Go ahead and send your application via the link below now.

Deadline for last application: 30/11/23, the position may be filled before the application deadline

Start date: 01/12/23

A Bootcamp is an intensive training program where you will learn skills, tools, and technologies to tackle the needs of a job market. In addition to theoretical knowledge, you will mainly take part in working on hands-on projects which are from real startups which provide you with experience. Bootcamp is a skill certification program.

name_location: TSMG · Moss, Viken, Norway  3 months ago  · 24 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Company Description

Terry Soot Management Group (TSMG) is a field data collection company founded in 2017 in Europe.

We collect data where automation is not possible. We count features, take pictures, make videos, record speech, and scan areas for every detail you need to make more informed decisions. Our field data collection teams are spread across Europe and North America, ready to accept new challenges.

Project objective

The goal of the project is to help collect images of streets, main points of interest and public areas in the EU countries. The project is performed on cars with 360 cameras mounted on top that image the area around the vehicle and store those images on computers inside the vehicle. Later, this data will be used to enhance one the most popular online maps in the world.

The data collectors will be given specific routes around public streets and areas, specifically targeting commercial districts and historical sites. Due to poor weather conditions some areas will be visited multiple times in order to collect the best quality of imaging. The project is expected to last at least 3 months and will cover different city/state zones.

The ideal candidate enjoys driving, knows well the area, traffic trends, is highly responsible and reliable.

The schedule expected on the project is Monday-Friday, 8 hours/day 40 hours per week. You can work more than 8 hours if you will.

Requirements

Must have a valid Driver License (driving experience, 3 yrs minimum)
Must have parking for vehicle
Enjoys driving, with flexible schedule
Available for a minimum of 3 months
Responsible & Reliable
Good driving skills
Great communication skills
High level of responsibility
General car knowledge
Tech savvy (smartphone and basic apps)
Basic computer skills
Self-motivated and detailed oriented

We would be happy to get to know you and your skills better and see how we can support each other's growth.

Please apply and let's meet!

name_location: UENI Ltd · European Economic Area  1 week ago  · 1,168 applicants
job_description:
About the job
As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and translating web and business data into actionable insights. Your primary focus will be to report on company activities, understand user behavior, and assist our marketing and operations teams. This role is critical in guiding our business decisions and improving customer satisfaction.

This is a technical role requiring extensive use of SQL to query databases and Excel, while also requiring you to liaise with stakeholders of all levels throughout the business.

You will be directly involved in the day-to-day of the business operations; from gathering requirements from stakeholders to giving recommendations to the management team. You will get exposure to both BI and MI, creating reports across multiple platforms.

Note that this role is available for candidates based in the UK or EU, timezone between UTC+0 - UTC+1. If you are based in the UK and need a work visa we are unable to provide it. Applicants who don't fit this requirement won't be considered for the role. 

Key Responsibilities

Web Data Analysis: Analyse web traffic data using tools such as Google Analytics, Innertrends, or similar platforms. Identify trends, patterns, and user behavior to provide valuable insights to the marketing and product teams. 
Business Data Analysis: Analyse business data using SQL and Excel, to report on revenues, and customer churn, and provide data to build forecasting models. 
Reporting and Dashboards: Create and maintain dashboards and reports that visualize key performance indicators (KPIs) related to customer acquisition, conversion rates, and user engagement. 
A/B Testing: Collaborate with the marketing team to analyze A/B tests to optimize website elements, including landing pages, marketing emails, and forms. 
Other Experimentation: Collaborate with the operations and customer success teams to devise valid experiments intended to improve processes, efficiency, and commercial outcomes. 
Process Analysis: Assist the operations team to create and automate processes related to business initiatives
Stakeholder Interaction: Liaise with stakeholders on a frequent basis to gather requirements, and translate the business context to actionable tasks. 
Data-driven Recommendations: Advise stakeholders by providing actionable recommendations whilst also managing expectations. 

Job Requirements

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Business Analytics, or Mathematics. 
2-3 years of experience as a Data Analyst. 
Proficiency in PostgreSQL (or similar) and Excel. Python is a plus. 
Experience with data visualization tools. 
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights. 
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present findings and recommendations to non-technical stakeholders. 
Detail-oriented and highly organized. Able to self-manage priorities.

name_location: PortalOne, Inc · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 28 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Since 2018, PortalOne has been laser-focused on its mission to converge the strengths of the games and TV industries to build an entirely new category: hybrid games. To succeed in forging this new category, we've built a team of industry experts from around the world, all bringing unique experiences from diverse industries. This, paired with our extensive roster of world-class investors and advisors, empowers us to deliver this next generation of entertainment.

We want to increase the joy and value of playtime, and realize the full potential of immersive, gamified experiences to entertain, inspire, connect and develop people around the world. Our mission is to become the ultimate destination for hybrid games, in the same way that Netflix is for TV and film, and Spotify for music. While our product is currently in beta, we are significantly outperforming industry standards, and we're now looking to supercharge our growth and increase our velocity as we gear up to launch PortalOne out into the world.

Regardless of your role, department, or level, we focus on cultivating a supportive, team-oriented, and collaborative environment. The beauty of joining our team at this stage is that each department is currently relatively small, meaning that you will see your contribution have an impact on our products, and your work will directly influence the evolution of hybrid games!

THAT'S WHERE YOU COME IN

We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Quality Assurance (QA) Tester to join our game development team. The QA Tester will be responsible for testing our games to ensure that they meet the required standards of quality and are enjoyable to play.

YOUR CHALLENGE

In this role, you will join a talented team of game developers and make a real impact on the quality of our games by:

Test and evaluate game mechanics, level design, and other non-technical aspects of the game.
Identify and report issues with gameplay and suggest improvements.
Provide feedback on overall game design and user experience.
Identifying and reproducing defects, and clearly document them in a bug tracking system.
Collaborating with developers to understand game features and technical implementation.
Participating in playtesting sessions to provide feedback on gameplay and user experience.
Assisting with the creation of user documentation and other materials related to game quality.
Keeping up-to-date with industry trends and new technologies related to game testing.

Who You Are

We are looking for a team player who is passionate about games and has a strong commitment to quality. If you have a track record of success in QA testing and are excited about the opportunity to work on a wide range of game projects, we encourage you to apply.

We are looking for someone who has:

3+ years of experience in a similar role in a game development environment.
ISTQB Foundation level certification or equivalent work experience.
Knowledge of game development workflows and testing methodologies.
Experience with testing tools and technologies such as JIRA.
Strong attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills.
Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical team members, both in writing and verbally.
Working proficiency in English.

CONTINUE?

>YES / NO

name_location: Riverty · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 months ago  · 97 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Everything we do, starts with you. Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyone’s future financial growth.

We are looking for a 

Software Developer (C#/.Net)

(unlimited, fulltime) Join our team at our location in Oslo – flexible working conditions available

Just to give you a quick insight, our tech function has over 500 employees based in different locations in Europe. In our Oslo Tech Hub we have been growing rapidly. We are proud to tell you that we have a big diversity in background and experience and we foster a good culture. Now we are looking for new talents and we would love to tell you more about it!

(Y)our Mission:

Our solutions contribute to flexible and customer-friendly payment alternatives. We offer consumers the opportunity to choose when and how they want to pay, whilst guaranteeing a steady and predictable cashflow for merchants. Our products make us proud, but not content and we have high ambitions for our existing as well as upcoming products. We have a strong commitment to building the future of FinTech — human-centric and sustainable. With investments to back it up. You will be part of a new and quickly growing product & tech organization, having the opportunity to shape our new teams as well as build the next revolutionary products.

Your key responsibilities:

You will join one of our product teams and daily you will:
 Design, develop, test, and ship robust, maintainable, and readable software, applications, API’s and other workflows. 
 As a member of an agile cross-functional team, you attend regular scrum ceremonies. 
 Analyse, discuss and implement business requirements while you maintain good documentation of the systems and components you create. 
 Bring-in industry standards and best practices to continually improve our code-base and architecture. 
 Make a positive impact on our engineering culture by adopting, implementing and providing feedback on both organizational and industry standards and practices. 

What you bring to the table:
 Hands-on experience working using C# and .NET framework. 
 Experience on developing, shipping and maintaining a cloud based application. 
 You demonstrate a good understanding and knowledge of restful API’s. 
 Basic knowledge of frontend development with any modern JavaScript framework. 
 Knowledge and experience working on a microservice and distributed architecture is a plus. 
 You bring in experience using relational databases, preferably SQL server. 
 You are familiar with cloud development while knowledge and experience using Azure is a bonus. 
 A practical knowledge using messaging platforms in a distributed architecture (RabbitMQ, Kafka) is a plus. 
 You have a well written and spoken English language skill to communicate and collaborate with our international team. 
 Knowledge and experience working on a FinTech and banking industry is a plus. 

About the technologies we use: 

Our teams have autonomy when it comes to tech choices. The example below will give you some insights, and we are looking forward to discussing this further with you.

All solutions developed cloud-native targeting Azure - Infrastructure defined using Terraform - Services deployed to Kubernetes clusters by default - A growing microservice ecosystem with event-based integration - Using latest .NET Core - RESTful API design - Single-page frontend apps served by CDN - Frontend tech using TypeScript, often Angular or standard Web Components (Stencil) - Automated tests in each layer - Design collaboration using Figma.

Thrive at Riverty with great benefits:
 Enjoy an open, trusting culture in agile teams and access opportunities within the Bertelsmann Group. 
 Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities. 
 Grow together through Riverty Academy trainings and personalized development. 
 Feel valued with numerous employee discounts. 
 Our flexible working arrangements empower you to blend on-site collaboration with remote work, tailoring your professional experience to suit your lifestyle. 

This list doesn't assure any certain benefits or actions. They might depend on the country or contract details and can change anytime without prior notice. We are happy to discuss these benefits further during your interview.

About Us

We are Riverty. And we believe everyone should be in control of their financials. We ask you to join in. Because together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. We build on experience of more than 50 years. More than 5,000 people in 13 countries drive our company and contribution to society. And we have their backs. We make sure they feel supported and included: Across teams, across physical and invisible borders and across the globe.

Our world is growing. And we’re here. Together, we’re finding smarter, simpler, seamlessly connected ways to manage money. By leveraging data and financial technology, our holistic solutions provide flexible payments, smarter accounting, and fair debt collection, all aimed at fostering everyone's financial growth.

And. Everything we do, starts with you. Join us and let‘s build a more sustainable financial future, together.

We keep what we promise:

More information on riverty.com/careers . Are you already convinced? Then we look forward to receiving your online application – with just a few clicks.

We look forward to applications from candidates who contribute to the diversity of our company. We relate diversity in particular to the dimensions of cultural or social origin, religion, age, disability, gender and sexual identity.

Company: Riverty Group Norway AS

Country: Norway

State/Region: Oslo

City: Oslo

Postal Code: 0153

Job ID: 256871

Date: Oct 9, 2023

Location:

Oslo, 03, NO, 0153

Job Segment:  Cloud, Developer, .NET, Testing, Information Technology, Technology

job_title: Python Software Engineer with DevOps Experience - Oslo
name_location: Nigel Frank International · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 11 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are looking for a Software Engineer with DevOps experience to join the team in Oslo!

As part of an established in-house team, you will work alongside some talented colleagues in development, data engineering and data science to deliver SaaS solutions for the power industry

Your role will involve working end-to-end on projects (both pilot and in production) to deliver AI solutions which enable the forecasting of the supply, demand, and cost of electricity

With a strong customer base in Norway and plans to expand across the Nordics in the coming months, it's an exciting time to take on new development challenges

Joining an innovative working culture with plenty of encouragement to experiment, it is a safe place to grow your skillset and develop professionally whilst working on some of the most cutting edge projects in the energy industry

We are looking for you to have:

 Professional software development experience in Python
 Experience working with DevOps and Infrastructure tools such as Jenkins, IaC, Git
 Experience with cloud (preferably Azure)
 Ability to work as part of a cross functional team and take initiative over your own tasks
 Ability to contribute towards a forward-thinking engineering environment and stay up to date with trends in the market
 Domain knowledge is beneficial, but an interest in the power/electricity/energy sector is essential!

In return, you can expect:

 Bonus/shares options
 Enhanced pension & insurances
 Excellent funded training programmes and courses
 Flexible working hours with option to work from home
 Modern central Oslo office
 Senior team to spar with and share knowledge
 Have a voice within the company and contribute to decision-making at all levels

For any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@jeffersonfrank.com

About the job
We are searching for a Python Software Engineer in Oslo!

The SaaS you create will help to digitalise the education industry, impacting everyone from school children locally in Norway, to University students around the globe

With products to help children learn maths and take their first steps into formal education, to solutions which allow assessments to be submitted instantly from anywhere in the world - you will play a key role in transforming education through technology

You will be joining an established "Tech Hub" environment consisting of developers, engineers, and data scientists & analysts where you will be working with the latest technologies

You will be working on new and existing products & features, ensuring your code is high quality, maintainable, and testable

We are looking for you to bring:

 Education in Engineering, Computer Science, or similar
 2+ years of experience in software development
 Professional experience with Python
 Experience with Cloud

Some of the benefits on offer include:

A fair & competitive salary based on experience along with access to the company's shares/equity scheme

Allocated budget for training and development - as an EdTech company, learning is both a professional and personal passion!

Flexible working arrangements to suit your lifestyle

Competent technical team to learn from and spar with

Freedom to explore and solve interesting technical challenges

Modern office space in central Oslo

The hardware and software of your choice required for your role

name_location: Funcom ZPX  · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  5 days ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
From critically acclaimed The Longest Journey to the very first sci-fi MMO Anarchy Online, to the brutal trials of Conan Exiles, our 30-year history has set our players uniquely up for a journey to the harsh world of Dune, where the continual battle for survival and spice will bring a challenge that is Legendary.

The Funcom team consists of over 400 people located in 5 studios - Norway, the US, Portugal, Sweden and Romania. As part of Funcom’s ongoing growth, and completing a successful turnaround, Funcom is now backed by Tencent, the largest online gaming company in the world!

Now, our Game Development team needs an experienced and talented UI/UX Programmer to join.

Your Mission in Funcom

In this position, the right candidate will be working in a multidisciplinary team of experienced programmers, designers and artists, and will have the chance to make a significant impact in the development of our in-house games. As a UI/UX Programmer at Funcom, you will use your experience to improve the usability and accessibility of live products and craft the user experience of products still in development.

We Are Looking For Someone That Has
3+ years of experience in UI programming 
Good knowledge of C++ 
Strong communication skills (English is our working language) 
An interest in keeping up to date with the newest trends in UI in the industry 
In addition, the perfect candidate has:

Previous experience in the gaming industry and experience working in UE4 and UMG would be a plus, but it's not a requirement.

We evaluate candidates on an ongoing basis and recommend candidates to apply as soon as possible!

Please apply in English.

Why Funcom?

We are a Scandinavian company and follow Scandinavian work values. For you, that means a flat structure where you can thrive, be yourself, leave a mark in the studio and become an ambassador for our company values. We focus on Agile/Scrum methodology and heavily value the importance of work-life balance in employee culture. Funcom values close-knit, collaborative individuals who crave creative ownership, a drive for constructive input, and a never-ending pursuit of evolution and quality.

Funcom Lisbon has a full-range development studio situated in Lisbon, the sunny capital of Portugal, in an area with famous cafés and sights near the river. The Lisbon team consists of roughly 80 people from more than 20 nationalities.

Funcom Lisbon offers challenging and interesting work, flexible schedules, relocation assistance, health insurance, meal allowance, gym discounts, social events, and a long list of other benefits. Even more: working at Funcom means being part of a family, with skilled and professional colleagues that share a passion for games.

We have a diverse, dynamic, inclusive , challenging, and engaging culture, with a basis of continued training and career development opportunities, and w e encourage candidates from all walks of life to apply. Join us in a friendly environment of enthusiasticprofessionals  willing to go the extra mile to deliver world-class games.

name_location: Aviant · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 65 applicants
job_description:
About the job
At Aviant, we enable autonomous parcel delivery by drone. After starting in the labs at MIT in 2020, Aviant has signed ten commercial contracts in Scandinavia, flown over 1,500 flights covering more than 25,000 km, built a strong team of 20 people, and managed to take a leading position in the European drone market. We operate commercial transportation drones with custom modifications, taking the role of both a drone producer and operator. Due to solid commercial traction, we are looking to expand our team.

What are we looking for?

Ability to work autonomously in the fast-paced, complex, and ambiguous environment of a startup
Verbal and written proficiency in English
Passion for Aviant's mission

Aviant has three departments: operations, tech, and business. The responsibility of each department are as follows:

Tech is responsible for building and developing new technological solutions.
Operations is making sure we're certified and operate the drones.
Business is driving the commercialization of our service.

We're growing quickly and looking for talented people in each department. Aviant's vision is to make society more efficient. Therefore, we are seeking enthusiasts who wish to build something that matters. If you feel compelled to work within our business, operations, or technology department, we'd love to hear from you!

We have a running application deadline for this position and will evaluate candidates as they apply.

job_title: Software Engineer - Python - Ubuntu Pro client - graduate level
name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 months ago  · 48 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Ubuntu Pro is a suite of specialist services provided by Canonical. Whether for enterprise customers deploying systems at scale or users who want security patching for their personal Ubuntu LTS at home, the Ubuntu Pro Client is the command-line tool that manages all these services.

The quality and stability of the Ubuntu Pro Client is critically important, since it comes pre-installed on every Ubuntu system. You'll work with the Ubuntu Server team, alongside major cloud partners and multiple Canonical product teams to develop, test and release improvements to the Pro client. You will also be a voice in communication with our users, ensuring their needs are met.

This role requires quality-oriented software engineering in Python and a focus on software interoperability over a vast range of target releases and environments. Excellent Python skills are a key requirement, with previous contributions to open source Python projects being an advantage. The Pro client often interacts with the Ubuntu package management; therefore, experience in configuring apt, and knowledge of deb packaging and general system administration is advantageous in this role.

Applicants should be passionate about the Ubuntu project and its values and about building tools that are used by millions of people around the world. A personal interest and emphasis on quality, thinking of edge cases, ease of use, documentation, and careful community coordination is important. The Pro client is used at all ranges, from mission-critical environments to hobbyist Ubuntu users; applicants should be ready to work with the whole spectrum of end users and help guide engineering best practices with all of them in mind.

What you'll do

Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality code, with unit and functional tests, to create new features
Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them
Review code produced by other engineers
Discuss ideas and investigate to find good solutions
Work from home, with global travel 2 to 4 weeks per year for internal and external events

Who you are

You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You have extensive experience with Python on Linux
You have interest in and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux systems administration, continuous integration, end-system contract management, Debian packaging, working with public or on premise clouds
Bonus points if you have experience engaging with the open source community

Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.

#stack

name_location: Mediabooster Norge · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 months ago  · 66 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Mediabooster er et raskt voksende IT og Markedsføringsbyrå, og ser nå etter nye motiverte kollegaer!

Hvordan jobber vi i Mediabooster?

Vår metode og mål i alle prosjekter er å levere skreddersydder skalerbare webløsninger som er en “perfect match” med kundens markedsførings-løsninger. Vi har ingen nisje, vår metode skal funke uavhengig av bransje! Dvs at vi utvikler digitale løsninger etter behov, som har et formål: Gode og målbare resultater!

For å oppnå dette så benytter vi oss av moderne og skreddersydd design som vi så utvikler i WordPress, samt at vi implementert alle nødvendige sporingsverktøy for å kunne analyserer og spore data og resultater.

Som et team skaper vi overordnete strategier som koordinerer: webdesign og webutvikling, digital markedsføring, innholdsproduksjon og analyse, under en og samme paraply.

Vår målgruppe?

Vårt motto «Vi er ikke din leverandør, vi er din partner og kollega», gjør at vi er veldig selektive og jobber kun med kunder som ønsker et tett, langsiktig og seriøst samarbeid med oss.

Noen av webløsningene vi har levert er oliviarestauranter.no, bighorn.no og partnerplast.com.

Hva sier våre kunder om oss?

Hvem er du?

Vi søker etter en flink webutvikler som kan WordPress!

Riktig person har relevant utdannelse og noe relevant erfaring med å lage nettsider fra a-å, som man kan vise til.

Som WordPress-utvikler hos oss på Mediabooster vil du bli tildelt oppgaver og ansvar for nye og eksisterende prosjekter. Jobben består av utvikle nettsider og tilhørende funksjonalitet som skal være brukervennlige og som representerer våre kunder på en solid og profesjonell måte. Dette kan også bety å skrive ny funksjonalitet i PHP og/eller Javascript når det er behov for dette.

Det vil være arbeid i team, selvstendig arbeid og mye kunde-dialog, så du må trives med å prate med både sluttbrukere og forretningsfolk.

Ideelt ser vi etter deg som går siste året på Bachelor eller Master som ønsker å jobbe deltid ved siden av studiene. Dette er en perfekt mulig for deg som ønsker å sikre deg en fulltidsstilling når studiene er fullført.

Høyest på vår prioriteringsliste er en person som er pedagogisk, konsekvent og hyggelig å jobbe med!

Kvalifikasjoner som WordPress utvikler:

Riktig person har relevant utdannelse og noe relevant erfaring med å lage nettsider fra a-å, som man kan vise til.
Erfaring med nettsideproduksjon 
Erfaring med front-end arbeid er veldig positivt. 
Flytende i norsk og engelsk – muntlig og skriftlig.
Kundedialog og god service 
Du kan stå 100% bak vårt motto utad: “Vi er ikke din leverandør, vi er din partner og kollega”

For den rette kan vi tilby:

En langsiktig karriere som WordPress-utvikler / webutvikler.
Remote og fleksibel arbeidsplass.
Full opplæring i våre systemer og prosesser.
Et godt arbeidsmiljø med kollegaer som støtter deg.
Utviklingsmuligheter i et selskap som vokser raskt.
Motiverende gründermiljø og utrolig dedikert team.
Mediabooster arranger team-events og sosiale samlinger stadig vekk!
Frihet til å utvikle deg, både faglig og personlig.

Om disse linjene ringer bjeller hos deg så ønsker vi å komme i kontakt med deg. Prosessen er allerede i gang, så ikke vent med å sende oss din søknad!

About the job
We are looking to grow a BI & data team in Oslo!

Beginning as a small Norwegian product company seeking to help others become more data-driven in the most efficient way, this core vision is still in place today to help teams automate and simplify their journey in the Cloud

Over the years the product and service range, along with the headcount, has grown significantly and there is room to grow further!

There are a variety of tasks you can get involved in across the business, from working with new features and discussing ideas with the team, to meeting with customers and tailoring solutions to suit their needs

You will be based in-house working amongst some very talented colleagues - both senior and junior - who you can learn from and share knowledge with

There is no requirement to travel to client sites as work can typically be done remotely, but if you prefer to visit then trips can be arranged.

There are many customers who use the products to facilitate everything from analysis and reporting, to big data, and AI/ML projects

Projects typically consist of multiple consultants so you can work alongside technical product specialists, engineers, and BI experts to deliver solutions

We encourage flexible working hours to suit your lifestyle, and have a hybrid home/office working policy. We have tried to maintain a social working space with multiple sporting and social activities, such as team-building trips, employee events, and company gaming clubs.

We are looking for you to have:

 Strong academic background
 Experience with MS SQL Server, SQL
 Experience with report development / visualisation tools / Power BI
 Experience with ETL tools
 Knowledge of Azure tools such as Data Factory, Data Flows, and various data storage types

We hope that you also bring an interest in new technologies and methodologies, and a positive & solution focused attitude

Quality is extremely important and we hope that you will be diligent in your work, and be able to see & understand customers' needs

For any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@jeffersonfrank.com

name_location: TSMG · Halden, Viken, Norway  5 months ago  · 10 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Company Description

Terry Soot Management Group (TSMG) is a field data collection company founded in 2017 in Europe.

We collect data where automation is not possible. We count features, take pictures, make videos, record speech, and scan areas for every detail you need to make more informed decisions. Our field data collection teams are spread across Europe and North America, ready to accept new challenges.

Project objective

The goal of the project is to help collect images of streets, main points of interest and public areas in the EU countries. The project is performed on cars with 360 cameras mounted on top that image the area around the vehicle and store those images on computers inside the vehicle. Later, this data will be used to enhance one the most popular online maps in the world.

The data collectors will be given specific routes around public streets and areas, specifically targeting commercial districts and historical sites. Due to poor weather conditions some areas will be visited multiple times in order to collect the best quality of imaging. The project is expected to last at least 3 months and will cover different city/state zones.

The ideal candidate enjoys driving, knows well the area, traffic trends, is highly responsible and reliable.

The schedule expected on the project is Monday-Friday, 8 hours/day 40 hours per week. You can work more than 8 hours if you will.

Requirements

Must have a valid Driver License (driving experience, 3 yrs minimum)
Must have parking for vehicle
Enjoys driving, with flexible schedule
Available for a minimum of 3 months
Responsible & Reliable
Good driving skills
Great communication skills
High level of responsibility
General car knowledge
Tech savvy (smartphone and basic apps)
Basic computer skills
Self-motivated and detailed oriented

We would be happy to get to know you and your skills better and see how we can support each other's growth.

Please apply and let's meet!

name_location: Endelig-Mandag IT-rekruttering · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 43 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Om Right:

Right er et konsulentselskap som ble opprettet i 2009. Vi er Gaselle bedrift 3 ganger, er 30 dedikerte ansatte, våre konsulenter er blant de fremste spesialister innen sine fagområder, og vi har et av Norges største Oracle fagmiljøer.

Vi jobber alltid for å beholde et dynamisk og fag-interessert miljø der vi har det trivelig sammen med kompetansebygging, deltagelse på konferanser/kurs og sosiale sammenkomster. Våre verdier understøtter målet om at våre konsulenter skal være tillits-byggende og hyggelige samarbeidspartnere, og dette er noe vi føler best oppnås ved å ha et spennende og engasjerende arbeidsmiljø.

Hvorfor jobbe hos Right?

Hos Right får du jobbe med det fremste innen sky-teknologi og data-arkitektur. Vi har et positivt og engasjert miljø der du kan utvikle deg selv og hjelpe kunder å innovere. Våre konsulenter har sentrale roller i flere av de mest spennende og moderne IT prosjektene her til lands, og du får raskt ansvar og spennende utfordringer.

Har du erfaring med implementering av SaaS, PaaS, IaaS og Analytics så er vi interessert i å høre fra deg. Vi leverer ledende Oracle SaaS løsninger som blant annet Oracle ERP cloud, HCM og EPM. På plattform og infrastruktur flytter vi kunder opp i Oracle Cloud Infrastructure og har ekspertkompetanse på integrasjon og PaaS.

Right har lenge vært ledende på datavarehus/data lake og har nå tatt steget videre med desentralisert data-arkitektur også kalt Data Mesh. Vi har utviklet vår egen beste praksis for desentralisert data-arkitektur hvor fordelen med PaaS og SaaS maksimeres ved hjelp av vår dype og helhetlige kompetanse. Vi bredder nå denne satsningen med Microsoft Azure for å gi optimale arkitekturen for våre kunder.

Hvem er du ?

Gode kommunikasjonsevner, muntlig og skriftlig (engelsk og norsk)
Er analytisk, strukturert og løsningsorientert
Har en naturlig autoritet som inngir tillit
Høy arbeidskapasitet og trives med forskjellige oppgaver
Relevant høyere utdanning (Bachelor/Master)
Gode samarbeidsevner, er både selvgående og en lagspiller
God til å kommunisere med forretning
Evne til å se helhet og jobbe proaktivt med god gjennomføringsevne
Evner å håndtere mange interessenter
Relevante sertifiseringer er selvfølgelig et pluss

Vi kan tilby:

Bli en del av et engasjerende og motivert miljø som inspirerer til faglig utvikling
Et bredt spekter av spennende arbeidsoppgaver basert på ledende og utprøvde teknologier
Et aktivt og hyggelig arbeidsmiljø i nye, moderne lokaler i Oslo sentrum
Faglige utfordringer med store utviklingsmuligheter
Opplæring i bruk av aktuelle verktøy og teknologi
Mulighet for å utvikle og sette ditt preg på en organisasjon i vekst (Gaselle 3 ganger)
Jobbe med mellomstore/store og viktige kunder i privat og offentlig sektor

Ønsker du å vite mer om denne muligheten, kontakt partner i Endelig-Mandag Sara Ben-Shams Augensen ; M: Sara@Endelig-Mandag.no T: +47 93299341

name_location: DHIS2 · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 week ago  · 41 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Company Description

DHIS2 is a configurable platform for data collection and analysis -- free and open source self-hosted software and a proud Digital Public Good. Today it is used in more than 100 countries. This includes use by more than 70 national ministries of health where it serves as the backbone for country health information systems. It has been estimated that 2.4 billion people (30% of the world’s population) live in countries where DHIS2 is deployed.

We are a well-funded not-for-profit project located at the HISP Centre at the University of Oslo (UiO), where we operate as an independent software development organization. We work with and are supported by many global development organizations and are a World Health Organization collaborating center. DHIS2 is used every day around the world to manage routine health service delivery, COVID-19 surveillance and vaccination, Malaria elimination campaigns, HIV/AIDS prevention and treatment, Tuberculosis programs, maternal and child health, national education systems, health supply chain logistics, climate impacts on human health, and much more.

With us you get a chance to work on problems which really matter: Improving the health and well-being of people around the world through access and use of information. We give you a lot of flexibility and freedom to make a difference while solving interesting technical challenges. At DHIS2 we believe you will do your best work if you fully understand the context in which the system operates, so you are encouraged to engage directly with our projects, take part in the design process, and get feedback from users in the field.

Job Description

We are hiring a UX engineer, a combination of a frontend and design role. You'll work across the whole DHIS2 ecosystem to improve the user experience by working directly in the code. You'll use your knowledge of frontend development and design principles to build usable, user-friendly web applications.

This role is part of the design team. Alongside our lead designer, you will work across product teams to develop new and iterate on existing user-facing features.

What You'll Do

Build application interfaces that solve problems effectively. 
Apply the principles, patterns, and components of the DHIS2 Design System across our library of applications. 
Design, develop, and iterate upon design system components. 
Identify where the user experience could be improved, and jump right in and make changes. 
Work with the design team to design, iterate on, and build user-facing features. 
Apply UX best practices across applications. 
Combine user requirements and design best practices to build interfaces that work. 
Focus on and craft interface details, like empty states and loading states, to make sure our applications are robust and effective. 

Qualifications

Several years of professional experience working with complex enterprise applications. 
Strong HTML/CSS/JS and React skills – you'll be writing production-ready code. 
An eye for visual design principles like spacing, color, and rhythm, and experience applying those principles to interfaces. 
Experience working with design systems and component libraries. 
Familiar with design tools, like Figma, to visualize and iterate on ideas. 
Excellent written and verbal English communication — you'll be communicating your solutions and collaborating with others every day. 

Additional Information

PLEASE READ! Important instructions to ensure your application is considered

We value, above all else, applicants who are passionate about making a positive difference in the world. Please write 3 sentences in the “Message to Hiring Manager” portion of your application telling us why you are specifically interested in working with DHIS2. It doesn't have to be a lengthy cover letter, we just want to know that you have at least reviewed our website (dhis2.org) and want to join us in our mission.

Diversity and Inclusion

The people designing and building DHIS2 should reflect the people of every imaginable background, identity, gender, religion, ability, and nationality in more than 100 countries and on 6 continents worldwide who rely on it. We have published a diversity pledge where you can learn more about our commitment to continually improve the diversity of our teams and to combat unjust disadvantages prevalent throughout the technology industry.

We encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply for our roles. This includes women, non-binary people, ethnic minorities, people with disabilities, LGBTQ+ people, people from the Global South, and anyone else who identifies with a group that remains underrepresented in tech and engineering. Please reach out if you have doubts about your suitability for a role, and let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments during any part of the application process.

Learn more at https://dhis2.org/careers/software/diversity

Location and Time Zones

You can work remotely from any country in the world or from our office in Oslo, Norway. If working remotely, we strongly prefer candidates who can have at least 4 hours of overlap with Central European Time Zone working hours. If you are located more than 2 time zones away from Europe, please indicate in your application how you will accommodate this difference. If you are located many timezones away and do not including any additional information in your application it may be automatically rejected.

Remote Work and Travel

We are a remote-first global team but we recognize the importance of meeting and collaborating with colleagues in person. You will have the opportunity to travel 1-3 times per year to meet with other members or your team. We host one annual all-hands meeting with the entire global software team, and each product team may also meet to collaborate or see DHIS2 use in the field. There may be additional opportunities to travel for conferences or to help facilitate academies. All travel expenses are fully covered.

We recognize that travel has an environmental impact, and so we work to limit travel to only what is essential and to mitigate or offset the impact of necessary travel we fund. We encourage the use of trains and other low-carbon transportation whenever this is a reasonable option.

Contract details

This is a full-time position (80% possible) on an annual renewable contract. We are focused on building long-term contractor relationships. We support flexible work arrangements with generous holiday allowances, and we offer the option to renew for longer contract periods over time.

job_description:
About the job
Summer internship 2024 – IT; Cloud & DevOps

Ready for an engaging opportunity that can launch your career with a Cube Storage Pioneer?

We are looking for highly engaged and self-driven students across different disciplines and locations for next year’s AutoStore Summer Internship.

The internship will generally take place in June 2024 and runs for a six-week period, until mid-August. During this period you will spend time with other interns and supervisors, and not only be surrounded by a social and fun environment, but also gain relevant work experience within a unique, multidisciplinary company.

In this specific summer internship, you will become a part of the IT department for Cloud Infrastructure at our office in Lysaker, and get to work with a variety of Cloud and DevOps projects and tasks. Task may include working with Kubernetes, CICD with Azure DevOps, Docker Containers and Infrastructure as Code with Terraform. Being familiar with python and Linux would also be beneficial.

Show your interest by submitting your CV and diplomas by October 31st via our online recruitment system.

The screening process may potentially take some time depending on volume and when the application is sent, but our goal is to provide offers to chosen individuals as quickly as we can, even prior to the deadline. We also aim to notify unsuccessful candidates as soon as possible.

All inquiries are treated confidentially.

name_location: Infor · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 7 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Would you like to work with implementing future digital solutions?  We are looking for Associate ERP Consultants to join us in Oslo or Trondheim in September 2024!

As the Associate Consultant, you will gain knowledge about our Cloud solutions, Implementation methodology, Consulting Skills, and Industry business practices. Throughout the program, you will learn how to create and implement digital solutions to address our customer's needs. It is a full time position with a start in The Early Talent Program. You don't need to have prior technical background/ERP experience. 

The daily task of the Consultant Associate consists of: 

 * Implementation of ERP solutions * 
 * Analyzing business processes 
 * Customer interaction 
 * Designing business solutions 
 * Participating in and preparing workshops for our customers 
 * Learning new methods of business implementation 
 * Supporting customer training 
 * Assisting in go-lives 

 
*ERP - Enterprise Resource Planning is the integrated management of main business processes, often in real-time and mediated by software and technology. ERP is usually referred to as a category of business management software —typically a suite of integrated applications — that an organization can use to collect, store, manage and interpret data from their various business activities. 
 
About The Early Talent Program 
The program duration is 12 months and consists of both training in our academy and working on projects to provide you with broad hands-on experience to accelerate your career in consulting. Early on in this program, you will help customers to benefit from our world-class Cloud solutions for companies within the Distribution, Food & Beverage, Automotive, and Manufacturing industries. This will give you a solid foundation in running innovative local and global Infor projects from both an IT and a business perspective in several key business areas. 

The Early Talent Program consists of: 
Project work • Product training • Mentor work • Soft skills training • Customer consulting • Traveling 

It's set in an international environment where you will interact with instructors and other Early Talents from EMEA. In addition to training in business processes, applications, and Industry solutions, you will also get an introduction to Infor, our values, and how we operate. 
All are designed to enable you to learn to innovate, improve, and transform yourself into a skilled consultant. 

 
You're a fit for the role if you identify with some of the below: 
A genuine interest in business processes and IT 
Fluent in a Scandinavian language and English - speaking and writing 
Willingness to travel and a have a driving license 
A "can-do" attitude 
Eager to grow and learn 
Enjoy interacting with other people 
Education or knowledge about Supply Chain Management or Logistics 

 
What do we offer? 

 * Start mid-September 2024 
 * Full-time permanent contract from day one 
 * International Onboarding week in Poland 
 * A mentor who will help you to navigate the new tasks 
 * Hands-on experience in customers projects 
 * Ongoing learning, and career development opportunities 
 * Work with experienced seniors and with other International Early Talents 
 * Competitive salary from the beginning of your career 
 * Hybrid type of work 
 * Office in Trondheim or Oslo 
 * Good pension and insurance scheme 
 * Good and welcoming work atmosphere

About Infor

Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation. 
For more information visit www.infor.com

Our Values

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called [1] Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law.

At Infor we value your privacy that’s why we created a policy that you can read [2] here.


References

Visible links
1. https://www.kochind.com/about/business-philosophy
2. https://www.infor.com/about/privacy

name_location: TSMG · Molde, Møre og Romsdal, Norway  5 months ago  · 27 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Company Description

Terry Soot Management Group (TSMG) is a field data collection company founded in 2017 in Europe.

We collect data where automation is not possible. We count features, take pictures, make videos, record speech, and scan areas for every detail you need to make more informed decisions. Our field data collection teams are spread across Europe and North America, ready to accept new challenges.

Project objective

The goal of the project is to help collect images of streets, main points of interest and public areas in the EU countries. The project is performed on cars with 360 cameras mounted on top that image the area around the vehicle and store those images on computers inside the vehicle. Later, this data will be used to enhance one the most popular online maps in the world.

The data collectors will be given specific routes around public streets and areas, specifically targeting commercial districts and historical sites. Due to poor weather conditions some areas will be visited multiple times in order to collect the best quality of imaging. The project is expected to last at least 3 months and will cover different city/state zones.

The ideal candidate enjoys driving, knows well the area, traffic trends, is highly responsible and reliable.

The schedule expected on the project is Monday-Friday, 8 hours/day 40 hours per week. You can work more than 8 hours if you will.

Requirements

Must have a valid Driver License (driving experience, 3 yrs minimum)
Must have parking for vehicle
Enjoys driving, with flexible schedule
Available for a minimum of 3 months
Responsible & Reliable
Good driving skills
Great communication skills
High level of responsibility
General car knowledge
Tech savvy (smartphone and basic apps)
Basic computer skills
Self-motivated and detailed oriented

We would be happy to get to know you and your skills better and see how we can support each other's growth.

Please apply and let's meet!

About the job
We are looking for a Senior BI Developer in Oslo to build and manage BI and analytics solutions that turn data into knowledge

Our solutions will help users to understand and manage their data, allowing for flexibility, scalability, along with future-proof data infrastructure to handle whatever their needs may be

 Developing reports and dashboards in Power BI
 Data modelling

 Working with cloud technologies such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse
 Develop database queries and conduct analysis
 Translate business needs to technical specifications
We Are Looking For You To Bring
 Proven experience as a BI Developer
 Experience working with Microsoft technologies including Power BI and Azure
 Familiarity with data warehouse design, data mining and database management systems.
 Proficiency with a variety of data sources and types of data
 Experience with ETL
 Analytical mind with a problem-solving attitude
What's in it for you?

There is the opportunity to play a key role in further developing the companies' analysis capabilities and have a real influence over the future of the department

You will be part of a senior an friendly team who enjoy to share knowledge and build solutions together

We support a flexible working model with hybrid options and flexitime

You will be supported through training and development opportunities with chances to develop your professional & technical skills as well as softer skills such as leadership

We have built a social culture with regular meetups, networking events, lunches and hobby groups

For any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@frankgroup.com

We are searching for a Senior Data Engineer to join the team!

As part of a dedicated team, you will work alongside colleagues within data engineering, data architecture, data science, and analytics to deliver modern solutions which offer valuable insights to customers in various domains

As a senior member of the team, you will be involved in strategic decisions along with overseeing the technical development of complex data projects

name_location: EIK Servering · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 2 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Her reiser du til land som Korea, Thailand og Mexico og skaper retter som krysser latinamerikanske og asiatiske smaker med nordiske råvarer. Rene smaker som er tro mot råvarene og en meny som endres hyppig, men som alltid baserer seg på havets delikatesser.

Leter du etter et morsomt og spennende sted å jobbe? Da trenger du ikke lete lenger enn Katla, den moderne og travle restauranten midt i hjertet av Oslo! Med en fusjon av søramerikanske og asiatiske smaker, tilbyr vi både à la carte og set menyer, i tillegg til en fantastisk vinkart, cocktails og frozen margaritas.

Vi søker nå en entusiastisk og serviceinnstilt servitør som ønsker å bli en del av vårt inkluderende og vennlige team. Som servitør hos Katla, vil du få muligheten til å utvikle ferdighetene dine i en utfordrende og hektisk arbeidsmiljø. Bli med oss i dag og vær en del av actionen!

Arbeidsoppgaver

Skape gode opplevelser for våre gjester gjennom fremragende service
Ta imot gjester og ta bestillinger
Håndtere betalinger
Jobbe med mersalg

Egenskaper:

Ryddig, punktlig, fleksibel og med godt humør
Ha en positiv innstilling og være utadvendt
Er svært ryddig og strukturert
Du liker at det er høy fart og jobber godt under press

Kvalifikasjoner:

God og bred faglig kunnskap og erfaring fra arbeid i salen.
Over 20 år
Kommunisere godt på norsk og/eller engelsk

Vi tilbyr:

Gode lønnsbetingelser 
En inspirerende restaurant
En plass til å utvikle seg som servitør
Godt arbeidsmiljø

Om arbeidsgiveren

EIK Servering står for driften av Alf Nabolagsbar, Brutus, Brød & Sirkus, Bølgen & Moi (Bodø, Gimle, Stavanger, Tjuvholmen), Delicatessen (Aker Brygge, Bodø, Fredrikstad, Grunerløkka, Majorstuen, Tromsø), Der Peppern Gror (Bogstadveien, Rådhusplassen), Dobbel, Felix, Fyrhuset Kuba, Handwerk Botaniske, Hitchhiker, Hrimnir ramen, Katla, Metz, Opland Burger & Steak, Sagene Lunsjbar, Sentralen Kafe, Sentralen Restaurant, Smalhans,The Golden Chimp, The Golden Chimp VIA, Utendørs, Uvisst, Vega Snackbar, Vineria Ventitude og Østbanehagen. Felles for alle disse unike stedene er ønsket om å være nyskapende og bærekraftige i det vi gjør best: Å skape gode matopplevelser – og tilby noe nytt og givende for kundene, og lokalsamfunnet vi befinner oss i. Bli med på matreisen. Velkommen til oss!
