name_location: Lnett AS · Sandnes, Rogaland, Norway  1 month ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
Søknadsfrist: 18.10.2023 

Lnett er et av Norges største nettselskaper. Hos oss er du med på laget som sørger for utbygging, drift og vedlikehold av strømnettet i Sør-Rogaland. Vi er i full gang med å forsterke og fornye strømnettet for å legge til rette for verdiskapning og elektrifisering, samt sørge for en trygg og stabil strømforsyning. 

Vil du være med å bygge og utvikle fremtidens bærekraftige energisystem?

Elektrifisering og det grønne skiftet skjer nå - bli med på laget!

Vårt traineeprogram gir anledning til å prøve alle sider av virksomheten, og tilpasses den enkeltes bakgrunn. Programmet går over 2 år og gir anledning til å jobbe med 3-5 av våre virksomhetsområder. Underveis får du tett oppfølging av nærmeste overordnede og en mentor, og etter endt rotasjon vil du få en fast stilling.

I traineeperioden vil du ha en variert hverdag, og kan for eksempel jobbe med

Nettutviklingsplan og utarbeidelse av konsesjonssøknad
Montasjearbeid på linjer og stasjoner
Overvåking av nettet og feilhåndtering
Kontraktstrategi ifm. anskaffelser av tjenester og materiell
Utarbeide analyser ifm. arbeid med rammebetingelser eller forbedringsprosjekt

Kvalifikasjoner 

Du er på siste året av mastergraden, eller har nylig fullført utdannelse
Vi søker primært søkere med utdanningsbakgrunn innen elkraft, fornybar energi, energi og miljø eller indøk, men oppfordrer også personer med bakgrunn innen økonomi, analyse og IT til å søke
Du kan vise til gode akademiske resultater
Du formulerer deg godt på norsk både skriftlig og muntlig

Personlige egenskaper

Du er proaktiv, selvgående og nygjerrig og tar eierskap for dine oppgaver
Du er relasjonsbygger med god evne til samarbeid og ser helheten i det du gjør
Du har et genuint ønske om å lære og å utvikle seg selv
Du har sterke analytiske egenskaper
Du liker teknologi og er nygjerrig på de endringer den kan skape
Du identifiserer deg med våre verdier Modig, Ansvarlig, Tydelig og Lagspiller, og du har en genuin interesse for å utgjøre en forskjell - det være seg for kunden, klima, regionen eller selskapet

Vi tilbyr

Lnett er arbeidsplassen for deg som verdsetter et sterkt tverrfaglig miljø, gode kollegaer, faglig utvikling, fart og ja, til og med litt spenning! Lnett er en del av folks hverdag. Som en av våre traineer vil du få en sentral og spennende rolle med muligheter for personlig og faglig utvikling. Du vil få gode karrieremuligheter hos en miljøorientert og sentral samfunnsbygger.

Vi Tilbyr Betingelser Som Ikke Står Tilbake For Resten Av Bransjen. Du Vil Møte Et Åpent Og Uformelt Arbeidsmiljø Med Takhøyde Og Fleksibilitet. Her Er Noe Av Det Vi Kan Tilby Av Goder

 En svært gunstig innskuddspensjon- og forsikringspakke 
 Firmahytter både på fjellet og ved sjøen 
 Bedriftsidrettslag og subsidiert trening 
 Ekstra fridager og gode velferdstiltak 
 Kjekke sosiale sammenkomster 
 Kompetanse- og karriereutviklingsmuligheter 

Og så gjør det godt å vite at vi jobber for et konsern med stort samfunnsengasjement. Bonus, ikke sant?

Hvor er kontoret? 

Lnett holder til i nytt kontorbygg i Jærveien i Sandnes nær Skeiane togstasjon. Hovedkontoret til konsernet er på Mariero i Stavanger. Begge kontorene ligger sentralt med bare få minutters gange til tog og buss, og vi tilbyr Hjem-jobb-hjem-ordning, sykkelparkering og garderobe.

Kontakt

Nærmere opplysninger om stillingen får du ved å kontakte Åshild Helland, leder rammebetingelser, på tlf. 934 88 739 . Personalrelaterte spørsmål rettes til Kajsa Bøgild, HR konsulent, på tlf. 979 76 180.

Send inn CV, karakterutskrift/vitnemål og søknad hvor du forteller hvorfor akkurat DU er en vi bør satse på. Screening intervjuer foretas fortløpende over Teams. Oppgi også om når du kan være tilgjengelig for intervju/assessment i Stavanger i perioden slutten av oktober - november.

Vi håper du sender oss en søknad. Vi gleder oss til å lese den!

Lnett er underlagt offentlighetens bestemmelser. Aktuelle kandidater må forvente at det gjennomføres bakgrunnssjekk.

Etter søknadsfristens utløp kan det bli offentliggjort en liste over søkerne. Det kan gjøres unntak fra offentlighet dersom søker ber om det. Vær oppmerksom på at opplysninger om en søker likevel kan bli offentliggjort. Søker vil bli varslet dersom unntak fra offentlighet ikke blir innvilget.

Lnett er en del av Lysekonsernet, et norsk konsern med virksomhet innen energi, infrastruktur og telekommunikasjon. Lnett har over 160 000 kunder og rundt 360 ansatte, og holder til i nye moderne lokaler i Sandnes sentrum. Vi har over 100 års historie med å levere strøm til innbyggere og bedrifter i Sør-Rogaland. Konsernet er blant landets største produsenter av fornybar vannkraft. Vårt mål er å bygge og å utvikle samfunnskritisk infrastruktur som muliggjør elektrifiseringen og digitaliseringen av Norge. Vår visjon er å være mer enn et selskap, både for våre kunder, for våre eiere og for våre ansatte. 

Konsernet med hovedkontor i Stavanger har virksomhet i Norge og Danmark, og teller i dag rundt 2000 ansatte. Lyse er heleid av 14 kommuner og vår verdiskaping går tilbake til fellesskapet.

name_location: Elvia · Oslo, Norway  1 week ago  · 98 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Sommerprosjekt 2024 - Vil du utforske nye løsninger i Norges største nettselskap?

Vil du være med i et utforskende og innovativt studentteam i Elvia? Motiveres du av å løse høyaktuelle utfordringer for elektrifiseringen av samfunnet?

Elvia søker engasjerte og nysgjerrige studenter til vårt sommerprosjekt sommeren 2024! Hos oss får du muligheten til å ta del i en veldig spennende utviklingsfase, der vi er midt i den største fusjonen noensinne blant nettselskaper i Norge. Elvia er ansvarlig for å sikre at nesten to millioner mennesker har strøm. Vår leveranse er helt avgjørende for samfunnet; alt fra at mobilen skal lades, til å levere strøm til samfunnskritiske institusjoner.

Deltakere i vårt summer internship får jobbe med utviklingsprosjekter, FoU-prosjekter eller strategiprosjekter, hvor casene vil være i grensesnittet mellom teknologi, prosess og mennesker. Du vil, sammen med et team på totalt fire studenter, få stor frihet og ansvar i å forme prosjektene dere jobber med og i. Teamet vil settes sammen med kompletterende kompetanse, og arbeidet vil dra nytt av en god bredde i kunnskap, erfaring og tilnærming. Det vil legges vekt på at det skal være caser hvor dere på en kort og intensiv sommer kan levere et godt og verdifullt bidrag i vårt utviklingsarbeid som selskap.

Dette er en mulighet til å få relevant arbeidserfaring, et godt innblikk i hvordan Norges desidert største nettselskap fungerer, og hvilken bredde vi har i oppgaver og områder. Vi er interessert i å velge kandidater som også på sikt kan være aktuelle søkere til fast stilling til vårt prosjektteam eller andre deler av virksomheten. Arbeidsperioden vil være fra medio juni til medio august med noen ukers sommerferie i juli etter ønske og behov. Nøyaktige datoer vil vi avtale med kandidatene ved ansettelse.

Er du interessert? Send oss en søknad (på norsk) der du begrunner hvorfor nettopp du er den kandidaten vi bør velge.

Husk å legge ved CV, vitnemål og relevante attester.

Vi gleder oss til å motta din søknad!

Kvalifikasjoner
Er godt ut i studiene, og nysgjerrig på muligheter i næringslivet
Studerer fagretninger som industriell økonomi, økonomi, ingeniørfag, IT, design, markedsføring eller samfunnsvitenskap

Personlige egenskaper
Nysgjerrig: du vil vite hvorfor ting er som de er
Empatisk: du vil forstå mennesker og hvorfor de gjør som de gjør
Analytisk: du liker å bryne deg på komplekse problemstillinger for å forså sammenhenger
Åpen: du liker å dele og være en del av et team
Modig: du tør å utfordre det etablerte og eksperimentere deg frem til løsninger

Vi tilbyr
Relevant arbeidserfaring i Norges største nettselskap
Gode fagmiljøer med mulighet til å lære av de beste
Mulighet til å jobbe med aktuelle problemstillinger og ny teknologi

name_location: Cobblestone Energy · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Employment type: Full-time & Permanent

Starting salary of USD 60,000 per annum + performance based bonus' - 0% tax environment

Job Location: Dubai, UAE (We provide visa sponsorship & relocation assistance)

About Cobblestone Energy

Cobblestone Energy is an energy trading company specialising in the Great Britain and European wholesale electricity markets. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading.

We make use of advanced data analytics and extensive research to drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country, and growing every day. In doing so, we help to balance the electricity grid, lowering the cost to end consumers, and aiding the transition to a renewable future. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.

At Cobblestone Energy, we are a diverse team of over 50 people from 20+ nationalities - we believe in hiring extraordinary talent from all around the world. Our flat organizational structure helps us in giving our team members complete ownership of the work and ensures ideas come from every level. We believe in providing unlimited growth opportunities to our people alongside constant feedback and support, which allows us to cover our vulnerabilities and grow as a team in new and interesting ways. With the right performance and potential, you could be managing the power desk for an entire country within eighteen months in your role. Come join our dream team!

Cobblestone Values

Lifelong learning with continuous reflection
Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas
The team is more important than the individual
Being the best in any market we enter
Hiring and keeping only the most effective people
Others must benefit from our existence

What We Offer In This Role

A full-time position on our Commercial team
Committed and remarkably talented colleagues
Highly competitive compensation dependent on performance
An exciting, challenging and fulfilling career
Investment in your development to ensure that you always remain the best in business
Equity participation for strong contributors, ensuring our interests are all aligned long term

Responsibilities

Owning, managing, and profitably trading in the European power markets while implementing any relevant strategies
Innovating new ideas for trading tools and strategies then working with the analysis and development teams to implement them
Working as a part of our 24/7 operating trading team, to ensure markets are always covered
Utilising self-starter capability while also working efficiently within a team environment
Ensuring all power market regulations and requirements are upheld through good communication with the system operators
Upholding and living our cultural values

Basic Qualifications

Excellent numerical and logical reasoning skills
Ability to think clearly in critical situations
Passion, resilience, and integrity

Preferred Qualification & Background

We look for individuals from strong numerical backgrounds as such skills carry over well for excelling as a Junior Trader. However, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds and experiences with a track record of excellence, both inside and outside of academics.

The Hiring Process

Once your application has been reviewed, the evaluation process will involve psychometric tests, a research project, and remote interviews. Following this, selected finalists will be invited to participate in the final stage of the recruitment process: the Commercial Training Program (CTP) in our Dubai office. During this one-week program, we will cover all relocation expenses, including flights, accommodation, work visa paperwork, and related costs.

Upon successful completion of the CTP, candidates will receive an offer to join our Dubai office as full-time Commercial Graduates through our Commercial Development Program (CDP). The CDP offers a comprehensive rotational experience in trading, and analytics, with the guidance of our experienced commercial team. Throughout the program, you will receive mentorship and training in market fundamentals, allowing you to develop strong analytical skills. After finishing the program, you will assume the role of a Junior Trader at Cobblestone Energy.

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
The role of a Linux Curriculum Developer at Canonical

For today's developers and system administrators, Ubuntu is the centrepiece of their valuable professional skills from cloud to containers, from edge to IoT, and in data science and AI. We are building a program to help technical professionals test, certify and showcase their open source abilities. This will be the Canonical Ubuntu version of RHCE, Cisco CNE and similar certifications. Join a fast-paced, global, fully remote team and help set the trajectory of our expanding technical certifications, credentials and future training programmes. This position requires the ability to balance the rigorous methodology of instructional design with the technical experience of an engineer to help create engaging technical curriculum and assessment content.

As a Curriculum Developer on the Credentials & Curriculum team, you'll use your skills as a quick learner and effective communicator to balance an interest in open source communities, operating systems, DevOps and cloud technologies, scripting languages, and git repositories, with a passion for improving assessment and instructional content through blueprinting, JTA surveys, and SME recruitment and management phases.

This role reports to the Skills Certification Lead.

Location: This role can be held anywhere in the EMEA or Americas time zones / regions.

What Your Day Will Look Like

Working with stakeholders and cross-teams in analysing instructional design requests to determine technical resource requirements and project needs
Creating relevant, engaging, accurate instructional, assessment, and supporting content based on blueprints, JTA surveys, item writing panels, SME guidance, and industry best practices
Act as internal Subject-Matter Expert (SME) for Linux and data centre products, verifying items and instruction accuracy 
Determine exam delivery platform specifications required per exam
Working with technical vendors and internal teams to manage porting and transferring of content and user data in various internal and vendor-based systems, including GitHub repositories and JIRA

What We Are Looking For In You

An expert in Linux, preferrably Ubuntu or Debian. 
Effective communication and collaboration across cross-functional teams, vendors, and with internal stakeholders to ensure resources and needs align
Relevant, engaging and accurate instructional design and assessment
Industry best practices of exam blueprinting and job task analysis
Strong initiative and leadership skills, Agile experience, and security and privacy assessment
User-friendly, accessible methods of conveying highly technical information that is relevant, appropriately challenging, and offers the highest quality user experience. 
Experience with GitHub repositories,CRMs, and JIRA
Curiosity and the drive to learn highly complex technologies rapidly and autonomously in addition to working with SMEs. 

What We Offer You

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.

An opportunity to shape the open source community
An inclusive work environment
Learning and development
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual leave
Priority Pass for travel

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products.Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

job_title: Bouvet Agder trenger flere dyktige utviklere, arkitekter og techleads!
name_location: Bouvet ASA · Arendal, Agder, Norway  1 week ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Om du brenner for utvikling og vil jobbe med rause og flinke kollegaer er dette sjansen du har ventet på.

Vi jobber med noen av Norges mest fremtredende virksomheter og du kan være med å skape løsninger med stor betydning for enkeltmennesker og for samfunnet.

Hos oss får du jobbe med kunder som tør gi deg ansvar, og kollegaer som ønsker å se deg på ditt beste. Det betyr at du får stor frihet i hverdagen, at du kan være deg selv – og at du blir utfordret og satt krav til.

Hvem er du?

Vi ser etter deg med en lidenskap for å programmere. Du har minst 3 års erfaring og er sulten på ny kunnskap.

Du trives godt som fullstack utvikler eller så er du spesielt god på enten backend eller frontend.

Du har erfaring med Java eller .Net, og skyløsninger - primært Microsoft Azure.

Du kan designe gode løsninger basert på riktig teknologi i forhold til kundens behov og krav.

Kompetanseutvikling er viktig for deg, og du liker å dele dine erfaringer med andre. Vi jobber hele tiden med å utvikle oss for å kunne tilby kundene våre fremtidsrettede og robuste løsninger.

Du må kunne kommunisere og skrive godt på norsk, og du må kunne bestå en sikkerhetsklarering til nivå hemmelig..

Bouvet tilbyr deg mer enn en arbeidsplass

Faglig utvikling og mulighet til å påvirke egen hverdag

Hos oss er du ikke alene. Vi gir vi deg tett faglig oppfølging og mulighet til å delta i faglige fellesskap og -arrangementer i egen og andres regi. Vi legger gode opplæringsløp sammen med deg, og gir deg mulighet til å påvirke hva slags prosjekter du deltar i og hva slags roller du har i dem, slik at du kan utvikle deg i den retningen du vil.

Spennende kunder og viktige prosjekter

Hos oss får du oppgaver som er faglig utfordrende, i prosjekter som veldig ofte påvirker langt flere enn oppdragsgiveren. Vi hjelper kort sagt noen av Norges største private og offentlige bedrifter med å utvikle digitale løsninger som gjør hverdagen bedre.

Vi jobber sammen

Derfor har vi ikke prestasjonsbasert lønn og individuelle bonuser, men gir heller alle ansatte en fast, god lønn knyttet til stillingen sin. Vi har dessuten aksjeprogram, overskuddsdeling og gode pensjonsordninger som til sammen utgjør gode tilskudd til lønnen.

Bli med oss når vi går foran og bygger fremtidens samfunn

Ta kontakt for en uforpliktende prat for å høre mer om hva vi kan tilby eller send inn søknad via 'Søk på Stillingen'.

Etter ansettelse vil en tredje parts bakgrunnssjekk gjennomføres. Dette er en verifisering av de opplysninger som gis i rekrutteringsprosessen. Bakgrunnssjekken er tilpasset stillingens krav og gjennomføres etter søkerens samtykke.

Vil du være med å utvikle morgendagens samfunn?

Vi vokser raskt, og ser nå etter deg som er nyutdannet, dyktig og interessert i en stilling hos Bouvet. Mener du at du kan bidra til vekst og ny innsikt i vårt allerede sterke fagmiljø? Da er vi interessert i å høre fra deg!

Teknisk bakgrunn fra høgskole/universitet
Evne til å ta ansvar og takle mange arbeidsoppgaver, også under tidspress
God allmenn forretningsforståelse er en fordel
Løsningsorientert, både teknisk og funksjonelt
Utadvendt og fleksibel
Interessert i å jobbe i varierte virksomheter og miljøer
Villig til å lære mer og til å dele din kunnskap med dine kolleger
Gode kommunikasjonsevner på norsk

Vi tilbyr:

Et av de beste fagmiljøene i Norge
Et trivelig miljø med stor vekt på kompetansebygging og sosiale aktiviteter 
Hyggelige kollegaer som er opptatt av å dele kunnskap
En variert arbeidsdag med utfordrende oppgaver i noen av Norges mest spennende prosjekter
Kort vei til beslutninger og mulighet til å påvirke hverdagen 
Gode muligheter for utvikling og kompetanseheving
Konkurransedyktige betingelser med attraktiv overskuddsdeling
Alle har individuelle utviklingsplaner i tillegg til et bredt utvalg av aktiviteter som fagkaffe, fagkvelder, deltakelse på konferanser, hackatons og internkonferanser der fag står sterkt.
"Innseiling": et program av de unge i Bouvet for de unge i Bouvet med sosiale sammenkomster, fagsamlinger og fadderordninger for alle med mindre enn 2 år i bransjen
Onboarding: vårt onboardingsprogram består blant annet av tre konsulentrollekurs som alle nyansatte skal gjennom i løpet av de første månedene. I disse kursene får man en grundig innføring i Bouvetkulturen og konsulentrollen.

Sjekk ut vår gulrotindeks for mer informasjon om godene våre: www.bouvet.no/bli-en-av-oss

CV og vitnemål

Vurderinger kjøres fortløpende, og søknadsfrist blir utvidet ved behov til alle plasser er besatt. Send oss gjerne en søknad allerede i dag så hører du fra oss når vi har gjort en vurdering.

name_location: TSMG · Hylkje, Vestland, Norway  4 months ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Company Description

Terry Soot Management Group (TSMG) is a field data collection company founded in 2017 in Europe.

We collect data where automation is not possible. We count features, take pictures, make videos, record speech, and scan areas for every detail you need to make more informed decisions. Our field data collection teams are spread across Europe and North America, ready to accept new challenges.

Project objective

The goal of the project is to help collect images of streets, main points of interest and public areas in the EU countries. The project is performed on cars with 360 cameras mounted on top that image the area around the vehicle and store those images on computers inside the vehicle. Later, this data will be used to enhance one the most popular online maps in the world.

The data collectors will be given specific routes around public streets and areas, specifically targeting commercial districts and historical sites. Due to poor weather conditions some areas will be visited multiple times in order to collect the best quality of imaging. The project is expected to last at least 3 months and will cover different city/state zones.

The ideal candidate enjoys driving, knows well the area, traffic trends, is highly responsible and reliable.

The schedule expected on the project is Monday-Friday, 8 hours/day 40 hours per week. You can work more than 8 hours if you will.

Requirements

Must have a valid Driver License (driving experience, 3 yrs minimum)
Must have parking for vehicle
Enjoys driving, with flexible schedule
Available for a minimum of 3 months
Responsible & Reliable
Good driving skills
Great communication skills
High level of responsibility
General car knowledge
Tech savvy (smartphone and basic apps)
Basic computer skills
Self-motivated and detailed oriented

We would be happy to get to know you and your skills better and see how we can support each other's growth.

Please apply and let's meet!

name_location: Strawberry (formerly Nordic Choice Hotels) · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 70 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Servitører for Hotel Amerikalinjen

Amerikalinjen er et urbant boutiquehotell for lokale og tilreisende som åpnet i mars 2019. En møteplass for mennesker i alle aldre og fra alle kulturer. Et varmt, eklektisk og inspirerende hus med 122 rom, en unik historie og en fantastisk beliggenhet. Det perfekte utgangspunktet for å utforske byen.

Amerikalinjen huser flere spennende mat- og drikkekonsept, alle inspirert av vår unike historie og beliggenhet. Våre serveringssteder retter seg mot det lokale markedet, med en tydelig ambisjon om å bli markedsledende i sine respektive segment.

Vi opplever en sterk vekst om dagen, og trenger flere nye kollegaer til å forsterke teamet vårt.

Er det deg vi leter etter?

Amerikalinjen har følgende avdelinger;

ATLAS: Levende, lekent og uformelt brasserie, som serverer mat inspirert av de ulike hjørnene i Europa - grunnlaget for den fantastiske og nyskapende kulinariske scenen i New York.

HAVEN: En frodig grønn oase i bakgården av hotellet. Her kan våre gjester nyte en drink så vel som en sen lørdagsdagsbrunch.

PIER 42: En klassisk Amerikansk cocktailbar med drinker som var populære på Amerikalinjebåtene. Vinner av Bartenders Choice Awards 2020 og 2021 for Best Cocktailbar in Norway.

GUSTAV: En unik jazzklubb- og eventscene med sitteplasser til 90 personer. Egen bar og kjøkken.

På Amerikalinjen legger vi vekt på å ansette ekstremt dedikerte mennesker som innehar en sterk servicekultur.

Vi ønsker at du;

Er lidenskapelig opptatt av å yte førsteklasses service og skape magiske gjesteopplevelser.

Er en sterk mønsterskaper som demonstrerer ærlighet og integritet.

Takler en hektisk hverdag, der nesten ingen dager er like.

Interessert i faget og ønsker å utvikle deg.

Være løsningsorientert, og evner å se mulighetene.

Jobbe aktiv for å nå satte målsettninger i avdelingen.

Er inkluderende og liker å spre glede og energi på arbeidsplassen.

Motiveres av teamjobbing.

Gjerne fagbrev, men ikke noe krav. Erfaring er like viktig.

Amerikalinjen kan tilby:

En unik mulighet til å ta del i utviklingen av et nytt hotellkonsept med flere mat- og drikke avdelinger.

Et profesjonelt og dynamisk arbeidsmiljø. Som stadig søker utvikling sammen.

Karrieremuligheter innen Nordic Hotels & Resorts og Nordic Choice Hotels.

Konkurransedyktige betingelser.

Personalpriser på fantastiske hotell i Skandinavia.

Stillingen rapporterer direkte til Restaurant manager på Amerikalinjen.

Søknadsfrist: Snarest (kandidater vil fortløpende innkalles til intervju).

Tiltredelse: Ved avtale

For spørsmål om stillingen, kontakt Restaurant manager Alexander Vallance

Email: alexander.vallance@amerikalinjen.com

Les mer om hotellet her: www.amerikalinjen.com

//

Waiters for Hotel Amerikalinjen

Amerikalinjen is an urban boutique hotel for locals and travelers that opened in March 2019. It's a meeting place for people of all ages and cultures. A warm, eclectic, and inspiring establishment with 122 rooms, a unique history, and a fantastic location. The perfect starting point for exploring the city.

Amerikalinjen houses several exciting food and beverage concepts, all inspired by our unique history and location. Our dining establishments target the local market with a clear ambition to become leaders in their respective segments.

We are currently experiencing strong growth and need more colleagues to strengthen our team.

Are you the one we're looking for?

Amerikalinjen has the following departments:

ATLAS: Vibrant, playful, and informal brasserie that serves food inspired by the different corners of Europe - the foundation of New York's fantastic and innovative culinary scene.

HAVEN: A lush green oasis in the hotel's backyard. Here, our guests can enjoy a drink as well as a late Saturday brunch.

PIER 42: A classic American cocktail bar with drinks that were popular on Amerikalinjen boats. Winner of the Bartenders Choice Awards 2020 and 2021 for Best Cocktail Bar in Norway.

GUSTAV: A unique jazz club and event venue with seating for 90 people. It has its own bar and kitchen.

At Amerikalinjen, we emphasize hiring extremely dedicated individuals who possess a strong service culture.

We want you to:

Be passionately committed to providing first-class service and creating magical guest experiences.

Be a strong role model who demonstrates honesty and integrity.

Handle a busy everyday life where almost no two days are the same.

Be interested in the field and eager to develop yourself.

Be solution-oriented and able to see possibilities.

Actively work to achieve set goals in the department.

Be inclusive and enjoy spreading joy and energy in the workplace.

Be motivated by teamwork.

Preferably have professional qualifications, but it's not a requirement. Experience is equally important.

Amerikalinjen can offer:

A unique opportunity to be part of the development of a new hotel concept with multiple food and beverage departments.

A professional and dynamic work environment that constantly seeks development together.

Career opportunities within Nordic Hotels & Resorts and Nordic Choice Hotels.

Competitive conditions.

Staff rates for fantastic hotels in Scandinavia.

The position reports directly to the Restaurant Manager at Amerikalinjen.

Application deadline: As soon as possible (candidates will be invited for interviews on an ongoing basis).

Start date: Upon agreement

For questions about the position, contact Restaurant Manager Alexander Vallance.

Email: alexander.vallance@amerikalinjen.com

Learn more about the hotel here: www.amerikalinjen.com

name_location: TSMG · Gjøvik, Innlandet, Norway  3 months ago  · 16 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Company Description

Terry Soot Management Group (TSMG) is a field data collection company founded in 2017 in Europe.

We collect data where automation is not possible. We count features, take pictures, make videos, record speech, and scan areas for every detail you need to make more informed decisions. Our field data collection teams are spread across Europe and North America, ready to accept new challenges.

Project objective

The goal of the project is to help collect images of streets, main points of interest and public areas in the EU countries. The project is performed on cars with 360 cameras mounted on top that image the area around the vehicle and store those images on computers inside the vehicle. Later, this data will be used to enhance one the most popular online maps in the world.

The data collectors will be given specific routes around public streets and areas, specifically targeting commercial districts and historical sites. Due to poor weather conditions some areas will be visited multiple times in order to collect the best quality of imaging. The project is expected to last at least 3 months and will cover different city/state zones.

The ideal candidate enjoys driving, knows well the area, traffic trends, is highly responsible and reliable.

The schedule expected on the project is Monday-Friday, 8 hours/day 40 hours per week. You can work more than 8 hours if you will.

Requirements

Must have a valid Driver License (driving experience, 3 yrs minimum)
Must have parking for vehicle
Enjoys driving, with flexible schedule
Available for a minimum of 3 months
Responsible & Reliable
Good driving skills
Great communication skills
High level of responsibility
General car knowledge
Tech savvy (smartphone and basic apps)
Basic computer skills
Self-motivated and detailed oriented

We would be happy to get to know you and your skills better and see how we can support each other's growth.

Please apply and let's meet!

job_title: Bouvet Agder trenger flere dyktige utviklere, arkitekter og techleads!
name_location: Bouvet ASA · Kristiansand, Agder, Norway  1 week ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Om du brenner for utvikling og vil jobbe med rause og flinke kollegaer er dette sjansen du har ventet på.

Vi jobber med noen av Norges mest fremtredende virksomheter og du kan være med å skape løsninger med stor betydning for enkeltmennesker og for samfunnet.

Hos oss får du jobbe med kunder som tør gi deg ansvar, og kollegaer som ønsker å se deg på ditt beste. Det betyr at du får stor frihet i hverdagen, at du kan være deg selv – og at du blir utfordret og satt krav til.

Hvem er du?

Vi ser etter deg med en lidenskap for å programmere. Du har minst 3 års erfaring og er sulten på ny kunnskap.

Du trives godt som fullstack utvikler eller så er du spesielt god på enten backend eller frontend.

Du har erfaring med Java eller .Net, og skyløsninger - primært Microsoft Azure.

Du kan designe gode løsninger basert på riktig teknologi i forhold til kundens behov og krav.

Kompetanseutvikling er viktig for deg, og du liker å dele dine erfaringer med andre. Vi jobber hele tiden med å utvikle oss for å kunne tilby kundene våre fremtidsrettede og robuste løsninger.

Du må kunne kommunisere og skrive godt på norsk, og du må kunne bestå en sikkerhetsklarering til nivå hemmelig..

Bouvet tilbyr deg mer enn en arbeidsplass

Faglig utvikling og mulighet til å påvirke egen hverdag

Hos oss er du ikke alene. Vi gir vi deg tett faglig oppfølging og mulighet til å delta i faglige fellesskap og -arrangementer i egen og andres regi. Vi legger gode opplæringsløp sammen med deg, og gir deg mulighet til å påvirke hva slags prosjekter du deltar i og hva slags roller du har i dem, slik at du kan utvikle deg i den retningen du vil.

Spennende kunder og viktige prosjekter

Hos oss får du oppgaver som er faglig utfordrende, i prosjekter som veldig ofte påvirker langt flere enn oppdragsgiveren. Vi hjelper kort sagt noen av Norges største private og offentlige bedrifter med å utvikle digitale løsninger som gjør hverdagen bedre.

Vi jobber sammen

Derfor har vi ikke prestasjonsbasert lønn og individuelle bonuser, men gir heller alle ansatte en fast, god lønn knyttet til stillingen sin. Vi har dessuten aksjeprogram, overskuddsdeling og gode pensjonsordninger som til sammen utgjør gode tilskudd til lønnen.

Bli med oss når vi går foran og bygger fremtidens samfunn

Ta kontakt for en uforpliktende prat for å høre mer om hva vi kan tilby eller send inn søknad via 'Søk på Stillingen'.

Etter ansettelse vil en tredje parts bakgrunnssjekk gjennomføres. Dette er en verifisering av de opplysninger som gis i rekrutteringsprosessen. Bakgrunnssjekken er tilpasset stillingens krav og gjennomføres etter søkerens samtykke.

name_location: Kelly Services Norway BroadBean · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  5 days ago  · 16 applicants
job_description:
About the job
About The Role

We are seeking a highly qualified Quality Assurance/Quality Control Specialist to join our client, a specialized offshore wind installation company that plays a crucial role in the renewable energy industry, to a temporary basis to support our offshore wind project. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring the timely and high-quality delivery of specialized tools for lifting, seafastening, and mooring operations. While expertise in these systems is not mandatory, a deep understanding of QA/QC processes, an "Engineering Quality" background, and a keen eye for detail are essential.

This is a temporary position with the possibility of an extension or a permanent offer.

Key Responsibilities

Collaborate closely with project vendors and suppliers to ensure the correct and timely production and delivery of equipment.
Monitor the production and assembly processes, identifying and mitigating potential risk areas.
Oversee the quality control processes, ensuring that products meet the specified quality standards.
Provide expert guidance on QA/QC matters, offering insights and recommendations to enhance overall quality.
Communicate effectively with project experts and stakeholders to align QA/QC efforts with project goals.
Maintain accurate records of QA/QC activities and report on progress to project management.

Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field.
In-depth QA/QC experience and knowledge, with a preference for candidates with an "Engineering Quality" background.
Strong understanding of quality control processes and methodologies.
Ability to identify and address potential issues in production and assembly.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work effectively under pressure and meet project timelines.
Fluent in English; Norwegian language skills considered a plus.

How To Apply

If you are a dedicated Quality Assurance/Quality Control Specialist with a passion for ensuring high-quality project outcomes, we invite you to apply. Please apply with your resume and a brief cover letter detailing your relevant experience and qualifications.

We are looking to fill this role promptly, so we encourage interested candidates to apply without delay.

Join us in making a significant impact on our offshore wind project by ensuring the highest standards of quality and timeliness in our equipment delivery. Your expertise will be instrumental in our project's success.

Kelly Services fungerer som rekrutteringsbyrå i forbindelse med denne stillingen. Hvis du velger å søke, vil opplysningene dine behandles i samsvar med Kellys personvernerklæring.

Vi er som oppdragsgiver opptatt av mangfold og like muligheter og oppfordrer derfor alle kvalifiserte kandidater til å søke, uavhengig av rase, kjønn, funksjonsevne, religion/tro, seksuell orientering og alder.

Kelly Services are acting as an Employment Business in relation to this role. Should you choose to apply, your information will be processed in accordance with Kelly's Privacy Statement.

As an Equal Opportunities employer, we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

name_location: Strawberry (formerly Nordic Choice Hotels) · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Det er en grunn til at det er akkurat du som ønsker å jobbe i Strawberry. Du ser muligheter på våre 100 destinasjoner. Du tror du vil passe inn i vårt mangfold blant 18.000 ansatte. Du er spent på våre fantastiske hotellkjeder og du har energi, mot og begeistring så det holder. Vil du vite mer om oss? Vi gleder oss til å høre fra deg! Quality Hotel™ er en del av Strawberry.

Rockestjerne søkes til housekeeping

Quality Hotel Entry™ søker en rockestjerne til avdelingen housekeeping.

Hele hotellet blir din scene og du sørger for at vasking av tildelte hotellrom, baderom, fellesarealer, lagerrom, korridorer eller andre tildelte områder rocker fett.

Arbeidsoppgaver inneholder blant annet:

 Rengjøring av hotellrom og fellesområder
 Ta vare på våre gjester og bidra til at de får et hyggelig opphold hos oss
 God kommunikasjon med Front Desk avdelingen
 Arbeidsmengde og tider vil variere.

Kjernetid er 08:00-16:00 men arbeid utenfor disse tidspunkter vil forekomme så det er viktig at du er fleksibel.

Vi søker følgende kvaliteter hos deg:

 Du tar ansvar
 Du kan levere gode resultater selvstendig, og i et team
 Du er grundig, effektiv, serviceinnstilt og detaljorientert- Nøyaktighet
 Serviceinnstilling
 Du gjør ting nøye og kvalitet er viktig for deg- Ser detaljer som ingen annen ser
 Kjekt om du har tidligere erfaring fra hotellrengjøring eller annen rengjøringserfaring, men dette er ikke et krav
 At du er en lagspiller som liker å ha det gøy på jobben
 Har en interiør-designer i deg, med øye for stil

Er dette noe for deg? Vil du danse med oss?

Send oss din søknad nå.

name_location: Kongsberg Discovery · Horten, Vestfold og Telemark, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
About the job
En spennende mulighet har dukket opp hos oss i Kongsberg Maritime som Test Technician. Som Test Technician vil du arbeide med å kvalitetssikre våre høyteknologiske hydroakustiske undervannsensorer som opererer i krevende omgivelser på store dybder hvor de blant annet overvåker fysiske og biologiske egenskaper under vann.

Du vil være en del av et engasjert, teknisk kompetent og kvalitetsbevist team. Hovedoppgaven vil være å utføre tester i henhold til gjeldende prosedyrer og sikre at produkter oppfyller nødvendige kvalitetsstandarder samt å rapportere og følge opp eventuelle avvik som avdekkes. For dette arbeidet er vi på jakt etter deg som er lærevillig, strukturert, og har høyt fokus på kvalitet og HMS. Trives du også å arbeide selvstendig med dine arbeidsoppgaver – så tar vi gjerne imot din søknad. Velkommen som søker hos oss!

Viktige ansvarsområder

Test og analyse av testresultater, feilsøking, og verifisering av undervannssensorer
Samarbeide med Utviklingsavdelingen i utviklingsprosessen av neste generasjons sensorer
Bidra til kontinuerlig forbedring
Kommunikasjon med interessenter

Kvalifikasjoner og erfaring

Teknisk fagskole eller relevant fagbrev (produksjonselektronikker, IT, elektronikk eller lignende). Relevant arbeidserfaring eller personlige egenskaper kan kompensere for manglende formell kompetanse
Erfaring fra produksjon eller testing / kvalitetskontroll
Gode kommunikasjonsevner på norsk og engelsk

Denne ansettelsen kan kreve sikkerhetsklarering fra Nasjonal sikkerhetsmyndighet eller bakgrunnssjekk. For mer informasjon besøk www.nsm.no.

Du er i stand til å

handle på eget initiativ, få ting til å skje og ta ansvar for resultatene
bruke en metodisk og systematisk tilnærming, planlegge fremover og definere klare prioriteringer i samarbeid med teamleder
analysere komplekse problemstillinger og problemer og komme opp med rasjonelle vurderinger
kommunisere på en klar, presis og strukturert måte
samarbeide godt med andre, dele kunnskap, erfaring, informasjon og støtte andre i jakten på teamets mål

Hva vi kan tilby

Vi tilbyr konkurransedyktig lønn og fordelspakker med gode utviklingsmuligheter i et internasjonalt miljø. Vi har gode ferieordninger i tillegg til en god pensjons- og forsikringsordning. Hos oss vil du få grundig opplæring og kursing. Du vil være omgitt av mange engasjerte kollegaer med ulik kompetanse du kan støtte deg på og lære sammen med. Du får mulighet til å jobbe med ledende og moderne produkter i et internasjonalt konsern med mange interne utviklingsmuligheter.

Arbeidstid

Dagtidt/2-skift ved behov

Arbeidssted

Horten, Strandpromenaden 50

Kontaktperson

Tim Benjamin Davidsen, Team Manager, TDM Mapping, +47 97 61 85 16

Kongsberg Discovery er ansvarlig for produkt- og teknologiutvikling, forsyningskjedeoperasjoner og prosjektleveranse for KONGSBERGs undervanns- og marine overflate-sensorer, hydroakustisk posisjonering, sonar- og kartleggingssystemer, robotfartøy og kommunikasjonssystemer. Gjennom sin omfattende portefølje av tilbud fortsetter Kongsberg Discovery å bli anerkjent som en verdensleder i sine kjerneområder over hele verden. Vi har en sterk historie med å levere produkter og tjenester i verdensklasse til kunder over hele kloden. Det er et solid fokus på å utvikle avanserte teknologiske og autonome systemer som optimaliserer operasjoner til sjøs- samtidig som de reduserer miljøpåvirkningen – våre løsninger er avgjørende for å transformere den maritime sektoren mot en mer bærekraftig fremtid.

KONGSBERG er en ledende global teknologigruppe. Gjennom vår stolte tohundreårs historie har vi kontinuerlig utvikles oss ved å anvende innovative løsninger for behovene til våre kunder, partnere og samfunnet som helhet. Vi tror mangfold er vår styrke. Ved å fremme en inkluderende og mangfoldig kultur, næres og sikres plass for ulike perspektiver og ideer. Vi arbeider målrettet med å modne og forbedre vår evne til å utnytte mangfoldet vårt og vår kultur med forskjeller for å skape forretningsresultater.

Protechting people and planet

_____

An exciting opportunity has arisen with us at Kongsberg Maritime as a Test Technician. As a Test Technician, you will work on ensuring the quality of our high-tech hydroacoustic underwater sensors, which operate in demanding environments at great depths, monitoring physical and biological properties underwater, among other functions.

You will be part of a dedicated, technically competent, and quality-conscious team. Your main responsibilities will include conducting tests according to current procedures, ensuring that products meet the necessary quality standards, and reporting and following up on any discrepancies that may arise. For this role, we are looking for someone who is eager to learn, organized, and has a strong focus on quality and safety. If you also enjoy working independently on your tasks, we welcome your application. Welcome as an applicant with us!

Key Accountabilities

Testing and analysis of test results, troubleshooting, and verification of underwater sensors
Collaboration with the Development Department in the development process of next-generation sensors
Contribution to continuous improvement
Communication with stakeholders

Qualifications And Experience

Technical college or relevant vocational certificate (production electronics, IT, electronics, or similar). Relevant work experience or personal qualities may compensate for formal qualifications.
Experience in production or testing/quality control
Good communication skills in Norwegian and English

This employment may require security clearance by the Norwegian National Security Authority, clearance through Civil Aviation Authority or a background check.

You are able to

act on own initiative, make things happen and accept responsibility for the results
use a methodical and systematic approach, plan ahead, define clear priorities and allocate resources effectively
analyse complex issues and problems and come up with rational judgments
communicate in a clear, precise and structured way
co-operate well with others, share knowledge, experience, information and support others in the pursuit of team goals

What We Can Offer

We offer competitive salary and benefit packages with excellent development opportunities in an international environment. We have good vacation schemes in addition to a solid pension and insurance plan. You will receive thorough training and courses with us. You will be surrounded by many dedicated colleagues with diverse expertise that you can rely, and learn from. You will have the opportunity to work with leading and modern products in an international corporation with many internal development possibilities.

Work Hours

Daytime/2 shifts as needed

Work location

Strandpromenaden, Horten

Point of contact

Tim Benjamin Davidsen, Team Manager, TDM Mapping, +47 97 61 85 16

Kongsberg Discovery is responsible for product and technology development, supply chain operations, and project delivery for KONGSBERG's subsea and marine surface sensors, hydroacoustic positioning, sonar & mapping systems, robotic vessels, and communications systems. Through its comprehensive portfolio of offerings, Kongsberg Discovery continues to be recognized as a world leader in its core markets all over the world. We have a strong history and track record of delivering world-class products and services to customers across the globe. There is a firm focus on developing advanced technological and autonomous systems that optimize operations at sea – while simultaneously reducing the environmental impact – our solutions are key in transforming the maritime sector for a more sustainable future.

KONGSBERG is a leading global technology group. Throughout our proud two hundred year history, we have continuously advanced, applying innovative solutions to the needs of our customers, partners and society at large. We believe diversity is our strength. By fostering an inclusive and diverse culture we nurture and ensure space for different perspectives and ideas. We work determined to mature and improve our ability to utilize our diversity and culture of differences to create positive business results.

Protechting people and planet

name_location: TSMG · Sylling, Viken, Norway  5 months ago  · 11 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Company Description

Terry Soot Management Group (TSMG) is a field data collection company founded in 2017 in Europe.

We collect data where automation is not possible. We count features, take pictures, make videos, record speech, and scan areas for every detail you need to make more informed decisions. Our field data collection teams are spread across Europe and North America, ready to accept new challenges.

Project objective

The goal of the project is to help collect images of streets, main points of interest and public areas in the EU countries. The project is performed on cars with 360 cameras mounted on top that image the area around the vehicle and store those images on computers inside the vehicle. Later, this data will be used to enhance one the most popular online maps in the world.

The data collectors will be given specific routes around public streets and areas, specifically targeting commercial districts and historical sites. Due to poor weather conditions some areas will be visited multiple times in order to collect the best quality of imaging. The project is expected to last at least 3 months and will cover different city/state zones.

The ideal candidate enjoys driving, knows well the area, traffic trends, is highly responsible and reliable.

The schedule expected on the project is Monday-Friday, 8 hours/day 40 hours per week. You can work more than 8 hours if you will.

Requirements

Must have a valid Driver License (driving experience, 3 yrs minimum)
Must have parking for vehicle
Enjoys driving, with flexible schedule
Available for a minimum of 3 months
Responsible & Reliable
Good driving skills
Great communication skills
High level of responsibility
General car knowledge
Tech savvy (smartphone and basic apps)
Basic computer skills
Self-motivated and detailed oriented

We would be happy to get to know you and your skills better and see how we can support each other's growth.

Please apply and let's meet!

name_location: Q-Free ASA · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  4 days ago  · 11 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Q-Free ASA (OSE: QFR) is a global innovator in intelligent transportation systems that improve traffic flow, road safety, and air quality. With an open, collaborative approach to tolling, traffic and active transportation management, Q-Free works with customers and partners on every continent to digitize infrastructure and overcome modern mobility challenges for the greater good of society. Headquartered in Trondheim, Norway, Q-Free has annual revenues of approximately 1 billion NOK (120 million USD) and employs 400 transportation innovators, experts and enthusiasts. To learn more about how Q-Free is changing the movements of life, visit www.q-free.com.

Would you like to be a summer intern in Q-Free in 2024?

We are currently looking for curious and engaged students to join Q-Free as summer interns at our headquarters in Trondheim in 2024. Maybe this could be the perfect opportunity for you?

By joining Q-Free, you join a company that contributes to making traffic and mobility more sustainable by offering technology that increases traffic flow, reduces emissions, and enhances traffic safety.

Q-Free is increasing our efforts to bring interns into the company, as this represents a sustainable long-term strategy for recruitment. In addition to offering summer internships, we have students working part-time with us alongside their studies, as well as students writing their bachelor and master thesis with us. This gives great benefits both for Q-Free and for our interns.

 We have available summer internships in our Products R&D department in Trondheim:

Our Products R&D department develops products for use in intelligent transport systems, with a focus on systems for tolling. The product portfolio includes onboard equipment (like tolling tags) and roadside equipment (like DSRC transceivers and advanced cameras). The department works with the entire development process from ideas to customer-ready products. This means that we work with electronics on all levels, from the development

Q-Free also works on research and development of next-generation tolling systems, i.e. solutions for Road User Charging where traditional tolling technology is combined with IoT and positioning systems to enable a reliable, secure, and fair system for charging drivers for using the roads.

Some of the work we do in our Products R&D department:


Electronics design and prototyping
Testing and characterization of electronics in the lab, e. power use, RF-testing and application-level testing
Firmware development MCU applications on all levels from «bare metal» to RTOS solutions
Developing automated test-suits for product verification based on Python
Software development: Creating user interfaces and control systems for Q-Free solutions
Develop hardware and software for advanced image processing


We are looking for candidates with an interest on one or more of the following fields:


Electronics schematics design, layout, and simulation
Radio technology and signal processing
Embedded programming, using tools like Linux, Docker, C/C++, Python and CI/CD
Prototype development and testing, using e. Arduino, Raspberry PI, and lab test equipment
Development of solutions from idea to fully characterized product
Statistics, mathematics, trial planning
Cybersecurity


In addition, you can identify with the following traits: 


You are curious and want to challenge yourself
You are a team player with good communication skills


What Q-Free can offer you:


Development and growth, and the opportunity to learn from world-class experts within our domain
A friendly and inclusive work environment based on collaboration, trust, and respect
A meaningful purpose where you can contribute to Q-Free’s mission of making mobility more environmentally friendly
A high degree of autonomy and flexibility
Competitive compensation


Practical information:

The internship period will be from June 10h until August 9th, with two weeks’ vacation in week 29 and 30. The workplace is our headquarters in Trondheim.

Q-Free is part of a collaborative project in Trondheim called Workation. Workation offers a unique summer program, and all summer interns who join Q-Free in 2024 will have full and free access to these activities. Last summer, our summer interns were free to join activities such as Escape Room, beer tasting, climbing, and more. Workation also offers a great arena to meet summer interns working for other companies and make new friends. This project will make sure that your summer internship in Trondheim will be one to remember.

Please forward your CV, application, and transcript of records. We ask to you outline your academic field and interest in the application. Feel free to also add your GitHub-user if you think this is relevant. Applications can be submitted in either Norwegian or English.

Working for Q-Free

Our highly skilled global workforce is the reason behind our high level of innovation and leading position within ITS technology. We are proud to have some of the world’s leading experts within ITS in our organization. Our values are EPIC – Excellence, Passion, Innovation, Collaboration, and these are traits we treasure and seek to enhance in all our employees.

For more information or an informal discussion, feel free to contact Erlend Espeland (erlend.espeland@q-free.com)

name_location: Endelig-Mandag IT-rekruttering · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  1 week ago  · 60 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We make reuse easy 

Loopfront has Norway's largest circular platform for building materials and fixtures. We aim to reduce global material waste and stop the extraction of new natural resources. 

As much as 40% of all waste, CO2 emissions, and use of energy and water resources in Norway and Europe comes from the construction industry. 

Construction waste is one of the biggest pollution sources in Europe, and we want to do something about it. The industry itself experiences many challenges associated with the reuse of building materials, including technical, legal and financial. 

Loopfront is an interaction platform that removes these barriers and makes reuse easy. The platform takes care of reuse from A to Z, and helps organizations map, interact, document and report all available materials for recycling, reuse and sale. 

If you have an overview, you have control - and this is exactly what we offer our customers. As a key member of our development team, you will work to help our customers achieve this. 

Who are you? 

 You have extensive experience with Typescript and React 
 You have experience with Tailwind CSS
You enjoy solving problems
You are innovative, "hands-on" and driven by progress You thrive in interdisciplinary teams
You are one who sees potential and opportunities where others see challenges
You communicate well in English (knowing Norwegian is a plus, but not required) 

It is also beneficial if you know and potentially have experience with any of the following:

 Typescript and React
Tailwind CSS
Testing using tools like Cypress and Jest
GraphQL
Amazon Web Services
Docker and container-based architecture
Figma
.Net 7

We have also chosen to create our own Design System, so further development and maintenance of this will be important. 

For more information about the position contact:

Martin Kirknes - Email: Martin@endelig-mandag.no - Phone: +47 91814853

name_location: Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace - Space & Surveillance - Horten · Horten, Vestfold og Telemark, Norway  1 week ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Divisjon Space & Surveillance er en divisjon i Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace AS. Den leverer et bredt spekter av systemer og elektronikk til satellitter, bæreraketter og romfartøyer, samt bakkestasjoner og tjenester knyttet til satellittdata. Divisjonen har 500 ansatte og er Skandinavias største innen romfartssegmentet.

Som en del av Divisjon Space & Surveillance utvikler og produserer vi elektronikk til satellitter. Vi holder til i vakre og flotte Horten i Vestfold. Vi er ca. 150 stolte, entusiastiske og flinke medarbeidere, og vi ønsker oss flere med på laget. Våre kunder er de store satellittbyggerne, og vår elektronikk leverer kritisk infrastruktur som navigasjonssignaler, søk- og redningstjenester, klima og jordobservasjon, overvåkning av kyst og sjø og ikke minst datakommunikasjon.

Har du lyst til å jobbe med utlegg av kretskort for romfart?

Vi har behov for å øke kapasiteten med en ny kretskortutlegger i Product Definition gruppa. Her vil du få muligheten til å utforme kretskort som skal ut i verdensrommet.

Dine Oppgaver

Gjøre grovutlegg og ruting i henhold til egne krav for romfart
Jobbe sammen med mekaniske- og skjema-designere for å realisere kretskortene.
Avholde design review med dine kollegaer for å sikre kvalitet på produktet
Være med på å vidreutvikle våre designløsninger, både med tanke på software og rutiner.

Hva Vi Ser Etter

Det er flott om du er målrettet og selvdreven. Du burde være glad i puslespill og problemløsning. Du har gjerne en bachelor innenfor elektronikk eller tilsvarende. Du må kunne flytende norsk og engelsk, skriftlig og muntlig. Av personlige egenskaper så ser vi etter deg som er nysgjerrig, lærevillig, er utholdende og har gode samarbeidsegenskaper. Vi oppfordrer både Seniorer og nyutdannede til å søke.

Vi Tilbyr

Hos oss vil du få konkurransedyktige betingelser, pensjonssparing og forsikringer i tillegg har vi fleksibel arbeidstid. Gjennom velferdsordninger har vi mulighet for å leie hytter og får rabatter til populære attraksjoner. Vi har en veldig god fadderordning hvor du vil få både en faglig og sosial kontaktperson.

Kandidater som søker på stillingen vil i forbindelse med rekrutteringsprosessen bli gjenstand for bakgrunnssjekk, og vurderingen av denne vil bli lagt til grunn ved valg av kandidat. For å være aktuell til stillingen, så må du kunne sikkerhetsklareres og autoriseres, jfr. sikkerhetsloven.

job_title: Store Associate (m/f/d) for a new opening in Oslo (11.2023)
name_location: PAPER & TEA · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  4 months ago  · 105 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Who we're looking for?

Paper & Tea ist more than just a brand - we create meeting points where people can exchange ideas and discover the beauty of life with all their senses together. With the highest standards of quality, aesthetics, and the mission to enrich life itself, we want to create an extraordinary feel-good experience for our customers.

Are you as passionate about tea as we are and always on the lookout to learn new things? Then you will certainly bring a smile to our customers' faces with high-quality teas and accessories. We are looking for you and your open personality, someone who enjoys approaching people and engaging in exciting conversations. Your P & T store should be an inviting place that sparks enthusiasm and inspiration. The creation of this familiar atmosphere lies in the hands of the entire team.

Do you want to be part of a creative, open, and motivated team and shape the future of our exciting brand through exceptional customer service? Then apply to join our retail team as a Store Associate!

Your mission

You are the host: with your open and warm-hearted nature, you enchant our customers; you let them immerse themselves in the lifestyle world of P & T and ensure that they feel at home.
You advise on individual preferences and sell high-quality teas, accessories, paper products, and more from P & T.
You conduct tea tastings and tea events in the store with joy and are the face of the location.
Networking comes easily to you, and you recognize the value of an engaged community.
You gladly share your knowledge about our products with your colleagues.
You participate in tea training and further education to become a professional in the P & T store.

Your profile

You have professional experience in retail, gastronomy, or the lifestyle sector.
You are a true sales talent and always know what your customers need.
Your empathetic, consistently positive, and team-oriented character sets you apart. Additionally, you possess excellent communication skills.
Attention to detail and a high standard of service characterize you.
You can identify with the aesthetics and quality standards of Paper & Tea.
You enjoy learning new things and sharing your knowledge – you continuously expand your expertise through regular training sessions.
Weekend work suits your flexible lifestyle, and you still prefer to have 1-2 Saturdays off each month.
You speak fluent English, Norwegian is a plus.
You can support us 20/32/38 h or up to 40h per week. 

That sounds just like you? Then send us your resume along with your cover letter. We are excited to get to know you.

Why us?

We believe there are many good reasons to work with us:

Our corporate culture is based on co-creation, individual proactive action, as well as collective support and appreciation.
Working time is living time that we share together - we collaborate in a friendly manner, exchange ideas, and celebrate our joint successes.
We operate with flat hierarchies, transparency, trust, and a culture of mutual respect, as working together on an equal footing is essential for us.
We are a diverse, open-minded team in a dynamic lifestyle company that aims to set new standards: Our brand cannot be categorized.
Employee discount on our products, travel allowance, contribution to retirement fund, corporate benefits program.

About Us

Paper & Tea stands for inspiration, creativity, and enjoyment. We want to enrich everyday life with high-quality products that inspire quality and unique design. Celebrate the little things, create wonderful moments, and consume consciously: whether with a cup of soothing tea or a timelessly beautiful notebook. The world of Paper & Tea invites you to enjoy. With 16 stores in currently three countries (Germany, Austria, Switzerland), an international online store, and a team of over 220 employees, we carry our mission of enriching life to the outside world.

job_title: Product Manager Bootcamp and Project Work (remote -part-time)
name_location: Moyyn · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
If you are a student, graduate or career change aspirant, and you are missing out on the skills to work in your dream job, this bootcamp is for you. Get trained and work on hands-on projects in our bootcamp to upskill yourself!

Program: 4 weeks training certification, and project work at our German AI startup – Moyyn

What you will get from this program?

– Four weeks hands-on training and projects – in a German AI startup

– Learn and work – directly with founders and potential clients from Germany

– Do practical group Project work and build up experience in product management

Modules

Hands-on training and projects:

Get trained directly from the Chief Product Officer of Moyyn and get hands-on training and projects

– Build your own MVP – including Lean Product Canva

– Create a product requirement document

– Customer feedback analysis and interviews

– Conduct market landscape research

– Create data-driven feedback processes

Product Management Training

8 hours training by experienced product managers incl. guest speakers from Europe

– Fundamentals of Product Management

– Lean startup methodology

– Pivoting principle

– Minimum Viable Product

– Market research methodology

– Ideal Customer Profile

– Product-market fit

– SCRUM methodology

– Product Management Tools

Career Guidance

Get guidance on how to land a job in Germany

– Career sessions

– Job search platforms intro

– CV preparation

– Cover letter preparation

– Interview tips

Benefits Of Attending Our Program

– Comprehensive Skill Development: The program will equip you with the essential skills and knowledge required to excel in a career as a product manager. You will learn about product strategy, market analysis, user research, product development, and cross-cultural communication, among other relevant topics. This comprehensive skill development can enhance your effectiveness in managing products in a global context.

– Cross-Cultural Communication: Global product managers need to effectively communicate and collaborate with stakeholders from different cultures and backgrounds. The program can enhance your cross-cultural communication skills, enabling you to navigate cultural nuances, build strong relationships, and overcome language and communication barriers in a global product management role.

– Industry Best Practices: The program will provide insights into industry best practices and the latest trends in global product management. You will learn from experienced founders who can share real-world examples, case studies, and practical strategies that can enhance your decision-making and problem-solving abilities.

– Networking Opportunities: We offer a valuable networking platform, allowing you to connect with other aspiring or experienced global product managers. You can exchange ideas, share experiences, and build a professional network that may open doors to future collaborations, job opportunities, or mentorship.

– Career Advancement: By attending the program, you can expand your skill set and knowledge base, making yourself a more valuable asset in the job market. The program can enhance your career prospects by demonstrating your commitment to professional development and your ability to adapt to the demands of a global product management role.

– Practical Application: The program includes interactive exercises, group discussions, and case studies that provide hands-on training and projects in applying global product management principles. This practical application can deepen your understanding and enable you to translate theoretical concepts into actionable strategies in real-world scenarios.

– Potential Job Opportunities: This often serve as a pathway to future job opportunities within the same organization or industry. Companies frequently hire interns who have demonstrated their skills, passion, and fit within the organization, making it a potential stepping stone to secure full-time employment in Product Management roles.

– Resume Building: Completing the program in Product Management adds significant value to your resume. It demonstrates practical experience in a specific area of product development and showcases your commitment to professional development. This experience can make you stand out to potential employers when seeking full-time employment in Product Management roles.

A Bootcamp is an intensive training program where you will learn skills, tools, and technologies to tackle the needs of a job market. In addition to theoretical knowledge, you will mainly take part in working on hands-on projects which are from real startups which provide you with experience. Bootcamp is a skill certification program.

name_location: Funcom ZPX  · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  5 days ago  · 4 applicants
job_description:
About the job
From critically acclaimed The Longest Journey to the very first sci-fi MMO Anarchy Online, to the brutal trials of Conan Exiles, our 30-year history has set our players uniquely up for a journey to the harsh world of Dune, where the continual battle for survival and spice will bring a challenge that is Legendary.

If you’re entering your final BA semester within a game dev-related program and want to step into the exciting world making games, then joining our Oslo studio might be the right choice for you.

You will not only get the chance to work with seasoned experts and mentors, but also have a real impact on games like Conan: Exiles, or on our ambitious upcoming Open World Survival MMO, Dune: Awakening.

Time, place, and extra information

Your internship will span from January to May 2024 (exact timing to be determined by your university), and will take place in our Oslo studio, located on Kirkegata 15, 0153. Unfortunately, we cannot provide accommodation.

About Us

We’re the oldest and biggest game developer in Norway, with 30 years of experience and more than 25 titles published, such as Metal: Hellsinger, Conan Exiles, or Secret World Legends, just to name a few.

Now, more than 470 people from about 36 different nationalities work and play at Funcom across our five studios located in Oslo, Lisbon, North Carolina, Stockholm, and Bucharest.

Could you please include a link to your portfolio in your application?

Your job would be to use creativity and technical skills to translate ideas and concepts into in game setups, well-optimized for real-time rendering and enhance the overall player experience. No prior experience is required, but demonstrable skill is a must. You should provide a portfolio showcasing your latest works and demonstrating a passion for growing and learning within the industry!

We Are Looking For Someone With The Following
Overall basic understanding of the game asset pipeline process.
General understanding and experience with the Unreal Engine.
Basic understanding of materials, lighting & rendering.
Interest in realistic game styles & aesthetics.
A strong desire to learn and is open to feedback and mentoring.
Nice to have
 A degree or diploma in 3D art, computer graphics, animation, or a related field is often preferred.
Familiarity with Unreal Engine
Basic experience with Substance Suite, Blender, Photoshop, Houdini or similar tools
Enjoys playing survival genre games.
We offer Interns can learn how to work closely with game designers, art directors, and other technical team members to create visually appealing and immersive game environments, props, and other assets using 3D modeling, texturing, and rendering techniques in real-world scenarios, gaining a deeper understanding of their field of study. Gain practical experience through the opportunity to work closely with the game dev team in Dune: Awakening. Guidance and mentorship from experienced Technical Artists on Unreal Engine logic and concepts. Opportunities to connect and build relationships with professionals in the field. By completing an internship, individuals can bolster their resume and demonstrate commitment, initiative, and relevant experience in the field.

We evaluate candidates on an ongoing basis and recommend candidates to apply as soon as possible!

Please apply in English.

Why Funcom?

We are a Scandinavian company and follow Scandinavian work values. For you, that means a flat structure where you can thrive, be yourself, leave a mark in the studio and become an ambassador for our company values. We focus on Agile/Scrum methodology and heavily value the importance of work-life balance in employee culture. Funcom values close-knit, collaborative individuals who crave creative ownership, a drive for constructive input, and a never-ending pursuit of evolution and quality.

The Funcom Oslo studio is a professional working environment with international work culture, with more than 100 people from over 25 different nationalities in one of the happiest countries in the world. Funcom is an international and varied environment in which people have one thing in common – their love for making and playing video games.

Located in central downtown Oslo, the studio is in a modern office building surrounded by a cozy area with many sights, restaurants, and cafés.

We have a diverse, dynamic, inclusive , challenging, and engaging culture, with a basis of continued training and career development opportunities, and w e encourage candidates from all walks of life to apply. Join us in a friendly environment of enthusiastic professionals  willing to go the extra mile to deliver world-class games.

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 5 applicants
job_description:
About the job
The role of a Software Engineer - Talent Science at Canonical

We are seeking a software engineer, passionate about improving the hiring process by delivering productivity initiatives using analytics and data science. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make significant contributions through high-quality code while exhibiting technical leadership, exceptional design, and intuitive project documentation.

As a Software Engineer focused on recruitment, you will be responsible for designing and maintaining a variety of web architecture, system integration and data science products. Building new hiring tools, dashboards and supporting analytics to enrich the hiring pipeline, enabling everyone at Canonical to make better decisions and deliver better work. You will work closely with the best and brightest developers within our company, ensuring that the solutions we build are well crafted, easy to use and scale to production workloads.

Location: This is a globally remote role.

What your day will look like

Write high-quality, well-designed software
Enable new processes and improve existing workflows
Collaborate proactively with a globally distributed team
Consistently provide high-quality code reviews to other engineers
Display technical leadership internally and within our external communities
Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Connect to many data sources and provide insightful visualisations
Database design and architecture for connected systems
Providing tooling to support optimised processes
Work remotely from home with global travel for 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events

What we are looking for in you

Experience writing backend programming in Python and Node.JS
Experience with Application Tracking Systems (ideally Greenhouse) or HR IT products. 
Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability

Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring

Experience with Data analytics and statistical analysis
Experience with Natural language processing, sentiment analysis, machine learning
Experience with Data visualisation
Understanding of build systems and toolchains, including system design
Experience integrating with system APIs
Strong database design and architecture experience

The ideal candidate will use their passion for experimentation and analytics to build tomorrow's tech organisation. This team will help us gain insights into the practice of recruitment and our talent pool, and use those insights to improve the experience of joining Canonical.

What we offer you

Remote first: 100% remote working with the opportunity to travel to Sprints. We meet a couple of times a year in interesting places all around the world to come together to collaborate. These Sprints see circa 300 people come together. This year we have travelled to Frankfurt, Copenhagen, Montreal and Prague!
Personal development: Annual budget allowance of 2,000 USD per annum and time to focus on areas you want to improve. 
Compensation: eligibility for annual pay review including bonuses. 
Recognition: The ability to be rewarded and recognised by others for the work you do. 
Travel: Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues. Priority Pass for lounge access when flying to sprints. International SOS membership to support you whilst travelling. 

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background creates a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.
