name_location: Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace - Space & Surveillance - Horten · Horten, Vestfold og Telemark, Norway  1 month ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
Space & Surveillance er en divisjon i Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace AS. Den leverer et bredt spekter av systemer og elektronikk til bæreraketter og romfartøyer, samt bakkestasjoner og tjenester knyttet til bearbeidelse av satellittdata til rom- og maritime overvåkingskunder i mer enn 40 land. Divisjonen har 500 ansatte og er Skandinavias største innen romsegmentet.

Vi utvikler og produserer elektronikk til satellitter. Vi holder til i vakre og flotte Horten i Vestfold. Vi er ca 150 stolte, entusiastiske og flinke medarbeidere, og vi ønsker oss flere på laget. Synes du det er spennende å jobbe med utfordrende ting? Her hos oss lager vi hardware til bruk på satellitter. Det krever at vi må lære noe nytt hele tiden. Om du liker utfordringer og i tillegg liker å lære bort, da kan vi være rette sted for deg. Om du blir begeistret og glad når du løser noe skikkelig utfordrende sammen med andre, da passer du veldig godt hos oss. Våre kunder er de store satellittbyggerne, og vår elektronikk leverer kritisk infrastruktur som navigasjonssignaler, lete og redningstjenester, klima og jordobservasjon, overvåking av kyst og sjø, værdata og ikke minst kommunikasjon som tele, data og tv signaler. På huset har vi flinke og entusiastiske ingeniører som designer og tester, og vi har space sertifiserte operatører som monterer og sammenstiller. Noe er manuelt arbeid, og mye er i automatlinjer.

Vi ønsker å utvide våre test gruppe, og trenger derfor flere kolleger med interesse for måleteknikk, test og verifikasjon av hardware.

Arbeidsoppgaver

Test av moduler og enheter
Tuning på alle nivåer
Utarbeide rapporter med testresultater

Krav til kompetanse

BSc elektronikk eller tilsvarende, eller
Radioamatør med fagbrev innen elektronikk 
Kunnskap og interesse for måleteknikk
Kunnskap om RF

Personlige egenskaper

Du må være en typisk gjennomfører
Ha gode samarbeids- og kommunikasjonsevner
Være metodisk og systematisk

Som ansatt i Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace AS får du først og fremst mange flinke kolleger. Vi har konkurransedyktig vilkår og gode forsikringsordninger. Ved oppstart får du en faglig veileder (fadder/mentor) og opplæringsprogram.

Søknader vurderes fortløpende.

Kandidater som søker på stillingen vil i forbindelse med rekrutteringsprosessen bli gjenstand for bakgrunnssjekk og vurdering av denne vil bli lagt til grunn ved valg av kandidat. For å være aktuell kandidat til stillingen må du kunne være kvalifisert for å bli sikkerhetsklarert på et senere tidspunkt i ansettelsen, jfr. Sikkerhetsloven.

Vi holder til i kystbyen Horten, midt i hjertet av Vestfold. I Horten er vi stolte av å tilby flotte omgivelser med rikt kulturliv og gode oppvekstsvilkår. Se videosnutt fra Horten https://vimeo.com/139789537

About the job
We are looking to grow our BI team in Stavanger!

Are you interested in seeking to help others become more data-driven in the most efficient way?

Experience with report development / visualisation tools / Power BI
Experience with ETL tools
Knowledge of Azure tools such as Data Factory, and various data storage types

job_description:
About the job
Bouvet Haugesund er en del av SildIkon Valley programmet som gir studentene 6 uker med nyskapning, ukentlige faglig og sosiale samlinger med sommeransatte fra andre bedrifter i Haugesundsregionen

Her får du teste ut hvordan det er å være i Bouvet, hvordan konsulentrollen fungerer i praksis. Du får være med å arbeide på innovative prosjekter og ta del i både digitaliseringen og utformingen av fremtidens løsninger. Det var stor stas i sommer da studentene våre vant 2 av 4 priser på SildIkon Valley - "Studentenes pris" og "Beste IT-løsning".

Vårt miljø innen systemutvikling har stor bredde, vi har utviklere innenfor alle moderne plattformer og programmeringsspråk. Vi driver blant annet med Java, C#, JavaScript, React, Angular, Android og iOS. Skyløsninger er stadig viktigere for oss og våre kunder. Vi tror på DevOps-kultur og jobber med å utarbeide fremtidens løsninger med bruk av AI og Machine Learning. I Bouvet tror vi at samarbeid mellom alle som jobber med systemutvikling gjør oss sterke og mer skikket til å levere de beste løsningene til våre kunder.

Med slik kompetanse ombord, får du naturligvis jobbe med spennende teknologi, og dessuten bruke og bryne den på både utfordrende og "umulige" oppgaver.

Litt om deg

Du studerer informatikk, kybernetikk eller realfag.
Du er opptatt av å utvikle deg, lære nye ting og å dele kunnskap med andre.
Du vil være med å bidra til at vi som fagmiljø er langt framme i bruken av ny teknologi og nye metoder, til det beste for kundene våre, for oss som selskap og, dessuten, for samfunnet.

Vi tilbyr

6 uker med full fokus på å løse en utfordring for en utvalgt kunde.
Ukentlige aktiviteter sammen med ca 50 andre studenter i SildIkonValley programmet
Faglig utfordring
En arbeidsplass med veldig hyggelige kollegaer 

Litt om oss

Bouvet gjør Norges største virksomheter mer konkurransedyktige med fremtidsrettet informasjonsteknologi. Våre ansattes kompetanse er det viktigste produktet vårt. Det er ferskvare. Derfor har vi også et aktivt forhold til faglig utvikling, som kommer i mange former. Vi har fagkvelder, deltakelse på konferanser, hackatons og internkonferansen BouvetOne.

Er alt dette deg, og appellerer dette miljøet til deg, er du etter all sannsynlighet vår kvinne eller mann. Vi gleder oss oppriktig til å høre fra deg! Husk å sende med karakterutskrift.

name_location: Aimo Sweden · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
I Aimo Park mener vi parkering er mer enn bare en sluttdestinasjon – parkering er en del av reisen. Vi jobber for å utvikle bransjen og ønsker å være en pålitelig og innovativ mobilitetspartner.

Sammen kan vi skape en fremtid der parkering blir en del av reiseopplevelsen – og samtidig bidra til smartere byer og mer miljøvennlig transport. Bli med i Aimo-familien, hvor bærekraft, innovasjon og menneskelige behov er våre fokusområder. Vi er også stolte av å være et sertifisert Miljøfyrtårn og jobber aktivt med å redusere vår miljøpåvirkning.

Hvem er du?

Du bør ha teknisk kompetanse og gjerne også erfaring fra elektro-/elektronikk- arbeid.

For å komme deg ut til anleggene, må du ha førerkort i klasse B (gjerne også klasse BE, men dette er ikke et krav). Vi ser det også viktig at du har erfaring fra mekanisk arbeid og med bruk av el-håndverktøy. Du er selvstendig og selvgående i det daglige arbeid, men du har også evnen til å jobbe godt i team og synes det er helt greit å både be om hjelp og å hjelpe andre. Vi liker at våre medarbeidere er proaktive og gjerne kommer med forslag til forbedringer. Det er viktig at du har en profesjonell holdning og atferd, både internt og eksternt. Det har blitt mer og mer aktuelt med kjennskap til dataverktøy, også innenfor dette fagområdet, så det er absolutt en fordel dersom du er fortrolig med ulike dataverktøy og også liker å jobbe med disse verktøyene. Vi forsøker å utføre de fleste oppgaver innenfor normal arbeidstid, men likevel vil noe overtid kunne forekomme.

Dine arbeidsoppgaver vil være

Installere og vedlikeholde teknisk utstyr
Oppsetting og avvikling av anlegg, inkl. skilting av anlegg
Bistå med teknisk kompetanse i andre byer, per tlf eller på stedet - etter behov
Aktivt benytte det it-baserte verktøy selskapet til enhver tid benytter, og følge de rutiner som er fastsatt for bruken av disse, herunder rapportere via , Outlook og myMCS og eventuelt andre verktøy
Holde god orden og ryddighet på arbeidsplassen, både ute og inne
Reparere p-teknikk i.h.h.t. oppdrag gitt av Operasjonssentralen og eventuelt overordnet personell, innen gitte tidsfrister. 
Rapportere status på mottatte oppdrag 

Aimo Park er en del av Aimo-familien, bestående av Aimo Share, Aimo Park og Aimo Charge. Aimo Park er Nordens ledende parkeringsselskap, med ca. 6700 parkeringsanlegg og 370.000 parkeringsplasser. Aimo Park er heleiet av det japanske selskapet Sumitomo Corporation. Med fokus på innovasjon og menneskers behov, jobber Sumitomo kontinuerlig med å ta frem nye mobilitetsløsninger og innovasjoner som forenkler menneskers hverdag. Aimo Park ble grunnlagt i 1959 og har i dag totalt ca. 800 medarbeidere, hvorav ca. 130 jobber i Norge.

Aimo Parks visjon er å bidra til en bærekraftig samfunnsutvikling, gjennom å tilby mobilitets- tjenester som forenkler hverdagen. Vi arbeider målrettet med å forbedre våre tjenester, med blant annet kameraløsninger for parkering, ladestasjoner, fleksible parkerings- og betalingsløsninger og ulike typer av servicetjenester for kjøretøy.

Kontaktperson:

Aina Vines, HR-ansvarlig

Tlf: 91601998

E-post: aina.vines@aimopark.no

Håndtere betalinger
Oppvask og rydding

Ryddig, punktlig, fleksibel og med godt humør

Er svært ryddig og strukturert
Du liker at det er høy fart og jobber godt under press

Felles for alle disse unike stedene er ønsket om å være nyskapende og bærekraftige i det vi gjør best: Å skape gode matopplevelser – og tilby noe nytt og givende for kundene, og lokalsamfunnet vi befinner oss i. Bli med på matreisen. Velkommen til oss!

name_location: Itera · Fredrikstad, Viken, Norway  4 months ago  · 23 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Søknadsfrist 22.10

Søknader behandles fortløpende fra 07.08

Er du nyutdannet i 2024? Kickstart karrieren din som utvikler i ett av Norges mest innovative selskaper!

 

Hos oss blir du en del av et fagmiljø bestående av 700 dyktige, lidenskapelige og engasjerte kollegaer som legger stor vekt på deling og god kultur, og som hver dag jobber for å skape verdens beste kundeopplevelser. Av disse sitter 300 i Norge, og 30 på det flotte kontoret i Fredrikstad, som du kan bli en del av!

I Itera vil du jobbe med meningsfulle, utfordrende og varierte prosjekter basert på fremtidsrettet teknologi. Vi gjennomfører oppdrag innen digitalisering for norske, nordiske og internasjonale virksomheter. Du vil jobbe kreativt i tverrfaglige team med designere, forretningsrådgivere og andre teknologer, og utvikle løsninger som bidrar til bærekraft innen sektorer som energi, industri, bank, forsikring, helse og offentlig sektor.

Deg i Itera

Vi har lang tradisjon for å ansette nyutdannede i Itera, og er opptatt av at hver enkelt skal få en fin start på sin karriere. Som «graduate» hos oss får du et skreddersydd program vi kaller «Boost», som sørger for at du kommer godt i gang både faglig og sosialt. Programmet gjennomføres i Oslo for kickoff og felles samlinger, men arbeidshverdagen din vil være ved kontoret vårt i Fredrikstad.

Boost er spesielt utviklet for deg som er ny i arbeidslivet. Gjennom Boost følger vi deg gjennom det første arbeidsåret, slik at du har gode rammer for å bli trygg i rollen din, bli kjent med hvordan det er å jobbe i kundeprosjekter, og bygge gode relasjoner med kolleger - ja, rett og slett få en «boost» på det som er starten på din karriere.

Les mer om Boost her

Hvem er du?

Vi ser etter deg som avslutter bachelor- eller masterstudier 2024, og som
kan vise til gode akademiske resultater 
er faglig nysgjerrig og engasjert 
har stor interesse for teknologi og programmering 
ønsker å utvikle deg og bidra inn i et aktivt fagmiljø 

 

Hvem er vi?

Itera er et norsk konsulentselskap. Vi ble startet allerede på 90-tallet, og har derfor med oss modenhet, struktur og masse erfaring. Samtidig er kulturen preget av entreprenørskap, kreativitet, innovasjon og store ambisjoner for fremtiden. Vi er om lag 700 teknologer, designere og forretningsrådgivere som jobber hver dag for å utgjøre en forskjell, hvorav 300 av oss er i Norge. De siste fem årene er vi kåret til ett av Norges mest innovative selskaper, uansett bransje.
Vi er store nok til å være solide, men ikke så store at du blir en i mengden 
Vi setter tverrfaglighet høyt. Hos oss vil du få kollegaer med høy kompetanse og sterk integritet som hele tiden ønsker å lære mer 
Vi investerer i din videre faglige utvikling og vekst 
Vi jobber aktivt med mangfold og inkludering og videreutvikler oss sammen med våre engasjerte ansatte 
Vi har flotte kontorlokaler i Fredrikstad, Oslo og Bergen 
Vi har selvsagt konkurransedyktige betingelser, solide forsikringer og pensjonsordninger, et attraktivt aksjeprogram for ansatte og en rettferdig bonusordning. 

Høres dette spennende ut?

Send oss en søknad, da vel! Vi behandler søknader etter 7. august. Husk å laste opp CV og karakterutskrifter.

Har du noen prosjekter på Github, har du holdt presentasjoner eller er du er stolt av noe annet du har gjort? Send oss gjerne en link!

 

Vi gleder oss til å høre fra deg!

Har du spørsmål til rollen? Kontakt gjerne Emilie Røsnæs (Senior Consultant) på 91707058 / emilie.rosnaes@itera.com eller Lise Eastgate (Head of Itera Fredrikstad) på 47812716 / lise.eastgate@itera.com

Dersom du har spørsmål til vårt Graduate-program Boost kan du kontakte Emilia Dahlqvist (HR-Advisor) på 40465795/ emilia.dahlqvist@itera.com

job_title: Summer Internship 2024 – Subsurface Data and Digital
name_location: Equinor · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  5 days ago  · 11 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Overview

 Job ID- 26628 
 Country- Norway 
 Location(s)- Stavanger, Oslo, Bergen, Trondheim 
 Company- Equinor ASA 
 Contact Name- internships@equinor.com 
 Workplace- Onshore 
 Discipline- Information Technology 
 Education Preferred- Bachelor or Master's degree 
 Experience Preferred- Less than 2 years 
 Closing Date- Nov 13 2023 

Job Description

As a summer intern at Equinor, you will join 22,000 colleagues delivering oil, gas, wind, and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. By 2050, we aim to become a net-zero company and provide the energy the world needs without contributing to global warming. It is one of the defining challenges of our time, and attracting and developing the brightest minds will be critical to our success.

The position

Our summer internship is a 6-week programme designed to provide the experience and skills you need in your studies and future career. Our Norwegian and UK internship will begin on 17 June and ends on 02 August 2024, with one week off starting 15 July.

You can find out more about the programme at www.equinor.com/careers/summer-interns

Information Technology plays a vital role in accelerating the energy transition within Equinor and shaping the future of energy. IT and digitalization is part of everything we do and a key enabler for value creation as well as secure and compliant operations. We utilize advanced technologies such as cloud computing, microservice architectures and machine learning to unlock the potential of the vast amounts of data we have. Within the subsurface domain we have several challenges going forward. We have a big focus on research and development to increase our carbon efficiency, optimize production and increase our energy efficient drainage. To succeed in these areas, we are dependent on skilled developers and IT professionals. Fields within discipline-

 Information Technology
 Cloud computing
 Software development
 Data analytics, data science and Artificial Intelligence (AI)
 Cyber security and risk management

By joining us a summer intern you will have the opportunity to-

 Work on real tasks in a real team
 Work with new technology
 Solve complex and challenging tasks
 Learn from competent team members
 Receive relevant training
 Take part in social event s

You

Some qualities are essential for Equinor. You identify with our values, open, collaborative, courageous and caring, which guide our decisions and help us succeed and grow. You make safety your priority and contribute to our zero-harm culture. For this position, we are also looking for-

 Cu rrently studying for Bachelor’s, Master’s degree, or Ph.D. with a strong academic record within S TEM (science, technology, engineering and math)
 Fluent in English and preferably a second working language
 No more than two year s of relevant full-time work experience
 Have c ompleted at least two years of higher education before the internship programme starts (1 7 June 202 4 )
 Have at least one year of higher education left after the internship programme ends (0 2 August 202 4 )
 The interns need to be located in the country where the internship takes place during its entire duration. Equinor does not support any relocation for our summer interns .
 Candidates must have the necessary work permit for the country in which they are applying for a position. The work permits must be valid at the point of application and for the duration of the employment. Please note that Equinor does not support, or sponsor work or visa permits for internship applications. Read more about it on the national authorities’ pages-
 Extracurricular activities and/or voluntary work are an advantag e

Every role and business area requires its own specific set of skills and personal attributes. Some of the qualities and characteristics we look for include-

 An awareness of risk and a commitment to safety for yourself and those around you.
 Effective communication skills and the ability to facilitate collaboration, influence stakeholders, and contribute to a diverse and inclusive culture.
 The flexibility to adapt to change, embrace new technology , and perform in a digitally enabled environment .
 Demonstrating a curious mind and the ability to problem-solve, innovate, and identify new ways of delivering against our objectives .

Equinor is an equal opportunities employer . We welcome applications from all candidates who meet the educational and experience requirements, including those with disabilities. If you have any specific requirements for any stage in our process, please make this clear in your application , and our team will be happy to support you .

General information

Please make sure that when applying, you attach the following-

 CV/ resume in English
 transcripts of records (or other documents describing subjects and grades) in English or Scandinavian language obtained to this point during your studies. If you are in the process of completing a degree, please upload an official temporary transcript.

Applications submitted without these attachments will unfortunately not be evaluated. To ensure an efficient recruitment process, please be informed that you may apply for a maximum of 3 Summer Internship roles per country.

Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process. Candidates will be asked for information on affiliation to high-risk countries for a security assessment. Furthermore, background checks are performed on all final candidates and all permanent and temporary hires will be screened against relevant sanctions lists to ensure compliance with sanctions law.

Why join us?

The summer internship is an opportunity for you to get to know Equinor, our people and culture, and the way we work. You will work on various tasks and projects that will provide value for you and Equinor. You can also expect-

Hands-on experienceYou will spend roughly 80% of your internship working on tasks and projects within the discipline you have applied for, giving you first-hand experience of your team's strategy, processes, and culture. Interns will spend the remaining 20% on learning experiences and a group project.

Learning and developmentYou will join a series of learning sessions that provide an overview of our business and introduce you to some of the processes we use at Equinor. These will include introductions to key areas of our strategy and learning opportunities covering various professional skills that will help you in your future career.

Multi-disciplinary projectYou will work on a group project with other interns from various academic backgrounds, guided and supported by an experienced employee. Over the course of this project, you will develop critical skills such as collaboration, leadership, communication, presentation, planning, and time management.

A balanced and rewarding work cultureOur interns have the same opportunities to work flexibly as the rest of our employees, allowing you to balance work with the things that matter away from the office. We also recognize that your internship is an opportunity to build lifelong relationships and networks. We encourage all our interns to take advantage of this.

For more information, visit Equinor's website www.equinor.com/careers/summer-interns

job_title: Technical Author - Ubuntu and Canonical products
name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Our ambition is to set a standard of excellence in the industry in technical documentation and documentation practice. This is your chance to be a part of that, as a Technical Author.

The role of a Technical Author

You'll be part of an engineering team, focused on a specific Canonical product area. You will lead the team effort to create, maintain and improve documentation that serves the needs of the product's users, embracing the principles of the Diátaxis documentation framework You will have a broad impact on - and responsibility for - the quality of the user experience with the product, and will contribute towards the long-term success of the project itself.

As the Technical Author on the team, you will collaborate with software developers, product managers, community members, other documentation authors, information architects, quality assurance engineers and technical support engineers to develop clear documentation for complex technical topics. You'll be part of our effort to establish documentation as a first-class engineering discipline.

You also be a part of Canonical's documentation practice team, that includes all the company's Technical Authors. Here, you'll be amongst other documentation experts, who collaborate to define documentation excellence.

Location: This is a fully remote role, open to candidates across the globe.

What you'll do on a regular basis

Create, maintain and improve software documentation
Work with engineering team members, to help them make effective documentation contributions
Influence the development of the product, as an expert user of the product, who has important opinions about its function and design
Engage with user communities to ensure that our documentation meets their needs 
Encourage and support community engagement in and contribution to documentation
Help standardise the structure, presentation, style and language of content across products
Collaborate with documentation peers to advance the state of the art in documentation at Canonical
Challenge and advance documentation understanding and best-practice, as part of a disciplinary team 

Our best candidate

Cares deeply about functional written communication
Is a technical writer with a programmer's mindset, or a programmer with a record of producing excellent documentation
Has a record of community engagement, in open-source software, documentation, research or other disciplines
Is sympathetic to the needs and challenges of open-source software and its communities
Demonstrates technical curiosity, and is fascinated by software technology and its challenges
Has demonstrable documentation skills, insight and enthusiasm
Has experience of software development contexts; is familiar with: Linux, working on the command line, application deployment, system operations, and infrastructure management, Git, documentation markup languages Has excellent written and verbal communication skills 
Holds a BSc/BA degree or equivalent 
Is able to travel twice a year for up to two weeks for events 

Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring

Deep technical domain knowledge
Open-source community leadership and management
User-experience, interaction or visual design

What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering software technology firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

job_description:
About the job
WANTED! ROBOT INTERACTION ENGINEER

We're seeking a Robot Interaction Engineer for a tech company specialising in engineering and robotics. Our client has been successfully working on human-like androids, and now they are joining forces with one of the biggest AI companies to deliver an innovative product unprecedentedly.

What we offer?

Up to 1,1 mln NOK/ year
Employment contract
Full-time
Moss, Norway (30min away from Oslo and comfortable connections)

Responsibilities

They are influencing the future by developing general-purpose androids that operate independently to perform security duties at client sites. Several tools, such as a VR teleoperation system and a web interface for fleet administration, are used to control these robots. They are now working on a consumer-grade solution for human-robot interaction to allow people to control and understand the robot's behaviour in the field.

Requirements

Must-Haves

Proficiency in Python and C++ programming.
Experience working in robotics, drones or remote-controlled vehicles.
Excellent communication and documentation skills.
Passion for developing consumer-ready human-robot interfaces.

Nice-To-Haves

Familiarity with implementing machine learning models.
Experience working with diverse programming languages, frameworks and tools.
Proficiency in front-end development with HTML, JavaScript, CSS, and Node technologies.
Expertise in embedded systems, including microcontrollers and embedded Linux boards.

name_location: 1X · Viken, Vestfold og Telemark, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 5 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Targeted start date: Immediately. 

1X designs androids built to benefit society. Since 2014, we’ve been building androids with the product design mindset of safety first, balanced performance, and smart behavior. Our mission is to build androids that work alongside people to meet the world’s labor demand and build an abundant society. Our wheeled model, EVE, is engineered to work with you, from guarding to logistics, and our bipedal model, NEO, is designed to become a general-purpose android, with a broad deployment in various applications, and, eventually, assisted living.

Founded in Moss, Norway, 1X has grown into an international team with offices around the globe. 1X envisions a bright new future: humans and androids, working and learning, Side by Side.

What You’ll Get By Joining Our Team

You can shape the future of humanoid robots
You will have the autonomy to improve all aspects of your technical skills
You’ll join an agile and diverse, global team

Responsibilities

Spearhead the design, development, and refinement of immersive VR teleoperation interfaces using the Unity engine.
Collaborate with robot operators to gather feedback, ensuring the VR system aligns with on-ground operational needs.
Continually enhance the system's UI/UX, developing intuitive menus, widgets, and interactive components tailored for immersive VR.
Proactively address and mitigate common VR challenges such as motion sickness, hand-eye coordination, and immersion breaks.

Must-Haves:

Extensive background in Unity-based development, including complex VR applications, leveraging OpenXR or similar systems, and integrating native plugins.
Innate understanding of scale, immersion, motion sickness, and hand-eye coordination; deeply committed to user-centric design.
Demonstrated experience crafting visually appealing and intuitive UIs within VR applications.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to work cohesively with diverse teams. 

Nice-To-Haves:

Extensive expertise in C/C++/Python, knowledge about computer graphics and core game engine principles.
A solid grasp of robot kinematics, frame transforms, motor controls. 
Hands-on experience working in robotics and teleoperation of robots.
Experience conducting user tests, gathering data, and performing analysis to inform design and feature decisions.
An enthusiasm for staying updated with emerging technologies and speculative trends in AR/VR.

Interview Process

Introduction Stage - Initial conversations to get to know you better

[30m] Recruiter Screen with Win Yu
[45m] Hiring Manager Screen with Ralf Mayet

Team Interview Stage - we then dive into your experience in more depth and introduce you to members of the team. This is also when you will do a take-home challenge

[60m] Technical Deep-Dive conversation with Ralf Mayet and team

Final Interview Stage - we move you to our final round

[15m] Expectation management with Ralf Mayet
[30m] Conversation with CEO Bernt Øivind Børnich

You are welcome to request additional conversations with anyone you would like to meet, but didn’t get to meet during the interview process.

Not sure if this is you?

If you’re excited about this role, but not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Location: 1XHQ, Moss

Our new headquarter in Moss, Norway, is a short train ride from Oslo. 1XHQ offers food, showers, and outdoor activities. All employees are supported with a comprehensive relocation package to handle all logistics. Join us in Moss, where performance meets great company culture.

Joining our team means becoming a valued member of one of the biggest brands in humanoid robotics, where you'll play a part in shaping the future of Androids.

Working at 1X

The ideas that express our team’s culture and how we work.

Be Nice

Collaboration is our driving force. Our team creates an open, trusting environment where everyone can be their most creative.

Stay Smart

A world-changing team needs the brightest minds in every discipline. This is where people come to work, learn, and grow to their full potential.

Make History

Everything we do gets us closer to one ambitious vision: general-purpose androids helping people around the globe. We believe what we build today will impact generations.

1X is an inclusive and equal-opportunity employer that values diversity. We consider all qualified applicants regardless of race, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected class. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don't hesitate to let us know during the interview process. We will do our best to accommodate your needs.

We're excited to have you on board!

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 16 applicants
job_description:
About the job
The role

Our Workplace Engineering team are a highly performant group which specialises in web architecture and analytics specialists. Building new tools, dashboards and analytics that empower colleagues, managers and executives to make better decisions and deliver better work.

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneer in the digital workplace, established in 2004 with a global, remote-first policy that has delivered world-class open source and sets the pace in cloud, developer and IoT technology.

We are dedicated to continually improving to keep Canonical the best at remote work. It's part of our enjoyment of our mission - both to deliver the world's best free software, and to push the boundaries of 21st-century work and collaboration.

Our goal is to improve the state of the art even further in key business processes for a distributed team: hiring, collaboration, communication, learning, documentation, development, and open source development. We want to understand our distributed teams as well as we could understand co-located teams. We want to help them work better, be happier, and make better decisions.

What you will do:

Design and deliver web-based systems and SAAS
Provide new insights into the Canonical workplace experience
Enable new processes and improve existing workflows
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high-quality code to create new features
Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
Consistently provide high-quality code reviews to other engineers
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Estimate work, set goals and meet them
Write project specifications, and epics and understand the risks
Understand completion criteria and push work to completion
Coaching, mentoring and providing feedback to more junior members of the team, while always developing yourself
Connect to many data sources and provide insightful visualisations
Database design and architecture for connected systems
Developing new and improved working practices for the company
Providing tooling to support optimised processes
Love what you do. 

Who You Are

To be successful in this team you must be an expert in two or more of the following:

Backend web service programming in Python and Node.JS
Solid understanding of web development technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. 
Data analytics and statistical analysis
Natural language processing, sentiment analysis, machine learning
Data visualisation

The ideal candidate will use their passion for experimentation and analytics to build tomorrow's tech organisation. This team will help us gain insights into the business and our talent pool, and use those insights to improve the experience of working at Canonical.

As a Senior Web Engineer at Canonical, you need an analytical, data-driven mind and a passion to connect and make sense of interesting data from APIs. We focus heavily on the collection of metrics, optimising processes, and ways of working across Canonical. You need to demonstrate leadership, excellence, and consistency and will mentor others in the team.

We offer

Remote first: 100% remote working with the opportunity to travel to Sprints. We meet a couple of times a year in interesting places all around the world to come together to collaborate. These Sprints see circa 300 people come together. This year we have travelled to Frankfurt, Copenhagen, Montreal and Prague!
Personal development: Annual budget allowance and time to focus on areas you want to improve. 
Compensation: eligibility for annual pay review including bonuses. 
Recognition: The ability to possibly be rewarded and recognised by others for the work you do. 
Travel: Priority Pass for lounge access when flying to sprints. International SOS membership to support you whilst travelling. 

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

About the job
Job Title: DevOps Architect, Nordic Remote

Location: Nordics

Are you passionate about cloud computing and automation? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment? We are looking for an AWS DevOps Architect to join a growing software team spread across the Nordics.

We are a medium sized firm using IoT and ML technology to improve efficiency in how office space is used across the world.

Responsibilities
 Design, deploy, and manage AWS-based infrastructure, ensuring scalability, high availability, and cost-effectiveness.
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to architect and implement reliable, automated CI/CD pipelines.
 Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and optimise system performance to meet or exceed service level objectives.
 Implement security best practices to safeguard AWS resources and data.
 Participate in code reviews and assist developers in deploying applications to AWS.
 Create and maintain documentation, including infrastructure diagrams, configuration procedures, and disaster recovery plans.
Qualifications
 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
 Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer with a focus on AWS technologies.
 Strong expertise in Amazon Web Services (AWS) services such as EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, CloudFormation, etc.
 Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell for automation tasks.
 Hands-on experience with infrastructure-as-code (IAC) tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.
 Familiarity with CI/CD tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or AWS CodePipeline.
 Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes for container orchestration.
 Strong understanding of networking concepts and security best practices within AWS.
 AWS certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, AWS Certified Solutions Architect) would be a plus.
Personal Attributes
 Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues.
 Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively within a team.
 Proactive and self-motivated, with a passion for learning and keeping up with the latest trends in cloud computing and DevOps practices.
 Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.

d.johnston1@jeffersonfrank.com

About the job
We are seeking a software engineer passionate about software quality, Ubuntu, and the open source community, to join the Ubuntu Quality Engineering team as we expand the set of open source packages we fully support and secure.

We see quality engineering as a first class engineering practice and are looking for people who can bring deep engineering insights to automation, testing capabilities, reporting and data analytics, as well as run processes in partnership with Canonical and community teams.

Ubuntu strives to deliver the latest-best free software components, in an easy to use and highly reliable form. We build on the technical excellence of Debian and bring additional focus and shape to the solutions we offer the industry.

As an Ubuntu Quality Engineer, you must be passionate about the future of Ubuntu, about quality and continuous integration and testing. You will work closely with multiple teams at the heart of Ubuntu and drive quality excellence. You will work closely with the Ubuntu Desktop, Server and Foundations team and put in place metrics for quality. You will research existing issues, troubleshoot and resolve problems, and identify opportunities for improvement and communicate them to the rest of the organization to drive the overall quality of Ubuntu. This is a great opportunity to start and progress your career in the QA domain.

Location: This is a Globally remote role

Monitor indicators of quality across the Ubuntu ecosystem and products
Troubleshoot and resolve issues in Ubuntu Desktop, Ubuntu Server and Ubuntu Core
Enhance our continuous integration to guard Ubuntu image, release and package quality
Report on KPIs and analytical insights
Empower other teams for better planning and constant quality improvements

A strong software engineering, Linux, and open source background
In-depth knowledge of Python and Shell scripting
Experience with C/C++
Excellent troubleshooting skills and experience working with others to identify, isolate and resolve issues
Experience with quality processes and continuous integration tools

job_description:
About the job
Our Restaurant Team Members are responsible for ensuring each customer enjoys an amazing experience. It starts with hot, freshly-prepared products, always using the highest quality ingredients, and it includes making sure our restaurants are always clean and family-friendly. You’ll work closely with the Restaurant Manager and other Team Members in a creative, supportive, fun, fast-paced environment, rich with teamwork and positivity.

What's In It For You

 Competitive Weekly Pay ($13 - $15 / hr DOE) 
 Schedule Flexibility: Day/Evening/Overnight Shifts (subject to city, county, and state requirements) 
 Discounted Meals 
 Opportunities for Career Development and Growth 
 Whataburger Family Foundation and Scholarship Program 
 Medical Benefits* 
 Whatagames (Ask us about this!) 
Team members who average at least 30 hours per week (or 130 hours of service per month) over a 12-month measurement period are eligible for these benefits. 

Our people make the difference at Whataburger. We take pride in our work, take care of each other and love serving our customers. Each and every day you’ll be learning skills that will serve you well no matter where your career journey leads you.

Work Locations

5775 BASELINE RD

Qualifications

 At least 16 years old 
 Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment 
 High school diploma/GED, equivalent work experience, or is attending high school, or educational equivalent, e.g., home school or primary vocational programs 

Requirements

 Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs. 
 Must be able to stand during entire shift 
 Must be able to reach, bend, stoop, lift, shake, stir, pour, carry, and push. 
 Must be able to read (orders on tickets, menu board, receipts, etc.) 
 Frequent contact/immersion of hands in water, cleaning and sanitation solutions, meat products, poultry products, seafood, and produce items 
 Frequent washing of hands 

 This Job Posting does not contain an exhaustive list of all roles, activities, requirements, efforts, or working conditions associated with the position. This description is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current position. Whataburger reserves the right to revise the position or to require that other or different activities be performed when circumstances change (e.g., emergencies, changes in personnel or workload, rush jobs, technological developments or other operational need). 

Whataburger is more than a burger chain. It’s a place that feels like home to more than 43,000 employees who we call Family Members and millions of customers. We take PRIDE in our work. We CARE for each other. And absolutely LOVE serving our customers.

Our opportunities are limitless if you bring the drive and a hunger for more. We’ll give you the tools and resources you need to reach your full potential. Your career at Whataburger will be what you make of it.

name_location: Cobblestone Energy · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 37 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Employment Type: Full-time & Permanent

Location: Dubai, UAE (Visa sponsorship & relocation assistance provided)

Salary: Competitive, DOE + performance-based bonus - 0% tax environment + Equity participation.

About Cobblestone Energy

Cobblestone Energy is an energy trading company, specializing in the Great Britain and European wholesale electricity markets. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading. Our advanced data analytics and extensive research drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country, and growing every day. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.

At Cobblestone Energy, we value diversity and believe in hiring extraordinary talent from around the world. Our flat organizational structure fosters a culture of innovation, giving team members complete ownership of their work and ensuring that ideas come from every level. We believe in providing unlimited growth opportunities to our people, along with constant feedback and support, which allows us to cover our vulnerabilities and grow as a team in new and interesting ways.

Cobblestone Values

Lifelong learning with continuous reflection
Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas
The team is more important than the individual. 
Being the best in any market we enter
Hiring and keeping only the most effective people
Others must benefit from our existence. 

Job Description

We are looking for a driven and skilled Business Analyst to become a valuable member of our dynamic team. As a leading player in the energy industry, our company is committed to innovation and growth. The successful candidate will need to have a strong understanding of business operations and be the communication intermediary for our different departments.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with cross-functional teams – tech and analytics to identify and communicate business needs. 
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, e.g., writing business requirement documents for software development. 
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in business analysis and apply these to our industry. 
Understand thoroughly the documentation of the different providers/third-parties/platforms that we interact with. 
Provide insights about the different features exposed by providers/third-parties/platforms and identify which ones we select/integrate as they serve best our business needs 
Develop strong commercial knowledge related to the different projects that are currently being implemented or part of the short-term roadmap 
Work with the technology team to have those business requirements implemented 
Conduct Exhaustive testing for implemented features before being deployed to production 
Synchronize with the Devs on daily basis addressing any inquiries related to business requirements/logic 
Being on top of all related tasks, executing based on set priorities, ensuring that any issues/bugs are solved immediately and taking all measures to minimize down time and guarantee high availability. 
Create and maintain data visualization tools e.g., Excel and Tableau. 

Requirements

2+ years' Experience in working in a similar position with cross functional teams 
Highly proficient with business intelligence and analytical tools such as SQL, Excel, Tableau and Python. 
Familiarity with modern data infrastructure and development practices. 
A quantitative related Bachelor's degree or above, preferably in the field of business intelligence, business or data analytics. 
In-depth knowledge of Agile processes and principles 
Outstanding communication, presentation and interpersonal skills 
Experience within the power and gas trading industry is a plus.

job_description:
About the job
Clarion Hotel® is all about living, not just staying - it's an experience. And you who work within Clarion are not just an employee - you are part of the experience! You are just as important to us as our guests. Today, we have several thousand employees, all with different experiences and backgrounds. But there are a few things we all have in common - We ARE personal, we HAVE passion and we strive to DO perfection! Clarion Hotel® is a part of Strawberry.

Clarion Hotel er mer enn bare et hotell. Vi gjør mer ut av hver detalj, og skaper møteplasser som øker livskvaliteten til våre gjester og kollegaer. Sammen med oss, vil du alltid være der det skjer, midt i hjertet av byen eller på flyplassen. Og kjernen i alt; Våre engasjerte og kunnskapsrike medarbeidere, som sørger for at gjestene opplever noe mer enn bare en overnatting.

Ved å jobbe i Clarion Hotel kan vi garantere deg:

At du vil omgi deg med de mest kunnskapsrike hotellansatte i Norden
At du blir inkludert i avgjørelser som angår din avdeling
At nettopp din mening betyr noe
At du vil oppleve genuin glede og omsorg fra dine kollegaer og ledere
At du får den utviklingen du trenger for å blomstre profesjonelt og personlig
At du vil få muligheten til å jobbe i hele Norden - hvis du selv vil
At du vil få jobbe i et trygt arbeidsmiljø som er i kontinuerlig utvikling og endring

Våre mål er skyhøye, og du kommer til å møtes av et team fullt av talenter og personligheter som hver dag tar de ekstra stegene for å levere gjesteopplevelser utenom det vanlige. Vår ambisjon er å ha de mest engasjerte og kompetente medarbeiderne i bransjen. Er du en av dem?

Nå søker vi ivrige og nøye Kitchen & Public Stylists til vår Kjøkken&Housekeeping-avdeling.

Som Kitchen & Public Stylists er du den som utfører renholdet og vask av hovedkjøkken, oppvask og fellesarealer, og sørger for at kollegaer og gjester får et magisk førsteinntrykk når de besøker oss.

Vi ser gjerne at du har erfaring fra renhold på kantine/kjøkken/hotell.

Du kommer til å inngå i et team som rapporterer til F&B Manager.

Du har gode samarbeidsevner, er åpen og tar fullt eierskap for gjestenes totale hotellopplevelse, og ikke bare ditt eget arbeidsområde, hver dag.

Stillingen innebærer jobber kveld/natt 22.00-06.00 i turnus- 154 timer pr mnd (mest sannsynlig 7på/ 7av)

Vil du bli en del av vår fremtid i Clarion Hotel? Liker du å bli utfordret og å utfordre? Ja, da er du kanskje den vi søker.

I stillingen inngår blant annet følgende arbeidsoppgaver:

Ansvar for oppvaskområde, rydd&vask kjøkken, sortering og plassering ut i avdelinger, vask av fellesarealer, lager, korridorer eller andre tildelte arealer har en høy renholdsstandard.
Å rapportere inn feil på kjøkken, korridorer og andre fellesarealer.
Å rapportere inn avvik på rutiner.
Å hver dag arbeide for at avdelingen skal nå sine mål på medarbeiderengasjement og effektivitet. 
Å være behjelpelig med å fylle på lager
Ved ansettelse blir en fullstendig stillingsbeskrivelse presentert, samt en oversikt over mandat og forventninger 

Rekrutteringen skjer løpende og stillingen kan besettes innen søknadsfristen går ut.

About the job
Are you passionate about helping children under the age of 6 years old?  Have you been looking for a preschool where you can grow and develop your career? If so, join us in our mission to spread Montessori education to children around the world!

Your role: 

We're looking for enthusiastic, adaptable Part-Time Assistant Teachers who have a passion for working with children to support our Infant (6 wks -16 mo), Toddler (16 mo - 3 yrs) or Children's House (3 yrs - 6 yrs) classrooms.

Austin campuses are located in Cedar Park, Bee Cave, West Lake Hills, and Round Rock.

This role is a great opportunity to get your foot in the door, and learn more about Montessori education! Many of our Assistant Guides ultimately grow to take on Lead Guide roles over time, thanks to our accredited Montessori training program we offer to exceptional employees.

job_title: Vi søker utviklere, arkitekter og tech leads til vårt Sandvika-kontor
name_location: Bouvet ASA · Sandvika, Viken, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 5 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Bouvet Sandvika er i vekst, og vi søker dyktige utviklere til vårt lokale kontor. Her får du kjenne på gode startup-vibber og samtidig jobbe i et av landets største og mest robuste konsulentselskaper. Vi kaller det liten i stor.

Vi har flere av regionens ypperste fagressurser på oppdrag i innovative og samfunnskritiske prosjekter, og spenner over bransjekompetanse innen alt fra forsvar, helse og mobilitet til strømnett og offentlige virksomheter. Bouvet Sandvika har en stolt tilstedeværelse i byen med sitt tverrfaglig miljø på over 30 konsulenter og nå søker vi flere lokale samfunnsbyggere som vil fornye, forbedre og digitalisere.

Hos Oss Får Du

Muligheter! Noen vil jobbe med .NET, andre med React eller Flutter. Noen drømmer om å bli løsningsarkitekter, andre vil jobbe med AR/VR, data science eller skyteknologi. Hos oss finner du prosjekter som tar deg i retningen som er riktig for deg.
Bli en bedre utvikler. Vårt «melk og brød» er sterk faglig kompetanse. Derfor har vi også et bevisst forhold til faglig utvikling. Alle får individuelle utviklingsplaner og mulighet for deltakelse på fagkvelder, hackatons, konferanser med mer. Erfarne kolleger med glød for faget sitt vil spille deg god og våre unge talenter vil inspirere deg og holde deg på tå hev.
Ta del i suksessen. Du får kjøpe deg inn i selskapet gjennom vårt aksjeprogram, og mottar årlig overskuddsdeling – på toppen av konkurransedyktig lønn. Vi jobber og skaper sammen, og derfor deler vi også likt av overskuddet. 
Verne om din fritid. Vi respekterer at fritid er viktig for oss alle. Vi praktiserer derfor fleksitid. Står du på litt ekstra i perioder, får du selvsagt betalt for timene du legger ned eller mulighet for avspasering.
Helse og trivsel. Her er det aktivitetsmuligheter innen alt fra padel og innebandy til minigolf og interne uhøytidelige Strava-dueller. Vi har sykkelparkering, eget treningsrom og rabatter på treningssenter. Vi er miljøfyrtårnsertifisert og sitter sentralt lokalisert ved Sandvika stasjon.
Nye venner. Vi drar på artige reiser, går ut sammen, spiller shuffleboard og gamer.
Støtte i ryggen. Bouvet er kjent som et trygt selskap som prioriterer de ansatte i gode, så vel som dårlige tider. Vi er godt rustet for nye utfordringer.

🥕 Vi har mange flere gulrøtter. De finner du i vår Gulrotindeks her🥕

Bærekraft, samfunnsansvar og mangfold

Som ledende IT-selskap skal vi gå foran og bidra til en bærekraftig fremtid lokalt, nasjonalt og globalt. I praksis innebærer dette at vi jobber aktivt med kompetansedeling og samarbeid på tvers av bransjer og nettverk, gjennom blant annet GoForIT. Du kan lese mer om vårt arbeid med bærekraft og samfunnsansvar her .

Vi er også svært opptatt av mangfold og inkludering. Det fremmer arbeidsglede, innovasjon og verdiskaping både på jobb og i samfunnet. Vårt interne nettverk, «Mangfold og inkludering», jobber for økt kunnskap og bevissthet og inviterer alle i selskapet til å delta i dette arbeidet. Vi satser stort på kvinner i Tech gjennom initiativ som ODA, Women in Tech Network og Girl Tech fest.

Hvem søker vi?

Vi Ser Etter Flere Medarbeidere Som Har

relevant bachelor/masterutdanning fra universitet/høyskole
relevant erfaring som backend-/fullstack-/frontendutvikler i .Net, Java, JavaScript
kunnskap og erfaring innen SQL, Python og Azure-løsninger
motivasjon til å skape et team som trives og leverer gode resultater
gode norskkunnskaper, både muntlig og skriftlig (minst B2 nivå).

Hvis beskrivelsen her passer deg, så send oss en søknad og CV. Vil du høre mer om alle mulighetene i Bouvet Sandvika, så ta gjerne kontakt eller kom innom vårt kontor for en kaffeprat.

Etter ansettelse vil en tredjeparts bakgrunnssjekk gjennomføres. Dette er en verifisering av de opplysninger som gis i rekrutteringsprosessen. Bakgrunnssjekken er tilpasset stillingens krav og gjennomføres etter søkerens samtykke.

Vi gleder oss oppriktig til å høre fra deg!

name_location: Goodtech · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Vi skaper konkurransefortinnSkal norsk industri være konkurransedyktig også i fremtiden må den være verdensledende når det gjelder industriell effektivitet og bærekraft.For å få til dette trenger den deg - og oss.

Vi har etablert oss som et ledende teknologiselskap i det grønne skiftet, og er i dag en betydelig leverandør av industriteknologi i Norden. Som et børsnotert selskap har vi den store virksomhetens muskler, og den lokale virksomhetens nærhet. Dette gjør oss i stand til å leverer alt fra store og teknisk krevende prosjekter til mindre, lokale og løpende oppdrag.

Vår kjernekompetanse er konsentrert rundt automatisering, industriell IT, elektrifisering og avansert produksjonsteknologi. Vi leverer i dag tjenester til blant annet i prosess- og næringsmiddelindustrien, olje- og gassektoren og havbruket. Stor etterspørsel og en offensiv satsning i markedet gjør at vi stadig utvider til flere sektorer og bransjer. Robotingeniør hos ossVi søker nå etter en erfaren robotingeniør til vår lokasjon i Trondheim. Goodtech leverer moderne robotlinjer til industri i regionen, og idriftsettelse hos Aker Solutions Verdal vil være din første oppgave.I denne rollen vil du være sentral på prosjekter innen robotisering, automasjon og digitalisering. Du vil ha et aktivt eierskap til prosjektene du deltar i og være involvert i hele prosessen fra forprosjekt til ferdig utført jobb.Du vil i hovedsak involveres på robot-leveranser, men være ansatt på avdeling for kontrollsystemer og kan også involveres i leveranser innen automasjon. Våre robotingeniører i region NordVest er også sterkt involvert i HVL Robotics Lab.ArbeidsoppgaverGjennomføring av automasjonsprosjekter med ansvar for en eller flere av disse oppgavene:Studier, tekniske spesifikasjoner, planlegging og kostnadsvurderingerProsjektering, programmering, idriftsettelse og service på robotsystemer.Prosjektering, programmering, idriftsettelse og service på kontroll-, PLS- og HMI/Scada-systemerØnsket kunnskap/erfaringSkal du trives og lykkes i denne rollen er det viktig at du har minimum 5 års erfaring fra arbeid med industrielle robot og PLS-systemer. Det er ønskelig at du har jobbet med robot-sveising og kan programmere roboter i 3d-miljøet i robotstudio.Det er en fordel med kjennskap til ABB roboter.Vi ser også for oss at du har utdanning som Sivilingeniør (MSc) / Ingeniør (BSc) innen automasjon, kybernetikk, mekatronikk eller tilsvarende.‍Handlingsrom og utviklingGoodtech har en solid markedsposisjon og solide ressurser i selskapet. Vi er offensive i markedet og er opptatt av å ha de beste menneskene hos oss. Her er det rom for både kursing og videreutdanning slik at du alltid har ressursene du trenger for å lykkes med dine oppgaver. For oss er det en selvfølge at medarbeidere har ulik bakgrunn, interesser og talenter. ‍Lønn og betingelserDu vil motta konkurransedyktig lønn, samt solide forsikrings- og pensjonsordninger. Alle våre ansatte får også muligheten til å ta del i selskapets aksjespareprogram. ‍Om arbeidsgiverenGoodtechs historie begynte i 1913. Da etablerte brødrene Alf og Thomas Snillsberg Norsk Elektrisk kabelfrabrikk. Brødrene hadde en visjon om at elektrisk kraft og automatiserte arbeidsprosesser ville gjøre livene våre bedre og enklere. Og de fikk rett. Over 100 år senere er hverdagen vår både elektrisk, automatisert og digitalisert. I dag heter konsernet Goodtech, og et ledende nordisk teknologikonsern. Vi leverer prosjekter, tjenester og produkter for industri, energi, miljø og infrastruktur som skaper verdi for våre kunder gjennom økt effektivitet og forbedret helse, miljø og sikkerhet. Goodtech er notert på Oslo Børs, omsetter for ca. NOK 600 millioner og har i underkant av 350 medarbeidere i Norge og Sverige.‍

name_location: 1X · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 29 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Targeted start date: Immediately.

1X designs androids built to benefit society. Since 2014, we’ve been building androids with the product design mindset of safety first, balanced performance, and smart behavior. Our mission is to build androids that work alongside people to meet the world’s labor demand and build an abundant society. Our wheeled model, EVE, is engineered to work with you, from guarding to logistics, and our bipedal model, NEO, is designed to become a general-purpose android, with a broad deployment in various applications, and, eventually, assisted living.

Founded in Moss, Norway, 1X has grown into an international team with offices around the globe. 1X envisions a bright new future: humans and androids, working and learning, Side by Side.

Safe, robust and efficient locomotion lies at the core of enabling humanoid robots to interact with the world. As a Robotics Controls Engineer at 1X Technologies, you will develop real-time controls, estimation and planning algorithms to allow the application of our robot to a wide range of behaviors and environments. Every day, you will work with other software and controls engineers to conceptualize, implement and test the algorithms needed to reach this goal. We believe that if it doesn’t work on a robot, it doesn’t work - so get ready to be hands-on with our state of the art hardware. To thrive in this role, you must have strong analytical skills, a burning desire for action and progress, and be motivated to make a positive impact in the world of robotics.

Why this job is exciting

Every day is different! You will get to

work in a nascent industry and shape the future of humanoid robots
drive the design and development of cutting-edge controls and planning algorithms in a small team of skilled and motivated controls engineers
deploy and test your software on our humanoid robots
collaborate with an interdisciplinary team of experts in an environment of learning and support.
thrive in an inclusive, supportive, and global culture

Within one month, you will…

learn the ropes about our humanoid system and get familiar with the controls and autonomy stack

Within three months, you will…

be self-sufficient, and able to independently contribute to the controls stack

Within one year, you will…

Become a key contributor that enables progress towards achieving more efficient, robust and safe locomotion of our robot for a wide range of environments and behaviors

Responsibilities 

Design and implement controls, motion planning and state estimation algorithms focused on legged humanoid robots
Test and debug your algorithms on our robots
Provide documentation for application and production engineers
Develop highly reliable, maintainable, and testable code for humanoid robots deployed to real world applications
Keep up to date with the latest research in legged robotics motion planning and controls

Must-Haves

Masters degree in Robotics, Mechanical/Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or similar. 
Good understanding of rigid body dynamics, dynamical systems, controls and linear algebra
Fast and independent learning and problem solving skills
Competent in Object Oriented C++ programming within a Linux development environment
Familiarity with modern software development practices, source control, and testing methodologies
Strong communication and documentation skills

Nice-To-Haves

Experience with C++, Java, Unity/C#, Python, ROS2 and DDS
Hands-on experience developing and debugging real-time software systems, preferably whole-body controls, estimation or planning algorithms on a physical robotic platform
Background in Model Predictive Control, learning for dynamics and controls, numerical optimization, modeling dynamic systems or system identification
Contributions to the robotics community via thesis, publications, conference presentations or open source projects
Familiarity with the Linux development environment

Interview process 

Introduction Stage - we have initial conversations to get to know you better…

[30m] Recruiter Screen with Win Yu
[30m] Hiring Manager Screen with Manuel Yves Galliker 

Team Interview Stage - we then dive into your experience in more depth and introduce you to members of the team.

[60m] Technical Deep-Dive conversation with Toni Garcia and Manuel Yves Galliker 

Final Interview Stage - a brief conversation introducing you to our leadership team

[15m] Expectation management with Manuel Yves Galliker
[30m] Conversation with CEO Bernt Øivind Børnich

 You are welcome to request additional conversations with anyone you would like to meet, but didn’t get to meet during the interview process.

Not sure if this is you?

If you’re excited about this role, but you’re not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Location

Our new headquarter in Moss, Norway, is a short train ride from Oslo. The facility is designed to be state-of-the-art, with a variety of 3D printers, an electronics lab, and controls test studio. 1XHQ offers food, showers, and outdoor activities. All employees are supported with a comprehensive relocation package to handle all logistics. Join us in Moss, where performance meets great company culture.

Joining our team means becoming a valued member of one of the biggest brands in humanoid robotics, where you'll play a part in shaping the future of Androids.

Working at 1X

The ideas that express our team’s culture and how we work.

Be Nice

Collaboration is our driving force. Our team creates an open, trusting environment where everyone can be their most creative.

Stay Smart

A world-changing team needs the brightest minds in every discipline. This is where people come to work, learn, and grow to their full potential.

Make History

Everything we do gets us closer to one ambitious vision: general-purpose androids helping people around the globe. We believe what we build today will impact generations.

1X is an inclusive and equal-opportunity employer that values diversity. We consider all qualified applicants regardless of race, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected class. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don't hesitate to let us know during the interview process. We will do our best to accommodate your needs.

We're excited to have you on board!

name_location: KONGSBERG · Kongsberg, Viken, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 9 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Er du en person med stor drivkraft, har lidenskap for ditt fagområde og er på utkikk etter neste karrieremulighet? Da kan dette være rollen for deg!

Kongsberg Defence and Aerospace er inne i en periode med sterk vekst innenfor luftvernsprogrammet NASAMS og Radarprogrammene, vi ønsker derfor å styrke vår organisasjon med en Test Technician. I denne rollen vil du jobbe med operativ test og verifikasjon av verdensledende luftvernsystemer og radarsystemer, samt overlevering av disse til kunde ut fra vår egen produksjon i en av Norges råeste og mest avanserte produksjonsfasiliteter.

Vi søker deg som liker høyt tempo, har gjennomføringsevne, arbeidskapasitet og interesse for fagfeltet test og verifikasjon. Du vil få jobbe tett sammen med et svært kompetent team, og bidra til leveranser av verdensledende luftverns- og radarsystemer, med rett kvalitet til rett tid!

Dette Vil Du Gjøre Hos Oss

Gjennomføre produksjonstester av elektromekaniske systemer
Test og feilsøking på enkeltkomponenter og systemer internt og eksternt
Utarbeide testprosedyrer / prosesser
Gjennomføre Factory Acceptance Test (FAT) ved leveranse til kunde
Teknisk støtte for produksjon, prosjekter og leverandører
Delta aktivt i videreutvikling og forbedring av våre prosesser og arbeidsmetoder

Ønskede Kvalifikasjoner Og Egenskaper

Tekniker/Ingeniør innenfor automasjon/elektronikk/mekatronikk.Relevant erfaring kan kompensere for formell utdannelse
Erfaring fra test- og verifikasjonsarbeid er en fordel, samt erfaring fra feilsøking på elektromekaniske systemer
Evne til å forstå tekniske tegninger og krav for elektro og kabler
Evne til å forstå komplekse systemer og tenke helhetlig
God forståelse av produksjonsvirksomhet og teknologi
Du tar initiativ til å få ting til å skje og tar ansvaret for resultatet
Gode samarbeidsevner er viktig, samt fokus på løsninger og å jobbe selvstendig
Du har stor teknisk interesse, er positiv, nysgjerrig og liker høyt tempo

Noe reiseaktivitet i Norge og utland må påberegnes i perioder.

Vi ønsker å utvikle våre ansatte både faglig og personlig. I KONGSBERG får du muligheten til å jobbe med produkter i verdensklasse i et høyteknologisk miljø med engasjerte og positive kolleger. Vi har konkurransedyktige betingelser, pensjons- og forsikringsordninger, samt et fordelaktig aksjeprogram for deg som er ansatt. KONGSBERG tilbyr også treningssenter, innovasjonslab, firmahytter, rabatterte billetter til kultur- og sportsarrangementer, samt et eget fritidsprogram for unge medarbeidere.

Aerostructures & MRO er en divisjon i Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace. Divisjonen driver teknologisk ledende produksjon av avanserte mekaniske, elektromekaniske og komposittprodukter med meget høye kvalitetskrav til forsvars- og aerospacekunder. Hovedvirksomheten i divisjonen er leveranse av produkter til F35 jagerfly og produkter til KONGSBERG utviklede systemer innenfor sivil og forsvars-sektoren, deriblant leveranser til NASAMS luftvernssystemer samt leveranse av radarsystemer.

Her kan du lese mer om NASAMS: https://protect.kongsberg.com/artikkel_norsk-luftvern-beskytter-og-redder-liv/

Kandidater som søker på stillingen vil i forbindelse med rekrutteringsprosessen bli gjenstand for bakgrunnssjekk og vurdering av denne vil bli lagt til grunn ved valg av kandidat. For å være aktuell kandidat til stillingen må du kunne sikkerhetsklareres og autoriseres, jfr. Sikkerhetsloven.

Søknader behandles fortløpende, så ikke vent med å søke!

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This is an exciting opportunity to join an industry leading software security team, and help protect the open source community and Ubuntu users from emerging threats. Canonical is building a team to provide security coverage across a wide range of different ecosystems and environments, and work to make the world a better, safer place.

As part of the Ubuntu team, you will work with the best and brightest people in technology to monitor, triage, respond to and document new and existing vulnerabilities in open source software. The role will involve collaboration with internal teams and external partners, to identify and prioritize issues and track progress.

The role can also include a number of other activities, including security assessment and code review, internal tooling developments, community engagement, security hardening and feature development and industry collaboration participation.

This job involves international travel several times a year, usually for one week and requires the ability to be productive in a globally distributed team through self-discipline and self-motivation.

What You'll Do

Analyze, fix, and test vulnerabilities in Ubuntu packages
Keep track of vulnerabilities in Ubuntu releases as they are discovered, researched and fixed (using internal software tools)
Collaborate with other teams in the Ubuntu community and with upstream developers where appropriate, to exchange or develop vulnerability patches and make sure that Ubuntu includes the very best security features
Audit source code for vulnerabilities

Who You Are

You have a thorough understanding of the common categories of security vulnerabilities and techniques for fixing them
You are familiar with coordinated disclosure practices
You are familiar with open source development tools and methodologies
You are skilled in one or more of C, Python, go, Rust, Java, Ruby or PHP 
You have excellent logic, problem-solving, troubleshooting, and decision-making skills
You can clearly and effectively communicate with the team and Ubuntu community members

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

About the job
Targeted start date: Immediately.

We are seeking a proactive and solutions-driven IT Systems Integrator and Solutions Engineer! This role goes beyond traditional IT administration. Not only are you the bridge between everyday IT operations and the groundbreaking R&D propelling our company, but you also excel in on-site problem-solving internally and for our end-users. As an invaluable partner to our R&D team, you help create both seamless systems integration and optimal end-user experiences.

1X designs androids built to benefit society. Since 2014, we’ve been building androids with the product design mindset of safety first, balanced performance, and smart behavior. Our mission is to build androids that work alongside people to meet the world’s labor demand and build an abundant society. Our wheeled model, EVE, is engineered to work with you, from guarding to logistics, and our bipedal model, NEO, is designed to become a general-purpose android, with a broad deployment in various applications, and, eventually, assisted living.

Founded in Moss, Norway, 1X has grown into an international team with offices around the globe. 1X envisions a bright new future: humans and androids, working and learning, Side by Side.

Responsibilities

Systems Integration: Efficiently set up, configure, and maintain computers and associated software for the organization, ensuring optimal performance and seamless interaction.
Proactive Troubleshooting: Lead the charge in diagnosing both internal and external IT challenges, ensuring minimal disruption and maximizing uptime.
R&D Collaboration: Act as a reliable tech partner for our R&D teams, understanding their needs, and ensuring that the IT infrastructure robustly supports ongoing projects and innovations.
Security and Compliance: Establish and uphold security best practices, ensuring our intellectual property and data remain uncompromised.
Continuous Learning: Stay updated with emerging IT trends and tools, ensuring our infrastructure remains state-of-the-art.

Must-Haves

Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, or a related field.
3 years of hands-on experience in IT administration, preferably in R&D environments.
Advanced proficiency in modern WiFi and 5G technologies, encompassing a deep understanding of 802.11 standards.
Comprehensive knowledge of networking protocols such as IPv6, IPv4, TCP/IP, and UDP. 

Nice-To-Haves

Knowledge of MU-MIMO, beamforming, and OFDMA.
Knowledge of networking protocols mDNS.
Demonstrated aptitude in problem-solving and delivering efficient IT solutions.

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  4 months ago  · 43 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Next-gen operations at scale, with pure Python infra-as-code, from bare metal to containers and applications. Our goal is to perfect enterprise infrastructure devops.

We run hundreds of private cloud, Kubernetes, and application clusters for customers across physical and public cloud estate, and we are raising the bar on what's possible with automation by embracing a universal operator pattern and model-driven operations.

To succeed in this role you need to believe in automation as a pure software engineering problem, not a hack-it-till-it-works-for-me problem. You need to be interested in the scientific approach to operations at scale, driven by metrics and code, and you need to be able to learn the entire stack, from bare metal networking and kernel up to serverless and open source applications.

Cloud Operations Engineer

Our cloud operations engineers bring Python software-engineering skills and rigour to the operations domain. We practice devsecops from bare metal to application. We architect and run OpenStack, Kubernetes and software defined storage, and we enable devsecops for applications running on that infrastructure too.

To become a member of this team, you need to be a software engineer fluent in Python, you need a genuine interest in the full open source infrastructure stack from metal to containers, and you need the ability to work in a high pressure operations environment with mission-critical services for global brand name customers.

As a member of the team you will gain experience in a broad range of cloud technologies. We evolve our offerings as the state of the art improves, so you get to stay current with the latest capabilities in open source infrastructure. We drive upgrades to keep our customers on the latest, best solutions.

What Canonical Offers

Technical management team that understands the details of what we are developing
A culture of openness and inclusiveness
Helpful and talented engineers who are world-class experts in many fields
Teams focused on good work life balance with long average retention rates
A wide range of engineering disciplines and career paths that can move between divisions
Fully remote company for career growth without relocation requirements

Requirements

Software Engineering or Computer Science degree
Linux experience and familiarity with Linux networking and storage
Python software development experience
Demonstrated drive for continual learning
Devops experience

Nice to haves

Experience with OpenStack or Kubernetes deployment or operations
We hope that you'll join us in helping to shape and build the future of free software together

Of course we also offer...

Learning and Development
Annual Compensation Review
Recognition Rewards
Annual Leave
Priority Pass for travel
Flexible working option

Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the world's computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Job Title: DevOps Architect, Nordic Remote

Are you passionate about cloud computing and automation? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment? We are looking for an AWS DevOps Architect to join a growing software team spread across the Nordics.

Responsibilities
 Design, deploy, and manage AWS-based infrastructure, ensuring scalability, high availability, and cost-effectiveness.
