job_title: Jobb som frontend- eller mobilutvikler i vårt unike tech-miljø!
name_location: Bouvet ASA · Stavanger, Rogaland, Norway  3 months ago  · 26 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Liker du å utvikle brukervennlige løsninger, og er en racer på koding? Da vil vi ha deg med på laget som frontend- eller mobilutvikler hos oss!

I Stavanger har Bouvet regionens største utviklingsmiljø. Nå trenger vi flere dedikerte utviklere med engasjement og interesse for moderne teknologi. Vi jobber med Norges mest spennende virksomheter og sammen skaper vi digitale løsninger med stor betydning for enkeltmennesker og samfunnet. Et godt eksempel er den viktige appen vi utvikler for Lyse Energi hvor vi er med å realisere en moderne, brukervennlig og oversiktlig app for strømkundene deres. Les om prosjektet her

Om du brenner for utvikling og vil jobbe med rause og flinke kollegaer er dette sjansen du har ventet på! Hos oss får du jobbe med kunder som tør å gi deg ansvar, og kollegaer som ønsker å se deg på ditt beste. Det betyr at du får stor frihet i hverdagen, at du kan være deg selv og at du blir utfordret.

Vi er ikke et typisk konsulentselskap. Vi har fantastiske lokaler i Jåttåvågen som huser mange av våre ansatte. Vi jobber i team og leverer ofte rene teamleveranser fra vårt kontor. I det yrende fagmiljøet vårt vil du alltid ha noen å sparre med. Deling er en av grunnverdiene våre, så erfaringer og kunnskap deler vi gledelig med hverandre.

Ønskede kvalifikasjoner

Du har helst noen år bak tastaturet, og solid kunnskap fra moderne webutvikling innenfor React eller tilsvarende. Når det er sagt, så vet jo ingen hva som gjelder av teknologi om et år eller tre. Frontend- og mobilutviklings-verden beveger seg i stor fart med nye rammeverk, bibliotek og ulike verktøy. Derfor er det viktig at du også er sulten på å utforske nye teknologier og være med å sette kursen videre i Bouvet. Du må kunne skrive og snakke flytende norsk og engelsk. Høyere utdanning innen IT er en fordel, men ikke et krav dersom du har lengre relevant erfaring.

Du bør ha kunnskap om flere av disse teknologiene:

React 
Remix 
Next.js 
TypeScript 
Webpack 
Vite 
CSS, SASS, less, Styled-Components 
React Native 
Flutter 
Expo 
Azure, alternativt Google Cloud eller AWS 

Bouvet-livet vårt byr på

Kontinuerlig kompetanseutvikling, faggrupper, kurs og spennende prosjekter 
Tverrfaglig samarbeid 
Overskuddsdeling 
Aksjeprogram 
Sertifiseringsbonus 
Flunka ny mobiltelefon 
God pensjon, helseforsikring og bedriftshelsetjeneste 
Nettverk for erfarne utviklere/arkitekter samt nyutdannede 
Bredt aktivitetstilbud med egne «sportsministre» 
Treningsavtaler og treningsrom på kontoret 
Firmahytte 
Sosiale turer 
Feiring av små og store begivenheter 
God balanse mellom jobb og fritid 
Trygg arbeidsplass 

Hva betyr mest for deg? Vår gulrotindeks er et supert sted å utforske hva vi tilbyr: https://www.bouvet.no/bli-en-av-oss

Det viktigste er til syvende og sist at Bouvet-livet skal være godt å leve. Du kan lese mye mer om hvordan det er å være ansatt hos oss i vår Ansattes Årsrapport her https://www.bouvet.no/om-bouvet/de-ansattes-arsrapport-22

Høres det interessant ut? Du trenger ikke skrive en lang søknad. Kanskje du ikke er klar for å søke enda, men er interessert i å vite litt mer. Ta gjerne kontakt med Jørn Høiland for en uformell prat om muligheter.

Eneste måten å leve i den fremtiden man ønsker er å bygge den selv.

Bli med oss og gjør akkurat det!

job_description:
About the job
Location: Bergen, Norway

As an AWS DevOps Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and managing our cloud infrastructure on AWS. You will collaborate closely with our development and operations teams to ensure seamless integration of systems and implement best practices for continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD). Your expertise will drive the optimization of our cloud infrastructure, improving performance, scalability, and security.

Key Responsibilities
 Design, build, and maintain scalable and fault-tolerant cloud-based infrastructure on AWS.
 Implement CI/CD pipelines to automate the deployment and release processes.
 Monitor and troubleshoot system performance, identifying and resolving issues proactively.
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of applications and systems.
 Ensure the security and compliance of our cloud infrastructure, implementing best practices and security measures.
 Automate manual processes to improve operational efficiency and reduce human error.
 Stay up-to-date with the latest AWS services and industry trends, proposing innovative solutions to improve our technology stack.
Requirements
 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
 Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer, with a strong focus on AWS cloud services.
 Solid understanding of CI/CD concepts and hands-on experience with CI/CD tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or AWS CodePipeline.
 Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
 Extensive knowledge of AWS services, including EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, IAM, etc.
 Experience with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus.
 Familiarity with infrastructure-as-code tools (CloudFormation, Terraform) is highly desirable.
 Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex issues effectively.
 Excellent communication and collaboration skills, both verbal and written.
 AWS certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer - Professional) are a plus.
If you're interested in finding out more please apply for this exciting opportunity or send your CV to b.mccrudden@jeffersonfrank.com for a follow up call.

Jefferson Frank is the Amazon Web Services (AWS) recruiter of choice. We work with organizations worldwide to find and deliver the best permanent and contract AWS DevOps, Big Data, IaaS and PaaS, and AWS Security professionals on the planet. For more information, visit jeffersonfrank.com.

About the job
The Educational Equality Institute, an NGO based in Norway committed to educating and thereby empowering disadvantaged girls.

In response to the war in Ukraine, we started the project: “Together for Ukraine”. 

Free educational programs where we, together with our partners, will help 100.000 Ukrainians shape their future through education, upskilling, and employment.

Do you have a passion for language learning and want to make a positive impact on the world?

Join Language Connect for Ukraine, a digital platform that connects international volunteers with Ukrainians for 1-on-1 video sessions to practice language skills.

As a volunteer, you will have the opportunity to improve your teaching skills and make a meaningful difference in someone's life. The program is flexible and adaptable to your schedule, allowing you to volunteer on your own terms.

Connect with Ukrainians and help them practice their language skills while enhancing your own experience as a language teacher.

Requirements

Language proficiency: be a native or fluent speaker of a language
Cultural awareness: be sensitive to the unique needs and challenges of displaced persons
Flexible time commitment: update your availability anytime in your profile calendar
Patience and empathy: help students learn at their own pace and be comfortable during the learning process
Effective communication skills: provide clear instructions and explanations to ensure understanding

Are you ready to make a difference? Sign up or contact the TEEI team today!

job_description:
About the job
Vi trenger å styrke vårt softwareteam i Asker på mange områder. Vi trenger derfor medarbeidere som jobber fokusert med kvalitetsstyring. Softwaregruppen i Asker består i dag av ca. 50 medarbeidere.

Oppgaver for Software Quality Assurance (SQA) Engineer

Kvalitetssikre at softwareutvikling, produkter og aktiviteter følger standarder, prosedyrer og prosesser
Være en støttefunksjon til bruk av internt management system for avdelingen og prosjektene
Etablere, gjennomføre og rapportere SQA aktiviteter
Delta på review-, milepæl- og leveransemøter
Delta i prosessaudit i softwareprosjekter
Rapportere avvik til Software- og QA-avdelingene
Utføre målinger, identifisere forbedringsområder og bidra i forbedringsarbeid

Hovedoppgavene til softwareavdelingen

Analyse, design, utvikling og vedlikehold av software for kommunikasjons- og våpenstyringssystemer
Supportere markedsinitiativer med demo/prototype software
Utvikling av software skjer i tverrfaglige prosjekter i samhandling med fagdisipliner som mekanikk, servo, elektronikk, system og test

Prosesser og metoder

Definert software ledelses- og utviklingsprosesser
Agile utviklingsmetodikk

Ønskede kvalifikasjoner og egenskaper

Fordel med teknisk utdannelse på fagskolenivå, BSc- eller MSc innen datateknikk eller annen relevant utdanning
Gjerne erfaring fra softwareutvikling og/eller kvalitetsarbeid, men ikke en forutsetning
Praktisk forståelse, engasjement og evne til godt lagspill
Grundig og kvalitetsbevisst
Gode kommunikasjonsevner på norsk og engelsk

Vi tilbyr

Interessante og spennende arbeidsoppgaver
Gode karriere- og utviklingsmuligheter i et internasjonalt selskap
God oppfølging med fadder og individuell opplæring
Varmt og inkluderende arbeidsmiljø med hyggelige kollegaer
Konkurransedyktige betingelser, pensjons- og forsikringsordninger
Moderne lokaler i Asker Panorama
Gode velferdsordninger med eget treningssenter, hytteutleie og mye mer
Mulighet for hybrid hjemmekontorløsning etter avtale

Du får muligheten til å være en del av et høykompetent teknisk miljø som består av flere tusen ingeniører i Kongsberg Teknologipark og Asker Panorama.

Søknadene vil bli vurdert fortløpende.

Kandidater som søker på stillingen vil i forbindelse med rekrutteringsprosessen bli gjenstand for bakgrunnssjekk og vurdering av denne vil bli lagt til grunn ved valg av kandidat. For å være aktuell kandidat til stillingen må du kunne sikkerhetsklareres og autoriseres, jfr. Sikkerhetsloven.

Bli kjent med KONGSBERG

Kongsberg Gruppen (KONGSBERG) er et internasjonalt teknologikonsern som leverer avanserte og pålitelige teknologiske løsninger som bidrar til sikkerhet, trygghet og effektivitet i komplekse operasjoner og under ekstreme forhold. KONGSBERG samarbeider med globale kunder innenfor forsvars-, maritim-, olje- og gass-, fiskeri- og romfartsindustrien.

Land Systems er en divisjon i Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace AS, ett av forretningsområdene i KONGSBERG GRUPPEN. Land Systems utvikler og produserer det fjernstyrte våpenstyringssystemet PROTECTOR og avanserte kommunikasjonsprodukter som sikrer samband med ekstreme krav til robusthet og ytelse.

Vi har økende oppdragsmengde og har behov for flere dyktige medarbeidere innen ulike områder av softwareutvikling, både i Kongsberg og Asker. Se alle våre annonser på Kongsberg.com.

name_location: Strawberry (formerly Nordic Choice Hotels) · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 week ago  · 11 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Housekeepers til Amerikalinjen

Vi søker ekstrahjelpere i housekeeping avdeling.

Amerikalinjen er et urbant boutiquehotell for lokale og tilreisende som åpnet i mars 2019. En møteplass for mennesker i alle aldre og fra alle kulturer. Et varmt, eklektisk og inspirerende hus med 122 rom, en unik historie og en fantastisk beliggenhet. Det perfekte utgangspunktet for å utforske byen.

Vi søker deg som vil delta i den krevende og kreative prosessen med å videreutvikle og drifte et pulserende hotell- og restauranthus på Jernbanetorget i Oslo.

Amerikalinjen huser flere spennende mat- og drikkekonsept, alle inspirert av vår unike historie og beliggenhet. Våre serveringssteder retter seg mot det lokale markedet, med en tydelig ambisjon om å bli markedsledende i sine respektive segment.

Amerikalinjen har følgende avdelinger;

ATLAS: Levende, lekent og uformelt brasserie, som serverer mat inspirert av de ulike hjørnene i Europa - grunnlaget for den fantastiske og nyskapende kulinariske scenen i New York.
HAVEN: En frodig grønn oase i bakgården av hotellet. Her kan våre gjester nyte en drink så vel som en sen søndagsbrunch.
PIER 42: En klassisk Amerikansk cocktailbar med drinker som var populære på Amerikalinjebåtene. Vinner av Bartenders Choice Awards 2020, for Best Cocktailbar in Norway.
GUSTAV: En unik jazzklubb- og eventscene med sitteplasser til 90 personer. Egen bar og kjøkken.

På Amerikalinjen legger vi vekt på å ansette ekstremt dedikerte mennesker som innehar en sterk servicekultur og som elsker å skape minnerike øyeblikk. Det er viktig for oss at du kan identifisere deg meg byggets historie og ta personlig eierskap til beretninger om mennesker i bevegelse. Et av våre viktigste mål er å levende formidle Amerikalinjens rike historie til nye generasjoner.

Vi ønsker at du:

Motiveres av å yte førsteklasses service for våre gjester.
Demonstrerer ærlighet og integritet i alt du gjør.
Er fleksibel, nøyaktig og selvgående.
Har relevant arbeidserfaring.
Innehar sterke kommunikasjonsegenskaper på engelsk, et skandinavisk språk er også en fordel.

Helgejobbing må påregnes.

Amerikalinjen kan tilby:

En unik mulighet til å ta del i utviklingen av et nytt hotellkonsept.
Et profesjonelt og dynamisk arbeidsmiljø.
Karrieremuligheter innen Nordic Hotels & Resorts og Strawberry.

Stillingen er basert i Oslo på hotellet Amerikalinjen.

For spørsmål om stillingene, kontakt oss på:

Executive Housekeeper: anna.labecka@amerikalinjen.com

Søknadsfrist: Snarest (kandidater vil fortløpende innkalles til intervju).

Tiltredelse: Snarest

Les mer om hotellet her: www.amerikalinjen.com

Vil jobbe tett med noen av de sterkeste 3D-utviklingsingeniørene i bransjen for å sikre systemkonsistens, opprettholde ekstremt store datasett, forbedre deres skalerbare løsninger og forbedre brukeropplevelsen

name_location: Strawberry (formerly Nordic Choice Hotels) · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 72 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Det er en grunn til at det er akkurat du som ønsker å jobbe i Strawberry. Du ser muligheter på våre 100 destinasjoner. Du tror du vil passe inn i vårt mangfold blant 18.000 ansatte. Du er spent på våre fantastiske hotellkjeder og du har energi, mot og begeistring så det holder. Vil du vite mer om oss? Vi gleder oss til å høre fra deg! Quality Hotel™ er en del av Strawberry.

Housekeeping Assistent

Quality Hotel33™ søker en rockestjerne til avdelingen housekeeping. Hele hotellet blir din scene og du sørger for at vasking av tildelte hotellrom, baderom, fellesarealer, lagerrom, korridorer eller andre tildelte områder rocker fett.

Nå er vi på jakt etter en av de viktigte for hotellets drift, nemlig housekeeping assistent. Vi søker deg som har jobbet med renhold før og som er rask og effektiv, og har erfaring fra renhold gjerne i en tidligere ansvarlig/assistentrolle. Med et øye for detaljer og et hjerte som banker for miljøet er du med på å sette standarden for hotellets resultat.

Arbeidsoppgver er i hovedsak ansvar for housekeeping teamet sammen med vår Housekeeping Manager og du vil ha fult ansvar annenhver helg

Du spiller sikkert på mange strenger, her er noen egenskaper vi setter ekstra høyt:

 Nøyaktighet
 Serviceinnstilling
 At du har humor og liker å ha det gøy på jobben
 Du holder hjulene igang.
 Kjører high-five med gjestene i korridoren
 Har en interiør-designer i deg, med øye for stil
 Ser detaljer som ingen annen ser

Om oss

Hva er det som gjør et besøk hos oss helt unikt? Kanskje er det servitøren som alltid har en vits på lur, housekeeping som legger igjen en personlig hilsen på rommet ditt, eller resepsjonisten som behandler femåringen din som en kongelig?

På Quality Hotel får hver medarbeiders personlighet skinne, og det gjenspeiles i arbeidet vi gjør. Vi gjør alt vi kan for at oppholdet ditt skal bli så bra som mulig, enten du skal holde en konferanse eller nyte kvalitetstid med familien. Vi elsker å tilby det lille ekstra, slik at dere kan lene dere tilbake, være sammen og sette av tid til de små øyeblikkene i hverdagen - de som virkelig betyr noe. Våre 60+ hoteller i Norden er unike på hver sin måte, men felles for dem alle er den gode, varme atmosfæren og den personlige tilnærmingen til hver gjest. Det er nettopp det som gjør et besøk hos oss helt unikt.

Er du med på notene? Kom inn i rampelyset og søk innen fristen. Jobben er en fast heltidsstilling med start etter avtale.

name_location: Two · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 5 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Two is bringing the very best of B2C e-commerce to B2B. We’re passionate about building solutions that enable B2B Merchants to sell more, faster, and more efficiently. Growing 30% month-on-month, our goal is to become the world’s largest B2B payment solution by 2025. We’re backed by the very best VCs in the world — raised over €30m from Sequoia, Shine, Local Globe, Antler, Posten and influential angel investors in Fintech.

Two is built by a passionate and energetic team with second-time founders with successful exits. We are a small, but mighty team leading Two into new countries. We have a global mindset, but deeply understand local nuance. We are entrepreneurs at heart, problem-solving to launch new countries end to end. We are team players that execute diligently from ideation to reality. We believe in diversity in opinions and ideas and expect all employees to think like an owner.

We have recently announced our three-way partnership with Allianz and Santander to support large, multinational merchants across all of Europe and North America and offer instant net terms to their business customers through one API solution. Apart from that, we have just entered the Swedish market, as well as launched our Instalment product allowing buyers to pay us back in 3-12 monthly instalments.

And this is only the beginning - our next chapter is going to be an even more exciting one!

Location

We are seeking candidate to be located in either our London or Oslo hub. We provide flexibility by offering a combination of onsite and remote working, allowing you to choose between 2 to 5 days in the office.

About The Role

The Collections Specialist role at Two encompasses managing customer queries and providing crucial support for the day-to-day collections operation. This will involve making daily phone calls to buyers who have overdue invoices, sending formal reminder emails, and fostering strong customer relationships. The ideal candidate will exhibit the ability to perform consistently under pressure while upholding the highest level of professionalism in their daily duties. Additionally, this role entails effectively managing difficult customer queries, should any arise.

Key Responsibilities:

Engage with our buyers to recover overdue payments by discussing their repayment terms and providing assistance in addressing any payment-related inquiries
Foster and maintain a positive relationship with our buyers and merchants while managing multiple queries simultaneously
Exercise critical thinking skills and identify opportunities to improve and optimise processes
Provide exceptional customer service in line with the Two brand's customer-centric values
Manage several day-to-day functions, including outbound calling, overseeing the collections inbox, and supporting collection campaigns
Demonstrate strong conflict resolution skills to navigate difficult conversations and facilitate mutually beneficial solutions
Multitask effectively to ensure efficient execution of daily tasks
Exhibit a commitment to meeting deadlines and exceeding expectations

Requirements

Essential requirements:

Believing in our mission! You believe in what we’re trying to build at Two, have a look at Two.inc to find out more
Fluent/ native level Norwegian or Swedish speaker
Effective communication skills in English, both verbally and in writing
Strong team player accustomed to working under pressure
Prior experience in call centre, outbound sales or a customer-facing role

Behavioural qualities we are looking for:

Empathy and a customer-centric approach when dealing with buyers
Attention to detail to ensure accuracy in payment processing
Conflict resolution skills for managing challenging conversations
A positive attitude and a willingness to learn and adapt
Proactive and self-motivated with a strong work ethic

Desirable:

Experience working in collections or payments

Benefits

NOK 5000 annual allowance — to spend on anything that will contribute to your mental or physical health 🤸
NOK 5000 support for a phone device every 24 months (from your 6th month anniversary) 📱
NOK 5000 annual allowance for learning and training 📚
Equity – get options at Two as part of your offer, and have a real stake in the company’s success 📈
Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly working framework!

name_location: Aidn · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  5 days ago  · 228 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We all have family and friends that have had less than satisfying run-ins with the healthcare system, repeating their story to new healthcare workers without access to the relevant records. Again and again. New faces. Same story. Binders hauled between offices explaining treatments. Time wasted. Patients suffering. They shouldn’t have to.

Healthcare systems are not coordinated. Not synchronized. They don’t communicate. Healthcare professionals need to record identical activities and measures in multiple systems. We don’t suffer from a lack of information in healthcare. We suffer from information sprawl. We shouldn’t have to.

As product builders, the work we do is important to our employers, but, at some point, we all ask ourselves the same question: Is the work itself important?

Our ambition is to give Norwegians the missing healthcare platform they deserve. An integrated set of products and services to allow institutions, clinicians, social workers, and citizens to seamlessly interact on healthcare matters.

That’s where you come in. Here’s your chance to put your talents to work for a purpose.

We are looking for a UX Designer for one of our product teams.

At Aidn, we believe that talented designers, engineers, and product managers should be allowed to work autonomously toward long-term goals. Together with designers, developers, nurses, and doctors, you will be instrumental in creating the future patient-centric eHealth system.

Here, you will:

Create user-centric designs by considering market analysis, data, customer feedback, user research, and technical constraints/opportunities
Create user flows, wireframes, design mockups and prototypes to effectively conceptualize new product initiatives
Conduct user research, interviews and testing
Simplify complex processes into intuitive and elegant user experiences
Use your experience with accessibility and inclusive design
Communicate complex, interactive design concepts in a simple manner
Follow up on the performance of designs on the basis of conversion rate and user heat maps

We think you have experience with some of this:

Working in a modern product development organization
Contributing to product discovery
Working with other designers across multiple product teams
Contributing to hypotheses, metrics for success of the designs and follow up their performance on the basis of conversion rate and user heat maps
Create user-centered designs by considering customer feedback, user research and technical constraints/opportunities
Contributing to user research, interviews and testing
Experience creating user flows, wireframes, design mockups, and prototypes to effectively conceptualize new product initiatives
Accessibility and inclusive design
Communicating complex, interactive design concepts in a simple manner
Bachelor-level education, within the design field (industrial, product, digital, service). Can be substituted by similar work experience.

If you have the skills, experience, and drive to juggle these varied responsibilities, we have the right team for you. Aidn has seven product teams at the moment, each with a product manager, a tech lead, a design lead, and other engineers and designers. The UX designer will report to the Director of Design.

Other things to get excited about:

6 weeks of vacation
Work where it suits you, at home or one of our offices in Bergen, Bodø or Oslo. Or maybe all of the above?
Opportunity to take part in our employee share scheme
The opportunity to contribute with your work, to a purpose-driven company

And there’s more! Aidn has the advantage of being a member of the Kernel family, a collection of like-minded companies focused on building the next generation of health services for Norway and beyond. This association gives us access to advisors across the entire healthcare ecosystem, sufficient capital to support the long runways required by our ambitions, and the strategic partnerships needed to realize cooperation across today’s siloed landscape.

We think you are intrigued by this. We believe you want to join us. And we think you know why. We believe you want to put your talents to work for a purpose.

Are you curious? We welcome you to check out our employee handbook to get to know us, some of our benefits, and what drives us.

job_description:
About the job
Are you looking for a unique opportunity to be a part of something great? Want to join a 20,000-member team that works on the technology that powers the world around us? Looking for an atmosphere of trust, empowerment, respect, diversity, and communication? How about an opportunity to own a piece of a multi-billion dollar (with a B!) global organization? We offer all that and more at Microchip Technology, Inc.

People come to work at Microchip because we help design the technology that runs the world. They stay because our culture supports their growth and stability. They are challenged and driven by an incredible array of products and solutions with unlimited career potential. Microchip’s nationally-recognized Leadership Passage Programs support career growth where we proudly enroll over a thousand people annually. We take pride in our commitment to employee development, values-based decision making, and strong sense of community, driven by our Vision, Mission, and 11 Guiding Values; we affectionately refer to it as the Aggregate System and it’s won us countless awards for diversity and workplace excellence.

Our company is built by dedicated team players who love to challenge the status quo; we did not achieve record revenue and over 30 years of quarterly profitability without a great team dedicated to empowering innovation. People like you.

Visit our careers page to see what exciting opportunities and company perks await!

Job Description

The position will be part of the Human Machine Interface Division (HMID) Silicon development department with focus on specification, implementation and verification of the touch controllers needed for the next generation touch products.

Responsibilities Will Include
Digital design and verification at module- and chip-level
Digital IP feasibilities, specification, and documentation
Support of successful product release to mass production
Support other functions with technical expertise: Marketing, Applications, Software and Product/Test.

Contribute to Microchip’s Global Technical development.

Requirements/Qualifications
BSc, MSc or PhD within Electrical Engineering or related fields with acceptable results OR proven record within these fields.
Experience

No experience required.

Preferred Skills
Experienced in digital and/or chip level design and verification.
Experienced in Verilog, TCL, and Python programming languages.
For personal development and other technical skills required for the position Microchip will provide training and a personal development plan.

Special Requirements

Fluent in written and oral English.

Some travel might be required.

What We Can Offer
Stable employment
Good working environment with a skilled workforce
5 weeks of paid vacation (following 1 year of service)
Stock and bonus plans
Employee stock purchase plan
Insurance and pension plan
New and modern office facilities with employee parking, bicycle garage and showers
Well run roof top lunch restaurant with a view
Active social club with regular group activities as well as company-wide events throughout the year, AVR Club
Travel Time

0% - 25%

name_location: KONGSBERG · Kongsberg, Viken, Norway  1 month ago  · 26 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Har du bakgrunn fra systemutvikling, IT/Softwareutvikling, kommunikasjonssystemer, eller nettverk, og har interesse for Security? Vi søker etter medarbeidere som kan bygge seg opp innen System Security eller som har jobbet med dette allerede.

Integrated Defence Systems (IDS) er en divisjon i Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace AS (KDA). Divisjonen jobber internasjonalt med utvikling og leveranse av avanserte forsvarssystemer. Vår spesialitet er systemintegrasjon, datadrevne operasjoner og beslutningsstøtte. Med blant annet luftvern systemer, kampsystem til ubåt, kommando og kontrollsystemer og virtualiserte flykontrolltårn for fjernstyrt flygeledelse er vi en svært interessant og mangfoldig arbeidsplass som også er i vekst.

Systems Engineer –System Security

Avdelingen for Systems Engineering søker etter ingeniører med interesse for System Security. Cyber er et strategisk satsningsområde for KONGSBERG som har etablert et eget KONGSBERG Cyber Security Center (KCSC). Sikkerhet er helt sentralt i våre produkter innen forsvar, autonomi og sivil luftfart.

Som Systems Engineer med fokus på systemsikkerhet vil du jobbe i et tverrfaglig team og i tett samarbeid med leverandører og kunder. Bidra til at systemene vi leverer er blant det ypperste når det gjelder motstandsdyktighet mot cyber-trusselen.

Arbeidsoppgaver

Spesifisere, utvikle og integrere sikkerhetsløsninger og sikkerhetsfilosofier
Planlegge og gjennomføre testing av sikkerhetsløsninger
Utvikle beskyttelsesmekanismer mot cyberangrep i våre systemer
Være en fagperson internt i bedriften og mot kunde/samarbeidspartnere i inn- og utland
Bidra til å videreutvikle prosesser og rutiner internt

Ønsket bakgrunn og erfaring innen et eller flere av områdene:

Bachelor eller Master innen ingeniørfag, eller relevant forsvarsbakgrunn
Interesse for systemsikkerhet (f.eks. informasjonssikkerhet, programvaresikkerhet, sårbarhetsanalyser, nettverk, etc.)
Du jobber allerede med systemutvikling og ønsker å spisse din kompetanse inn mot System Security
Gode muntlige- og skriftlige kommunikasjonsevner, på norsk og engelsk

Vi Kan Tilby

Gode utviklingsmuligheter innen System Security i et internasjonalt selskap med et godt fagmiljø
Interessante og spennende arbeidsoppgaver i et høyteknologisk miljø
Konkurransedyktige betingelser
Gode velferdsordninger med eget treningssenter, hytteutleie og mye mer

Arbeidssted er Kongsberg. Noe reisevirksomhet må påregnes.

Søknader behandles fortløpende

Kandidater som søker på stillingen vil i forbindelse med rekrutteringsprosessen bli gjenstand for bakgrunnssjekk og vurdering av denne vil bli lagt til grunn ved valg av kandidat.

For å være aktuell kandidat til stillingen må du kunne sikkerhetsklareres og autoriseres, jfr. Sikkerhetsloven.

name_location: BillEase · Norway  1 day ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
About the job
First Digital Finance Corporation (FDFC) is a fin-tech company building disruptive and innovative products in retail credit for Southeast Asia.

The company operates BillEase, the top-rated, buy now pay later (BNPL) platform for merchants and their customers in the Philippines with more than 1m downloads.

Vision: Build financial services that delight and enable consumers

Mission: Use software and AI to build financial products that are at least 10x better than the status quo for our customers

The Role

At First Digital Finance Corp, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We will count on our site reliability engineer (SRE) to empower users with a rich feature set, high availability, and stellar performance level to pursue their missions. As we expand customer deployments, we’re seeking an experienced SRE to deliver insights from massive-scale data in real-time. Specifically, we’re searching for someone who has fresh ideas and a unique viewpoint, and who enjoys collaborating with a cross-functional team to develop real-world solutions and positive user experiences for every interaction.

Your Responsibilities Will Include

Run the production environment by monitoring availability and taking a holistic view of system health
Build software and systems to manage platform infrastructure and applications
Improve reliability, quality, and time-to-market of our suite of software solutions
Measure and optimize system performance, with an eye toward pushing our capabilities forward, getting ahead of customer needs, and innovating for continual improvement
Provide primary operational support and engineering for multiple large-scale distributed software applications
Gather and analyze metrics from operating systems as well as applications to assist in performance tuning and fault finding
Partner with development teams to improve services through rigorous testing and release procedures
Participate in system design consulting, platform management, and capacity planning
Create sustainable systems and services through automation and uplift
Balance feature development speed and reliability with well-defined service-level objectives
You must have experience in design/build in AWS, this is a deal stopper, if you don't have

Ideal Profile

Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in computer science or related discipline

About the job
Hitchhiker var i sin tid landets første restaurant som serverte autentisk gatemat, med særlig fokus på alt av snadder fra Øst-Asia.I 10 år holdt vi til i andre etasje på Mathallen. Nå finner du restauranten med en twist i lokalene til Sentralen restaurant i Øvre Slottsgate.

Vi serverer en sammensatt meny spedd med all den kjærligheten vi har for gode råvarer, skikkelig digg mat og asiatisk matkultur. En kulinarisk reise fylt med duftende krydder, fargerike retter og smaker som transporterer deg direkte til asiatiske gatemarkeder venter.

Hos Hitchiker søker vi nå etter en entusiastisk servitør som vil være en verdifull del av vårt team. Vår restaurant er kjent for å servere spennende streetfood, og vi ønsker å finne en person som ikke bare er effektiv og serviceinnstilt, men som også deler vår lidenskap for denne kulinariske opplevelsen. En inspirerende restaurant
En plass til å utvikle seg som servitør

About the job
Job: SRE/Platform Engineer

Location: Oslo

Are you a skilled Platform Engineer/SRE with expertise in AWS infrastructure? We are currently seeking a talented individual to join our team in the exciting world of sports streaming. Our company, a leading provider in this industry, is dedicated to delivering high-quality and immersive sports content to viewers worldwide. With cutting-edge technology and a passion for innovation, we strive to enhance the sports streaming experience for our users.

Must Have
 DevOps mentality / mindset
 Strong understanding of Continuous Delivery (CD) and Continuous Integration (CI) principles; we use GitLab CI.
 Proficiency in Linux, particularly OL8.
 Specialisation in AWS cloud deployments and Infrastructure as Code, including extensive experience with CloudFormation and a wide range of AWS services.
 Proficient scripting skills in Python and Shell.
Nice To Have
 Familiarity with Ansible.
 Experience with Docker.
 Proficiency in Java deployments and related tools such as Maven and POM.
 A success story related to CI/CD practices that you can share.
 A team player who enjoys collaborating in a team environment.
 Knowledge of video streaming and broadcasting.
Tasks
 Be part of a team of platform specialists and work very closely with both our operations/support teams and development teams.
 Work in a hybrid environment, encompassing both cloud and on-premises infrastructure. Our new services are designed to be cloud-native, and we prioritise the use of managed services and serverless technologies to offload operational overhead.
 Maintain and continue development of our deployment tools and processes, with a focus on scalability and security.
 Take ownership of tools/libraries and actively contribute to evolving our system on the AWS stack.
 Opportunity to work on both older and brand new systems/platforms with very large traffic.
Join our team and play a crucial role in revolutionising the way sports content is streamed to viewers. If you are passionate about AWS infrastructure, have experience in video streaming, and thrive in a team-oriented environment, we would love to hear from you.

d.johnston1@jeffersonfrank.com

job_title: Bouvet Vestfold trenger flere dyktige utviklere, arkitekter og techleads!
name_location: Bouvet ASA · Vestfold og Telemark, Norway  1 week ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
Om du brenner for utvikling og vil jobbe med rause og flinke kollegaer er dette sjansen du har ventet på.

Vi jobber med noen av Norges mest fremtredende virksomheter og du kan være med å skape løsninger med stor betydning for enkeltmennesker og for samfunnet.

Hos oss får du jobbe med kunder som tør gi deg ansvar, og kollegaer som ønsker å se deg på ditt beste. Det betyr at du får stor frihet i hverdagen, at du kan være deg selv – og at du blir utfordret og satt krav til.

Hvem er du?

Vi ser etter deg med en lidenskap for å programmere. Du har minst 3 års erfaring og er sulten på ny kunnskap.

Du trives godt som fullstack utvikler eller så er du spesielt god på enten backend eller frontend.

Du har erfaring med Java eller .Net, og skyløsninger - primært Microsoft Azure.

Du kan designe gode løsninger basert på riktig teknologi i forhold til kundens behov og krav.

Kompetanseutvikling er viktig for deg, og du liker å dele dine erfaringer med andre. Vi jobber hele tiden med å utvikle oss for å kunne tilby kundene våre fremtidsrettede og robuste løsninger.

Du må kunne kommunisere og skrive godt på norsk.

Bouvet tilbyr deg mer enn en arbeidsplass

Faglig utvikling og mulighet til å påvirke egen hverdag

Hos oss er du ikke alene. Vi gir vi deg tett faglig oppfølging og mulighet til å delta i faglige fellesskap og -arrangementer i egen og andres regi. Vi legger gode opplæringsløp sammen med deg, og gir deg mulighet til å påvirke hva slags prosjekter du deltar i og hva slags roller du har i dem, slik at du kan utvikle deg i den retningen du vil.

Spennende kunder og viktige prosjekter

Hos oss får du oppgaver som er faglig utfordrende, i prosjekter som veldig ofte påvirker langt flere enn oppdragsgiveren. Vi hjelper kort sagt noen av Norges største private og offentlige bedrifter med å utvikle digitale løsninger som gjør hverdagen bedre.

Vi jobber sammen

Derfor har vi ikke prestasjonsbasert lønn og individuelle bonuser, men gir heller alle ansatte en fast, god lønn knyttet til stillingen sin. Vi har dessuten aksjeprogram, overskuddsdeling og gode pensjonsordninger som til sammen utgjør gode tilskudd til lønnen.

Bli med oss når vi går foran og bygger fremtidens samfunn

Ta kontakt for en uforpliktende prat for å høre mer om hva vi kan tilby eller send inn søknad via 'Søk på Stillingen'.

Etter ansettelse vil en tredje parts bakgrunnssjekk gjennomføres. Dette er en verifisering av de opplysninger som gis i rekrutteringsprosessen. Bakgrunnssjekken er tilpasset stillingens krav og gjennomføres etter søkerens samtykke.

job_description:
About the job
Note: while this is a non-paid, volunteer role, it can provide you with valuable experience for your resume and references from our organization if you are successful.

The Educational Equality Institute, an NGO based in Norway committed to educating and thereby empowering disadvantaged girls.

In response to the war in Ukraine, we started the project: “Together for Ukraine”.

Free educational programs where we, together with our partners, will help 100.000 Ukrainians shape their future through education, upskilling, and employment.

We are seeking a talented and experienced UI/UX Designer to join our team who will play a crucial role in creating outstanding user interfaces.

Role Scope

Analyzing requirements and developing well-structured UI design specifications
Creating and implementing innovative UI concepts that align with project goals
Prototyping and validating ideas in the early stages of product development
Designing visually appealing layouts and graphic elements to enhance user experience
Collaborating closely with developers to ensure high-quality UI implementation

Requirements

Proven experience as a UI Designer with a strong portfolio showcasing your work
Experience working collaboratively in a team environment to deliver high-quality design solutions
Hands-on experience in Figma
Solid understanding of user-centered design principles and best practices
Experience with prototyping tools and user testing methodologies
Strong visual design skills with a keen eye for detail
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with developers and stakeholders
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
Good spoken/written level of English

At TEEI, we offer a range of exciting opportunities for volunteers to make a real impact.

As a volunteer, you can expect:

Remote and flexible scheduling: We only require a minimum of 6 hours of work per week, and you can choose when to work based on your schedule and availability
The chance to join a highly motivated multinational team: You'll work alongside other passionate individuals from around the world, all dedicated to making a positive difference in Ukraine
The opportunity to influence the daily lives and future of Ukrainians: By contributing to TEEI's projects, you'll be helping to shape the future of Ukraine and make a tangible impact on the lives of its people
Creative freedom and the ability to acquire new skills: We encourage our volunteers to think outside the box and come up with innovative solutions to the challenges we face. As a result, you'll have the opportunity to develop new skills and broaden your experience in a supportive and collaborative environment
Great networking and educational opportunities: By working with TEEI, you'll have the chance to connect with other professionals in your field and learn from their experiences and expertise
Job meaningfulness and tangible results: Above all, volunteering with TEEI is a chance to make a meaningful difference in the world and see the tangible results of your efforts

name_location: Sandvik Coromant · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  3 days ago  · 3 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Our sensorized tools and software are used globally to increase efficiency and sustainability in production processes. We strive to deliver a consistently high quality, and with our expanding product portfolio, automation of software and hardware testing is key to maintain quick release cycles and high quality.

We are looking for 1-2 students with skills within software development for an exciting summer job in 2024!

Sandvik Coromant is leading the industry in developing sensorized tools, applying sensor measurement and software technology to help our customers’ machine better products, with less environmental impact. We believe this to be a key enabler for a more automated, and more sustainable future within metal cutting processes.

As part of your work, you will need to work closely with our software development team to create a test-plan, and identify suitable technology to automate the testing itself, and then implement some of the automated tests. You will be working both together with our software team and individually.

We are looking for tech-savvy and quick learning students with some coding experience or interest. Having a positive attitude and working well in a team is a great benefit. We think work should be serious fun!

We can offer a great work environment, the opportunity to directly impact our software and our customers’ experience, and a broad technical competence in our team to hang out with and learn from.

The summer job period is from early June until mid-August, but the selected students will be invited to spend a few hours per month with us to get to know the team and the task during the spring and be well prepared for summer. We go on vacation week 29 and 30 and expect you to do the same.

Are you still interested? Apply then! Write a little about yourself, what you study, what your talents are and why we should choose you for this project.

Application deadline: 17.november 2023

Job ID: R0060410

Sandvik Coromant Trondheim er en del av næringslivsprosjektet Workation i Trondheim som tilbyr et unikt sommerprogram for alle studentene som får jobb i de 20 deltakerbedriftene. Sommeren 2023 var vi blant annet på Høyt & Lavt klatrepark, Escape Room og ølsmaking på ØX. Alt dette er gratis for deg som student! Dette sommerprogrammet er en god mulighet til å bli kjent med nye mennesker på tvers av bedriftene og få venner for livet. Vi og Workation skal sørge for at du får en uforglemmelig sommer her i Trondheim!

name_location: Strawberry (formerly Nordic Choice Hotels) · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  1 week ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
Det er en grunn til at det er akkurat du som ønsker å jobbe i Strawberry. Du ser muligheter på våre 100 destinasjoner. Du tror du vil passe inn i vårt mangfold blant 18.000 ansatte. Du er spent på våre fantastiske hotellkjeder og du har energi, mot og begeistring så det holder. Vil du vite mer om oss? Vi gleder oss til å høre fra deg! Quality Hotel™ er en del av Strawberry.

Quality Hotel™ Augustin er et av byens mest sentrale hotell, og ligger midt på Trondheim Torg.

Hos oss bor gjestene midt i byen, og får servert en veldig god frokost. I tillegg er konferanser og middager / selskaper en viktig del av tilbudet vårt.

Da en av våre servicehelter har fått ny stilling internt i bedriften, søker vi nå etter ny stjerne til vår resepsjon og konferanseavdeling.

Frem til 1.januar er stillingen tilkalling i resepsjon, og kurs/konferanse avdelingen.

I 2024 er stillingen et 20% vikariat (annen hver helg), med gode muligheter for ekstravakter.

Hos oss blir du ansatt i resepsjonen, men kan hjelpe til der det trengs. Vi er et lite team, og hjelper hverandre på kryss av avdelinger. Noen av arbeidsoppgavene er innsjekk, utsjekk, forberede ankomstlister, besvare tlf, bookinger, barsalg og sørge for at våre gjester er fornøyde.

Arbeidstid vil i hovedsak være annen hver helg, dag og kveld. Ekstravakter ved behov.

For at dette skal bli en bra match:

Du må være fylt 20 år (på grunn av barsalg)
Hos oss er både gjester og kolleger viktig, og du er en god lagspiller
Fleksibel
Har du kunnskap i vårt bookingsystem Mews oppfordrer vi deg til å søke, men det er ingen krav. Opplæring vil bli gitt. 
Du snakker og skriver flytende norsk eller et annet skandinavisk språk i tillegg til engelsk.

name_location: Capgemini Invent · Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 44 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Er du en ambisiøs og engasjert student med interesse i en karriere innen management consulting? Har du lyst til å være med å påvirke og optimalisere selskaper, løse utfordringer og skape verdi for våre kunder både nasjonalt og internasjonalt? Gjennom Capgemini Invent får du muligheten til å bli en del av vår organisasjon – en ledende global aktør innen consulting, teknologi, og digital endring. Vil du vite mer om hva en fremtid med oss betyr? Capgemini Invent tilbyr et summer internship for talentfulle masterstudenter som har ett til to semestre igjen av sin utdanning. Nå søker vi flinke studenter til våre kontorer i Oslo, Stavanger og Bergen!
Stillingsbeskrivelse
Et summer internship hos Capgemini Invent vil gi deg unik innsikt i hvordan det er å jobbe som en management consultant hos oss. Gjennom syv uker vil du få muligheten til å jobbe med et team bestående av erfarne konsulenter på strategiske eller operasjonelle prosjekter for våre klienter. Som medlem av prosjekt-teamet vil du lære om våre metoder og verktøy, og få verdifull erfaring til å bruke disse på et av våre pågående eller sommerprosjekter med våre kunder. Dette er også en unik mulighet for oss til å oppdage potensielle fremtidige talenter for vår organisasjon. Som summer intern i Capgemini Invent vil du jobbe på tvers av våre fagområder og industrier i løpet av din prosjekttid hos oss.
Våre industrier:
· Banking & Insurance
· Consumer, Products & Retail
· Energy & Utilities
· Manufacturing
· Telecom
· Public Services
Som summer intern vil du kunne utfordre og utvikle deg selv, både personlig og profesjonelt, i et sosialt og omgjengelig arbeidsmiljø. Et strukturert program vil gi deg muligheten til å skape verdi for våre klienter, samt forsikre deg om at du får det beste ut av tiden din hos oss. Du vil også bli kjent med våre konsulenter i uformelle settinger på flere sosiale arrangementer gjennom sommeren.
Hva vi ser etter Vi er først og fremst på utkikk etter 4. års studenter med sterke akademiske resultater, utmerkede kommunikasjonsevner, og god norsk språkforståelse (minimum level C1). Vi ser etter kandidater som er nysgjerrige og motiverte for en karriere innen management consulting og et ønske om å lære mer om hvordan det er å jobbe for Capgemini Invent. Vi vil også vurdere 3. års studenter som viser eksepsjonell motivasjon og virker til å ha en god personlig match for vårt summer internship.
Hva vi kan tilby
· Spennende prosjekter med ekte klienter
· Veiledning og oppfølging fra erfarne konsulenter
· Utfordrende oppgaver i en morsomt og trygt arbeidsmiljø
· Sosiale arrangementer
· Muligheten til å erfare det å jobbe som konsulent hos Capgemini Invent
· Muligheten til å vise dine evner og motivasjon for å potensielt jobbe som en konsulent i fremtiden
Interessert? Slik søker du!
Som en del av søknaden ønsker vi at du legger ved motivasjonsbrev, CV, sertifiserte karakterutskrifter fra videregående skole, bachelor og påbegynt master. Du velger selv om du vil skrive ditt søknadsbrev på norsk eller engelsk. Bruk gjerne karakterutskrifter fra ‘Vitnemålsportalen’ om du har studert ved et universitet i Norge.
Ikke gå glipp av muligheten til å bygge et fantastisk nettverk, samt utvikle dine evner i Management Consulting – Søk nå!
Fristen for å søke er 12.november. Veien videre deretter er en Assessment Day i våre lokaler i Oslo, Stavanger og Bergen.
Om du har noen spørsmål kan du ta kontakt med oss via e-post: cginvent.no@capgemini.com

About the job
Are you finishing your studies next spring and looking to kickstart your career? In AutoStore we are now accepting applications for next year’s Graduates! We are looking for highly engaged and self-driven graduates who seek new exciting opportunities and are intrigued by a multidisciplinary and innovative work environment. 

AutoStore is the pioneer of cube engineered storage systems and is constantly evolving as a company. We are changing the way goods and services are stored across the globe, and are pushing borders to increase efficiency, safety and develop new products for our customers. Amongst our close to 1000 employees, there are around 350 people working in AutoStore in Norway, divided across our headquarter in Nedre Vats and our offices in Oslo and Stavanger.

By becoming a part of Norway’s first Unicorn, you will not only get to work on developing new, unique and world-leading products, but you will also become a part of the AutoStore family that values creativity, flexibility and our core values; lean, transparent & bold.

We are looking for talents across different disciplines for possibly Oslo, Haugesund, Stavanger and Nedre Vats.

The departments we are interested in Graduates for is:

R&D (like Mechanics/Machine, Electronics, Software, firmware, and Product compliance and product testing)
IT: Data Science/Analytics/AI/ML

Show your interest by registering your CV and application as soon as possible.

Feel free to also attach relevant certificates and diplomas.

All inquiries are treated confidentially.

We will contact relevant candidates ongoingly.

name_location: Jefferson Frank · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  6 days ago  · 5 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are looking for a developer who is interested to work with Golang to join the team in Oslo!

You will work on an open source platform which aims to allow the collection, sharing, and analysis of data to help customers in agriculture make better decisions

Through a combination of deep technical knowledge, talented developers, and domain experts, we seek to become a global leader in cloud based applications, data, and IoT for the farming and food production industry

We are now looking to expand the development environment where you will work together with backend & frontend developers and designers to help create new digital solutions, as well as continue to build on our existing product base

Your Role And Responsibilities Can Include
 Developing and implementing solutions according to specifications and the overall strategy
 Writing clean, quality and maintainable code, and participate in code-reviews
 Working alongside developers, architects and product owners to deliver solutions according to best practice
We Are Looking For You To Bring
 Professional experience in backend development, preferably with Java or Golang
 Experience with cloud services, preferably AWS
 Experience working with devops principles
 Curiosity and willingness to learn new technologies
What's in it for you?

The opportunity to be part of creating technology which contributes towards sustainable development in agriculture

There is a casual yet professional working environment with lots of opportunities for learning - both hands-on with new tools as well as courses, certifications and through industry events

Flexitime and hybrid working options are offered as standard, with a modern office space in central Oslo which most colleagues attend a couple of days per week

We welcome a knowledge-sharing and collaborative culture where colleagues can express themselves, share new information, and contribute towards decision making at all levels

For any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@frankgroup.com

name_location: BNP Paribas CIB · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  6 months ago  · 784 applicants
job_description:
About the job
BNP Paribas is a European leader in banking and financial services, with a significant and growing international presence. The Group has one of the largest international banking networks, a presence in 73 countries and nearly 198 000 employees, working in three main business areas: Retail Banking, International Financial Services and Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB). BNP Paribas is recognized as a market leader in each of these areas.

BNP Paribas has been present in the Nordic region since 1985 and counts today 700 employees. The region is strategic for the Group and has been identified as a key development area.

Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB) is a worldwide organization within the BNP Paribas Group and in the Nordics we are present in Copenhagen, Helsinki, Oslo and Stockholm. We are currently experiencing growth in several areas of activity and have been recruiting a number of new talents to join our exciting organization.

We have recently hired people in roles such as Analyst, Associate, Relationship Manager, Investment Banker, Compliance Officer, Legal counsel, IT and KYC specialist amongst others. We welcome open applications from high performing individuals with experience in these and other banking related roles. Maybe you will be our next new colleague?

We can offer you a dynamic organization with approximately 150 enthusiastic and hard-working colleagues within the Nordic CIB organization, as well as interaction with colleagues across Europe and beyond. You find a number of the largest Nordic companies and financial institutions amongst our clients, as well as a number of non-Nordic multinational companies.

We can promise you a fast-paced and exciting development opportunity, while we hope you will bring strong interpersonal skills, a proven track record in your field of study/experience and a willingness to help us succeed in our ambitious growth targets.

Primary Location

NO-3-Oslo

Job Type

Standard / Permanent

Job

CUSTOMER RELATIONSHIP MANAGEMENT

Education Level

Bachelor Degree or equivalent (>= 3 years)

Experience Level

At least 1 year

Schedule

Full-time

Entity

BNP Paribas CIB

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 141 applicants
job_description:
About the job
The role of a Product Designer at Canonical

With Ubuntu, Canonical created the first Linux for human beings. Our design team is on a mission to turn complex, open-source software into intuitive products that can change the face of enterprise IT. We are looking for an exceptional Product Designer, who shares our passion.

Our mission is to make enterprise-grade open source software, applications and services available to people everywhere. We create world-renowned software, impacting the lives of millions of engineers, enterprises, entrepreneurs and consumers every day. Our multi-disciplinary web design and production team includes visual designers, UX designers, front-end and back-end developers to bring exciting web projects to life. We help and learn from each other and strive to improve our work and processes.

We make enterprise-grade open source available to people everywhere. We are looking for an expert Product Designer who is fluent in current design thinking, with an appetite for technology and innovation, and who is looking to bring the Ubuntu and Canonical brands to life across events, offices as well as digital and social assets. As a multi-disciplined designer, you will deliver exceptionally crafted and creative work in response to the business design needs.

This role sits in the design team reporting to the design manager - brand & marketing.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What will your day look like

We create world-renowned software, impacting the lives of millions of engineers, enterprises, entrepreneurs and consumers every day. Our design team works in a multi-disciplinary environment with visual designers, UX designers, front-end and back-end engineers to bring exciting web projects to life. We help and learn from each other and constantly strive to improve our work and processes.

Product Designers at Canonical have a vital role in the success of Ubuntu, our partners, customers and the larger Ubuntu community. Clear, stylish presentation that aids the user experience of our products is how we raise the bar and reach the widest audience. Real content and information will be at the core of the designs you produce. You know the ins and outs of typography, colour and layout, and you care deeply about usability, accessibility and web standards. You should have agency, company or freelance design experience.

Read more about the design team

What we are looking for in you

Excellent academic results at school and university
Bachelor's or equivalent in Art /Design
Exceptional design talent with experience in branding, including visual identities, brand experiences…
Knowledge and passion for user experience, technology and design
Commitment to continuous learning and improvement - curious, flexible, scientific
Engagement with the latest design research and innovation
Knowledge of InDesign, Illustrator, and Figma Photoshop

What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.

Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events 

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer 

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

job_title: Jobb som backend-utvikler i vårt unike tech-miljø!
name_location: Bouvet ASA · Stavanger, Rogaland, Norway  3 months ago  · 11 applicants
job_description:
About the job
I Stavanger har Bouvet regionens største utviklingsmiljø. Nå trenger vi flere dedikerte utviklere med engasjement og interesse for moderne teknologi. Vi jobber med Norges mest spennende virksomheter og sammen skaper vi digitale løsninger med stor betydning for enkeltmennesker og samfunnet.

Om du brenner for utvikling og vil jobbe med rause og flinke kollegaer er dette sjansen du har ventet på! Hos oss får du jobbe med kunder som tør å gi deg ansvar, og kollegaer som ønsker å se deg på ditt beste. Det betyr at du får stor frihet i hverdagen, at du kan være deg selv og at du blir utfordret.

Vi er ikke et typisk konsulentselskap. Vi har fantastiske lokaler i Jåttåvågen som huser mange av våre ansatte. Vi jobber i team og leverer ofte rene teamleveranser fra vårt kontor. I det yrende fagmiljøet vårt vil du alltid ha noen å sparre med. Deling er en av grunnverdiene våre, så erfaringer og kunnskap deler vi gledelig med hverandre.

Ønskede kvalifikasjoner

Vi leter etter en kandidat som liker å holde seg oppdatert med de nyeste trender innenfor backend-utvikling, og som har en naturlig nysgjerrighet og interesse for å finne mer ut av, eller å utforske nye ideer og konsepter.

Du har helst noen år bak tastaturet, og solid kunnskap fra utvikling innenfor .NET eller tilsvarende. Du kjenner godt til hvordan du designer og utvikler API-er ved hjelp av disse teknologiene.

Det viktig at du også er sulten på å utforske nye teknologier og være med å sette kursen videre i Bouvet. Du må kunne skrive og snakke flytende norsk eller engelsk. Høyere utdanning innen IT er en fordel, men ikke et krav dersom du har lengre relevant erfaring.

Du bør ha kunnskap om flere av disse områdene:

C#, Java
.NET, Spring Boot
Sikkerhet og autentisering
CI/CD, DevOps eller DevSecOps
Microsoft Azure, alternativt Google Cloud eller AWS
Applikasjonsarkitektur for skalerbare og vedlikeholdbare løsninger

Vi Verdsetter Også Følgende Generelle Kvalifikasjoner

God kunnskap om databasehåndtering og erfaring med SQL og ORM rammeverk som Entity Framework eller Hibernate.
Sterk problemløsningskompetanse og evne til å tenke analytisk for å finne effektive løsninger på komplekse utfordringer.
Evne til å arbeide effektivt både selvstendig og som en del av et team, med god kommunikasjon og samarbeidsevner.

Bouvet-livet vårt byr på

Kontinuerlig kompetanseutvikling, faggrupper, kurs og spennende prosjekter
Tverrfaglig samarbeid
Overskuddsdeling
Aksjeprogram
Sertifiseringsbonus
Flunka ny mobiltelefon
God pensjon, helseforsikring og bedriftshelsetjeneste
Nettverk for erfarne utviklere/arkitekter samt nyutdannede
Bredt aktivitetstilbud med egne «sportsministre»
Treningsavtaler og treningsrom på kontoret
Firmahytte
Sosiale turer
Feiring av små og store begivenheter
God balanse mellom jobb og fritid
Trygg arbeidsplass

Hva betyr mest for deg? Vår gulrotindeks er et supert sted å utforske hva vi tilbyr: https://www.bouvet.no/bli-en-av-oss

Det viktigste er til syvende og sist at Bouvet-livet skal være godt å leve. Du kan lese mye mer om hvordan det er å være ansatt hos oss i vår Ansattes Årsrapport her

Hvis du føler deg hjemme i et dynamisk og innovativt arbeidsmiljø, og hvis du ønsker å jobbe med spennende og utfordrende prosjekter innenfor backend-utvikling, kan du være den vi leter etter. Søk nå og bli en del av team som alltid har fokus på å være oppdatert og relevant innenfor utvikling. Høres det interessant ut? Du trenger ikke skrive en lang søknad. Kanskje du ikke er klar for å søke enda, men er interessert i å vite litt mer. Ta gjerne kontakt for en uformell prat om muligheter.

Eneste måten å leve i den fremtiden man ønsker er å bygge den selv.

Bli med oss og gjør akkurat det!

Kontaktperson

Eivind Mikkelsen

Enhetsleder

+47 47463249

eivind.mikkelsen@bouvet.no

job_title: Product Manager Bootcamp and Project Work (remote -part-time)
name_location: Moyyn · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  6 days ago  · 5 applicants
job_description:
About the job
If you are a student, graduate or career change aspirant, and you are missing out on the skills to work in your dream job, this bootcamp is for you. Get trained and work on hands-on projects in our bootcamp to upskill yourself!

Program: 4 weeks training certification, and project work at our German AI startup – Moyyn

What you will get from this program?

– Four weeks hands-on training and projects – in a German AI startup

– Learn and work – directly with founders and potential clients from Germany

– Do practical group Project work and build up experience in product management

Modules

Hands-on training and projects:

Get trained directly from the Chief Product Officer of Moyyn and get hands-on training and projects

– Build your own MVP – including Lean Product Canva

– Create a product requirement document

– Customer feedback analysis and interviews

– Conduct market landscape research

– Create data-driven feedback processes

Product Management Training

8 hours training by experienced product managers incl. guest speakers from Europe

– Fundamentals of Product Management

– Lean startup methodology

– Pivoting principle

– Minimum Viable Product

– Market research methodology

– Ideal Customer Profile

– Product-market fit

– SCRUM methodology

– Product Management Tools

Career Guidance

Get guidance on how to land a job in Germany

– Career sessions

– Job search platforms intro

– CV preparation

– Cover letter preparation

– Interview tips

Benefits Of Attending Our Program

– Comprehensive Skill Development: The program will equip you with the essential skills and knowledge required to excel in a career as a product manager. You will learn about product strategy, market analysis, user research, product development, and cross-cultural communication, among other relevant topics. This comprehensive skill development can enhance your effectiveness in managing products in a global context.

– Cross-Cultural Communication: Global product managers need to effectively communicate and collaborate with stakeholders from different cultures and backgrounds. The program can enhance your cross-cultural communication skills, enabling you to navigate cultural nuances, build strong relationships, and overcome language and communication barriers in a global product management role.

– Industry Best Practices: The program will provide insights into industry best practices and the latest trends in global product management. You will learn from experienced founders who can share real-world examples, case studies, and practical strategies that can enhance your decision-making and problem-solving abilities.

– Networking Opportunities: We offer a valuable networking platform, allowing you to connect with other aspiring or experienced global product managers. You can exchange ideas, share experiences, and build a professional network that may open doors to future collaborations, job opportunities, or mentorship.

– Career Advancement: By attending the program, you can expand your skill set and knowledge base, making yourself a more valuable asset in the job market. The program can enhance your career prospects by demonstrating your commitment to professional development and your ability to adapt to the demands of a global product management role.

– Practical Application: The program includes interactive exercises, group discussions, and case studies that provide hands-on training and projects in applying global product management principles. This practical application can deepen your understanding and enable you to translate theoretical concepts into actionable strategies in real-world scenarios.

– Potential Job Opportunities: This often serve as a pathway to future job opportunities within the same organization or industry. Companies frequently hire interns who have demonstrated their skills, passion, and fit within the organization, making it a potential stepping stone to secure full-time employment in Product Management roles.

– Resume Building: Completing the program in Product Management adds significant value to your resume. It demonstrates practical experience in a specific area of product development and showcases your commitment to professional development. This experience can make you stand out to potential employers when seeking full-time employment in Product Management roles.

A Bootcamp is an intensive training program where you will learn skills, tools, and technologies to tackle the needs of a job market. In addition to theoretical knowledge, you will mainly take part in working on hands-on projects which are from real startups which provide you with experience. Bootcamp is a skill certification program.

name_location: Remoted · Moss, Viken, Norway  1 month ago  · 44 applicants
job_description:
About the job
on-site 100% in Moss, Norway / contract of employment

Targeted start date: Immediately

The business was established to develop androids with useful, practical uses in the workplace. The business expanded from its Norwegian headquarters to a global organization with offices in Dallas, San Francisco, and Oslo.

As they get ready for the next stage of our quick expansion and shift more of our attention to the NEO bipedal model, the company is now prepared to enter the global market. While constructing a future in which androids may assist humans every day, all over the world, the company is now hiring the world's finest talent in the field. Along with announcing its Series A2 fundraising round, led by the industry's foremost authority on artificial intelligence, OpenAI, the firm will be the first to deploy a fleet of our EVE androids for use in night patrols in the commercial sector this year. These are significant affirmations of the organization's credibility as a reliable digital company ready to have an international influence.

You will create real-time controls, estimating, and planning algorithms as a Robotics Controls Engineer for the company in order to apply our robot to a variety of behaviors and settings. You will collaborate with other software and controls engineers every day to conceptualize, carry out, and test the algorithms required to accomplish this. Get ready to interact with our cutting-edge hardware since, in our eyes, if it doesn't work on a robot, it doesn't work. You must be highly analytical, have a strong drive for action and advancement, and be driven to have a good impact on the robotics industry in order to succeed in this position.

What makes this job exciting?

Each day is unique! When you do, you'll

work in a developing sector and influence the direction of humanoid robots
directing a small team of talented and driven controls engineers in the design and development of cutting-edge controls and planning algorithms.
use our humanoid robots to test and deploy your software.
collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of professionals in a supportive environment.

In the first month you will...

Get to know our humanoid system's controls and autonomy stack by learning the fundamentals of it.

In three months...

You possess independence and the capacity to make autonomous contributions to the controls stack.

In a year, you will...

Become a major player in advancing the development of our robot's more effective, reliable, and secure locomotion for a variety of situations and behaviors prosper in a welcoming, encouraging, and international culture.

Responsibilities

Create and implement algorithms for legged humanoid robot controls, motion planning, and state estimation.
Utilize our robots to test and refine your algorithms.
Give application and production engineers documentation.
Create code that is incredibly dependable, tested, and manageable for humanoid robots that are used in real-world applications.
Follow the most recent developments in legged robots motion planning and controls.

Requirements

Must-Haves

a master's degree in robotics, computer science, mechanical or electrical engineering, or a related field.
good command of linear algebra, controls, dynamical systems, and rigid body dynamics
quick learning and independent problem-solving abilities
capable of programming in Object-Oriented C++ in a Linux development environment.
knowledge of current source control, testing, and software development processes
strong written and verbal communication abilities

Nice-To-Haves

knowledge of ROS2, C++, Java, Unity/C#, Python, and DDS
practical knowledge of creating and debugging real-time software systems on a physical robotic platform, ideally with whole-body controls, estimation, or planning algorithms
model Predictive Control training, dynamics and controls education, numerical optimization, modeling dynamic systems, or system identification experience
contributions made to the robotics community through a thesis, books, articles, talks at conferences, or open source initiatives
a working knowledge of the Linux development environment
