job_title: Summer Internship 2024 – Automation, Robotics, Optimization & Control
name_location: Equinor · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  1 day ago  · 5 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Overview

 Job ID- 26619 
 Country- Norway 
 Location(s)- Stavanger, Oslo, Bergen, Trondheim, Kårstø, Sture&Kollsnes, Hammerfest, Tjeldbergodden, Mongstad 
 Company- Equinor ASA 
 Contact Name- internships@equinor.com 
 Workplace- Onshore 
 Discipline- Project Development 
 Education Preferred- Bachelor or Master's degree 
 Experience Preferred- Less than 2 years 
 Closing Date- Nov 13 2023 

Job Description

As a summer intern at Equinor, you will join 22,000 colleagues delivering oil, gas, wind, and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. By 2050, we aim to become a net-zero company and provide the energy the world needs without contributing to global warming. It is one of the defining challenges of our time, and attracting and developing the brightest minds will be critical to our success.

The position

Our summer internship is a 6-week programme designed to provide the experience and skills you need in your studies and future career. Our Norwegian and UK internship will begin on 17 June and ends on 02 August 2024, with one week off starting 15 July.

You can find out more about the programme at www.equinor.com/careers/summer-interns

Automation, robotics, optimization & control are essential to control and monitor our facilities safely and to ensure efficient operations & production in Equinor. These subject areas are a key enabler for our digital future as we develop towards remotely operated and more autonomous facilities. Plus, these areas contribute to Equinor's transition towards a low-carbon future by supporting our effort to reduce carbon emissions from oil & gas production; and by accelerating the use & development of low-carbon solutions such as electrification and carbon capture & storage.

Fields within the discipline-

Automation, Cybernetics & Robotics
Software development, data science and analytics
Technology development, qualification, and implementation 
Control and process optimisation 

By joining our team within Automation, robotics, optimization & control, you may have the opportunity to-

Accelerate the use of robots and drones within Equinor through software development, technology qualification, implementation, simulation, testing, and integration of robotic solutions.
Proactively address the opportunities enabled by automation and digitalisation to improve the digital mindset and competency within the organisation.
Follow up automation and process development toward major Equinor projects within electrification and oil & gas.
Aid in digitalisation and development of laboratories and facilities for the future.
Support assets in production optimization and energy efficiency through proactive debottlenecking, simulator support and monitoring.

Your exact assignment will be decided based on our business needs combined with your field of expertise and interests.

Equinor is focusing on digitalization; an interest in programming/scripting could be advantageous for some positions.

You

Some qualities are essential for Equinor. You identify with our values, open, collaborative, courageous and caring, which guide our decisions and help us succeed and grow. You make safety your priority and contribute to our zero-harm culture. For this position, we are also looking for-

 Currently studying for Bachelor’s, Master’s degree, or Ph.D. with a strong academic record
 Fluent in English and preferably a second working language.
 No more than two years of relevant full-time work experience.
 Have completed at least two years of higher education before the internship programme starts (17 June 2024).
 Have at least one year of higher education left after the internship programme ends (02 August 2024).
 The interns need to be located in the country where the internship takes place during its entire duration. Equinor does not support any relocation for our summer interns.
 Candidates must have the necessary work permit for the country in which they are applying for a position. The work permits must be valid at the point of application and for the duration of the employment. Please note that Equinor does not support, or sponsor work or visa permits for internship applications. Read more about it on the national authorities’ pages-
 Extracurricular activities and/or voluntary work are an advantage.

Every role and business area requires its own specific set of skills and personal attributes. Some of the qualities and characteristics we look for include-

 An awareness of risk and a commitment to safety for yourself and those around you.
 Effective communication skills and the ability to facilitate collaboration, influence stakeholders, and contribute to a diverse and inclusive culture.
 The flexibility to adapt to change, embrace new technology, and perform in a digitally enabled environment.
 Demonstrating a curious mind and the ability to problem-solve, innovate, and identify new ways of delivering against our objectives.

Equinor is an equal opportunities employer. We welcome applications from all candidates who meet the educational and experience requirements, including those with disabilities. If you have any specific requirements for any stage in our process, please make this clear in your application, and our team will be happy to support you.

General information

Please make sure that when applying, you attach the following-

 CV/ resume in English
 transcripts of records (or other documents describing subjects and grades) in English or Scandinavian language obtained to this point during your studies. If you are in the process of completing a degree, please upload an official temporary transcript.

Applications submitted without these attachments will unfortunately not be evaluated. To ensure an efficient recruitment process, please be informed that you may apply for a maximum of 3 Summer Internship roles per country.

Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process. Candidates will be asked for information on affiliation to high-risk countries for a security assessment. Furthermore, background checks are performed on all final candidates and all permanent and temporary hires will be screened against relevant sanctions lists to ensure compliance with sanctions law.

Why join us?

The summer internship is an opportunity for you to get to know Equinor, our people and culture, and the way we work. You will work on various tasks and projects that will provide value for you and Equinor. You can also expect-

Hands-on experienceYou will spend roughly 80% of your internship working on tasks and projects within the discipline you have applied for, giving you first-hand experience of your team's strategy, processes, and culture. Interns will spend the remaining 20% on learning experiences and a group project.

Learning and developmentYou will join a series of learning sessions that provide an overview of our business and introduce you to some of the processes we use at Equinor. These will include introductions to key areas of our strategy and learning opportunities covering various professional skills that will help you in your future career.

Multi-disciplinary projectYou will work on a group project with other interns from various academic backgrounds, guided and supported by an experienced employee. Over the course of this project, you will develop critical skills such as collaboration, leadership, communication, presentation, planning, and time management.

A balanced and rewarding work cultureOur interns have the same opportunities to work flexibly as the rest of our employees, allowing you to balance work with the things that matter away from the office. We also recognize that your internship is an opportunity to build lifelong relationships and networks. We encourage all our interns to take advantage of this.

For more information, visit Equinor's website www.equinor.com/careers/summer-interns

job_title: Summer Internship 2024 – Automation, Robotics, Optimization & Control
name_location: Energy Jobline · Hammerfest, Troms og Finnmark, Norway  4 days ago  · 4 applicants
job_description:
About the job
As a summer intern at Equinor, you will join 22,000 colleagues delivering oil, gas, wind, and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. By 2050, we aim to become a net-zero company and provide the energy the world needs without contributing to global warming. It is one of the defining challenges of our time, and attracting and developing the brightest minds will be critical to our success.

The position

Our summer internship is a 6-week programme designed to provide the experience and skills you need in your studies and future career. Our Norwegian and UK internship will begin on 17 June and ends on 02 August 2024, with one week off starting 15 July.

You can find out more about the programme at www.equinor.com/careers/summer-interns

Automation, robotics, optimization & control are essential to control and monitor our facilities safely and to ensure efficient operations & production in Equinor. These subject areas are a key enabler for our digital future as we develop towards remotely operated and more autonomous facilities. Plus, these areas contribute to Equinor's transition towards a low-carbon future by supporting our effort to reduce carbon emissions from oil & gas production; and by accelerating the use & development of low-carbon solutions such as electrification and carbon capture & storage.

Fields Within The Discipline

Automation, Cybernetics & Robotics
Software development, data science and analytics
Technology development, qualification, and implementation 
Control and process optimisation 

By joining our team within Automation, robotics, optimization & control, you may have the opportunity to:

Accelerate the use of robots and drones within Equinor through software development, technology qualification, implementation, simulation, testing, and integration of robotic solutions.
Proactively address the opportunities enabled by automation and digitalisation to improve the digital mindset and competency within the organisation.
Follow up automation and process development toward major Equinor projects within electrification and oil & gas.
Aid in digitalisation and development of laboratories and facilities for the future.
Support assets in production optimization and energy efficiency through proactive debottlenecking, simulator support and monitoring.

Your exact assignment will be decided based on our business needs combined with your field of expertise and interests.

Equinor is focusing on digitalization; an interest in programming/scripting could be advantageous for some positions.

job_title: Graduate & Young Professional Analyses and Design Engineer
name_location: Aker Solutions · Bergen, Vestland, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 21 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Do you want to play a role in solving global energy challenges for future generations?

At Aker Solutions we are committed to helping the energy industry and broader society #PowerTheChange towards a low-carbon future.Our ambitions are high. By 2030, renewables and low-carbon solutions for oil and gas will make up two-thirds of our business. Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?

The Life Cycle segment takes care of energy assets in a Life Cycle perspective. From the start to end of production, Life Cycle ensure safe operations. Our objective is to be a leading supplier of low carbon solutions and electrification projects. We focus on optimizing field life solutions, driven by decarbonization and environmentally sound offerings.

Our Structural department in Bergen is now looking for Young Professional Analyses and Design to help us in our mission to #powerthechange.

What will you be doing?
As a graduate in 2024 in Aker Solutions, you will be a part of a graduate program. This includes professional network, meet other graduates across locations and visit to our headquarter and one of our yards
As a permanent employee in Aker Solutions, you will participate in project teams that proudly deliver world class projects. You will work together with some of our most experienced and knowledgeable engineers and gain valuable experience
You will be joining a dedicated team of engineers and learn the methods as you go
You will be involved in a wide variety of projects ranging from smaller Front End Studies to Major Modification Projects and various Specialist Services
Training will be given and you will receive a mentor to guide you while developing your skills
We Think You Should Have
Student graduating in 2024 or recent years
Education related to Analyses and Design
If you like to like to plan, manage and execute tasks you will thrive in this role
Being proactive and have the ability take initiative are great personal skills that will be appreciated in this role
You will be given all the tools you need to succeed, and the rest is up to you!
More Reasons To Work With Us
As an employee in Aker Solutions, you have many career opportunities. We ensure that our employees get the chance to work across disciplines, build expertise and develop their own potential. This contributes to a vibrant and engaged working environment at all our locations.
A healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your life journey
Competitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker Care
Access to welfare club with free gym facilities, sports equipment hire and cabins for rent in the mountains and by the sea
You will be a part of our Solutioneers, an international employee network that brings together our young talents for professional development, networking and fun. In addition, Aker offer a wide range of welfare activities and training options for all our employees.
We can promise you it will be both challenging and fun!
Please send us a motivation letter together with your CV and transcript by 29.10.2023If you are currently enrolled in a program, you can send a preliminary grade transcript.Please note that applications without a diploma/transcript will not be evaluated.Background checks will be performed on final candidates.

Interested? Contact us.

Anders Fjærestad, Recruiter, NES Advantage Solutions, Anders.fjaerestad@nesfircroft.com

NES Advantage Solutions is Aker Solutions’ global recruitment services provider responsible for permanent and temporary staffing service.

We use Semac background checking for final candidates in our recruitment processes

Diversity and Inclusion

Aker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce. We ensure a good working environment where equal opportunity, diversity and inclusion are considered vital to our success. We believe diversity creates value, attracts talent, and makes life more interesting. We therefore encourage and welcome applications from diverse backgrounds related to race, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender, ethnicity, disability, age, and more.

This is Aker Solutions

Aker Solutions delivers integrated solutions, products and services to the global energy industry. We enable low-carbon oil and gas production and develop renewable solutions to meet future energy needs. By combining innovative digital solutions and predictable project execution we accelerate the transition to sustainable energy production. Aker Solutions employs approximately 15,000 people in more than 20 countries.

name_location: Strawberry (formerly Nordic Choice Hotels) · Bodø, Nordland, Norway  4 days ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
Clarion Collection® Hotel er en samling av personlige hoteller med en genuint koselig og varm følelse. Du finner våre hotellperler midt i byen, akkurat nå i både Sverige og Norge. Hos oss får du ikke bare en komfortabel hotellseng og en skikkelig god frokostbuffet. Vi tilbyr også fika og, som eneste hotellkjede i Norden, vår populære kveldsmat – alle dager i uken. Vi ønsker at gjestene våre skal se oss som en venn på turen. En varm, omsorgsfull venn å komme hjem til, uansett hvor de er. Vi har en klar visjon om at Clarion Collection® Hotel skal tilby det mest personlige oppholdet med ekte omtanke. Treffer den visjonen deg rett i hjertet? Da gleder vi oss til å møte deg! Clarion Collection® Hotel – yours truly. Clarion Collection® Hotel er en del av Strawberry.

Har du lyst til å jobbe i den mest kreative og stadig voksende hotellkjeden i Nord-Europa? Er du en person som liker utfordringer og strever etter noe unikt?

Vi?

Vi ligger midt i Bodø sentrum og er et forretningshotell med 100 rom og møterom til 30 personer. Hotellet har en lang og stolt historie, og hotellethar spilt en stor rolle i mange sitt liv. Vi er et skreddersydd forretningshotel hvor hygge-opplevelsen står sterkt. Rommene er delikate og varierte, og med våre konsepter der vi byr på fika og kveldsmat er vi forretningsreisendes førstevalg i Bodø.

Jobben

Gjennom fantastisk service skal du sikre at gjestene alltid blir tatt vare på
Daglig resepsjonsarbeid, innsjekking og utsjekking, håndtere telefoner osv.
Administrativt arbeid som fakturering, forskuddsbetalinger, gjennomgang av ankomstlister
Forventet å jobbe helger og skift
Perfekt for student

Talent

Du må være energisk, ha mot og være entusiastisk.
Du har gode datakunnskaper
Gode norske og engelsk-kunnskaper både skriftlig og muntlig.
Over 20 år
Vi ser etter deg som elsker et høyt tempo og mange baller i luften
Du elsker mennesker
Erfaring fra bar er en fordel men ikke avgjørende

Er dette en perfekte match for deg? Send oss din søknad i dag!

Hva venter du på?!

name_location: Cobblestone Energy · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  4 months ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Employment Type: Full-time & Permanent

Location: Dubai, UAE (Visa sponsorship & relocation assistance provided)

Salary: Competitive, DOE + performance-based bonus - 0% tax environment + Equity participation.

About Cobblestone Energy

Cobblestone Energy is an energy trading company, specializing in the Great Britain and European wholesale electricity markets. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading. Our advanced data analytics and extensive research drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country, and growing every day. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.

At Cobblestone Energy, we value diversity and believe in hiring extraordinary talent from around the world. Our flat organizational structure fosters a culture of innovation, giving team members complete ownership of their work and ensuring that ideas come from every level. We believe in providing unlimited growth opportunities to our people, along with constant feedback and support, which allows us to cover our vulnerabilities and grow as a team in new and interesting ways.

Cobblestone Values

Lifelong learning with continuous reflection
Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas
The team is more important than the individual. 
Being the best in any market we enter
Hiring and keeping only the most effective people
Others must benefit from our existence. 

Job Summary: As an Algorithmic Power Trader, you will be responsible for developing and executing algorithmic trading strategies in the continental European power markets. Your primary focus will be on analysing market trends, identifying trading opportunities, and implementing automated trading algorithms to optimize trading performance. You will work closely with the trading team and utilize your quantitative skills to contribute to the company's overall trading success.

What We Offer In This Role

A full-time position on our Commercial team
Committed and remarkably talented colleagues. 
Highly competitive compensation dependent on performance
An exciting, challenging and fulfilling career. 
Investment in your development to ensure that you always remain the best in business. 
Equity participation to align long term interests. 

Responsibilities

Develop and implement algorithmic trading strategies in the European power markets with a focus on identifying profitable opportunities while managing risk exposure. 
Build and maintain trading algorithms and models to execute trades in an automated manner. 
Conduct research on market fundamentals, regulations, and pricing models to enhance trading strategies. 
Stay up to date with market developments, industry trends, and technological advancements in algorithmic trading. 
Collaborate with the technology team to enhance trading infrastructure and systems. 

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, mathematics, computer science, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus. 
A track record of success in Algorithmic trading, with at least one year of experience in pan European trading. 
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, MATLAB, or R for algorithm development and data analysis. 
Excellent quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and identify trading opportunities. 
Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams. 
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic trading environment with tight deadlines. 
Knowledge of risk management principles and regulatory frameworks in the energy trading industry.

job_title: Vi søker utviklere, arkitekter og techleads til vårt Drammenskontor
name_location: Bouvet ASA · Drammen, Viken, Norway  1 month ago  · 11 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Bouvet Drammen er i vekst og vi søker dyktige utviklere til vårt lokale Drammenskontor. Her får du kjenne på gode startup-vibber og samtidig jobbe i et av landets største og mest robuste konsulentselskaper. Vi kaller det liten i stor.

Vi har flere av regionens ypperste fagressurser på oppdrag i innovative og samfunnskritiske prosjekter og spenner over bransjekompetanse innen alt fra forsvar, helse og mobilitet til strømnett og offentlige virksomheter. Bouvet Drammen har en stolt tilstedeværelse i byen med sitt tverrfaglig miljø på over 30 konsulenter og nå søker vi flere lokale samfunnsbyggere som vil fornye, forbedre og digitalisere.

Hos Oss Får Du

Muligheter! Noen vil jobbe med .NET, andre med React eller Flutter. Noen drømmer om å bli løsningsarkitekter, andre vil jobbe med AR/VR, data science eller skyteknologi. Hos oss finner du prosjekter som tar deg i retningen som er riktig for deg.
Bli en bedre utvikler. Vårt «melk og brød» er sterk faglig kompetanse. Derfor har vi også et bevisst forhold til faglig utvikling. Alle får individuelle utviklingsplaner og mulighet for deltakelse på fagkvelder, hackatons, BouvetONE med mer. Erfarne kolleger med glød for faget sitt vil spille deg god og våre unge talenter vil inspirere deg og holde deg på tå hev.
Ta del i suksessen. Du får kjøpe deg inn i selskapet gjennom vårt aksjeprogram, og mottar årlig overskuddsdeling – på toppen av konkurransedyktig lønn. Vi jobber og skaper sammen og derfor deler vi også likt av overskuddet. 
Verne om din fritid. Vi respekterer at fritid er viktig for oss alle. Vi praktiserer derfor fleksitid. Står du på litt ekstra i perioder, får du selvsagt betalt for timene du legger ned eller mulighet for avspasering.
Helse og trivsel. Her er det aktivitetsmuligheter innen alt fra padel og innebandy til minigolf og interne uhøytidelige Strava-dueller. Vi har sykkelparkering, eget treningsrom og rabatter på treningssenter. Vi er miljøfyrtårnsertifisert og sitter i et av Nordens mest bærekraftige kontorbygg, SporX, sentralt lokalisert ved Drammen stasjon.
Nye venner. Vi drar på artige reiser, går ut sammen, spiller shuffleboard og gamer.
Støtte i ryggen. Bouvet er kjent som et trygt selskap som prioriterer de ansatte i gode så vel som dårlige tider. Vi er godt rustet for nye utfordringer.

🥕 Vi har mange flere gulrøtter. De finner du i vår Gulrotindeks her🥕

Bærekraft, samfunnsansvar og mangfold

Som ledende IT-selskap skal vi gå foran og bidra til en bærekraftig fremtid lokalt, nasjonalt og globalt. I praksis innebærer dette at vi jobber aktivt med kompetansedeling og samarbeid på tvers av bransjer og nettverk, gjennom blant annet GoForIT. Du kan lese mer om vårt arbeid med bærekraft og samfunnsansvar her .

Vi er også svært opptatt av mangfold og inkludering. Det fremmer arbeidsglede, innovasjon og verdiskaping både på jobb og i samfunnet. Vårt interne nettverk, «Mangfold og inkludering», jobber for økt kunnskap og bevissthet og inviterer alle i selskapet til å delta i dette arbeidet. Vi satser stort på kvinner i Tech gjennom initiativ som ODA, Women in Tech Network og Girl Tech fest.

Hvem søker vi?

Vi Ser Etter Flere Medarbeidere Som Har

relevant bachelor/masterutdanning fra universitet/høyskole
relevant erfaring som backend/fullstack/frontendutvikler i .Net, Java, JavaScript
kunnskap og erfaring innen SQL, Python og Azure-løsninger
motivasjon til å skape et team som trives og leverer gode resultater
gode norskkunnskaper, både muntlig og skriftlig (minst B2 nivå).

Hvis beskrivelsen her passer deg, så send oss en søknad og CV. Vil du høre mer om alle mulighetene i Bouvet Drammen så ta gjerne kontakt eller kom innom vårt kontor for en kaffeprat.

Etter ansettelse vil en tredje parts bakgrunnssjekk gjennomføres. Dette er en verifisering av de opplysninger som gis i rekrutteringsprosessen. Bakgrunnssjekken er tilpasset stillingens krav og gjennomføres etter søkerens samtykke.

Vi gleder oss oppriktig til å høre fra deg!

name_location: Guidepost Montessori · Time, Rogaland, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 4 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are hiring an Infant Assistant Teacher for our lovely Guidepost Montessori school at Lawrenceville!

Get the opportunity to empower 0 to 18 months to gain independence, self-confidence, and an enduring love of learning!

Your Role

We're looking for an enthusiastic, adaptable Assistant Guide (Teacher) to support a mixed-age class of Infant children in a Montessori environment.

In a Montessori environment, guides (teachers) carefully prepare an environment that fosters independence and captivates a child’s interest. Guides provide personalized support to each child. They offer individual and small-group lessons, showing children how to use the materials and perform activities with them, and giving them precise language to understand their experiences.

Because of the carefully prepared environment and individualized support, children in a Montessori class have tremendous liberty to explore the environment and work on materials of their choice for as long as they want. Most importantly, the support and materials help every child develop skills, confidence, and a firm conviction that they are capable.

We’re looking for an Assistant Guide who will bring their best in order to support every child in reaching their highest potential!

Guidepost Assistant Guides:

Observe children closely to understand and best meet their needs 
Prepare a beautiful, orderly environment that fosters independence and concentration 
Provide individual and small-group lessons to support each child’s development
Form personal connections with each child and cultivate a community of collaboration and respect 

An ideal candidate has:

Experience working with children ages 0-18 months. 
Love for children. 
Passion about Montessori and Children Independence. 

What we offer:

The opportunity to contribute to a high-quality Montessori program that serves the individual needs of each child
Fully sponsored Montessori diploma training and ongoing professional development through the Prepared Montessorian Institute 
75% tuition discount for two children at any school in our network (we serve children from 3-months-old through 12th grade)
A network of supportive peers and mentors who appreciate your valuable contributions and regularly share best practices 
Abundant career growth and promotion opportunities
A competitive salary
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Paid time off and paid holidays 

About Us

Guidepost Montessori is a growing network of 100+ Montessori schools, serving children ages 0-12 in our Nido, Toddler, Children’s House, and Elementary programs. And with schools from Shanghai to Paris and California to New York, as well as virtual school and homeschooling support, there are countless opportunities for passionate educators to support children on their individual path to success.

At Guidepost, we believe children are capable and we design an education for independence. We’re on a mission to radically transform education based on this belief—for children, parents, and educators!

Our mission? Children who fully experience and joyfully achieve their own development; children who can reach their highest potential and flourish—in school and in life!

If you love children and have been looking for the right opportunity to grow, join our school community by applying below!

We will not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, alienage or citizenship, disability, marital status, military or veteran status, or any other legally recognized protected basis under applicable federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. Our leadership is dedicated to ensuring the fulfillment of this policy. When requested, we are committed to reasonably accommodate employees and applicants with disabilities or special needs that may require an accommodation.

name_location: Varner · Skien, Vestfold og Telemark, Norway  6 days ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Om stillingen

name_location: Aker Solutions · Stavanger, Rogaland, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 14 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Do you want to play a role in solving global energy challenges for future generations?

At Aker Solutions we are committed to helping the energy industry and broader society #PowerTheChange towards a low-carbon future.Our ambitions are high. By 2030, renewables and low-carbon solutions for oil and gas will make up two-thirds of our business. Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?

The Life Cycle segment takes care of energy assets in a Life Cycle perspective. From the start to end of production, Life Cycle ensure safe operations. Our objective is to be a leading supplier of low carbon solutions and electrification projects. We focus on optimizing field life solutions, driven by decarbonization and environmentally sound offerings.

Our Instrument department in Stavanger is now looking for Graduate and Young Professionals Instrument Engineer to help us in our mission to #powerthechange.

What will you be doing?
As a graduate in 2024 in Aker Solutions, you will be a part of a graduate program. This includes professional network, meet other graduates across locations and visit to our headquarter and one of our yards
As a permanent employee in Aker Solutions, you will participate in project teams that proudly deliver world class projects. You will work together with some of our most experienced and knowledgeable engineers and gain valuable experience
You will be joining a dedicated team of engineers and learn the methods as you go
You will be involved in a wide variety of projects ranging from smaller Front End Studies to Major Modification Projects and various Specialist Services
Training will be given and you will receive a mentor to guide you while developing your skills
We Think You Should Have
Student graduating in 2024 or recent years
Area of study relevant to the role you are applying for
If you like to like to plan, manage and execute tasks you will thrive in this role
Being proactive and have the ability take initiative are great personal skills that will be appreciated in this role
You will be given all the tools you need to succeed, and the rest is up to you!
More Reasons To Work With Us
As an employee in Aker Solutions, you have many career opportunities. We ensure that our employees get the chance to work across disciplines, build expertise and develop their own potential. This contributes to a vibrant and engaged working environment at all our locations.
A healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your life journey
Competitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker Care
Access to welfare club with free gym facilities, sports equipment hire and cabins for rent in the mountains and by the sea
You will be a part of our Solutioneers, an international employee network that brings together our young talents for professional development, networking and fun. In addition, Aker offer a wide range of welfare activities and training options for all our employees.
We can promise you it will be both challenging and fun!
Interested? Contact us.

About

Please send us a motivation letter together with your CV and transcript by 29.10.2023 If you are currently enrolled in a program, you can send a preliminary grade transcript. Please note that applications without a diploma/transcript will not be evaluated. Background checks will be performed on final candidates. For questions about the position, please contact:

Christer Knag, Junior Recruiter NES Advantage Solutions, tel. +47 980 87 641 christer.knag@nesfircroft.com

NES Advantage is Aker Solutions’ global recruitment services provider responsible for permanent and temporary staffing service.

Diversity and Inclusion

Aker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce. We ensure a good working environment where equal opportunity, diversity and inclusion are considered vital to our success. We believe diversity creates value, attracts talent, and makes life more interesting. We therefore encourage and welcome applications from diverse backgrounds related to race, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender, ethnicity, disability, age, and more.

This is Aker Solutions

Aker Solutions delivers integrated solutions, products and services to the global energy industry. We enable low-carbon oil and gas production and develop renewable solutions to meet future energy needs. By combining innovative digital solutions and predictable project execution we accelerate the transition to sustainable energy production. Aker Solutions employs approximately 15,000 people in more than 20 countries.

job_description:
About the job
About Us

Are you looking for meaningful work and want to make a difference? Do you want to gain valuable work experience? Joining the Goodwill team could be a great fit for you! At Goodwill we live and breathe our Core Values of Creativity, Credibility, and Collaboration. We are a mission-integrated organization that is funded by resalable goods. Last year alone, we were able to keep 10 million pounds of donated goods from hitting our landfills. Through the reselling of donated items, we can provide job readiness training and employment opportunities to individuals with disabilities and barriers to employment.

Overview

POSITION SUMMARY: Understands the facility operation including, product flow, sorting, operating the register, auctions, dock area, and provides excellent customer service. Process various recycling materials per our guidelines.

Responsibilities

 Essential Functions Statement: 
 Accurately maintains dock related documentation on a daily basis. 
 Assists management on the efficient movement of product from the trucks to the designated areas. 
 Gauges when compactor is full and to “compact” properly to maximize efficiency when changing out the container. 
 Understands and prioritizes daily activities of the department base on critical operational needs and gives input to management on schedules. 
 Operates and conducts daily inspections on the compactor, conveyor belt, baler, and forklifts. Meets productivity standards when bailing.

Qualifications

 SKILLS AND ABILITIES 

 Education:  High School Diploma or GED preferred.

 Experience:  1 year or more related experience.

 Certificates and Licenses:  Must be able to be forklift certified.

 Other requirements  : Must be able to communicate in English. Bilingual (Spanish/English) preferred. Prior experience on heavy equipment, pallet jack, and compactor preferred.

job_title: Accelerator program - Vil du bli Associate Consultant innen Data & Analytics?
name_location: Columbus · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 11 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Endelig! Høsten 2024 er vi tilbake med vårt anerkjente Accelerator Program i Data & Analytics. 

Er du nysgjerrig på konsulentrollen og ønsker å være med på den digitale transformasjonen? Nå ser vi etter neste generasjon stjerner som tenker utenfor boksen og er drevet av en genuin lidenskap for å skape meningsfulle digitale forretningsløsninger for våre kunder. 

Vårt Accelerator Program gir deg muligheten til å skape en fremgangsrik konsulentkarriere i et selskap som vil satse på din kompetanseutvikling og din framtid. Hos oss er du ikke bare en ansatt, du er en verdifull del av vårt team og du vil få muligheten til å jobbe med spennende verdiskapende prosjekter i lag med dedikerte kolleger. Du vil bli en integrert del av et globalt kompetansemiljø hvor vi er opptatt av å spille hverandre gode. Sammen former vi den digitale fremtiden!

Programmet har et begrenset antall plasser – så send inn din søknad allerede i dag!

Programmet fokuserer på 

🔎 Soft skills – konsulentegenskaper/rådgivning, presentasjonsteknikk, globalt samarbeide og prosjektmetodikk

💻 Praktisk kunnskap i de nyeste produktene innen dataanalyse – gjennom e-læring og undervisning / Q&A

🤝 Kundeprosjekt – få verdifull praksisnær erfaring ved å jobbe direkte med kunder i spennende implementeringsprosjekter

Programmets innhold og hvordan dine dager vil se ut

Som accelerator vil du oppleve å bli satset på. Du kan derfor se frem til et faglig og personlig utviklingsløp. I starten av programmet blir du tildelt en mentor som kommer til å gi deg strukturert veiledning og hjelper deg med å vokse inn i rollen som en dyktig konsulent.

Programmet strekker seg utover totalt 6 måneder og du vil bli ansatt som Associate Consultant.

I løpet av 1-3 måneder: Du skal omsette teori til praksis - du vil følge en erfaren konsulent i kundeprosjekter og gradvis ta på deg oppgaver og bli en del av kundeteamet. Som Associate Consultant i våre ulike kundeprosjekter kommer du til å være en viktig del av et prosjektteam som jobber med de nyeste produktene innen Data & Analytics. Her vil du jobbe med dyktige kolleger på alle nivåer, fra yngre ressurser til erfarne konsulenter.

I løpet av 3-6 måneder: Nå skal du jobbe aktivt i kundeprosjekter som Business Consultant og du vil være svært delaktig i leveranse. Du vil bli introdusert for flere business intelligence verktøy som for eksempel Microsoft Power BI, Infor Birst, Qlik og Tableau. Du kommer også til å jobbe med forskjellige verktøy for datahåndtering. Columbus har en strategisk skysatsing og programmet vil gi deg en grunnleggende kunnskap om plattformer som Azure. Ved interesse finnes det også mulighet å fordype seg innen avansert dataanalyse som AI og maskinlæring.

Etter programmet 

Jobber du som konsulent og bidrar i å lede kunder i sine transformasjonsprosjekter
Har du fått verdifull og praktisk kunnskap som du bruker for å veilede våre kunder til å jobbe smartere i sine forretningsprosesser
Har du skaffet deg et stort nettverk og en super karrieremulighet – både i Norge og globalt
Vil du samarbeide med din mentor og leder for å sette opp en personlig utviklingsplan som strekker seg fremover i tid. Sammen legger vi en god plan for å oppnå dine ønsker og ambisjoner og knytter det til selskapets strategi, slik at du ser at din personlig vekst også bidrar til selskapets suksess.

Hvem er du? 

Du har interesse for virksomhet- og forretningsprosesser og trives i dialog med kunder. Du har gode kommunikasjonsevner og synes det er givende å etablere gode og langsiktige relasjoner. Du tenker logisk og er nysgjerrig på ny datateknikk som kan øke verdier i et selskap. Vi forventer at du er en lagspiller – for hos oss jobber vi i team 👩🏻‍🤝‍🧑🏽

For å lykkes i Columbus tenker vi at du også har noen av følgende kvalifikasjoner og egenskaper:

Master innen relevant fagområde, som for eksempel systemvitenskap, data og analyse eller tilsvarende
Noe relevant arbeidserfaring vil være en fordel
Evner å kommunisere godt på engelsk og norsk med kunder og kolleger – både muntlig og skriftlig

Du har gjerne jobbet noen år etter utdanningen din – det er bare et pluss. Det vil også være fordelsaktig med erfaring og kunnskap om databaser 😊

Er du klar for å ta utfordringen? 

For å sikre at programmet blir vellykket for alle parter er det viktig at du investerer i din egen utvikling og læring. Programmet er intensivt og læringskurven er bratt. Dette krever engasjement og motivasjon fra din side. I gjengjeld gir vi deg en fantastisk karrieremulighet i et kreativt og kompetent miljø, hvor vi også har det gøy på jobb! Våre kunder har tillit til at vi guider dem til de beste løsningene, og din ekspertise vil spille en betydelig rolle i denne prosessen. Du vil være med på å påvirke våre kunders forretning og bistå dem med å optimalisere deres operasjonelle prosesser.

Hvilke kontorer tilbyr vi Accelerator Program? 

Du vil tilhøre et av våre kontorer i Oslo eller Tønsberg.

Søknad og neste steg 

Vi ønsker at alle kandidater benytter vår elektroniske søknadsportal. Her kan du søke gjennom å laste opp din LinkedIn og/eller CV og du behøver ikke å fylle ut lange spørsmålsformuleringer.

Siste søknadsfrist er 15. oktober 2023.

name_location: FRG Technology Consulting · Norway  2 months ago  · 147 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Cyber Security Consultant (CTM), you'll contribute technically to Cyber Security client projects and internal projects. An important part of your role will be to actively establish, maintain and strengthen internal and external relationships. Similarly, you'll anticipate and identify risks within projects and share any issues with senior members of the team. In line with the client's commitment to quality, you'll confirm that work is of high quality and is reviewed by the next-level reviewer. As an influential member of the team, you'll help to create a positive learning culture, coach and counsel junior team members and help them to develop.

Responsibilities And Requirements

You will lead the performance of Attack & Penetration Testing in areas such as Databases, Web applications, IT Infrastructures, Non-web applications, mobile devices, mobile applications, application code review, social engineering, hardware/firmware, Wireless, IoT and Connected devices, Cloud, Red Team Assessment, Purple Team Assessment, Cyber red team tuning, Threat Modeling / Security Architecture Review.
You will lead the conception of technical protection measures up to crisis management in cyber-attacks.
You will identify and exploit security vulnerabilities in a wide array of systems in a variety of situations.
You will perform in-depth analysis of penetration testing results and create reports that describe findings, exploitation procedures, risks and recommendations.
You will execute penetration testing projects using the established methodology, tools and rules of engagements.
You will convey complex technical security concepts to technical and non-technical audiences including executives.

More information about the project will be provided during meeting with the customer. Please contact r.tasker@frankgroup.com for more information.

name_location: Omda · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 5 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Join our team and your talent could be part of software creation that helps healthcare professionals bring new life safely into the world, contributes to more people living longer and more fully, or makes all the difference in emergencies when every second counts. 
Our teams empower customers with tools to support their patients and help save lives. We currently have seven business areas that develop specialised software solutions across medical fields and emergency services. At Omda you’ll be close to customer needs and your work will have an impact where it matters most.
Our Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) business area provides comprehensive support for all aspects of blood, cell and tissue management, with 180 blood centres across 5 countries utilising the platform.
As our Technical specialist LIMS support you will join our Delivery & Support team. In this role, you will be working as part of a team to support our product ProSang and maintain system environments at our customer sites, as well as internally. We hope you are a person who will improve our way of working with support, deployment outcomes and monitoring by working in close collaboration with our operation- and development organisations.
If this sounds interesting to you, join our team in Stockholm, Copenhagen or Oslo.
 As our Technical specialist LIMS support you will:
Provide technical support in the LIMS domain
Handling customer dialogues, requests, and requirements
Perform minor upgrades, patching, operation and troubleshooting of ProSang proprietary applications and modules
Setup and configuration of Linux and Windows servers
Setup, configuration, and basic creation of MS SQL Server and Oracle databases
Perform application installation, failover setup and pre-configured installations
Conduct high-level root-cause analysis for service interruption and establish preventive measures
 
Your matching strengths for our role:
General interest in IT and curious about new technology
Good written and verbal communication skills both internally and customer-facing
Fluently speaking in at least one Scandinavian language
Familiar with working in Windows environments, both server and client 
1-2+ years’ experience in IT
Good understanding of server infrastructure and error tracing 
Experience with software installation on Linux and Windows servers 
Experience with issue tracing at server, OS, and system level
Flexible and able to handle none planned task

Would be great, but not mandatory, if you have:
Bachelor's Degree in appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience
Previous experience performing customer installations and configurations
Preferably have experience in customer service, operation, or support 1st / 2nd line
A great sense of accuracy, responsibility, and respect towards the important domain you are working in
You are knowledgeable about centralised monitoring and automatic alerts 
Knowledge of Oracle databases (installation, backup, and recovery)
You are communicative and familiar with speaking to customers, both in IT departments and healthcare businesses
 Benefits and what we offer
A positive and passionate working environment
Pension and insurance arrangement
Flexible working hours
A unique chance to do something meaningful within your field of expertise
Participation in further development of the Delivery & Support organisation
The ability to work and share knowledge with employees around the world
Exciting and challenging work with significant autonomy
 We are interviewing continuously, therefore we recommend you submit your application as soon as possible.
Looking forward to meeting you!

job_description:
About the job
We are looking for a service star for a 50% position in our fantastic reception team!

Amerikalinjen is an urban boutique hotel for locals and visitors that opened in March 2019. A meeting place for people of all ages and from all cultures. A warm, eclectic and inspiring house with 122 rooms, a unique history and a fantastic location. The perfect starting point for exploring the city.

We are looking for you who want to participate in the demanding and creative process of further developing and operating a vibrant hotel and restaurant on Jernbanetorget in Oslo. This is a perfect opportunity for you who want to get unique training and experience from Oslo's most exciting hotel!

Amerikalinjen houses several exciting food and drink concepts, all inspired by our unique history and location. Our catering establishments target the local market, with a clear ambition to become market leaders in their respective segments.

At Amerikalinjen, we emphasize on hiring extremely dedicated people who have a strong service culture and who love to create memorable moments. It is important to us that you can identify with the building's history and take personal ownership of stories about people in motion. One of our most important goals is to vividly convey Amerikalinjen's rich history to new generations.

We are going on an exciting adventure with a completely new booking system, Mews, and we want you to join us!

Come join us if you are:

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 months ago  · 12 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Canonical is building a new generation of Ubuntu-based container images to simplify open source application deployment across the world. These container images will be free to use with long term security commitments, and engineered for performance, security and usability. As with Ubuntu, we will work in the open and welcome community participation.

In this role, you'll be developing the tools and technology for building and maintaining this new generation of container images. You'll be working with multiple teams, both inside and outside Canonical, to ensure we deliver container images with the highest quality whilst maintaining a seamless Ubuntu user experience. You will also be highly involved in the implementation and maintenance of the Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery automation around these container images, for which you are expected to demonstrate deep insights into container-based devops.

You will be contributing to fast-moving products like ROCKs (OCI images) and Chisel, and thus have the chance to help steer and consolidate this new team. You'll gain experience with numerous container technologies and participate in exciting and exploratory tasks, where your feedback will be critical for the decision-making process. As an engineer, your seniority will be based on your software development background and ability to lead junior team members.

Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical. This is an exciting opportunity for experienced software engineers looking for a place to leave their mark, who are passionate about shaping an open source product with the highest quality, with and for the community!

What you'll do

Build robust, scalable, leading-edge container images
Work on automated Ci/CD processes for building, testing and publishing our container images
Write tools and tests for assessing security compliance and cloud-native compatibility
Work in Python and/or Go to deliver new functionalities to our container building tools
Demonstrate sound engineering principles by contributing directly to your team's goals
Participate in strong engineering process through code and architectural review
Provide technical feedback for the team's decision-making process
Engage with the open source community as a subject-matter expert
Grow our knowledge base and write documentation
Help design new tools and products
Work in a collaborative, agile and globally distributted environment
Mentor and help hiring
Work from home with global travel up to 15% for internal and external events

Who you are - at least some of those statements apply to you:

You are knowledgeable and passionate about software development
You have experience in collaborative development
You have worked with CI/CD systems (e.g. Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Concourse CI, etc.)
You have a track record of delivering timely, high quality software
You have experience with container images and containerised operations
You master at least one container management/orchestration tool (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud (e.g. Microsoft Azure, GCP, AWS, etc.)
You have significant experience with Python and/or Go
You are experienced with Linux systems administration and package management
You have strong written and verbal communication skills to convey technical concepts
You bring clarity to technical and engineering discussions
You are someone who strongly believes that sharing is caring, and knowledge is power
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree

What Canonical Offers:

Learning and development, with annual budget for professional development
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual leave
Priority Pass for travel
Work remotely with a talented, distributed global team

Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.

#stack

name_location: Kongsberg Discovery · Horten, Vestfold og Telemark, Norway  1 week ago  · 10 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Kongsberg Discovery AS, Customer Services, Uncrewed platforms is responsible for technical advisory, support, and training for our Autonomous Underwater Vehicle (AUV) systems. Our goal is to provide support and services to fulfill our customer needs the best possible way.

Our AUV, Hugin, can dive down to 6000 m depth and scan the seabed using multibeam echosounder (EM) and High resolution Interferometric Synthetic Aperture Sonar (HiSAS). It also consists of different environmental sensor.

For more information please visit: https://www.kongsberg.com/maritime/products/marine-robotics/autonomous-underwater-vehicles/AUV-hugin-superior/

We are now strengthening our services and are building up a new team for System as a Service (SaaS) with System operators at Kongsberg Discovery in Horten. As a system operator you will support the customer with the mobilization and demobilization of the AUV system onto their vessel, supervise them with the operation, and be responsible for making sure that the AUV system is in best shape between missions. You will also be a part of the service engineer team where you will do service, repair and maintenance on customers already installed AUV systems. As well as offer in-house technical support and remote service to external and internal customers.

Our System operators and Service Engineers are at the front line when representing KONGSBERG to our worldwide customers. If you have technical qualifications, like to work hands on, and identify with our values; determined, innovative, collaborative, and reliable, and are motivated for worldwide support activities: Then you are the person we are looking for.

Key Accountabilities

Operating, testing, repair, maintenance, and service jobs worldwide.
Supervision and operator assistance onboard.
Technical support and on-call/remote service.
Approximately 100-120 travel days a year.

Qualifications And Experience

Bachelor/master’s in engineering or other relevant skills/experience.
Good IT/PC/network skills.
Good communication skills in English and Norwegian. Both oral and written.
Experienced and non-experienced engineers are encouraged to apply.

This employment may require security clearance by the Norwegian National Security Authority. For more information visit www.nsm.no.

You are able to

act on own initiative, make things happen and accept responsibility for the results.
communicate in a clear, precise, and structured way.
work independent, co-operate well with others, share knowledge, experience, information, and support others in the pursuit of team goals.
demonstrate specialist knowledge and expertise in own area.
use a methodical and systematic approach, plan ahead, define clear priorities and allocate resources effectively.
analyze complex issues and problems and come up with rational judgments.
be aware of own strengths and limitations and pursue learning and career development opportunities.

What We Can Offer

An exciting and important position working for the world-leading supplier of maritime solutions.
International work environment and multidisciplinary team collaboration.
An inspiring and safe work environment.
Personal development and career opportunities.

Work location

Horten, with substantial worldwide travel

Point of contact

Petter Ramde, SaaS Manager, +47 920 47 190

Henning Tolleifsen, Customer Support Manager, +47 992 03 959

Kongsberg Discovery is responsible for product and technology development, supply chain operations, and project delivery for KONGSBERG's subsea and marine surface sensors, hydroacoustic positioning, sonar & mapping systems, robotic vessels, and communications systems. Through its comprehensive portfolio of offerings, Kongsberg Discovery continues to be recognized as a world leader in its core markets all over the world. We have a strong history and track record of delivering world-class products and services to customers across the globe. There is a firm focus on developing advanced technological and autonomous systems that optimize operations at sea – while simultaneously reducing the environmental impact – our solutions are key in transforming the maritime sector for a more sustainable future.

KONGSBERG is a leading global technology group. Throughout our proud two hundred year history, we have continuously advanced, applying innovative solutions to the needs of our customers, partners and society at large. We believe diversity is our strength. By fostering an inclusive and diverse culture we nurture and ensure space for different perspectives and ideas. We work determined to mature and improve our ability to utilize our diversity and culture of differences to create positive business results.

Protechting people and planet

job_title: Accelerator Program - Vil du bli Associate Consultant innen Digital Commerce?
name_location: Columbus · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 9 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Endelig! Høsten 2024 er vi tilbake med Accelerator Program i Digital Commerce. 

Er du nysgjerrig på konsulentrollen og ønsker å være med på den digitale transformasjonen? Nå ser vi etter neste generasjon stjerner som tenker utenfor boksen og er drevet av en genuin lidenskap for å skape innovative løsninger og tjenester innen digital handel! 

Vårt Accelerator Program gir deg muligheten til å skape en fremgangsrik konsulentkarriere i et selskap som vil satse på din kompetanseutvikling og din framtid. Hos oss er du ikke bare en ansatt, du er en verdifull del av vårt team og du vil få muligheten til å jobbe med spennende verdiskapende prosjekter i lag med dedikerte kolleger. Du vil bli en integrert del av et globalt kompetansemiljø hvor vi er opptatt av å spille hverandre gode. Sammen former vi den digitale fremtiden!

Programmet har et begrenset antall plasser – så send inn din søknad allerede i dag!

Programmet fokuserer på 

🔎 Soft skills – konsulentegenskaper/rådgivning, presentasjonsteknikk, globalt samarbeide og prosjektmetodikk

💻 Praktisk kunnskap – gjennom e-læring og undervisning / Q&A

🤝 Kundeprosjekt – få verdifull praksisnær erfaring ved å jobbe direkte med kunder i spennende implementeringsprosjekter

Innholdet i programmet og hvordan dagene dine vil se ut

Det er et tettpakket program hvor du får muligheten til å lære hvordan du leder og navigerer kunder i den digitale revolusjonen. Som accelerator vil du ikke bare være en passiv observatør men oppleve å bli satset på. Du kan derfor se frem til et faglig og personlig utviklingsløp. I starten av programmet blir du tildelt en mentor som kommer til å gi deg strukturert veiledning og hjelper deg med å vokse inn i rollen som en dyktig konsulent.

Programmet strekker seg utover 6 måneder og du vil bli ansatt som Associate Consultant.

I løpet av 1-3 måneder: Du skal omsette teori til praksis - du skal følge en erfaren konsulent i kundeprosjekter og gradvis ta på deg oppgaver og bli en del av kundeteamet. Du vil få innsikt i vårt tjenestetilbud, prosjektmetodikk og interne prosesser. Du vil få en god forståelse for våre kunders utfordringer og hvordan vi støtter dem i deres digitale transformasjonsreise.

I løpet av 3-6 måneder: Du har opparbeidet praktisk erfaring og skal jobbe aktivt i kundeprosjekter som Business Consultant. Din innsats og bidrag vil være avgjørende for prosjektleveransen. Denne perioden legger et solid grunnlag for å gradvis utvikle deg til roller som UX designer eller rådgiver – og jobbe som en troverdig Digital Trusted Advisor.

Hvem er du? 

Du liker den digitale verden og har en interesse for teknologi. Din forståelse av forretningsaspekter kombinert med en utforskende og nysgjerrig natur gjør at du trives i en rolle som involverer direkte kundekontakt. Du har gode kommunikasjonsevner og synes det er givende å etablere gode og langsiktige relasjoner. Vi forventer at du er en lagspiller – for hos oss jobber vi i team 👩🏻🤝🧑🏽

For å lykkes i Columbus tenker vi at du også har noen av følgende kvalifikasjoner og egenskaper:

Bachelor eller master innenfor områder som interaksjon-/tjeneste/industridesign, industriell økonomi, markedsføring, strategi/innovasjon eller lignende 
Evner å kommunisere godt på engelsk og norsk med kunder og kolleger – både muntlig og skriftlig 
Har du arbeidserfaring er dette et pluss. Kanskje jobber du tett på e-handel i dag eller med innkjøp og ønsker å bytte karriere? Overrask oss! 

Hvilke kontorer tilbyr vi Accelerator Program? 

Du vil tilhøre et av våre kontorer i Oslo eller Tønsberg. I den første periode vil rollen innebære noe reising til våre kontorer i Sverige.

Søknad og neste steg 

Vi ønsker at alle kandidater benytter vår elektroniske søknadsportal. Her kan du søke gjennom å laste opp din LinkedIn og/eller CV og du behøver ikke å fylle ut lange spørsmålsformuleringer.

Siste søknadsfrist er 31.01.24

name_location: Amby · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 3 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Do you want to build Norway's best developer platform? 

At Coop Norge, we are passionate about how technology and data can be used to simplify and streamline the shopping experience so that millions of Norwegians can spend time and energy on more important things.

As our new Staff Platform Engineer, you will support the development and operation of software by building, extending, and maintaining our multi-cloud platform. You will be part of the core team ensuring stable and accessible services for our customers, and our engineers.

Interested yet? You will also have the opportunity to work with a wide range of exciting technologies and tools, as well as be a part of a collaborative and dynamic team that is focused on delivering high-quality solutions for Coop Norway! 

We Believe Your Day-to-day Will Look Somewhat Like This

Design and extend our platform with better or new features. 
Advise engineers in building cloud infrastructure in a secure and repeatable manner. 
Maintain, upgrade, and monitor our platform. 
Build services that our engineers can leverage to quicker deliver software. 
Support users of the platform in consuming the platform as a product. 
Actively work together with your team to discuss issues, designs, and solutions.

To succeed in this role, you will need to have: 

Hands-on experience with any of the major public clouds (we use Azure and GCP). 
Practical knowledge and experience with Infrastructure as Code. 
Good knowledge of Git. 
Experience with container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes. 
The ability to communicate fluently/very well in English (both oral and written). 
Higher education in relevant areas, or relevant work experience. 
5+ years of experience as a Platform Engineer, or other relevant DevOps or SRE positions. 

It Would Also Be Beneficial To Have

Knowledge of one or more programming languages such as Go or Python. 
Hands-on experience with observability. 
Experience using GitHub. 
Knowledge of Backstage. 
Experience with Crossplane or building Kubernetes Operators. 
Experience working with Bash. 

Technologies You Will Be Working With

GCP 
Azure 
Terraform / Spacelift 
GitHub / GitHub Actions 
Kubernetes / Istio 
Crossplane 
Backstage 
Datadog 
Kubernetes Operators 

What can we offer you?

Access to the most exciting technologies and data to solve complex and important tasks. 
You'll be part of an ambitious and diverse team where you get to impact the way of working and contribute to organizational guidelines. 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development (e.g., conferences, training, time to work on own projects/upskilling, etc.). 
Modern office spaces at our HQ at Grorud with a high degree of flexibility on working hours and location. 
Gear and equipment (Mac/Windows/Linux) are provided when you begin your adventure with us. 
Competitive compensation package in addition to good pension and insurance schemes. 
Other benefits like mobile phone and internet coverage, company cabins, and discounts in all Coop stores. 

Do you want to learn more about the role or who we are?

Feel free to reach out to Ameneh Ahmadi (+47 90269214 / ameneh.ahmadi@coop.no).

About Coop Norge

Coop is one of the largest consumer retail operators in Norway, counting over 1250 stores and 28 000 employees across the country. Being an operator in a rapidly changing landscape, we dare to innovate and implement new innovative digital solutions such as fully automated warehouses, unmanned stores, and the use of advanced analytics/AI products for a diverse range of purposes - to mention some. We strive to build digital solutions that make everyday life easier and create seamless shopping experiences for millions of Norwegians—backed by high-quality tech and data products.

name_location: EF Academy · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 months ago  · 19 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Enrollment Advisor– EF Academy 

We are looking for an Enrollment Advisor to expand and market our incredible International Boarding School and drive the recruitment of students to our campuses in Oxford, New York and California. Our mission is to open the world through education.

Who We Are

EF Academy International Boarding Schools opens a world of opportunities for high school students by providing them with a transformational international education, thorough preparation for university and a future that knows no borders.

Learn more about EF Academy here: https://www.efacademy.org

When You Join EF Academy You Will

Join an international, dynamic and innovative work environment
Be part of our culture of entrepreneurship and empowerment
Travel to our amazing campuses and collaborate with colleagues from 17 local offices
Have the opportunity for an international career progression shaped according to your aspirations and strengths
Get new-hire training and continuous professional development opportunities for growth
Attractive performance-based bonuses in addition to your fixed salary
Be part of the Top Performers Summit in Switzerland (if qualified)
Visit an office of choice in your region or around the world for Top Performers (if qualified)
Participate in Kick Off Meetings around the world (rotating location such as California 2019, New York 2023)
And many more! 

What will I get to do in this role? 

Engage and inform prospective parents and students about EF Academy and the benefits of an education in our high schools, serving as the face of the school in Norway
Promote our top-ranked program to potential families and recruit students through phone, face-to-face conversations, school fairs and other events
Identify the right students from Norway to attend one of our campuses 
Build and maintain long-term relationships based on trust, guiding families through important life decisions around high school education
Work in close collaboration with international stakeholders across EF offices and the campuses in order to deliver the best quality experience for our students and parents

What are the role requirements? 

Bachelors or Postgraduate degree 
Fluency in Norwegian and high proficiency of English (C1 required)
Previous experience in the education industry, recruitment, hospitality and/or customer service 
You have lived, worked or studied abroad 
IB Diploma or boarding school background is a plus 
Empathy and passion for helping and guiding the families through important life decisions around high school education 
Determination to consistently meet and exceed individual KPIs and targets 

If you are motivated by the prospect of an international career with a dynamic and forward-thinking company, we want to hear from you. Please submit your application, including your CV, in English. 

Learn How We Empower Students Here

About EF Education First:

At EF we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we have helped millions of people see new places, experience new cultures, and learn new things about the world and about themselves. Our culturally immersive education programs - focused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics - turn dreams into international opportunities.

When you join EF, you join a multicultural and diverse community working across more than 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education. Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about - we welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. EF is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, parental status, identity, experience and everything else that makes you unique.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. About Education First: https://www.ef.com/wwen/about-us/

name_location: Infotree Global Solutions · Enebakk, Viken, Norway  2 months ago  · 7 applicants
job_description:
About the job
As a Data Center Site Lead, you will collaborate closely with the Site Services Manager to inspire and guide a team of talented technicians. You will play a crucial role in optimizing workflows, triaging anomalies, and scaling operations within cutting-edge data center campus. Your technical expertise, coupled with your exceptional attention to detail and analytical mindset, will empower you to identify opportunities for process improvement and foster a culture of continuous learning and development.

Location: Enebakk, Norway (26 km from Oslo)

Working model: On-site.

Responsibilities:

Serve as the primary technical point of contact for incidents, escalations, and retrofits, acting as a trusted advisor to stakeholders.
Lead a team of dedicated data center technicians, focusing on efficiently restoring systems and ensuring seamless production for our clients.
Implement global standards and workflows, aligning local data center operations with the organization's strategic vision.
Mentor and develop technicians to enhance their operational capabilities and empower them to deliver exceptional results with minimal supervision.
Manage server upgrades, integration, automated OS provisioning, and other projects while troubleshooting network, hardware, and Linux OS issues.
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of comprehensive documentation in the global DC knowledge base.
Drive process improvements and share best practices to optimize data center operations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define specifications for tooling and automation, enabling streamlined deployment, monitoring, and hardware diagnostics at scale.
Ensure operational excellence by achieving key metrics and continuously seeking opportunities for improvement.
Conduct diagnostics and troubleshooting to identify the root causes of issues, swiftly replacing faulty components to minimize customer disruption.
Perform post-execution quality checks, ensuring adherence to safety protocols, deployment standards, and planned Network Design Tasks (NDTs) related to grounding, staging, labeling, and cabling.
Communicate, report, and escalate incidents following established procedures to facilitate timely resolution.
Promote a positive team environment by actively sharing knowledge, participating in team meetings, and staying informed about the progress of colleagues' work.

Requirements:

Possess exceptional knowledge of server hardware, including an in-depth understanding of component and system failures.
Exhibit the ability to work autonomously as well as collaboratively within local or geographically dispersed teams.
Demonstrate strong leadership skills and experience in mentoring and guiding a team of technicians.
Conduct thorough failure analysis to resolve field issues effectively.
Track server fleet health, identifying trends, unknown issues, and validating customer service level agreements (SLAs).
Proficient in utilizing IPMI for diagnostics and administering software tools.
Experienced in real-time issue resolution during deployment execution.
Familiarity with Windows Server OS and WinPE OS administration.
Linux PXE services experience is a plus.
Knowledge of network troubleshooting at Layer 1, Layer 2, and Layer 3 is beneficial.
Skilled in scripting languages such as PowerShell, Python, and Bash for automation.
Virtual machine setup and environmental configuration expertise.

Qualifications:

name_location: Strawberry (formerly Nordic Choice Hotels) · Stavanger, Rogaland, Norway  1 week ago  · 12 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Clarion Collection® Hotel er en samling av personlige hoteller med en genuint koselig og varm følelse. Du finner våre hotellperler midt i byen, akkurat nå i både Sverige og Norge. Hos oss får du ikke bare en komfortabel hotellseng og en skikkelig god frokostbuffet. Vi tilbyr også fika og, som eneste hotellkjede i Norden, vår populære kveldsmat – alle dager i uken. Vi ønsker at gjestene våre skal se oss som en venn på turen. En varm, omsorgsfull venn å komme hjem til, uansett hvor de er. Vi har en klar visjon om at Clarion Collection® Hotel skal tilby det mest personlige oppholdet med ekte omtanke. Treffer den visjonen deg rett i hjertet? Da gleder vi oss til å møte deg! Clarion Collection® Hotel – yours truly. Clarion Collection® Hotel er en del av Strawberry.

Har du lyst til å jobbe i den mest kreative og stadig voksende hotellkjeden i Nord-Europa? Er du en person som liker utfordringer og strever etter noe unikt? Strawberry har jobbet for innovasjon i hotellbransjen i mange år. Vi har tro på at talent kan komme fra hvor som helst. Vi er aldri gjennomsnittlig - er du?

Hotellet åpnet sine dører i 1988 og har spilt en avgjørende rolle for det moderne Stavanger. Med inspirasjon fra de gamle sjøbodene som preger området har hotellet vunnet priser for sin sjarmerende arkitektur. Med vakttårnet Valberget i bakgrunnen brukes ofte hotellet i markedsføring av Stavanger.

I 2011 ble hotellet medlem av Strawberry-familien innen Clarion Collection-kjeden og fikk da navnet Clarion Collection Hotel Skagen Brygge.

Hotellet finner du i et område med en lang og spennende historie preget av Stavangers sentrale rolle innen sildefiske. I nyere tid er Stavanger blitt Norges oljehovedstad. Hotellet ligger på bryggen i sentrum av Stavanger. Her nyter du utsikten over havneområdet og Gamle Stavanger, Nord-Europas best bevarte trehusbebyggelse.

Med vårt unike konsept finner gjestene roen og følelsen av å komme hjem. Frokost og enkel kveldsmat dekkes på hver dag og det byr vi på slik at de skal slippe å bekymre seg for å gå sulten.

Jobben

Påse at gjestene alltid blir ivaretatt gjennom ypperlig service og høyt kompetansenivå. 
Resepsjonsarbeid som inn- og utsjekk, svare på telefoner, ta imot bookinger, forberede ankomstlister, fakturering m.m. 
Være behjelpelig med gjestene både under og etter oppholdet. 
Salg av de produkter som finnes i resepsjonen og aktivt mersalg. 
Sørge for at sjekklister blir fulgt opp.
Påse at resepsjonsområdet og lobby ser ordentlig ut i henhold til gitte instruksjoner. 
Sørge for å være oppdatert og kjent med hotellets brann- og sikkerhetsrutiner.
Sørge for et godt arbeidsmiljø der alle stiller opp for hverandre. 
Behandle gjester og kollegaer med respekt.
Øvrige arbeidsoppgaver som kommer fra nærmeste leder
Stillingen innebærer skiftarbeid og helgejobbing. 
Ekstrahjelp med mulighet for fast stillingsprosent på sikt.

Talent

Du må være positiv, energisk, sosial, ha mot og være entusiastisk.
Du har gode datakunnskaper. Tidligere erfaring med bookingsystem er et pluss.
Fleksibel
Gode norske og engelsk-kunnskaper både skriftlig og muntlig

Vi tilbyr

En spennende og variert jobb med trivelige kollegaer i Nordens mest spennende og ekspansive hotellkonsern.
God opplæring og muligheter for videreutvikling.
Ta del i våre Super Colleague fordeler med ekstra gode priser på hoteller, reiser og restauranter.
Med over 200 hoteller i porteføljen til NCH finnes det også gode karrieremuligheter videre. 

Tiltredelse: snarest

Er dette en perfekte match for deg? Send oss din søknad i dag!

Hva venter du på?!
