job_description:
About the job
Integrated Defence Systems er en divisjon i Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace AS. Divisjonen utvikler og leverer avanserte og teknologisk ledende kommando-, kontroll-, og kommunikasjonsløsninger til hær, sjø og luftforsvar verden over. Hovedprodukter er NASAMS luftvernsystemer og kampsystemer til ubåter og overflatefartøy. Hovedvirksomheten er lokalisert på Kongsberg. Selskapet er positiv utvikling og vi trenger din hjelp for å vokse videre! Assembly & Test søker derfor etter en dyktig test operatør til test avdelingen.

Kongsberg Defence and Aerospace er inne i en periode med sterk vekst innenfor luftvernsprogrammet NASAMS og vi ønsker derfor å styrke vår organisasjon med en Test Operatør. I denne rollen vil du jobbe med operativ test og verifikasjon av verdensledende luftvernsystemer, Vi søker deg som liker høyt tempo, har gjennomføringsevne, arbeidskapasitet og interesse for fagfeltet test og verifikasjon. Du vil få jobbe tett sammen med et svært kompetent team, og bidra til leveranser av verdensledende luftvernssystemer, med rett kvalitet til rett tid!

Avdelingen Assembly & Test er lokalisert på Kongsberg og har ca. 65 ansatte fordelt på produksjon, planlegging, produksjons support og test. Hovedaktivitetene for Assembly & Test avdelingen er enhetsproduksjon og hovedsammenstilling av våre verdensledende løsninger.

Typiske Arbeidsoppgaver Vil Være

Gjennomføre tester etter prosedyrer på elektronikkbokser, kabler, og komplette systemer
Utføre tester ved hjelp automatisk utringing og automatisk teststasjon
Gi tilbakemelding til testutvikling på eventuelle feil/mangler i testprosedyrer/testutstyr.
Bistå med å sende instrumenter til kalibrering og ESD tester

Vi ser for oss at du har følgende kvalifikasjoner og egenskaper:

Fagbrev som produksjonselektroniker/automatiker/dataelektroniker eller avionikk.
Positiv, allsidig, praktisk og løsningsorientert med evne til å se sammenhenger og jobbe selvstendig
Ryddig og systematisk
God teknisk forståelse
Gode skiftelige og muntlige engelskkunnskaper

Vi Kan Blant Annet Tilby Deg

Interessante og spennende arbeidsoppgaver i et høyteknologisk miljø
Gode karriere- og utviklingsmuligheter i et internasjonalt selskap
Et godt arbeidsmiljø med faglig sterke og høyt motiverte kolleger
Konkurransedyktige betingelser med gode pensjons- og forsikringsordninger
Gode velferdsordninger med eget treningssenter, hytteutleie og mye mer

Ikke nøl med å ta direkte kontakt med Knut eller Sølve om du har ytterligere spørsmål om stillingen.

Vi gjør oppmerksom på at søknader behandles fortløpende.

Stillingen setter krav til at søkeren må kunne sikkerhetsklareres i Norge og NATO.

Reisevirksomhet må påregnes.

name_location: Infotree Global Solutions · Enebakk, Viken, Norway  2 months ago  · 26 applicants
job_description:
About the job
As a Data Center Technician, you will be responsible for performing various tasks, including hardware setup, diagnostics, troubleshooting, and decommissioning. You will follow standard procedures and protocols to ensure the smooth functioning of data center operations. Additionally, you will contribute to documentation efforts, share knowledge, and actively participate in team meetings and briefings. Your ability to work autonomously and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment will be instrumental in meeting or exceeding established service level agreements (SLAs).

Employment duration: 12+ month,

Location: Enebakk, Norway (26 km from Oslo),

Working model: On-site,

Employment: Permanent or Freelance Contract.

Responsibilities:

Prepare, stage, set up, and perform data center hardware startups and shutdowns following specific instructions provided via checklists, guides, protocols, and emails.
Assist and provide guidance to other technicians in completing challenging or complex tasks.
Conduct diagnostics and troubleshooting, swiftly identifying the root causes of issues and replacing faulty components with minimal customer and business disruption.
Perform post-execution quality checks, ensuring proper grounding, staging, labeling, and cabling according to safety protocols, deployment standards, and planned Network Design Tasks (NDTs).
Decommission hardware for simple changes and refreshes, following standard procedures with minimal guidance.
Follow procedures to communicate, report, and escalate incidents to appropriate management.
Participate in daily safety briefings, complete required safety training, and adhere to safety procedures.
Foster a positive and effective team environment by sharing information, contributing to team meetings, and staying informed about the progress of others' work.
Proactively share relevant information to enable efficient workflow and mitigate the impact of changes on others.
Efficiently complete assigned tickets and tasks, meeting or exceeding established Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Service Level Agreements (SLAs) with minimal guidance.
Demonstrate accountability and ownership of data center facilities, ensuring service quality and a positive user experience.
Develop a strong client focus and understand the impact of your work when completing tickets and assigned tasks.

Requirements:

Possess exceptional knowledge of server hardware, including a deep understanding of component and system failures.
Ability to assist in conducting failure analysis on field issues.
Ability to assist in tracking server fleet health, investigating emerging failure trends, and validating adherence to customer service level agreements (SLAs).
Solid experience in utilizing IPMI for diagnostics and administering software tools.
Proficiency in real-time issue resolution during new deployments.
Experienced in Windows Server OS and WinPE OS administration.
Familiarity with Linux PXE services is a plus.
Basic scripting experience in both Linux and Windows environments.
Ability to troubleshoot network issues at Layer 1, Layer 2, and Layer 3.
Proficiency in setting up virtual machines and configuring environments.
Ability to work autonomously as well as within a local or geographically dispersed team environment.

Qualifications:

2+ years of experience as a data center technician, demonstrating a strong foundation in data center operations.
Associate degree in computer science, computer engineering, information technology, or equivalent experience preferred.
CompTIA A+ or equivalent experience.
CompTIA Server+ or equivalent experience.
CCENT or equivalent experience.
Windows OS experience.
CCNA certification is preferred.
MCP/MSCE certification is preferred.
Scripting experience preferred, specifically in PowerShell, Python, or Bash.
Ability to lift up to 35 pounds when necessary.
Proficiency in safely climbing ladders and correctly wearing personal protective gear.
Ability to stand and walk throughout the facility for extended periods without loss of productivity.
Dexterity to handle, control, or feel objects, tools, or controls and perform repetitive movements without reduction in productivity.

name_location: Aker Solutions · Bergen, Vestland, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 10 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Do you want to play a role in solving global energy challenges for future generations?

At Aker Solutions we are committed to helping the energy industry and broader society #PowerTheChange towards a low-carbon future.Our ambitions are high. By 2030, renewables and low-carbon solutions for oil and gas will make up two-thirds of our business. Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?

The Life Cycle segment takes care of energy assets in a Life Cycle perspective. From the start to end of production, Life Cycle ensure safe operations. Our objective is to be a leading supplier of low carbon solutions and electrification projects. We focus on optimizing field life solutions, driven by decarbonization and environmentally sound offerings.

Our SAS department in Bergen is now looking for Graduate and Young Professionals SAS to help us in our mission to #powerthechange.

What will you be doing?
As a graduate in 2024 in Aker Solutions, you will be a part of a graduate program. This includes professional network, meet other graduates across locations and visit to our headquarter and one of our yards
As a permanent employee in Aker Solutions, you will participate in project teams that proudly deliver world class projects. You will work together with some of our most experienced and knowledgeable engineers and gain valuable experience
You will be joining a dedicated team of engineers and learn the methods as you go
You will be involved in a wide variety of projects ranging from smaller Front End Studies to Major Modification Projects and various Specialist Services
Training will be given and you will receive a mentor to guide you while developing your skills
We Think You Should Have
Student graduating in 2024 or recent years
Education in SAS area
If you like to like to plan, manage and execute tasks you will thrive in this role
Being proactive and have the ability take initiative are great personal skills that will be appreciated in this role
You will be given all the tools you need to succeed, and the rest is up to you!
More Reasons To Work With Us
As an employee in Aker Solutions, you have many career opportunities. We ensure that our employees get the chance to work across disciplines, build expertise and develop their own potential. This contributes to a vibrant and engaged working environment at all our locations.
A healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your life journey
Competitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker Care
Access to welfare club with free gym facilities, sports equipment hire and cabins for rent in the mountains and by the sea
You will be a part of our Solutioneers, an international employee network that brings together our young talents for professional development, networking and fun. In addition, Aker offer a wide range of welfare activities and training options for all our employees.
We can promise you it will be both challenging and fun!
Please send us a motivation letter together with your CV and transcript by 29.10.2023If you are currently enrolled in a program, you can send a preliminary grade transcript.Please note that applications without a diploma/transcript will not be evaluated.Background checks will be performed on final candidates.

Interested? Contact us.

Anders Fjærestad, Recruiter, NES Advantage Solutions, Anders.fjaerestad@nesfircroft.com

NES Advantage Solutions is Aker Solutions’ global recruitment services provider responsible for permanent and temporary staffing service. We use Semac background checking for final candidates in our recruitment processes.

Diversity and Inclusion

Aker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce. We ensure a good working environment where equal opportunity, diversity and inclusion are considered vital to our success. We believe diversity creates value, attracts talent, and makes life more interesting. We therefore encourage and welcome applications from diverse backgrounds related to race, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender, ethnicity, disability, age, and more.

This is Aker Solutions

Aker Solutions delivers integrated solutions, products and services to the global energy industry. We enable low-carbon oil and gas production and develop renewable solutions to meet future energy needs. By combining innovative digital solutions and predictable project execution we accelerate the transition to sustainable energy production. Aker Solutions employs approximately 15,000 people in more than 20 countries.

job_description:
About the job
Who we're looking for?

Paper & Tea is more than just a brand – we create meeting points where people can exchange ideas and together discover the beauty of life with all their senses. With the highest standards of quality, aesthetics, and the mission to enrich life itself, we aim to create an exceptional experience for our customers to feel good.

If you are as passionate about tea as we are and are always eager to learn new things, you will undoubtedly bring a smile to our customers' faces with high-quality teas & accessories. We are looking for you and your open personality, which allows you to approach people with enthusiasm and engage in exciting conversations.

Do you want to be part of a creative, open, and motivated team and shape the future of our exciting brand through exceptional customer service? Then join our Retail Team as an Store Sales Advisor now.

Your mission

You are an inspiring host and immerse your customers in the world of P & T.
You provide personalized advice and sell high-quality teas, accessories, paper products, and more from P & T.
With your open and warm approach, you enchant our customers by preparing and serving our Cold Brew beverages.
You joyfully accompany Tea Tastings & Events on-site with your team.

Your profile

Communication is your strength; you are cheerful, open, and warm-hearted, and enjoy engaging with people. 
You take pleasure in working in a motivated team and love learning new things, as well as sharing your knowledge with others. 
Weekend work, especially on Saturdays, suits your flexible lifestyle. 
You are fluent in English, Norwegian is a plus.
You can support us 10-15h per week. 

That sounds just like you? Then send us your CV in English along with your cover letter. We are looking forward to getting to know you.

Why us?

We believe there are many good reasons to work with us:

Our corporate culture is based on co-creation, individual proactive action, as well as collective support and appreciation.
Working time is living time that we share together - we collaborate in a friendly manner, exchange ideas, and celebrate our joint successes.
We operate with flat hierarchies, transparency, trust, and a culture of mutual respect, as working together on an equal footing is essential for us.
We are a diverse, open-minded team in a dynamic lifestyle company that aims to set new standards: Our brand cannot be categorized.
Employee discount on our products, travel allowance and corporate benefits program.

About Us

Paper & Tea stands for inspiration, creativity, and enjoyment. We want to enrich everyday life with high-quality products that inspire quality and unique design. Celebrate the little things, create wonderful moments, and consume consciously: whether with a cup of soothing tea or a timelessly beautiful notebook. The world of Paper & Tea invites you to enjoy. With 16 stores in currently three countries (Germany, Austria, Switzerland), an international online store, and a team of over 220 employees, we carry our mission of enriching life to the outside world.

name_location: Mediabooster Norge · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 13 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Mediabooster er et raskt voksende IT og Markedsføringsbyrå, og ser nå etter nye motiverte praktikanter!

Hvordan jobber vi i Mediabooster?

Vår metode og mål i alle prosjekter er å levere skreddersydder skalerbare webløsninger som er en “perfect match” med kundens markedsførings-løsninger. Vi har ingen nisje, vår metode skal funke uavhengig av bransje! Dvs at vi utvikler digitale løsninger etter behov, som har et formål: Gode og målbare resultater!

Som et team skaper vi overordnete strategier som koordinerer: webdesign og webutvikling, digital markedsføring, innholdsproduksjon og analyse, under en og samme paraply.

Vår målgruppe?

Vårt motto «Vi er ikke din leverandør, vi er din partner og kollega», gjør at vi er veldig selektive og jobber kun med kunder som ønsker et tett, langsiktig og seriøst samarbeid med oss.

Noen av webløsningene vi har levert er oliviarestauranter.no, bighorn.no og partnerplast.com.

Hva sier våre kunder om oss?

Hvem er du?

Vi søker etter praktikanter som ønsker å lære, og som tørr å ta eget initiativ!

Riktig person er i relevant utdannelse og har helst fullført relevante kurser/sertifiseringer på nett.

Som praktikant hos oss på Mediabooster vil du bli tildelt varierte oppgaver og ansvar for interne og eksterne prosjekter.

Det vil være arbeid i team og selvstendig arbeid, så du må trives med å prate med både kolleger og sluttbrukere.

Ideelt ser vi etter deg som går Bachelor eller Master, og som ønsker å jobbe deltid ved siden av studiene etter praktikplass. Dette er en perfekt mulig for deg som ønsker å sikre deg en fulltidsstilling når studiene er fullført.

Høyest på vår prioriteringsliste er en person som er pedagogisk, konsekvent og hyggelig å jobbe med!

Kvalifikasjoner vi ser etter:

Riktig person er i relevant utdannelse og har fullførte kurser/sertifiseringer man kan vise til.
Flytende i norsk og engelsk – muntlig og skriftlig.
Liker Kundedialog og god service. 
Du kan stå 100% bak vårt motto utad: “Vi er ikke din leverandør, vi er din partner og kollega”

For den rette kan vi tilby:

En langsiktig karriere.
Remote og fleksibel arbeidsplass og arbeidstid, tilpasset dine studier.
Full opplæring i våre systemer og prosesser.
Et godt arbeidsmiljø med kollegaer som støtter deg.
Utviklingsmuligheter i et selskap som vokser raskt.
Motiverende gründermiljø og utrolig dedikert team.
Mediabooster arranger team-events og sosiale samlinger stadig vekk!
Frihet til å utvikle deg, både faglig og personlig.

Om disse linjene ringer bjeller hos deg så ønsker vi å komme i kontakt med deg. Prosessen er allerede i gang, så ikke vent med å sende oss din søknad!

job_title: Quality Control Technician - Relocation to Malta
name_location: Magro Brothers · Norway  2 weeks ago  · 18 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Magro Brothers Group of Companies is a private, family-owned organisation. It finds its roots in 1916 when three Magro brothers joined their father`s business as general provisions merchants.

In 1934 they ventured in the processing and canning of fresh tomatoes and subsequently branched into a number of other business activities including the importation into Malta of livestock, fodder and foodstuffs and exports of local agricultural produce.

In 1977, John and Michael Magro, the sons of one of the first partners, took over the running of the business and further expanded their activities to include tinplate can manufacture, food distribution, retailing, advertising & marketing, property development.

In 1995, the company moved to a purposely built factory with a covered area of 27,000 square metres which today has become a centre of excellence for food processing in the Mediterranean.

In December 2013, John and Michael, being the 3rd generation in the Magro Brothers business enterprise, transferred their shares to John’s children namely, Christian, Nicholas and Joanna. Christian was appointed C.E.O. of the Group in January 2018 while John remains chairman of the Group and Michael continues to form part of the main board of directors.

The backbone of the food sector of Magro Brothers Group of Companies is still the processing of fresh tomatoes – Magro Brothers (Foods) Ltd is the major company within the group. It is one of the few local companies which handle the whole production cycle of tomato related products, from the growing of crops to the distribution of the finished product. This also includes the production of tinplate-cans. The present production range is very diversified and includes canned tomatoes, table and pasta sauces, ketchup, mayonnaise and other condiments, thin sauces, jams and ready-to-eat jellies.

The company is also well established in several overseas markets with sales offices in UK and Ireland supplying high profile international brands. Presently the company exports some 45% of its production to 20 countries spread in four continents.

In 2004, as part of the company’s policy of diversification and living up to market expectations, Magro Brothers Group expanded their business to offer exclusive gifting and hampers of Maltese delicacies and crafts under the Savina Brand and, in 2010 they ventured also in the production of traditional Maltese cheeses and dairy products under the popular Hanini Brand.

Today, with over 100 years’ experience, Magro Brothers Group of Companies has become one of the leading enterprises in Malta and has gained the respect of the local business community and the trust of most financial and commercial organisations. The owners take pride into rigorously monitoring the crops and herds of the many Maltese and Gozitan farmers who regularly supply fresh agricultural produce and milk to their organisation. This has helped the company to achieve the well-deserved premier position in food processing in Malta.

The company is very proud of its Quality credentials and boasts a BRC Grade AA food safety certification, an Organic certification and ISO 22000. They offer brand owners a wealth of manufacturing expertise and specialize in private label. Currently they supply their products to various multinational brand owners around the world and in major retail outlets.

The Role

You Will Be Responsible For

To ensure that products produced by the Magro Food Village (MBFL, Farm Fresh and Savina) are produced according to company’s standards and to the Food Law Legislation while ensuring that the final product is produced at its best by carrying out the required Quality Control tests and procedures.
To be responsible for the Quality Control Checks of the following:
 MBFL Chemical / Organoleptic Tests
 Savina Chemical / Organoleptic Tests
 Farm Fresh Chemical / Organoleptic Tests
 Daily chemical water analysis
 Assist in GRN testing of raw materials and packaging
To carry out quality spot checks and visual inspections on production lines at the Magro Food Village, while making sure that finished products conform with specifications and are within parameters following the checks conducted.
To ensure that proper GRN tests are being executed on all raw materials, including ingredients and packaging and if any non-conformance is noted, to overlook that the necessary actions are taken and the departments concerned are immediately updated.
To manage the Quality Control Samples Store where samples are retained for current year, and check that everything is correctly kept in order; checking also that the mid and end of shelf-life are checked and monitored.
To keep good communication with superiors and communicate effectively with Quality Control Personnel and all Departments concerned on findings.
To keep forms, documents and results duly filled and updated and properly filed for ease of reference and ensure that all data is inputted in computer system and that such system is kept up to date at all times.
 To follow correctly plant hygiene procedures, ensure that the areas which have been maintained are properly cleaned and that all the tools and equipment being used are properly maintained and accounted for.

Ideal Profile

Be a graduate.
In possession of a Degree in Food Technology.
Have between two (2) and three (3) years’ work experience in a similar role, in the food industry.
Have a good command (written and communication) in English to be able to liaise effectively to different stakeholders across the region.
Have good communication and leadership skills.
Be well organized, target oriented and can handle target pressures

What's on Offer?

Work alongside & learn from best in class talent
Join a well known brand within Hospitality
Leadership Role

name_location: NoA Ignite Norway · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 40 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Sommerjobb 2024 i NoA Ignite?
 Ser du for deg en karriere innen frontend, backend eller data engineering? Eller som en designer av digitale løsninger? Flaks! Vi ser allerede nå etter hele 12 studenter som har lyst å tilbringe sommeren 2024 hos oss i NoA Ignite. 
NoA Ignite er det største selskapet i The North Alliance — en progressiv byråfamilie med flere av de fremste strategi-, design-, teknologi- og kommunikasjonsselskapene i Norden. 
Vi i Ignite liker å se oss selv som et kraftsenter for alle typer digital vekst! Våre tverrfaglige team jobber i partnerskap med kundene for å finne nye måter å skape bærekraftige og forretningsorienterte digitale løsninger. Kombinert med innovasjon, personlig engasjement og en tydelig forretningsverdi blir dette solide digitale plattformer, e-handelsløsninger, datadrevne produkter og tjenester, nettsteder og apper vi vi er stolte av. Visste du at vi er kåret til ett av de mest innovative selskapene? 
Vi bruker sommerjobb som en rekrutteringskanal, Frøydis deler her sin opplevelse fra å gå fra sommerjobb til fast ansettelse. 

Årets oppgave:  Automatisering og prediksjonsmodeller. 
Som Summer-Intern hos oss i NoA Ignite får du mulighet til å jobbe på et prosjekt for noen av våre kunder. Du og de andre studentene vil jobbe i tverrfaglige team, veiledet av våre dyktige ansatte.
 Masterstudentene i år har over flere uker jobbet intensivt med nye løsninger for Meny og Avonova. For Meny har studentene utforsket hvordan prediktive modeller kan gjøre nettbutikkhandelen bedre med vareforslag. Det andre studentteamet har jobbet med å automatisere årsrapporten Avonova hvert år sender ut til sine kunder.
Felles for prosjektene er at de handler om å tilgjengeliggjøre data på en måte som gjør løsningen enklere og raskere å bruke. På denne måten skapte de verdi både for kunden og sluttbrukeren. Med fokus på brukeropplevelse og automatisering, endte Avonova-gjengen opp med en imponerende effektivisering av prosessen med å lage årsrapporter. Meny-teamets fokus på maskinlæring, brukerreise og design førte til et kjempeløft av handleopplevelsen i Meny-appen.
Hva oppgaven blir til neste år er foreløpig en overraskelse, men vi kan love minst like spennende utfordringer. Her kan du lese enda mer om årets prosjekt. I tillegg til å jobbe på prosjekt er det også mye hyggelig og sosialt som skjer. Det er jo tross alt sommer..
 

Hvem er så du? 
Om du er en student av det kreative slaget som holder på med et eller annet slags teknologi- eller designprogram ved universitet eller høgskole, vil vi gjerne høre fra deg. Mest sannsynligvis skal du i disse dager ta fatt på masterstudiet ditt. Kanskje klør det i fingrene etter å få arbeidserfaring som vil hjelpe deg med å utvikle ferdighetene dine og gi deg forståelse av hvordan det er å jobbe som konsulent. 
Har du gjort noen spennende prosjekter i studietiden som du kan vise til, vært aktiv i foreningsarbeid eller hatt relevant arbeidserfaring fra før av? Fortell oss gjerne om det når du sender oss din CV og søknad! Husk også å legge med karakterutskrift for studiene så langt. 

Hva kan vi tilby?
Målet vårt er først og fremst å skape et fantastisk sted å vokse og å være viktig partner for kundene våre. For å lykkes med det tenker vi både med hodet og hjertet, og gjør jobben vår med integritet og stolthet. Vi har selvfølgelig konkurransedyktige betingelser og tilbyr blant annet:
Å bli kjent med oss og de andre studentene før dere deles inn i team
En sosial sommer med mange aktiviteter
Små kurs innen design og utvikling på tvers om du er teknolog eller designer
Sentrale kontorer ved Stortinget og en del av et stort kreativt miljø
Mulighet til å ta egne valg i prosjektet. Dere får veiledning underveis, men også stor frihet til å velge teknologi og ta designavgjørelser selv
Gjennomprøvde og gode prosesser for strukturert teamarbeid som dere lærer av våre dyktige prosjektledere
 Frokost, lunsj, ettermiddagssnacks i kantinen, som er kåret til Norges beste. Vi har egen kaffebar og barista, og perfekt brygget «dagens kaffe». Make Office Coffee Great again! 
Et trygt arbeidsmiljø som verdsetter deg og din kunnskap
Relevante prosjekter som bygger CVen din! 

Vi vurderer søknader kontinuerlig og ser frem til å høre fra deg, men husk å sende inn din søknad før fristen 1. oktober!
Om prosessen:
Vi kaller inn fortløpende til en kort første prat med deg om hva du er interessert i og dine tanker rundt det å være konsulent. Etter det er det en kort fagprat med noen av lederne våre som baserer seg på hva du kan og vil lære mer om. Vi bruker tester i prosessen fra AlvaLabs som går på hva slags personprofil du er og hvordan du resonnerer. Etter det tar vi en samlet vurdering av prosessen. Det høres kanskje litt omfattende ut, men vi ønsker å ha ulike profiler som også jobber godt sammen. Vi får alltid god feedback av studentene om at dette er det beste teamet de har jobbet i; Da bruker vi heller litt ekstra tid i prosessen.

For androids, the company has created a fully immersive virtual reality-based robot teleoperation system. Each day is unique!

Work on the ongoing development of the company's virtual reality application for robot teleoperation with the team.

name_location: Guidepost Montessori · Time, Rogaland, Norway  5 days ago  · 15 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Are you passionate about helping children under the age of 6 years old?  Have you been looking for a preschool where you can grow and develop your career? If so, join us in our mission to spread Montessori education to children around the world!

We are looking for a Spanish speaking, enthusiastic and adaptable teacher who is interested in learning more about early childhood education in Alexandria, Virginia.

Your role: 

In this Assistant Guide role, you will support our Lead Guides in guiding children to be more independent and confident in their abilities. This is a great opportunity to start your career in Montessori, and early childhood education more generally, as many of our Assistant Guides ultimately grow to take on Lead Guide roles over time, thanks to our MACTE-accredited Montessori training program.

This position is a full-time role with great benefits including health, dental, and vision insurance, a 401K, a competitive rate of pay, and a generous 75% tuition discount for up to two children at our school. 

We would love to talk to you if you: 

Are familiar with the development of young children
Are bilingual in Spanish and English
Have strong interpersonal skills and a customer-service oriented mindset 
Are willing to grow and learn 

Want to learn more about us?

Guidepost Montessori is a community of educators who truly believe that to meet the needs of today's students and to bring about true progress in the world around us, we need an education model that fosters independence and develops competent, capable, action-oriented thinkers and change agents. For more information about us, check out our website.

Join our school community by applying below!

About Us

Guidepost Montessori is a growing network of 100+ Montessori schools, serving children ages 0-12 in our Nido, Toddler, Children’s House, and Elementary programs. And with schools from Shanghai to Paris and California to New York, as well as virtual school and homeschooling support, there are countless opportunities for passionate educators to support children on their individual path to success.

At Guidepost, we believe children are capable and we design an education for independence. We’re on a mission to radically transform education based on this belief—for children, parents, and educators!

Our mission? Children who fully experience and joyfully achieve their own development; children who can reach their highest potential and flourish—in school and in life!

If you love children and have been looking for the right opportunity to grow, join our school community by applying below!

About the job
Job Overview

This is an opportunity to join the Workforce Assurance team at The Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust as a Workforce Assurance Officer.

The successful candidate will support the Workforce Systems Information Officer and the Workforce Planning and Engagement Lead to ensure the workforce data and analytics needs of the organisation are met and in supporting the organisation to make data driven, evidence based, decisions.

Use all available workforce information systems to design and produce workforce reports

Present reports in a variety of formats and make recommendations for improvement.

name_location: DIPS AS · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  1 day ago  · 5 applicants
job_description:
About the job
DIPS AS er et programvarehus som utvikler samfunnskritisk helseteknologi og leverer digitale arbeidsverktøy til norske sykehus. Vår aller viktigste ressurs er våre 400 medarbeidere. Med et mangfold av ansatte, kunder og partnere fremmer vi innovasjon og brukervennlighet. Sammen skaper vi løsninger som gir klinisk verdi for over 100 000 brukere i helsetjenesten. Vi er en sentral del av Kernel-konsernet, og Norges ledende leverandør av e-helse. DIPS er utviklet for helsepersonell, pasienter og norske forhold siden 1987.

DIPS er på vei til å bli en designdrevet organisasjon og vi vil ha med deg som ønsker å gjøre en reell forskjell innen folks helse og liv.

Det satses på design i DIPS, og designavdelingen vår har vokst til å bli en solid og flott gjeng med UX- og tjenestedesignere både i Oslo, Bodø og Trondheim. I tillegg til våre fire designere i Trondheim, leter vi nå etter to nye UX/digitale designere.

Er du en UX/Digital designer som vil være med på å skape gode digitale løsninger for morgendagens helsetjenester? Da bør du lese videre.

Vi ser etter deg som kan tenke deg å jobbe med komplekse problemer innen e-helse, og ønsker å bidra til at helsearbeidere får gode digitale verktøy slik at de bruker mindre tid til administrativt arbeid og mer tid på pasientene.

Du har gjerne en helhetlig tilnærming til design med teft for komplekse utfordringer og kreativitet. Vi ser etter deg med en lidenskap for gode brukeropplevelser, som ønsker å bruke dine UX- og UI-ferdigheter til å gjøre en forskjell. Kanskje du liker å jobbe både med konseptutvikling og samtidig er opptatt av struktur og detaljer for å skape brukervennlige, engasjerende grensesnitt?

Du trives med å

Fasilitere og lede designprosesser i tverrfaglige team fra idé til implementering
Utvikle UX/UI-design for digital programvare og applikasjoner, både på desktop og mobil
Drive innsiktsarbeid, behovskartlegging og konseptutvikling
Visualisere og kommunisere innsikt og informasjon slik at budskapet blir lett å forstå
Skissere ut arbeidsflyt og utforme detaljerte skjermbilder
Prototype og brukerteste konsepter og produkter
Skape visuelle grensesnitt som engasjerer 

Vi ønsker at du

Har solid kunnskap om UX- og brukersentriske designmetoder (utdanning og/eller erfaring)
Er en engasjert lagspiller som liker å samarbeide på tvers av team og fag
Kan bruke Figma som verktøy for å skape «piksel-perfekte» grensesnitt
Tør å prøve og feile, tar initiativ og får ting til å skje
Behersker både norsk og engelsk, og har god skriftlig og muntlig formidlingsevne

Vi tilbyr

Flotte kontorer på Solsiden i Trondheim.
Muligheten til å være med på å bygge opp et sterkt designmiljø innen e-helse.
Anledning til å sette ditt preg på arbeidsprosesser og arbeidsflater for de som yter helsehjelp.
Hyggelige kolleger som brenner for helse og alltid stiller opp for å hjelpe deg.
Innovativt fagmiljø med fremragende kompetanser innen e-helse.
Gode lønnsbetingelser, full lønn i foreldrepermisjon, gode personalforsikringer og en svært god pensjonsordning. 
Mange sosiale arrangement.
Faglig påfyll gjennom fagdager, hackatons og konferanser.

Vi har kunder og sluttbrukere både i nord, vest og sør-øst, og avhengig av prosjekt må det påregnes noe reisevirksomhet.

Lyst til å vite mer?

For spørsmål om stillingen kan du kontakte designleder Marita Lund Koppang på telefon 417 64 472 eller mlk@dips.no.

Hvis dette høres spennende ut, håper vi å høre fra deg!

Registrerer din søknad via lenken på denne siden, og legg ved CV (inkl personalia) og portfolio.

job_description:
About the job
Do you want to play a role in solving global energy challenges for future generations?

At Aker Solutions we are committed to helping the energy industry and broader society #PowerTheChange towards a low-carbon future.Our ambitions are high. By 2030, renewables and low-carbon solutions for oil and gas will make up two-thirds of our business. Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?

The Life Cycle segment takes care of energy assets in a Life Cycle perspective. From the start to end of production, Life Cycle ensure safe operations. Our objective is to be a leading supplier of low carbon solutions and electrification projects. We focus on optimizing field life solutions, driven by decarbonization and environmentally sound offerings.

Our Process department in Bergen is now looking for Graduates & Young Professional Safety to help us in our mission to #powerthechange.

What will you be doing?
As a graduate in 2024 in Aker Solutions, you will be a part of a graduate program. This includes professional network, meet other graduates across locations and visit to our headquarter and one of our yards
As a permanent employee in Aker Solutions, you will participate in project teams that proudly deliver world class projects. You will work together with some of our most experienced and knowledgeable engineers and gain valuable experience
You will be joining a dedicated team of engineers and learn the methods as you go
You will be involved in a wide variety of projects ranging from smaller Front End Studies to Major Modification Projects and various Specialist Services
Training will be given and you will receive a mentor to guide you while developing your skills
We Think You Should Have
Student graduating in 2024 or recent years
Education relevant to Safety
If you like to like to plan, manage and execute tasks you will thrive in this role
Being proactive and have the ability take initiative are great personal skills that will be appreciated in this role
You will be given all the tools you need to succeed, and the rest is up to you!
More Reasons To Work With Us
As an employee in Aker Solutions, you have many career opportunities. We ensure that our employees get the chance to work across disciplines, build expertise and develop their own potential. This contributes to a vibrant and engaged working environment at all our locations.
A healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your life journey
Competitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker Care
Access to welfare club with free gym facilities, sports equipment hire and cabins for rent in the mountains and by the sea
You will be a part of our Solutioneers, an international employee network that brings together our young talents for professional development, networking and fun. In addition, Aker offer a wide range of welfare activities and training options for all our employees.
We can promise you it will be both challenging and fun!
Please send us a motivation letter together with your CV and transcript by 29.10.2023If you are currently enrolled in a program, you can send a preliminary grade transcript.Please note that applications without a diploma/transcript will not be evaluated.Background checks will be performed on final candidates.

Interested? Contact us.

For More Information About The Position, Please Contact

Anders Fjærestad, Recruiter, NES Advantage Solutions, Anders.fjaerestad@nesfircroft.com

NES Advantage Solutions is Aker Solutions’ global recruitment services provider responsible for permanent and temporary staffing service.

We use Semac background checking for final candidates in our recruitment processes.

Diversity and Inclusion

Aker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce. We ensure a good working environment where equal opportunity, diversity and inclusion are considered vital to our success. We believe diversity creates value, attracts talent, and makes life more interesting. We therefore encourage and welcome applications from diverse backgrounds related to race, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender, ethnicity, disability, age, and more.

This is Aker Solutions

Aker Solutions delivers integrated solutions, products and services to the global energy industry. We enable low-carbon oil and gas production and develop renewable solutions to meet future energy needs. By combining innovative digital solutions and predictable project execution we accelerate the transition to sustainable energy production. Aker Solutions employs approximately 15,000 people in more than 20 countries.

job_description:
About the job
We are looking for a Summer Intern for our Marine Business Department.

Are you curious about international sales…?

We are looking for a service minded and outgoing person to be a part of our team next summer! 

The Marine Business Department in Framo is responsible for key account management, sales, and global profiling of our systems for the maritime sector worldwide. Framo is a diverse global organization, with head office and production in the Bergen area, Norway.

As an example, our cargo handling system plays a central role in the worldwide chemical and product trade. We strive to continuously improve our global position in the markets we are part of.

You will as an intern get the chance to see how it is to work across internal departments as well as towards our partners and customers worldwide. Our main stakeholders include Ship Owners, Energy majors and Shipyards. You will receive necessary training and take part in preparing technical system specifications and commercial quotations. The position also includes sales and project execution, order and contract handling as well as technical and commercial analysis and calculations.

Furthermore, you will also get the opportunity to take part in technical discussions and commercial negotiations with customers from all over the world. We are looking for someone who is service minded and outgoing, with good communication and cooperative skills.

Due to increasing market activity, we are in the process of strengthening our commercial team in Bergen, Norway. As a successful summer intern, you will be well-positioned for a full-time position in Framo after your studies.

The Framo Summer Internship

6-8 weeks from mid-June to mid-August
Introduction to the entire Framo organization
Learn by doing real tasks in the Sales Department, and learn from a dynamic team with long experience and deep knowledge of the maritime industry
Join one of our Area Sales Managers on an international customer visit
Future career opportunities both within Framo and in the wider Alfa Laval organization

As a Framo Sales Department Intern You Should Have

Minimum three years of completed studies (3rd or 4th year student)
Good academic results
Good communication skills, cooperation skills and be interested in increasing your cultural understanding as our customers and colleagues are based world-wide
The person should also possess the ability to work independently and systematic

For further information, please contact Steinar Fjelldal; 909 42 173 // stfj@framo.no

You can apply for the position in Workday. Search for "Find Job Vacancies" in the search field and use the details from your Workday profile to apply.

The application deadline is October 31st 2023.

name_location: PortalOne, Inc · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 week ago  · 42 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Since 2018, PortalOne has been laser-focused on its mission to converge the best of gaming and live TV to build an entirely new category: hybrid games. To succeed in forging this new category, we've built a team of industry experts from around the world, all bringing unique experience from diverse industries. This, paired with our extensive roster of world-class investors and advisors, will enable us to deliver this next generation of entertainment.

We want to increase the joy and value of playtime, and realise the full potential of immersive, gamified experiences to entertain, inspire, connect and develop people around the world. While our product is currently in beta, we are significantly outperforming industry standards, and we're now looking to supercharge our growth and increase our velocity as we gear up to launch PortalOne out into the world.

Regardless of your role, department or level, we focus on cultivating a supportive, team-oriented, and collaborative environment. The beauty of joining our team at this stage is that each department is currently relatively small, meaning that your work will have a direct impact on our products, significantly influencing our mission to unlock the potential of hybrid games.

THAT'S WHERE YOU COME IN

As a Game Designer, you will be at the forefront of innovation, responsible for proposing new types and formats of games, collaborating with brands and intellectual properties, and shaping the direction of our game portfolio. Your creative vision, strategic thinking, and knowledge of market trends will drive the exploration and selection of exciting new opportunities for PortalOne.

YOUR CHALLENGE

Take on the challenge of proposing and shaping new game types, formats, and collaborations by:

Researching and analyzing market trends, player preferences, and emerging technologies to identify new opportunities for game concepts and formats.
Designing creative game concepts and prototypes, considering the unique possibilities of hybrid games and the target audience.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including other game designers, artists, engineers, and producers, to refine and develop game ideas into compelling proposals.
Translating proposals for new games into high level design documents for new games, including feature specifications, level designs, and game flowcharts.
Evaluating and recommending potential collaborations with brands and intellectual properties that align with our vision and target audience.
Creating pitch materials and presentations to effectively communicate and advocate for new game ideas and collaborations.
Conducting market research and competitive analysis to understand the landscape and inform strategic decision-making.
Working closely with licensing teams and legal advisors to ensure compliance and secure necessary partnerships and licenses.
Contributing to the overall game design process by providing insights and feedback on existing projects and collaborating with other game designers.
Collaborating with the broader game design team to iterate on improve gameplay systems, difficulty curves, and player progression to provide a satisfying and enjoyable gameplay experience.
Collaborating with the production team to define and meet project milestones and deadlines.

Who You Are

Bring your passion for game design and creative thinking to the table. If you meet the criteria below, we’d love to hear from you!

A minimum of 5 years of professional experience as a Game Designer or in a related role, with a proven track record of proposing and developing successful game concepts.
Strong sense of key components that drive early, mid, and late game retention and other core KPIs.
Deep knowledge of metagame systems and best practices in Mobile games
Experienced at using data, analytics, and other forms of validation to inform game and systems tuning.
Deep understanding of game design principles, mechanics, and player psychology.
Strong research and analytical skills, with the ability to identify market opportunities and trends.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively articulate and sell new game ideas and collaborations.
Collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Passion for gaming and a keen eye for innovative and engaging gameplay experiences.

Bonuses:

Bachelor's degree in Game Design, Computer Science, or a related field is preferred but not mandatory.
Experience in social systems, meta-game systems, and/or monetization.
Experience with Unreal Engine.
Experience working on a multi-platform game.

CONTINUE? 

>YES / NO

job_title: Ph.D.-scholarship in modelling and simulation of solid oxide fuel cell systems
name_location: Western Norway University of Applied Sciences · Bergen, Vestland, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
This is Western Norway University of Applied Sciences With about 17,500 students, Western Norway University of Applied Sciences is one of the largest higher education institutions in Norway. A broad range of academic programmes are offered at Bachelor, Master and PhD levels, spread out on five campuses Førde, Sogndal, Bergen, Stord og Haugesund. Our ambition is to build stronger and more solid academic and research environments that will interact nationally and internationally. The aim is to become a recognized actor on the international higher education arena. Increased international cooperation and engagement in externally funded projects will work towards this goal. The Faculty of Engineering and Science has approximately 370 employees and approximately 3,260 students. The faculty has a broad educational offer at both bachelor's and master's level in engineering and science, as well as PhD education in computer technology. The Mohns Center for Innovation and Regional Development researches innovation and offers master's education in innovation and entrepreneurship. The diving education offers a one-year vocational school education. The main part of the faculty's activities are in Haugesund, Bergen, Sogndal and Førde, but we also offer decentralized education in Florø, Kristiansund and Stord. The faculty's activities are internationally based and take place in close collaboration with regional companies, clusters, health trusts and the public sector, including other institutions in the university and college sector. This applies to research, development, innovation and not least education with student projects at all levels. The Department of Mechanical and Marine Engineering has 40 employees. More than 70% of the academic staff have first competence, of which 7 are professors. The department has about 600 students and educates engineers. There are 5 educational programs offered at bachelor level (general mechanical engineering, ocean technology, energy technology, marine technology and sustainable production and circular economy), and 2 at master's level (sustainable energy technology and ocean technology i cooperation with University of Bergen). R&D work in energy, materials technology and marine technology is conducted at the department. The department has modern laboratories with, among other things, Marinlab for testing boats and offshore structures. Great emphasis is placed on developing the content of our study programs in close collaboration with the public and private business community, which are employers for our engineers. Western Norway University of Applied Sciences (Høgskulen på Vestlandet, HVL), Faculty of Engineering and Science, has a vacancy for a scholarship (PhD position) in modelling and simulation of solid oxide fuel cell systems for maritime applications About the position (Ph.D.-scholarship): Western Norway University of Applied Sciences (Høgskulen på Vestlandet, HVL) has an open Ph.D. position with a project period of 4 years at the Department of Mechanical and Marine Engineering. The Ph.D. candidate will be part of interdisciplinary research groups focusing on energy and environmental technology and data science. Due to the nature of the work to be carried out in the project, the candidate will be a part of the Ph.D.-programme Computer Science: Software Engineering, Sensor Networks and Engineering Computing. This programme is located at the Faculty of Engineering and Science at Western Norway University of Applied Sciences. Workplace will be at HVL campus Bergen. Tasks and areas of responsibility: The shipping industry is undergoing a transformation with respect to propulsion and other energy systems and the types of zero-emissions fuels to be used already in the near future. Modelling and simulation of ship energy systems as a whole and of certain components plays a vital role in finding optimal solutions and operation modes for hybrid propulsion systems. The main objective of the project to be worked on is the development of simulation models for establishing architectures for controlling a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) system, which is part of a maritime energy system. The development is to be carried out with the help of big data analysis and machine learning with data from a test facility where a 100 kW SOFC will be running on renewable fuel as part of a prototype of a maritime propulsion system. The simulation models and control architectures shall aim for optimal operation of the fuel cell with respect to parameters like, for example, cell voltage, load, degradation, and environmental conditions. Furthermore, the simulation models shall be able to help with planning predictive maintenance of the fuel cell stack and its subsystems as well as be usable in simulations of hybrid maritime energy systems. As part of the required duties (25% of the position), the candidate will join the team focusing on regional development at the faculty and the department. This might include:

Promote more externally funded research projects in collaboration between our research environment and the shipping industry.

Interact with regional, national and international partners, and work to promote cooperation between the department and the surrounding society (e.g., bachelor and master theses).

Mobilization to promote research-based innovation in the shipping industry in collaboration with our participation in the project FORREGION Vestland.

Supporting the department in our work related to lifelong learning in the shipping industry, with emphasis on strengthening the portfolio of flexible and decentralized education. A separate application to join the Ph.D. programme Computer Science: Software Engineering, Sensor Networks and Engineering Computing must be submitted and accepted within 3 months of starting in the position. The supervisors will help with this procedure. Qualifications (requirement): Admission to the Ph.D. programme requires that the applicant holds a master's degree within computer science, informatics, engineering computing, scientific computing, or computational engineering. Candidates from other natural sciences or engineering disciplines, in particular control systems engineering, holding a master's degree with a strong emphasis on computing may also qualify for admission to the programme. A master's dissertation of at least 30 ECTS is required.

Admission to the Ph.D. programme requires an equivalent of grade B or better on the ECTS grading system for the master's dissertation and an average equivalent to grade C or better on the ECTS grading system for the courses taken in the master's programme.

Documented programming skills such as Matlab, Python, C++ etc.

Documented skills in big data analysis and machine learning. Favoured qualifications (not a requirement):

Knowledge and experience of modelling, simulation and control of energy systems.

Knowledge of and experience with energy systems containing fuel cells.

Knowledge of and experience with optimization methods.

A formal background (bachelor/master's degree) in control systems engineering is beneficial. Personal abilities:

Ability to contribute towards a good work environment and in teamwork.

Excellent communication skills, ability to communicate well in both written and spoken English. Proficiency, written and spoken, in a Scandinavian language is an advantage. Applicants who have submitted a master's thesis (but who have not yet been awarded a master's degree) may also qualify for the position provided that the master`s degree is awarded within 4 weeks after the application deadline. Applicants already holding a Ph.D. are not eligible for this position. For more information, contact: Associate Prof. Norbert Lümmen. The PhD candidate will be assigned two academic supervisors at Western Norway University of Applied Sciences, combined with an advisory group with members from both research groups. An application for enrolment should first be submitted after an appointment is made and the supervisor(s) will help with this procedure. Normally the candidate apply for enrolment within three (3) months after the start of the employment according to Regulations relating to programmes of study and examinations at Western Norway University of Applied SciencesHVL

2-4. Application procedure: Applications will be evaluated by an expert panel of three members. Applicants are asked to submit their application and CV online. Please use the link «Apply for this job» («Søk stillingen»). The following documentation must be uploaded as an attachment to the online application:

Master's dissertation

Copies of selected academic publications (no more than 15)

A CV with a complete list of academic publications

Diplomas and certificates

Required

At least one letter of recommendation, preferably from a previous academic supervisor. Applicants should indicate which publications or parts of publications should be given special consideration in the evaluation. If the documents submitted are not in a Scandinavian language or in English, the applicants must submit certified translations of these. The transcripts must specify the topics, the course works, and the grades at the bachelor`s and master`s degree levels. Applicant whose education is from another country than Norway, need to also attach a certified translation of the diploma and transcript of grades to English or a Scandinavian language, if the original is not in any of these languages. It is required that the applicant enclose a review from NOKUT whether the education (bachelor and master's degree) is of a scope and level that corresponds to the level of a Norwegian master's degree. Please see www.nokut.no/en for more information about NOKUT's general recognition. This may take some time and we recommend you to apply as soon as you know you will apply for this position. If no answer within the application deadline, please enclose documentation from NOKUT that they have received your application. Applicants should note that the evaluation will be based on the documentation submitted electronically via Jobbnorge within the submission deadline. The applicants are responsible for ensuring that all the documentation is submitted before the closing date. It is of utmost importance that all publications to be considered in the evaluation are uploaded as an attachment with the application, since these are sent electronically to the expert panel. Applications cannot be sent by e-mail or to individuals at HVL. Salary:

Good occupational pension, insurance and loan schemes from The Norwegian Public Service Pension Fund

Exciting academic environment with the possibility of competence enhancement and development

Opportunities for training within the working hours

Initial salaries will be offered at grade 54 (code 1017) in the Civil Service pay grade table scale. There is a compulsory 2 % deduction to the pension fund (see http://www.spk.no for more information). The successful applicant must comply with the guidelines that apply to the position at any time. General information: The appointment will be made in accordance with the regulations for State employees Law in Norway ("Lov om statens ansatte)". Organizational changes and changes in the duties and responsibilities associated with the position must be expected. State employment shall reflect the multiplicity of the population at large to the highest possible degree. Western Norway University of Applied Sciences Bergen has therefore adopted a personnel policy objective to ensure that we achieve a balanced age and gender composition and the recruitment of persons of various ethnic backgrounds. Information about the applicant may be made public even though the applicant has requested not to be named in the list of applicants. The applicant will be notified if his/her request is not respected. Short-listed applicants will be called in for an interview. Employed on condition that you are granted a work and residence permit (must be considered individually). Western Norway University of Applied Sciences is subjected to the regulation for export control system. The regulation might be applied in the processing of the applications. Contacts: 1) Associate Prof. Norbert Lümmen, +47 55 58 76 41, Norbert.Luemmen@hvl.no

About the job
Overview

 Job ID- 26736 
 Country- Norway 
 Location(s)- Stavanger 
 Company- Equinor ASA 
 Contact Name- internships@equinor.com 
 Workplace- Onshore 
 Discipline- Information Technology 
 Education Preferred- Bachelor or Master's degree 
 Experience Preferred- Less than 2 years 
 Closing Date- Nov 13 2023 

Job Description

As a summer intern at Equinor, you will join 22,000 colleagues delivering oil, gas, wind, and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. By 2050, we aim to become a net-zero company and provide the energy the world needs without contributing to global warming. It is one of the defining challenges of our time, and attracting and developing the brightest minds will be critical to our success.

The position

Our summer internship is a 6-week programme designed to provide the experience and skills you need in your studies and future career. Our Norwegian and UK internship will begin on 17 June and ends on 02 August 2024, with one week off starting 15 July.

You can find out more about the programme at www.equinor.com/careers/summer-interns

In Cyber Security, you’ll be at the forefront of protecting Equinor. From detecting and responding to cyber threats to safeguarding operational technology and promoting secure software development, you'll tackle a variety of challenges while working in a highly collaborative environment.

As a summer intern you will have the possibility to-

Learn how the different aspects of Cyber are applied at Equinor (i.e. detect, respond, threat intelligence, security testing, awareness).
Participate in the day-to-day activities of our Cyber Defense Center.
Participate in the development of our Detect toolbox.

We are looking for summer interns who are collaborators, eager to learn and with a passion for Cyber Security.

You

Some qualities are essential for Equinor. You identify with our values, open, collaborative, courageous and caring, which guide our decisions and help us succeed and grow. You make safety your priority and contribute to our zero-harm culture. For this position, we are also looking for-

 Cu rrently studying for Bachelor’s, Master’s degree, or Ph.D. with a strong academic record within IT or Cyber Security
 Fluent in English and preferably a second working language
 No more than two year s of relevant full-time work experience
 Have c ompleted at least two years of higher education before the internship programme starts (1 7 June 202 4 )
 Have at least one year of higher education left after the internship programme ends (0 2 August 202 4 )
 The interns need to be located in the country where the internship takes place during its entire duration. Equinor does not support any relocation for our summer interns .
 Candidates must have the necessary work permit for the country in which they are applying for a position. The work permits must be valid at the point of application and for the duration of the employment. Please note that Equinor does not support, or sponsor work or visa permits for internship applications. Read more about it on the national authorities’ pages-
 Extracurricular activities and/or voluntary work are an advantag e

Every role and business area requires its own specific set of skills and personal attributes. Some of the qualities and characteristics we look for include-

 An awareness of risk and a commitment to safety for yourself and those around you.
 Effective communication skills and the ability to facilitate collaboration, influence stakeholders, and contribute to a diverse and inclusive culture.
 The flexibility to adapt to change, embrace new technology , and perform in a digitally enabled environment .
 Demonstrating a curious mind and the ability to problem-solve, innovate, and identify new ways of delivering against our objectives .

Equinor is an equal opportunities employer . We welcome applications from all candidates who meet the educational and experience requirements, including those with disabilities. If you have any specific requirements for any stage in our process, please make this clear in your application , and our team will be happy to support you .

General information

Please make sure that when applying, you attach the following-

 CV/ resume in English
 transcripts of records (or other documents describing subjects and grades) in English or Scandinavian language obtained to this point during your studies. If you are in the process of completing a degree, please upload an official temporary transcript.

Applications submitted without these attachments will unfortunately not be evaluated. To ensure an efficient recruitment process, please be informed that you may apply for a maximum of 3 Summer Internship roles per country.

Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process. Candidates will be asked for information on affiliation to high-risk countries for a security assessment. Furthermore, background checks are performed on all final candidates and all permanent and temporary hires will be screened against relevant sanctions lists to ensure compliance with sanctions law.

Why join us?

The summer internship is an opportunity for you to get to know Equinor, our people and culture, and the way we work. You will work on various tasks and projects that will provide value for you and Equinor. You can also expect-

Hands-on experienceYou will spend roughly 80% of your internship working on tasks and projects within the discipline you have applied for, giving you first-hand experience of your team's strategy, processes, and culture. Interns will spend the remaining 20% on learning experiences and a group project.

Learning and developmentYou will join a series of learning sessions that provide an overview of our business and introduce you to some of the processes we use at Equinor. These will include introductions to key areas of our strategy and learning opportunities covering various professional skills that will help you in your future career.

Multi-disciplinary projectYou will work on a group project with other interns from various academic backgrounds, guided and supported by an experienced employee. Over the course of this project, you will develop critical skills such as collaboration, leadership, communication, presentation, planning, and time management.

A balanced and rewarding work cultureOur interns have the same opportunities to work flexibly as the rest of our employees, allowing you to balance work with the things that matter away from the office. We also recognize that your internship is an opportunity to build lifelong relationships and networks. We encourage all our interns to take advantage of this.

For more information, visit Equinor's website www.equinor.com/careers/summer-interns

name_location: Airthings · Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 44 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Are you passionate about using your tech skill to make the world more sustainable? 

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our data and insights team at Airthings, bringing our solutions to the next level.
Airthings — Our business & people Empower the world to breathe better

Airthings is a global tech company creating world-class air quality and radon monitors for people and businesses. Led by a team of experienced scientists, engineers, developers and visionaries, Airthings is on a mission to ensure people around the world take control of their air quality and energy footprint through simple, sustainable and accessible technology solutions – making radon, air quality and energy saving solutions an essential and universal element for every building or home.

You will join a company going places with huge international expansion plans. We have big goals, challenges and learning opportunities. Our international environment has a focus on diversity and inclusion, and out of our 130+ employees, we (so far) have 35 different nationalities. And we want more! You will get to work with a group of people with high competence, that are fun, caring and a bit “crazy.”

About the team and the role
The new data and insights team in Airthings is currently building a data platform and developing algorithms to extract insights and provide customer value in the domain of air quality and energy optimization in buildings. The evolution of the data platform is continuous and you will have a big impact on how we work and shape the platform. As a data scientist, you’ll be responsible for explorations, feasibility studies, making prototypes and models. We continuously improve our data quality, and work on making our data clean, structured and available for different parts of the company. We also use it for developing external services and products. 

The Airthings ecosystem includes mobile apps, web clients, smart home integrations, building management systems and houses, and you will work in projects with experts in software engineering for apps, cloud and web, in addition to data scientists. We build our software with AWS and tools like AWS Sagemaker, Glue, Lambda, ECS, MSK/Kafka, Kotlin (Ktor, Vertx) and Python (Pandas, Tensorflow). We manage our infrastructure with Terraform (IaC) and use Athena and a lot of SQL for transforming our data.

We look for
We are looking for a team player, intellectually curious and eager to grow with the company. You will have a key role in developing algorithms for reducing energy consumption while maintaining good air quality in buildings, significantly contributing to reducing the CO2 emissions worldwide. You are motivated by bringing value to the end-customers, through a pragmatic adaptation to real life conditions. Experience with above mentioned technical frameworks is a plus, but not a must. Curiosity, open mindedness and willingness takes you far!

In addition, you:
are hands on with your analytical skills, expertise in data science and machine learning, and enjoy solving complex problems
have experience in working with both structured and unstructured data sources, exploration, hypothesis testing and statistical modeling
want to develop and implement models, proof-of-concepts and prototypes
are comfortable with taking a pragmatic approach to provide customer value from real data
are familiar with Python, SQL and various machine learning libraries
are curious and want to drive initiatives
Experience from the health tech - or energy optimization industry is a plus, but not a requirement, as long as you are interested in learning!

Perks & Benefits:
You get to be a key member of a great international team in Oslo that is becoming a world leader in smart air quality monitoring. Central office located in downtown Oslo, facing the royal castle. Competitive compensation package, competitive salary, social events, health insurance, pensions saving and more:
Work-life balance is important, and we aim to be flexible
KPI bonuses: We recognize strong performance and reward with annual bonuses
Share options: Airthings employees have the opportunity to invest in the company
Tasty lunches
Company retreats: Hiking mountains, skiing down slopes, it's all part of our Norwegian spirit
Social events: We work hard and play hard with recurring social activities
Working for a greater cause: improving people’s health and well-being, and improving energy efficiency of buildings.

Our culture:
We believe that team building and friendly inspiration outside the office is important for our long-term growth. Hence, we aim to facilitate discussions amongst our employees. In other words, our flat structure ensures that your voice will be heard regardless of your position. We are multicultural, intellectually curious and creative thinkers, eager to grow and make a big impact, excellent communicators and collaborators, and interested in health, science and technology. We DARE, LOVE & FOCUS!

job_description:
About the job
Selskapsbeskrivelse

JYSK har ekspandert fra en butikk i Danmark i 1979 til mer enn 3000 butikker over hele verden i dag. For å sikre vekst i fremtiden trenger vi de beste medarbeiderne.

Grip denne fantastiske muligheten til å bli en del av JYSK. Dersom du viser engasjement, vil du møte muligheter.

Jobbeskrivelse

Er dette din neste mulighet?

Bli vår kollega på JYSK Customer Service Center!

Vi vokser og søker derfor etter flere medarbeidere ved vårt hovedkontor på Furuset i Oslo. Vi ser etter deg som søker en heltidsstilling. 

Kundesenteret er sammen med butikkene vårt ansikt utad og vi jobber hver dag for å levere fantastiske kundeopplevelser.

Liker du å jobbe i et miljø med høyt tempo bestående av daglige utfordringer og inspirerende kolleger? Er du resultatorientert, proaktiv og samtidig opptatt av å levere de aller beste kundeopplevelsene til våre kunder? 

Har du i tillegg erfaring fra kundesenter, er glad i å kommunisere med kunder både muntlig og skriftlig og ser løsninger der andre ser problemer? Da kan du være den vi leter etter!

Din hovedoppgave vil være å betjene kundehenvendelser i alle våre innkommende kanaler, som er via telefon, mail, chat og SoMe.

Kvalifikasjoner

Du viser sterkt engasjement og du…
Er en sterk kommunikator både skriftlig og muntlig, på både norsk og engelsk
Er fleksibel, fremoverlent og målrettet
Trives i en hektisk hverdag, er en lagspiller og håndterer flere oppgaver samtidig
Er strukturert, besluttsom og tar eierskap til enhver henvendelse
Tilegner deg raskt ny kunnskap og evner å holde deg oppdatert og relevant
Er komfortabel med å jobbe etter konkrete mål, har konkurranseinstinkt og tenker alltid på kundens beste
Er lett å samarbeide med og gir av deg selv for at teamet skal prestere best mulig. 
Er robust og står godt i utfordrende situasjoner

Ytterligere informasjon

Du får muligheter og vi tilbyr deg:
Bonusordning for alle ansatte ved kundesenteret teambasert
Fleksibilitet knyttet til hjemmekontor
Treningsrom på jobb
Ansattgoder i form av personalrabatt og årlig fest med alle ansatte i JYSK 
Moderne og nyoppussede lokaler fra april 2023
Meget god introduksjon og opplæring
En attraktiv arbeidsplass med positive og engasjerte kolleger som hver dag jobber sammen om å nå felles målsetninger
Sterk merkevare å representere og ivareta
Parkeringsmuligheter utenfor bygget

Vårt kundesenter holder for tiden åpent følgende tidspunkt:

Mandag: 07 - 19

Tirsdag: 08 - 18

Onsdag: 08 - 18

Torsdag: 07 - 19

Fredag: 08 - 17

Lørdag: 08 - 16 

Du vil jobbe i en turnusordning som dekker hele åpningstiden.

name_location: Invacare Corporation · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 week ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Samarbeid, selvstendighet og teknisk problemløsning

Invacare® i Norge søker servicetekniker til vårt avdelingskontor i Oslo 

Er mennesker og livsglede din store lidenskap og brenner du for en jobb med en spennende og varierende hverdag? Akkurat nå søker vi en engasjert, og imøtekommende ny kollega til tilpasninger av våre tekniske hjelpemidler.

Invacare er en ledende produsent av elektriske og manuelle rullestoler, mobile og stasjonære personløftere, senger og madrasser og avanserte hjelpemotorer til manuelle rullestoler. Våre kunder er i hovedsak kommunehelsetjenesten, hjelpemiddelsentraler og private sluttbrukere, som alle kjenner oss godt som en forutsigbar og seriøs leverandør av kvalitetshjelpemidler. Hele produktspekteret understøtter vår misjon” Making life´s experiences possible”.

Ansvarsområder som servicetekniker

Tilpasning og teknisk service på hele vårt produktsortiment
Montering og tilpasninger av produkter tilpasset individuelle behov
Utlevering til sluttbruker med opplæring
Montering av fastmontert utstyr
Produktveiledning og rådgivning
Resirkulering av produkter
Tekniske kurs
Kundepleie og kundeutvikling i samråd med salg

Du får

Som servicetekniker hos Invacare får du stor mulighet til å påvirke dine aktiviteter og resultater, noe som gir frihet og ansvar i hverdagen. Din jobb utføres i tett samarbeid med selgere, kundeservice, hjelpemiddelsentraler, helsepersonell og sluttbrukere i distriktet. Denne jobben krever stor fleksibilitet, selvstendighet og en serviceminded innstilling. Du blir en viktig person i teamet, og her vil du oppleve en god stemning blant kollegaene. Som kollegaer arbeider dere tett sammen om å nå mål som er satt for teamet og for Invacare Norge. Ved oppstart vil du møtes med et tilrettelagt on - boarding program etterfulgt av løpende opplæring som sikrer at du får den kunnskapen du trenger. Ditt daglige arbeidssted vil være Bryn i Oslo, men stillingen kan også medføre noe reiseaktivitet ved større prosjekter.

Din bakgrunn

Din bakgrunn kan være variert, men vi forutsetter at du har teknisk eller mekanisk kompetanse og digital interesse da vår tekniske avdeling må holde følge med våre kunders krav og utnytte våre produkters muligheter innenfor spekteret velferdsteknologi. Har du erfaring fra hjelpemidler, eller medisinteknisk samtykke er det en fordel. Som person er du engasjert og liker å jobbe i et miljø der innovative løsninger og et høyt tempo er avgjørende for suksess.

Du er

Kommersiell av teft og trives i rollen som løsningsformidler
Teknisk utdannet, gjerne med bakgrunn som service-elektroniker, elektriker eller mekaniker, og har erfaring fra arbeid med dette
Innovativ med digital interesse
Lagspiller som verdsetter felles suksess
Løsningsorientert og tar ansvar
Strukturert, systematisk og overholder frister
God til å kommunisere
Nysgjerrig på Velferdigteknologi

Er du interessert?

Du kan enkelt registrere din søknad på https://www.invacare.no/nb/karriere. Søknadsfristen er 5 november, men vi behandler søknader løpende.

Har du spørsmål så kontakt gjerne vår Salgs - og marketingsjef Karianne Nyrud-Jansen på telefon +47 915 42 478. Les og se mer om Invacare på www.invacare.no og www.working4invavcare.com.

job_description:
About the job
