name_location: Energy Jobline · Stavanger, Rogaland, Norway  4 days ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
About the job
As a summer intern at Equinor, you will join 22,000 colleagues delivering oil, gas, wind, and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. By 2050, we aim to become a net-zero company and provide the energy the world needs without contributing to global warming. It is one of the defining challenges of our time, and attracting and developing the brightest minds will be critical to our success.

The position

Our summer internship is a 6-week programme designed to provide the experience and skills you need in your studies and future career. Our Norwegian and UK internship will begin on 17 June and ends on 02 August 2024, with one week off starting 15 July.

You can find out more about the programme at www.equinor.com/careers/summer-interns

The Renewables (REN) area in Equinor is developing and delivering wind and solar power, storage solutions and green hydrogen. We have great ambitions and aim to grow almost 20 times the size within renewables as we are today by 2030. REN aims to do this by combining Equinor’s broad energy competence, project delivery capabilities and ability to integrate technological solutions. To do this we also need young talents with an eye for the future.

By joining this position within REN, interns will participate in a common summer internship programme as well as other technical and commercial challenges, tasks and/or group work.

Technical positions are offered across the 4 locations, while commercial positions are limited to Oslo, Stavanger or Bergen.

Technical Field

Your exact assignment will be decided based on our business needs, combined with your field of expertise and your interests, with some examples provided below:

Develop cost-effective solutions for offshore wind design for floating and bottom fixed projects for various markets.
Carry out electric power and wind turbine related activities for one or several offshore wind projects e.g. calculations, information exchange, supplier engagement.
Participate in technology development and technology qualification.
Performance analysis of offshore wind farms using advanced data analytic methods.
Assist project development with ad-hoc technical tasks to ensure deliveries and timelines are met.
Support as needed with work related to Equinor's management system.
Contribute and Support with standardizing best practices

Commercial Field

Participate in business case development, optimization and commercial strategy work.
Assist project development with ad-hoc commercial tasks to ensure deliveries and timelines are met
Support as needed with work related to Equinor's management system.

By joining us in REN as a summer intern you will have the opportunity to:

Get exposure to the renewable business
Work on real tasks in a real team
Work with new technology
Work with new commercial concepts
Solve complex and challenging tasks
Learn from competent team members
Receive relevant training
Take part in social events

You

Some Qualities Are Essential For Equinor. You Identify With Our Values, Open, Collaborative, Courageous And Caring, Which Guide Our Decisions And Help Us Succeed And Grow. You Make Safety Your Priority And Contribute To Our Zero-harm Culture. For This Position, We Are Also Looking For

 Cu rrently studying for Bachelor’s, Master’s degree, or Ph.D. with a strong academic record within a technical discipline, or within non-technical disciplines, such as Business, Economics, Finance, Environmental Sciences, Marketing or Political Science
 Fluent in English and preferably a second working language
 No more than two year s of relevant full-time work experience
 Have c ompleted at least two years of higher education before the internship programme starts (1 7 June 202 4 )
 Have at least one year of higher education left after the internship programme ends (0 2 August 202 4 )
 The interns need to be located in the country where the internship takes place during its entire duration. Equinor does not support any relocation for our summer interns .
 Candidates must have the necessary work permit for the country in which they are applying for a position. The work permits must be valid at the point of application and for the duration of the employment. Please note that Equinor does not support, or sponsor work or visa permits for internship applications. Read more about it on the national authorities’ pages: Norway
 Extracurricular activities and/or voluntary work are an advantag e

Skills

Every role and business area requires its own specific set of skills and personal attributes. Some of the qualities and characteristics we look for include:

 An awareness of risk and a commitment to safety for yourself and those around you.
 Effective communication skills and the ability to facilitate collaboration, influence stakeholders, and contribute to a diverse and inclusive culture.
 The flexibility to adapt to change, embrace new technology , and perform in a digitally enabled environment .
 Demonstrating a curious mind and the ability to problem-solve, innovate, and identify new ways of delivering against our objectives .

Equinor is an equal opportunities employer . We welcome applications from all candidates who meet the educational and experience requirements, including those with disabilities. If you have any specific requirements for any stage in our process, please make this clear in your application , and our team will be happy to support you .

General information

Please make sure that when applying, you attach the following:

 CV/ resume in English
 transcripts of records (or other documents describing subjects and grades) in English or Scandinavian language obtained to this point during your studies. If you are in the process of completing a degree, please upload an official temporary transcript.

Applications submitted without these attachments will unfortunately not be evaluated. To ensure an efficient recruitment process, please be informed that you may apply for a maximum of 3 Summer Internship roles per country.

Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process. Candidates will be asked for information on affiliation to high-risk countries for a security assessment. Furthermore, background checks are performed on all final candidates and all permanent and temporary hires will be screened against relevant sanctions lists to ensure compliance with sanctions law.

name_location: Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU) · Gjøvik, Innlandet, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Om stillingen

NTNUs Fagseksjon for økonomi og ledelse på Gjøvik har ambisjoner om å ta en tydeligere posisjon innen både campus og nettbaserte utdanninger, og derfor søker vi en ny kollega for å styrke de administrative funksjonene i vår videre utvikling. Hos oss blir du en del av et administrativt team som jobber tett med fagstaben og studieprogramledere, samtidig som du vil være en viktig kontaktperson for studentene våre. Vi tilbyr en stilling med varierte oppgaver, der hovedtyngden av arbeidet vil være knyttet til studieområdet.

Din nærmeste leder er kontorsjef.

Arbeidsoppgaver

studieveiledning av hel- og deltidsstudenter på bachelor- og masterprogram
saksbehandling og oppfølging av studentsaker
støtte i studieplanarbeid
oppfølging av studiekvalitet og læringsmiljøtiltak
håndtere bestillinger og avtaler
annet administrativt arbeid

Kvalifikasjonskrav

Relevant utdanning fra universitet eller høyskole, minimum tilsvarende bachelornivå. Realkompetanse med relevans for de aktuelle oppgavene kan kompensere utdanningskravet
god skriftlig og muntlig framstillingsevne på norsk og engelsk
god digital kompetanse

Ønskede kvalifikasjoner 

serviceinnstilt, fleksibilitet og løsningsorientering
har relevant arbeidserfaring, gjerne fra universitetssektoren
kjennskap til NTNUs administrative støttesystemer

Personlige egenskaper 

Du Er Motivert Og Har Evne Til

å kommunisere godt med både studenter og kollegaer
å tilpasse deg til endringer
å strukturere eget arbeid og håndtere mange saker samtidig
å ta initiativ og gjennomføre
å prioritere i perioder hvor det er stort arbeidspress

Ved vurdering av den best kvalifiserte, skal det legges vekt på utdanning, erfaring og personlig egnethet, samt motivasjon for stillingen.

Vi tilbyr 

Spennende og utviklende oppgaver i et sterkt og internasjonalt fagmiljø
Åpent og inkluderende arbeidsmiljø med engasjerte kolleger
Gunstige vilkår i Statens pensjonskasse 
 ansattegoder og fordeler 

Lønn og vilkår 

I stillingen som 1363 seniorkonsulent vil du normalt lønnes fra brutto kr 584 500 pr. år avhengig av kvalifikasjoner og ansiennitet. Fra lønnen trekkes 2 % lovfestet innskudd til Statens Pensjonskasse.

Ansettelsen blir gjennomført etter prinsippene i statsansatteloven , og lovverk som regulerer eksport av kunnskap, teknologi og tjenester. Etter ansettelsen må du påregne at det kan skje endringer i arbeidsområdet.

Det er en forutsetning at du kan være til stede ved og tilgjengelig for institusjonen på daglig basis.

Om søknaden

Vi gjør oppmerksom på at søknaden kun blir vurdert ut fra informasjonen som foreligger ved søknadsfristens utløp. Sørg derfor for at søknaden din tydelig viser hvordan dine ferdigheter og erfaringer oppfyller kriteriene som er beskrevet over.

Søknaden Må Inneholde

CV, attester og vitnemål
navn og adresse til tre relevante referanser

Dersom hele eller deler av utdanningen din er tatt i utlandet, ber vi deg i tillegg legge ved dokumentasjon på omfang og kvalitet for hele ditt utdanningsløp, både bachelor- og masterutdanning, i tillegg til annen høyere utdanning. Beskrivelse av hvilken dokumentasjon som er nødvendig finner du her . Dersom du allerede har en uttalelse fra NOKUT, er det fint om du legger ved den også.

Generell informasjon 

Inkludering og mangfold er en styrke. Vi ønsker at våre ansatte skal speile befolkningen, og søker til enhver tid de beste hodene. Dette gir NTNU økt produktivitet, innovasjon, bedre beslutningsprosesser, økt medarbeidertilfredshet og det konkurransefortrinnet vi trenger for å gjennomføre vårt samfunnsoppdrag innen forskning og utdanning.

NTNU legger vekt på tilrettelegging og oppfordrer deg som kvalifisert kandidat til å søke uavhengig av kjønn, funksjonsevne, hull i CV eller kulturell bakgrunn.

Som ansatt ved NTNU må du til enhver tid rette deg etter endringer som utviklingen i faget medfører, og de organisatoriske endringer som vedtas.

Offentlig søkerliste med navn, alder, stillingstittel og bostedskommune utarbeides etter søknadsfristens utløp. Dersom du ønsker å reservere deg fra oppføring på offentlig søkerliste må dette begrunnes. Vurdering vil bli gjort i henhold til gjeldende lovverk . Du vil bli varslet om reservasjon ikke tas til følge.

Hvis du har spørsmål om stillingen kan du ta kontakt med Even Johnsen, tlf. 61 13 51 87, e-post even.johnsen@ntnu.no. Hvis du har spørsmål om ansettelsesprosessen kan du ta kontakt med Oddny Pauline Lyngvær, e-post: oddny.lyngvar@ntnu.no

Synes du dette ser interessant ut, og i samsvar med dine kvalifikasjoner, sender du oss din søknad elektronisk via jobbnorge.no med CV, vitnemål og attester vedlagt. Ved forespørsel må du kunne fremskaffe bekreftede kopier av din dokumentasjon

 Søknadsfrist: 22.10.2023

NTNU - kunnskap for en bedre verden

NTNU - kunnskap for en bedre verden

Ved NTNU, Norges teknisk-naturvitenskapelige universitet, skapes kunnskap for en bedre verden og løsninger som kan forandre hverdagen.

Institutt for industriell økonomi og teknologiledelse

Vi forsker og underviser på internasjonalt nivå i grenseflaten mellom teknologi/naturvitenskap og økonomi, ledelse og HMS. Målet er bærekraftig verdiskaping innenfor teknologibaserte områder i industri, næringsliv og offentlig sektor i Norge. Vi har fagseksjoner i Trondheim og på Gjøvik. Institutt for industriell økonomi og teknologiledelse er ett av fire institutter ved Fakultet for økonomi.

job_title: PhD and PD positions in the HYDROGENi team
name_location: Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU) · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  1 month ago  · 7 applicants
job_description:
About the job
HYDROGENi’s main objective

HYDROGENi’s main objective is to accelerate the research and innovation needed to deliver a new hydrogen-based energy and technology export industry for Norway, reducing emissions while boosting industry competence and creating new green jobs.

HYDROGENi’s work will focus on four main research areas:

Cost-efficient and scalable production
Transport and storage in Norway and Europe
End-use technologies
Safety and material integrity

These are over-arched by research activities dedicated to enabling a sustainable hydrogen economy. HYDROGENi offers an integrated community where knowledge, experience and ideas are shared, with an overall research approach to develop methodologies and knowledge in inter-disciplinary teams that balance technology push and application pull.

The Centre

The Centre is led by SINTEF, with NTNU (Norwegian University of Science and Technology), UiO (University of Oslo), USN (University of South-Eastern Norway), and UiT (The Arctic University of Norway) as the academic partners. The Centre involves more than 50 national and international industrial partners that together with the research partners comprise a world leading consortium. Find out more via the HYDROGENi webpage: https://www.sintef.no/en/projects/2022/fme-hydrogeni/

Do you want to become a part of the HYDROGENi team?

We are now announcing PhD and PD positions in HYDROGENi that aim to bring forward outstanding research and innovation and to facilitate a sustainable development of the Norwegian energy sector. You are encouraged to apply for more than one position if there are several that fit your interests and background.

NTNU offer

exciting and stimulating tasks in a strong international academic environment
an open and inclusive work environment with dedicated colleagues
favourable terms in the Norwegian Public Service Pension Fund 
 employee benefits 

General information

Working at NTNU

NTNU believes that inclusion and diversity is our strength. We want to recruit people with different competencies, educational backgrounds, life experiences and perspectives to contribute to solving our social responsibilities within education and research. We will facilitate for our employees’ needs.

The city of Trondheim is a modern European city with a rich cultural scene. Trondheim is the innovation capital of Norway with a population of 200,000. The Norwegian welfare state, including healthcare, schools, kindergartens and overall equality, is probably the best of its kind in the world. Professional subsidized day-care for children is easily available. Furthermore, Trondheim offers great opportunities for education (including international schools) and possibilities to enjoy nature, culture and family life and has low crime rates and clean air quality.

As an employee at NTNU, you must at all times adhere to the changes that the development in the subject entails and the organizational changes that are adopted.

The Faculty of Natural Sciences is a key player in national and international research and education programmes in natural sciences and technology. About the job
ON-SITE work - office in Moss, Norway

For our client, we are looking for a qualified Automation Engineer. You will be in charge of creating and implementing automated testing tools and processes that will help our production team and developers create androids more quickly. Your main goal will be to increase productivity while making sure the androids are created with great quality and dependability. By developing dependable and scalable testing frameworks, tooling, running exhaustive tests, and pinpointing areas for improvement, you will play a significant part in ensuring the success of our android production as an automation engineer.

What makes this job exciting?

Each day is unique!

You will in one month...

become familiar with our hardware and software stack and gain the ability to control the androids on your own.

You will in three months...

for the benefit of our development and production teams, you will have created some automated tests and tools.

In a year, you will...

oversee testing and automation and grow it as necessary.

Requirements

Must haves:

3+ years' experience in development, excellent software engineering skills;
knowledge of C, C++, Python, Java, and Rust;
experience with hardware in the loop test systems and a strong background working with embedded systems;
QA knowledge.

Nice To Haves

Experience with robotics/motors/actuated systems;
Experience with visualizing data
Experience with CI/CD systems

job_title: Vi vokser og trenger flere dyktige Java-utviklere og arkitekter – bli med på vårt vinnende lag!
name_location: Bouvet ASA · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  5 months ago  · 13 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Om du brenner for utvikling og vil jobbe med rause og flinke kollegaer er dette sjansen du har ventet på.

Vi jobber med noen av Norges mest fremtredende virksomheter og du kan være med å skape løsninger med stor betydning for enkeltmennesker og for samfunnet.

Hos oss får du jobbe med kunder som tør gi deg ansvar, og kollegaer som ønsker å se deg på ditt beste. Det betyr at du får stor frihet i hverdagen, at du kan være deg selv – og at du blir utfordret og satt krav til.

Vi trenger flere utviklere og arkitekter til Java-miljøet vårt.

Hvem er du?

Vi ser etter deg med en lidenskap for å programmere. Du har minst 2 års erfaring og er sulten på ny kunnskap.

Du trives godt som fullstack utvikler eller så er du spesielt god på enten backend eller frontend.

I våre prosjekter benyttes både Java, Kotlin og Go til applikasjonsutvikling med moderne arkitekturer basert på mikrotjenester. Vi investerer også tungt i kompetanse på skyplattformer, både på AWS, GCP og Azure.

Vi jobber hele tiden med å utvikle oss for å kunne tilby kundene våre fremtidsrettede og robuste løsninger. Vi har høyt tempo på vår kompetanseutvikling, og det er viktig at du også vil trives med dette og liker å dele dine erfaringer med andre.

Hos oss kan du bygge karrieren din videre innenfor et ledende kompetansemiljø.

Du må kunne kommunisere og skrive godt på norsk.

Bouvet tilbyr deg mer enn en arbeidsplass

Faglig utvikling og muligheten til å påvirke egen hverdag

Hos oss er du ikke alene. Vi gir vi deg tett faglig oppfølging og mulighet til å delta i faglige fellesskap og -arrangementer i egen og andres regi. Vi tilbyr også skreddersydde opplæringsløp, og gir deg mulighet til å påvirke hva slags prosjekter du deltar i og hva slags roller du har i dem, slik at du kan utvikle deg i den retningen du vil.

Spennende kunder og viktige prosjekter

Hos oss får du oppgaver som er faglig utfordrende, i prosjekter som veldig ofte påvirker langt flere enn oppdragsgiveren. Vi hjelper kort sagt noen av Norges største private og offentlige bedrifter med å utvikle digitale løsninger som gjør hverdagen bedre.

Vi jobber hardt, og vi jobber sammen

Derfor har vi ikke prestasjonsbasert lønn og individuelle bonuser, men gir heller alle ansatte en fast, god lønn knyttet til stillingen sin. Vi har dessuten aksjeprogram, overskuddsdeling og gode pensjonsordninger som til sammen utgjør betydelige tilskudd til lønnen.

Bli med oss når vi går foran og bygger fremtidens samfunn

Ta kontakt for en uforpliktende prat for å høre mer om hva vi kan tilby eller send inn søknad via 'Søk på Stillingen'.

Etter ansettelse vil en tredje parts bakgrunnssjekk gjennomføres. Dette er en verifisering av de opplysninger som gis i rekrutteringsprosessen. Bakgrunnssjekken er tilpasset stillingens krav og gjennomføres etter søkerens samtykke.

name_location: Jefferson Frank · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
Position: Backend (Golang) Software Engineer

Location: Oslo

We are looking for a backend software engineer, experienced with Golang, Python, AWS (and ideally some Kubernetes).

You will work with a team of 8 engineers to build a new product on top of the existing range.

The product connects heavy devices, within a production line, aerospace and defence (among other applications). We are an Engineering first firm, a product built for Engineers, by Engineers.

Responsibilities
 Optimise and scale our systems to support increasing traffic and data volume
 Design, develop, and maintain the backend of our SaaS products using Golang and Python
 Collaborate with frontend developers to ensure seamless integration of front and backend systems
 Work with data scientists to integrate machine learning algorithms and analytics into our products
 Write clean, efficient, and reusable code, adhering to software development best practices
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure timely delivery of high-quality software products
Qualifications
 Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field
 3+ years of experience in software development, with a focus on Golang backend development
 Strong understanding of software design principles
 Experience with databases such as PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and Redis
 Experience with cloud technologies such as AWS
 Familiarity with containerisation technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes
 Excellent communication and collaboration skills
To learn more or to get involved with the process, please contact Dylan Johnston on:

d.johnston1@jeffersonfrank.com

or on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/dylan-johnston-666707130/

name_location: Mason Frank International · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 11 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are working with one of Norway's most reputable schools in their search for a Salesforce Developer to join their inhouse team. Our set up currently consists of; Education Cloud, Sales and Service, Marketing Cloud and Experience Cloud, with more in the pipeline depending on your recommendations.

Role

As a Salesforce Developer, you will be a key player in our university's digital transformation journey. Your expertise in Salesforce development will help us optimise processes, create seamless user experiences, and enable innovative solutions that empower our students, faculty, and staff.

Responsibilities
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyse requirements, and translate them into effective technical solutions within Salesforce Education Cloud, Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, and Experience Cloud.
Develop, customise, and maintain Salesforce applications, ensuring they align with best practices and university standards.
Integrate Salesforce with third-party systems to create holistic solutions that enhance efficiency and data accuracy.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including administrators, business analysts, and end-users, to deliver high-quality solutions.
Participate in code reviews, optimise performance, and ensure code quality and security.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues, working with internal teams and Salesforce support when necessary.
Stay updated with Salesforce updates, new features, and industry trends to drive continuous improvement and innovation.

Requirements
Bachelor's degree is essential.
Proven experience as a Salesforce Developer, with a track record of successful implementation and customisation.
Salesforce certifications are highly desired.
Proficiency in Apex, Lightning Components, and other Salesforce development tools, along with experience with flows and config.
Experience with as many of the following is an advantage: Salesforce Education Cloud, Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, and Experience Cloud.
Strong understanding of software development best practices, design patterns, and integrations.
Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

For more info, apply directly or reach out to me at j.bright@frankgroup.com

name_location: Shortcut · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 months ago  · 104 applicants
job_description:
About the job
In Shortcut, we make apps (such as Ruter, REMA 1000’s Æ, Vipps, BankID, DNB, and Cutters) that simplify the everyday lives of millions of people! 🚀

We are a team of 5 located in Oslo and Bergen with different backgrounds. We create and maintain backend systems in the cloud. We collaborate, innovate, take initiative, and have fun together. Join us in shaping the future of mobile apps.

What will you do?

You’ll get a chance to work on several different projects, from small ones to longer commitments with larger teams. Together with Project Managers, UI/UX designers, and other developers, you’ll make our customers' visions a reality.

We always aim to create clean, well-structured, and manageable work. We also participate in the estimating-, planning-, and prioritization process for new projects.

Simply put: Write code, talk to and understand customers, make choices, create solutions, develop yourself, and contribute to change, improvement, and simplification. Hurray! 🥳

Some of what you can expect at Shortcut

Flexible working hours and location (from home, office, and client) 
Good follow-up and guidance from the manager and colleagues, such as 1-1 conversations every month, weekly stand-ups, and low-threshold contact on Slack, the office, and with the client 
Sponsorship of all certification costs, including study materials, exam fees, and training 👩🏻‍🎓
A place where you can be yourself and your opinion counts - we love initiative and improvements 💚 Such as our Shortcut Sports initiative!
Conferences, courses, professional groups, certifications, and other development-related and fun events such as weekly Hackin'it, where people gather after work to eat pizza, drink and work on hobby projects, play console or VR games 🤓
Insanely good lunch in the canteen at Rebel (Oslo) 
Latest equipment, so you can do your job as efficiently as possible 👩🏼‍💻
Other benefits such as monthly ticket zone 1, contribution to your Internet at home and mobile bill, extra pension, and parental allowance paid directly from us (not NAV)
We take mental and physical health seriously, which is why we also cover health insurance. This includes a free online doctor, physiotherapist, and online psychologist 🧘

Outstanding work culture

We foster a culture of open communication and transparency, where every team member's ideas are valued. Collaboration is at the core of our DNA, and you'll often find us huddled together brainstorming, and problem-solving 🧠

At Shortcut, we encourage continuous learning and growth. Our supportive environment provides opportunities for skill development, attending (or organizing) workshops, and obtaining certifications.

Fun is another essential ingredient in our culture's recipe! From team-building activities to monthly parties, International summits to Christmas parties, we know how to have a good time together 💃🕺

We believe that you:

Have at least 3 years of experience in building backend systems
Have good knowledge of at least one backend language such as Kotlin, Golang, Typescript, Java, C#, etc.
Have practical knowledge of deploying to cloud services such as GCP, AWS, and/or Azure
Have solid skills in building APIs
Have good knowledge of database technologies
Are comfortable working as a consultant in the IT industry
Speak Norwegian (or Swedish or Danish) and English

Proud Google Cloud Platform (GCP) partner

As a GCP partner, we leverage Google’s powerful infrastructure and tools to deliver scalable and efficient solutions to our clients. We value our employees' growth and provide resources and bonuses for relevant certifications. While GCP is our primary focus, we also value certifications for Azure and AWS. We encourage our engineers to explore and obtain certifications beyond GCP, for having diverse expertise.

About Shortcut

Shortcut is a leading app innovation company with offices in Oslo, Bergen, Stockholm, Copenhagen, Bucharest, Lviv, and Tetovo.

We are roughly 180 individuals with big app hearts and minds consisting of developers, designers, architects, and project managers. Together with our customers, we have succeeded in building digital tools that are used by millions every day.

Clean, simple, and user-friendly. We make apps for life! 💚

If you are unsure if you meet the requirements, or have any questions, please reach out to Kicki Holmberg.

We encourage all qualified people to apply, regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, sexual identity, disability, nationality, and ethnic background!

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 7 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Summary

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.

We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

What You'll Do

Collaborate remotely with a globally distributed team. 
Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang). 
Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale. 
Review code and technical designs produced by other engineers. 
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions. 
Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events. 

Who You Are

You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people. 
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable. 
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated. 
You have a broad technology base but favor backend code and infrastructure. 
You have proficiency developing public-facing APIs and web applications, preferably using Python and/or Golang. 
You know your way around relational and non-relational databases and can effectively design data models that perform well, and tune queries to access them. 
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform. 
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree. 

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.

What Canonical offers:

Work from home
Learning and development allowances
Competitive Salary
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Generous annual leave
Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
Priority Pass for travel
Exposure to international business and technology

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

#stack

name_location: Innovatrics · Time, Rogaland, Norway  1 day ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
Job Description

Our Solutions team is a technical authority engaged in the process of selling, analyzing, deploying and operations of our Innovatrics ABIS product around the world. This position offers a great opportunity for someone with software development experience to move into a consultancy role.

You will help our partners and customers to use our Innovatrics ABIS in the best way possible to make their use cases (including elections, passport issuance, border control and more) as smooth as possible.

At Innovatrics, you will be a part of a closely cooperating expert group of people including system engineers, project managers, product owners and software developers offering a lot of learning opportunities.

If you are keen to travel and explore new cultures, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities

End-to-end ownership of technical solution of our projects
Communication and building strong relationships with customers and working with their technical and expert teams
Providing domain and product expertise during project delivery for our clients
Identifying and solving complex technical issues of our partners
Coordinating internal development and delivery teams from technical point of view
Requirements collection from customers and feature analysis together with product analysts team
Preparation and execution of product and biometric trainings for customers and employees
Performing Proof-of-Concepts and advanced analyses for potential partners
Project data collection and analysis with a focus on resolution of complex problems
Legacy data analysis and migration from past versions or external systems
Contribute to product and project documentation and knowledge base, including training materials
Maintenance and creation of internal tools to increasing project delivery efficiency
Advanced and high-level technical support of Innovatrics ABIS product

Candidate requirements

Responsible approach to work, ability to work independently and in stressful environments
Analytical approach to solving complex problems, ability to clearly describe the situation and suggest a solution strategy
Advanced programming skills in at least one mainstream programming language such as Java, Kotlin, C#, Python, Go
Knowledge of SQL, database systems and data analysis
Excellent technical verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability high quality to deliver written outputs, diagrams, analyzes and presentations
University education in technology or economy/business area
Willingness to learn new programming languages and technologies
Willingness and capacity to learn and become a technical expert in the biometric domain
Flexibility and willingness to travel on short business trips to destinations mostly in Asia and Africa. Traveling represents around 20% of working time

What Makes You Stand Out

Knowledge of biometrics and biometric technologies
Experience with consulting software integrations
Experience with enterprise system migrations
Experience with project management and deliverables handling
Knowledge of Spanish, French, Arabic, Mandarin or other world languages

About ABIS

Automated Biometrics Identification System – is a biometric identity management system supporting fingerprint, iris, and facial recognition. With our ABIS modules our clients can easily build an identity management solution tailored to their needs. From identifying people on crime scenes to voter registrations, our ABIS covers a whole scale of use cases.

Are you interested in this position?

Send us your CV. We are looking for the best of the best.

I want to send a CV

Knee-deep in something?

Let's touch base when you're free. Just leave us your contact details.

Apply later

name_location: Enode · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 13 applicants
job_description:
About the job
About Enode

Do you want to join a fast-growing climate tech startup with real impact?

At Enode, our mission is to accelerate the energy transition 🌍️

A fully renewable energy system is dependent on flexible demand that can adapt to the intermittent supply from wind and solar. To create this flexibility, we need to connect to and control the fast-growing demand coming from electric vehicles, heat pumps and other energy hardware.

This is what we’re doing at Enode. Our APIs power the next generation of green energy apps, reaching more than 60 million consumers worldwide.

We are backed by some of the best climate tech investors in the world, including Y Combinator, Lowercarbon Capital and Creandum. We already have a global presence with customers in 11 countries across Europe, US and APAC.

Yet, we’re still at the start of our journey, and we want exceptional people to join us!

If you want to learn more about Enode, click here.

About The Role

Enode is looking for an experienced Customer Engineer to help lead our work on building Enode’s Customer Engineering function. In this role you’ll interface directly with engineers, product managers, and leadership stakeholders as they integrate Enode’s API to help them realise value from our product fast. Beyond the integration phase, Customer Engineers also own the technical relationship with customers and act as an internal advocates for customers throughout their entire journey with Enode.

You will be a core part of Enode’s Customer Success team and play a critical part in establishing this function within Enode, whilst also working on a daily basis across engineering, product, and sales teams. You will:
Design and help our customers implement technical solutions using the Enode API based on their engineering, product, and business needs
Advise customers on technical product architecture and best practices for using the Enode API and provide ongoing technical support to customers (e.g. answering technical questions, debugging customer implementations and resolving/escalating issues)
Not only will you identify and debug issues in customer implementations, but you will also proactively make necessary fixes and/or improvements directly in the Enode codebase
Act as a champion for new products, features, and company initiatives based on customer discussions and your own product expertise you will develop in the role to ensure Enode’s resources are allocated to high impact areas
Drive and/or contribute to internal projects (e.g. developer portal experience, Integration Guides, customer analysis, etc). 

About You

To succeed at Enode you should be passionate about our mission. You should be excited about electrification and the opportunity to use consumer products and software to solve grid challenges in the transition to a net zero energy system. We’re looking for:
2+ years of experience relevant to customer engineering such as solutions/sales engineering or being a user-oriented software engineer
An all-rounder who is energised by managing technical client relationships but can also dive into the codebase to make fixes/improvements
Experience managing complex software projects, ideally with both external and internal stakeholders
An articulate communicator who has the ability to explain complex, technical issues at the right level depending on the audience
A nimble operator & team player who can thrive in a dynamic environment and flat organisation where tasks change frequently to fit the requirements of the company
Nice to have: Experience from a technical role in third-party API companies

As a startup, we want to attract the best candidates with the highest potential for growth & impact. If we think you’re a fit, note the seniority and responsibilities for this role can be tailored based on your experience.

What we offer
A stimulating, fun and caring work environment with high drive and ambition
Opportunity to join an early-stage climate tech startup with global aspirations
Competitive compensation, including a very attractive employee option program
A remote-first setup. We also have an office in Oslo if you want to work from there
Stipend for setting up your home office / co-working space
Regular offsites with the team in various exciting locations (we went to Italy 🇮🇹 earlier this year). 

Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

name_location: Funcom ZPX  · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  5 days ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
From critically acclaimed The Longest Journey to the very first sci-fi MMO Anarchy Online, to the brutal trials of Conan Exiles, our 30-year history has set our players uniquely up for a journey to the harsh world of Dune, where the continual battle for survival and spice will bring a challenge that is Legendary.

The Funcom team consists of over 400 people located in 5 studios - Norway, the US, Portugal, Sweden and Romania. As part of Funcom’s ongoing growth, and completing a successful turnaround, Funcom is now backed by Tencent, the largest online gaming company in the world!

Now, our Core Tech team needs a Tools Programmer to work on our source control infrastructure.

Your Mission at Funcom

In this position, your responsibilities will be to create and maintain our source control infrastructure, help to make software building and deployment easier, design scripts and tools used for software deployment, and seamlessly integrate updates of the software using continuous delivery pipelines.

How You Can Have An Impact In Your Position
Maintenance and improvement of the build system (in-house technology)
Develop and improve our build scripts
Maintain our source control software (perforce and in-house solutions)
Providing support for the teams.
Work on build automation
Improving builds performance
Creating and maintaining documentation of the build process
We are looking for someone that has:
Experience with Python, c# and .net
Experience with Perforce administration
Experience using CI tooling
Experience with DevOps (preferable)
Experience working with the Unreal editor and build tool (preferable)
Knowledge of continuous build, release, and deployment systems.
Knowledge of container-based development (preferable)
Desire and ability to write clear documentation for the end-users
4+ years of relevant professional experience
Strong communication skills (English is our working language)
We evaluate candidates on an ongoing basis and recommend candidates to apply as soon as possible! Please apply in English.

Please apply in English.

Why Funcom?

We are a Scandinavian company and follow Scandinavian work values. For you, that means a flat structure where you can thrive, be yourself, leave a mark in the studio and become an ambassador for our company values. We focus on Agile/Scrum methodology and heavily value the importance of work-life balance in employee culture. Funcom values close-knit, collaborative individuals who crave creative ownership, a drive for constructive input, and a never-ending pursuit of evolution and quality.

The Funcom Oslo studio is a professional working environment with international work culture, with more than 100 people from over 25 different nationalities in one of the happiest countries in the world. Funcom is an international and varied environment in which people have one thing in common – their love for making and playing video games.

Located in central downtown Oslo, the studio is in a modern office building surrounded by a cozy area with many sights, restaurants, and cafés.

Working at Funcom Oslo offers a flexible 37.5h/week working schedule, relocation assistance, pension plan, healthcare package, social Fridays, free access to the gym, and a long list of other benefits. Even more: working at Funcom means being part of a family of kind, skilled and professional colleagues that share a passion for games!

We have a diverse, dynamic, inclusive , challenging, and engaging culture, with a basis of continued training and career development opportunities, and w e encourage candidates from all walks of life to apply. Join us in a friendly environment of enthusiastic professionals  willing to go the extra mile to deliver world-class games.

job_description:

About Enode

Do you want to join a fast-growing climate tech startup with real impact?

At Enode, our mission is to accelerate the energy transition 🌍️

A fully renewable energy system is dependent on flexible demand that can adapt to the intermittent supply from wind and solar. To create this flexibility, we need to connect to and control the fast-growing demand coming from electric vehicles, heat pumps and other energy hardware.

This is what we’re doing at Enode. Our APIs power the next generation of green energy apps, reaching more than 60 million consumers worldwide.

Yet, we’re still at the start of our journey, and we want exceptional people to join us!

If you want to learn more about Enode, click here.

About The Role

We are looking for a Business Development Representative that can further accelerate our growth. In this role you will be a core part of our small and fast-moving go-to-market team, working on market entry and new business in Europe, the US and other markets where Enode is active. You will:
Find and develop new business opportunities
Perform market analysis, prospecting and outreach to potential clients
Develop relationships with key people at prospective customers within the areas of electric vehicles, demand response, grid management and customer engagement
Development of Enode's go-to-market strategy

About You

You are mission driven and have an urge to fight climate change. You are a problem solver by nature and someone who can adapt to changing circumstances, and hectic startup life. You are a people's person who can engage with customers and understand their needs. You are organized and used to handling a large number of high stakes relationships, and moving them forward.

You should be ready to get your hands dirty and not expect someone else to fix menial tasks for you - you are a builder, motivated to build a potentially generational climate tech business from the ground up. You should be excited about being part of a fast growing company where roles and responsibilities can change fast as we scale. There is no limit to how far you can go and how fast you can grow at Enode.

We are looking for someone with:
1+ years experience in a customer facing role (Startups, Consulting, B2B Sales)
High interest and motivation to build a career in sales
Experience with (or high interest for) renewable energy, utilities, energy management, electric mobility or demand response
Excellent communication skills, oral and written (English)
Organized and independent
Understanding of APIs, B2B sales experience and energy market knowledge is a bonus

What we offer
A stimulating, fun and caring work environment with high drive and ambition
Opportunity to join an early-stage climate tech startup with global aspirations
Competitive compensation, including a very attractive employee option program
A remote-first setup. We also have an office in Oslo if you want to work from there
Stipend for setting up your home office / co-working space
Regular offsites with the team in various exciting locations (we went to Italy 🇮🇹 earlier this year). 

Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

name_location: INFUSEmedia · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 39 applicants
job_description:
About the job
OUR HIRING PROCESS:

We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals—every person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment. 
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team. 
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSEmedia team. 
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed. 

Are we a match?

Do you put the end user first? Can you transform challenging content into engaging learning material? Do you enjoy organizing and structuring information? Is one of your passions directed towards acquiring new technical skills? If so, the role of Learning Specialist at INFUSEmedia might be the perfect fit for you!

What we are looking for in our ideal candidate:

Minimum 2 years of Mid-level Learning Specialist role experience or similar role within L&D department (e.g. Instructional Designer)
Excellent knowledge of learning theories and instructional design models (be able to explain how you would use them in your work)
Impeccable English writing skills
Ability to provide structure, both for yourself and for others
Passion for acquiring new technical skills and the ability to translate complex technical concepts into understandable language that newcomers can grasp easily
Ability to distinguish between primary and secondary details, simplifying complex information
Someone with a talent for crafting diversity of engaging learning materials, including scripts for video lectures, guides, manuals, etc.. 
Ability to work proactively in an ambitious, fast growing, and dynamic environment and be OK with adapting to change
Experience with learning management systems and understanding of their basic functionality

What you can expect to do on the job:

Support the development of corporate learning experiences to improve onboarding, performance, and the growth of employees aligned with the company's vision and values
Contribute to creation of the vision for educational products that solve business problems/needs and implement it
Work with the subject matter experts and discover learning needs within various departments, articulate why certain solutions will or will not work
Analyze diversity of our learners and contexts
Create engaging learning activities and compelling course content that enhances retention and creates an engaging culture of learning 
Create supporting material/media (audio, video, simulations, case-based learning, scenarios, games, etc)
Be creative and seek solutions outside generally used practices
Tackle undefined, complex projects
Keep project documentation and courses folders organized
Supervise Junior Instructional Designers and manage their workflow if needed
Voice out concerns to the team leads
Ability to grow into Senior Learning Specialist / Instructional Designer Position within 6 months

If you recognize yourself in this and are up to the challenge, then we see a match!

name_location: KONGSBERG · Kongsberg, Viken, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 17 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Er du en person med stor drivkraft, har lidenskap for ditt fagområde og er på utkikk etter neste karrieremulighet? Da kan dette være rollen for deg!

Kongsberg Defence and Aerospace er inne i en periode med sterk vekst innenfor luftvernsprogrammet NASAMS og Radarprogrammene, vi ønsker derfor å styrke vår organisasjon med en Production Engineer. I denne rollen vil du jobbe teknisk nært med produksjon hos våre leverandører, og mot vår egen produksjon med montasje og test av avanserte og verdensledende systemer i en av Norges råeste og mest avanserte produksjonsfasiliteter. Oppgavene vil bl.a. bestå i å jobbe selvstendig med produksjons- og montasjesupport til vår egen produksjon og test, samt med teknisk oppfølging av leverandører av verdensledende luftvernsystemer. Vi søker deg som vil bidra til leveranser med rett kvalitet til rett tid.

Dette Vil Du Gjøre Hos Oss

Være teknisk ansvarlig for intern produksjon og montasje
Utarbeide produksjons- og montasjeprosesser, samt forbedring av disse
Håndtere og følge opp tekniske endringer og avvik mot egen produksjon og leverandører
Gjennomføre / delta på Production Readiness Review (PRR) og First Article Inspecion (FAI) for egen produksjon og hos våre leverandører
Følge opp mekanisk produksjon ute hos våre leverandører
Delta i leveranseaktiviteter av komplekse systemer
Være pådriver og delta i utviklingen av kostnadsoptimale design og løsninger for produksjon

Ønskede Kvalifikasjoner Og Egenskaper

Teknisk Fagskole, Bachelor eller Master innenfor mekaniske fag/relevant fagområde
Gjerne fagbrev og/eller produksjonsteknisk erfaring. Relevant erfaring kan veie opp for manglende utdanning
Forståelse og kunnskap om mekanisk produksjonsvirksomhet
Kunnskap om tegningslesning og geometriske toleranser er en fordel (ISO8015/GPS)
Fordel, men ikke et krav med kjennskap til mekanisk design, 3D modellering og tegning med verktøy som SolidWorks
Gode datakunnskaper og erfaring med ERP- og PDM-systemer
Du har stor arbeidskapasitet og gjennomføringsevne, tar initiativ til å få ting til å skje og tar ansvaret for resultatet
Du har stor teknisk interesse og trives med tekniske utfordringer og høyt tempo
Som person er du positiv, nysgjerrig og trives med å jobbe både selvstendig og i team

Noe reiseaktivitet i Norge og utland må påberegnes i perioder.

Vi ønsker å utvikle våre ansatte både faglig og personlig. I KONGSBERG får du muligheten til å jobbe med produkter i verdensklasse i et høyteknologisk miljø med engasjerte og positive kolleger. Vi har konkurransedyktige betingelser, pensjons- og forsikringsordninger, samt et fordelaktig aksjeprogram for deg som er ansatt. KONGSBERG tilbyr også treningssenter, innovasjonslab, firmahytter, rabatterte billetter til kultur- og sportsarrangementer, samt et eget fritidsprogram for unge medarbeidere.

Aerostructures & MRO er en divisjon i Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace. Divisjonen driver teknologisk ledende produksjon av avanserte mekaniske, elektromekaniske og komposittprodukter med meget høye kvalitetskrav til forsvars- og aerospacekunder. Hovedvirksomheten i divisjonen er leveranse av produkter til F35 jagerfly og produkter til KONGSBERG utviklede systemer innenfor sivil og forsvars-sektoren, deriblant leveranser til NASAMS luftvernssystemer samt leveranse av radarsystemer.

Her kan du lese mer om NASAMS: https://protect.kongsberg.com/artikkel_norsk-luftvern-beskytter-og-redder-liv/

Kandidater som søker på stillingen vil i forbindelse med rekrutteringsprosessen bli gjenstand for bakgrunnssjekk og vurdering av denne vil bli lagt til grunn ved valg av kandidat. For å være aktuell kandidat til stillingen må du kunne sikkerhetsklareres og autoriseres, jfr. Sikkerhetsloven.

Søknader behandles fortløpende, så ikke vent med å søke!

job_title: Vil du være med å bygge fremtidens Norge? Søk internship i Statsbygg
name_location: Statsbygg · Oslo, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 82 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Er du gira på et fantastisk Summer Internship som kommer til å gi deg verdifull erfaring OG en haug med minner for livet? Da bør du lese videre! Bli med på et spennende eventyr med Norges største byggherre, hvor du i tillegg til å få utfordre deg selv, også får muligheten til å være med på å forme fremtidens byggenæring gjennom reelle og kule prosjekter! 🏗️🌞

Vi har noen skikkelig kule oppgaver på lur
Internshipet hos oss gir deg muligheten til å få henge med en gjeng studenter fra en rekke ulike studieretninger og jobbe med knallspennende prosjekter. Hva handler det om? Jo, det handler om hvordan Statsbygg skal møte fremtiden og du er en nøkkelspiller i dette prosjektet. Du kan forvente å arbeide med spennende temaer som bærekraft, utvikling, innovasjon og prosjektgjennomføring. Vi leter etter kreative og kloke hoder med ulik kompetanse, så uansett hva du studerer - søk internship hos oss!

Unike befaringer og varierte kurs
For å vise deg hvordan vi leder byggeprosjekter og tar vare på eksisterende eiendommer, vil vi også ta turen ut av kontoret og ut på spennende befaringer. De siste årene har internsene besøkt blant annet Prosjekt nytt regjeringskvartal, Operaen, Nasjonalmuseet og Livsvitenskapsbygget. I tillegg setter vi opp flere kurs du kan melde deg på i løpet av sommeren. 

Skap minner med oss
En stor del av internshipet er selvfølgelig også å ha det gøy sammen! Det blir masse sosiale aktiviteter som volleyballturnering, badstue i Oslofjorden, minigolf, SUP, grilling i parken og sommerfest. Det blir garantert en sommer du ikke vil glemme og vi håper du får venner for livet! 

Les mer om vårt internship, søknadsprosessen og se hva tidligere interns har jobbet med her: 
https://www.statsbygg.no/karriere/summer-internship 
https://www.instagram.com/statsbygg/ 

Hvem ser vi etter?
Vi trenger kompetanse fra en rekke ulike studieretninger. I utgangspunktet prioriterer vi deg som i vårsemesteret 2024 befinner deg i ditt tredje eller fjerde år på et masterstudie innenfor: 
Data og IT-relaterte fag 
Ingeniørfag
Energi og miljø 
Arkitektur og landskapsarkitektur 
Økonomi
Planfag
Juridiske fag 
Eiendomsfag 
Medie- og kommunikasjonsfag 
Industriell økonomi
HR/organisasjon og ledelse 
Søkere med andre utdanningsretninger oppfordres også til å søke. 

Praktisk info 
Statsbyggs Summer Internship varer i 7 uker, fra 10.06.23 til 09.08.23, hvor det blir to uker ferie i uke 28 og 29. Arbeidsted vil være på vårt hovedkontor i Oslo sentrum. Lønn på timebasis, fra kr 270,- til kr 280,- avhengig av studielengde. Alle summer interns er sikret 1. gangs intervju dersom de søker relevante stillinger hos oss etter endte studier. 

Tips til søknaden din
I søknaden er det viktig å få frem hvorfor du er motivert til å være intern hos oss. Skriv gjerne om dine faglige interesser og hva du ønsker å bidra med i Statsbygg. Det er nødvendig å beherske norsk skriftlig og muntlig. Søknader fra kandidater som ikke har lagt ved karakterutskrift og som ikke kan jobbe i hele perioden vil ikke bli vurdert. 

Kort om oss
Unike prosjekter krever høy kompetanse og ulike innfallsvinkler. Statsbygg er en av Norges største byggherrer og eiendomsforvaltere, og vi gir råd til staten i bygge- og eiendomssaker. Vi jobber med alt fra museum, fengsel og ambassader til avanserte forskningsinstitusjoner. Hvert år arrangerer vi et Summer Internship for engasjerte studenter fra ulike studieretninger, vi tilbyr stillinger for nyutdannede og samarbeider gjerne om bachelor- og masteroppgaver. 

Søknadsfrist: 14.01.2024

job_description:
About the job
Would you like the opportunity to work in a global energy company?

Do you enjoy taking on challenging projects?

Join our innovating Internship Program

The Baker Hughes Internship is designed to enable students either pursuing a Bachelors’ or Masters’ degree or recently graduated to gain hands-on work experience as the foundation of their professional lives. Our internships will give you first-hand insights into the processes, systems, and practices that are aligned to ensure customer needs are met through flawless execution and the application of leading-edge technology.

Partner with the best

You’ll participate in focused training, and team meetings, work on projects, and present your results. During your internship, you will be supported by a buddy and your manager who will ensure you have a valuable learning experience. You can expect to receive coaching and mentoring to enable you to complete assignments and projects to develop your learning and skillset.

You will also have the opportunity to become familiar with the Health, Safety, and Environment (HS&E) and culture of Baker Hughes. as well as our strong commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion.

As an Intern, you will be responsible for:


Completing internal projects to deliver customer outcomes and identify business improvements
Learning internal software to assist with the completion of projects and tasks
Collaborating with cross-functional teams and interns to interact and network with global business leaders
Applying Health, Safety, and Environment (HS&E) standards and procedures in all situations to ensure compliance is maintained

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:


Be currently enrolled or recently graduated in a Bachelors’ or Masters’ level degree in Engineering, Technology, Mechanics, other STEM-related or business-related program.
Have maintained a GPA grade greater than or equal to 3.0 out of 4.0 or the equivalent in your country
Be fluent in oral and written English and have effective communication skills
Be able to relocate for the duration of your internship (locations vary)
Be able to legally work in the country that you are applying in, without company sponsorship or time restriction

Work in a way that works for you

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone. In this role, we may be able to offer flexible working patterns. Talk to us about your desired working options when you apply.

Working with us

Working at Baker Hughes means being at the forefront of the energy transition. Our people are diverse, ambitious, and collaborative. We're on a mission to redefine the energy sector by unlocking the power of engineering, data, and science.

About Us

With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, were committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and were always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner, and more efficient.

Join us

Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.

About Us:

We are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward – making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.

Join Us:

Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.

Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 28 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Canonical is a remote-first global company that publishes Ubuntu and open-source enterprise solutions for cloud, developer, IoT and AI. Ubuntu is the fastest growing Linux distribution and ranks as the number #1 OS in the cloud.

In partnership with Google, Amazon, IBM and Microsoft, Canonical helps companies become more agile, productive and adopt new technologies faster. Examples of customer success include AI, Blockchain, IoT, Advanced Robotics and self-driving cars, where Ubuntu is the preferred development platform.

The role of a Sales Development Representative at Canonical

Canonical is profitable and growing. We consider our sales development organization to be the best technology sales academy in the market, and as such, we select exceptional and ambitious candidates to join our team. You will enjoy this role if you are organized, persistent, charismatic, and hard-working. You will need to be interested in tech and its business implications. In this role, you will collaborate with a regional sales and marketing team, and your primary objective is to find customer projects that fit our product lines and spread the good name of Canonical across multiple different industries and geographies.

Click HERE to watch our SDR team discuss their role in Canonical

What Your Day Will Look Like

Handle inbound customer inquiries across email, phone and chat
Execute outbound sales & marketing campaigns
Travel to events and conferences worldwide, presenting on booths and driving face-to-face marketing and sales opportunities
Collaborate across multiple teams and senior stakeholders to drive results 
Work directly with marketing on campaigns
Research information about prospective customers
Generate a multi-million pound pipeline
Identify prospects and market trends
Help define the processes and policies for the team
Liaise with new and existing customers, setting up and attending meetings whilst actively mapping accounts to identify new opportunities
Accurately create, update, maintain and nurture leads on global opportunities

What We Are Looking For In You

Excellent academic results at school and university
Passion for business and technology
Commitment to continuous learning and improvement - curious, flexible, scientific
Creative problem solving and cross team collaboration
Verbal and written communication skills
Result driven with an over-achiever spirit
Persistence & perseverance

What We Offer You

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.

Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
