job_description:
About the job
Are you passionate about both technology and literature? Do you thrive in a dynamic and creative environment? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! The company is a well-established publishing company based in the heart of Oslo is on the lookout for a talented and innovative Tech Lead with expertise in TypeScript and Vue 3.

Job Title: Tech Lead - TypeScript & Vue 3 Location: Oslo, Norway

About Them: We are a leading publishing company that has been dedicated to bringing inspiring and captivating stories to readers worldwide. With a commitment to excellence and a deep appreciation for creativity, they aim to foster an environment that empowers both authors and technology enthusiasts alike. Especially when building a new platform!

Job Description: As a Tech Lead, you will play a crucial role in our mission to transform the publishing landscape through cutting-edge technology. You will lead and mentor a team of skilled developers, working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to build and maintain innovative web applications using TypeScript and Vue 3.

Responsibilities
 Lead a team of developers, providing technical guidance and fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented environment.
 Design, develop, and maintain web applications with an emphasis on responsive design and exceptional user experience.
 Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
 Drive the adoption of best practices, coding standards, and development methodologies within the team.
 Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in TypeScript, Vue 3, and related web technologies, ensuring continuous improvement and innovation.
Requirements
 Extensive experience in software development with a focus on TypeScript and Vue 3.
 Proven track record of leading and mentoring development teams in an Agile environment.
 Strong understanding of web development principles, responsive design, and user experience.
 Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with a keen eye for detail and UI/UX aesthetics.
 Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to architect scalable and maintainable solutions.
 Familiarity with backend technologies and API integration is a plus.
 Passion for literature and the publishing industry is a bonus.
Benefits
 Competitive salary and benefits package.
 Opportunity to work with a talented and diverse team of professionals.
 Access to a wide range of books and literature-related resources.
 Flexible working hours and a supportive work-life balance.
 A chance to make a meaningful impact on the future of publishing.

job_description:
About the job
Do you want to play a role in the transition to sustainable energy production?

At Aker Solutions we are committed to helping the energy industry and broader society #PowerTheChange towards a low-carbon future.

We are changemakers and problem solvers with more than 180 years of experience. Our ambitions are high. By 2030, renewables and low-carbon solutions for oil and gas will make up two-thirds of our business. Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?

The Life Cycle segment takes care of energy assets in a Life Cycle perspective. From the start to end of production, Life Cycle ensure safe operations. Our objective is to be a leading supplier of low carbon solutions and electrification projects. We focus on optimizing field life solutions, driven by decarbonization and environmentally sound offerings.

Our Materials Technology Engineer department in Stavanger is now looking for Graduate & Young Professional Materials Technology Engineer to help us in our mission to #powerthechange.

What will you be doing?
As a graduate in 2024 in Aker Solutions, you will be a part of a graduate program. This includes professional network, meet other graduates across locations and visit to our headquarter and one of our yards
As a permanent employee in Aker Solutions, you will participate in project teams that proudly deliver world class projects. You will work together with some of our most experienced and knowledgeable engineers and gain valuable experience
You will be joining a dedicated team of engineers and learn the methods as you go
You will be involved in a wide variety of projects ranging from smaller Front End Studies to Major Modification Projects and various Specialist Services
Training will be given and you will receive a mentor to guide you while developing your skills 
We Think You Should Have
Student graduating in 2024 or recent years
Area of study relevant to the role you are applying for
If you like to like to plan, manage and execute tasks you will thrive in this role
Being proactive and have the ability take initiative are great personal skills that will be appreciated in this role
You will be given all the tools you need to succeed, and the rest is up to you! 
More Reasons To Work With Us
As an employee in Aker Solutions, you have many career opportunities. We ensure that our employees get the chance to work across disciplines, build expertise and develop their own potential. This contributes to a vibrant and engaged working environment at all our locations.
A healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different
phases of your life journey
Competitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker Care
Access to welfare club with free gym facilities, sports equipment hire and cabins for rent in the mountains and by the sea
You will be a part of our Solutioneers, an international employee network that brings together our young talents for professional development, networking and fun. In addition, Aker offer a wide range of welfare activities and training options for all our employees.

job_title: Adjunkt- adjunkt med tillegg, vikariat ut skoleåret
name_location: Arendal kommune · Arendal, Agder, Norway  4 days ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Om stillingen

Myra skole er en lærende organisasjon med elevens beste i fokus. Vi jobber derfor kontinuerlig med organisering av elever og å bruke personalets ressurser optimalt, slik at vi får et godt og trygt læringsmiljø.

Skolens visjon: ”Vi vil ha balanse”

Overordnet Mål

 Vi vil at hver enkelt elev opplever å bli sett hver dag
 Vi vil at alle skal bli respektert for den de er og føle seg likeverdig
 Vi skal ha et faglig utfordrende læringsmiljø hvor alle opplever mestring
 Vi skal ha et godt samarbeid med hjemmene

Skolen er organisert i tre team: SFO, 1.-4. trinn og 5.-7. trinn. Gjennom disse teamene ønsker vi å utvikle et tett samarbeid på tvers av trinnene.

Skolen har også et lederteam bestående av rektor, avdelingsledere og adm.ansatt.

Det søkes etter pedagog i 100% vikariat fra og med 13.11.23 til og med 31.07.2024.

Det er en undervisningsstilling, fortrinnsvis på 5.-7.trinn.

Det vil være undervisning i hele grupper og i spes.ped.

 Arbeidsoppgaver 

Planlegge, gjennomføre og evaluere undervisning i klasse eller i mindre grupper, etter Opplæringsloven og læreplanen.

Vikaren skal delta i møter internt på skolen og med andre samarbeidspartnere.

Vikaren vil jobbe i samarbeid med kontaktlærer på trinnet om undervisning i fag og grupper (større/mindre).

Til stillingen ligger det ansvar for vurdering av elevers kompetanse i fag og veiledning i å utvikle seg.

 Kvalifikasjoner 

Vi søker fortrinnsvis etter personer med adjunkt/ adjunkt med tillegg, gjerne formell kompetanse i norsk, matematikk og engelsk.

Kompetanse i kunst og håndverk og spes.ped vil også bli vurdert som et pluss.

 Personlige egenskaper 

Vi søker etter en person som er samarbeidsorientert, positiv og opptatt av å skape gode relasjoner på arbeidsplassen- både til elever og ansatte,.

Det er behov for å være fleksibel i stillingen, da arbeidsdagen og arbeidsoppgavene kan bli annerledes enn forutsatt.

 Vi tilbyr 

Godt arbeidsmiljø, fine elever, mye humor og gild foreldregruppe.

Lønn etter tariffavtale

About the job
Linde Gas AS

Cylinder Operator

Oslo, Norway (req13805)

What You Will Enjoy Doing

You will be managing production on daily basis,
Administration and working with transport documentation is part of this role
Working in SAP program is required
You will be checking arriving products and placing products and packages with truck
Constant working on improvements in your work area
Responsibilities in warehouses

What Makes You Great

You have problem solving skills, accuracy and the ability to see the whole picture
You are structured and own the ability to handle many tasks at once
Stress tolerance is needed, as well as willingness to listen and develop
Good planning skills suit your profile
High level of responsibility
Moreover you have good computer skills, especially in Excel and SAP
Norwegian and English languages both spoken and written
Previous experience with LEAN is a big advantage
Truck operating license is required

Why you will love working with us

At Linde you will be surrounded by knowledgeable people who love what they do. We are creative and strive to move our company forward. We take pride in our people and work hard to provide an enriching, enjoyable place to work. We have a clear vision: to be the place where a diverse mix of dedicated people want to come, stay and excel. We are always improving, and because we are part of Linde, a global company, our people have limitless opportunities to grow and make an impact, all over the world.

Our values – Safety, Integrity, Accountability, Inclusion and Community are at the heart of everything we do. True our values we shape an environment that puts safety first, where people do things the right way, new ideas are encouraged, everyone can be themselves and we support our local communities.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you’re looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless. 

In addition to an attractive compensation package, we offer you social benefits, such as a competitive pension plan and insurance package and a hybrid workplace. We actively work towards gender equality and diversity; therefore, we are happy to see applicants with different backgrounds and experiences.

Have we inspired you? Let´s talk about it

We are looking forward to receiving your complete application (motivation letter, CV, certificates) via our online job market.

Last application date: 16th October 2023

Your contact person

Linde Gas AS

Cylinder Handling Manager

Jonathan Gray

+47 413 86 539

To all recruitment agencies: Linde does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Linde employees or any other organization location. Linde is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.

name_location: INFUSEmedia · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 19 applicants
job_description:
About the job
OUR HIRING PROCESS:

We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals—every person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment. 
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team. 
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSEmedia team. 
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed. 

Are you a skilled Instructional Designer with a knack for comprehensive writing and creating essential structures? Are you adept at unraveling complex information, all while asking the right questions to gather necessary details? Are you an organized individual who enjoys exploring diverse areas of expertise?

https://youtu.be/Yv9-q6rgQMA*

If so, we invite you to apply for the position of Instructional Designer on our team. In this role, you'll have the freedom to unleash your creativity, devise innovative solutions, all while enjoying unwavering support from our dynamic team. Join us and be part of a journey that empowers learners and drives excellence.

What we are looking for in our ideal candidate:

Minimum 2 years of Mid-level ID role experience or similar role within L&D department 
Excellent knowledge of learning theories and instructional design models (be able to explain how you would use them in your work)
Impeccable English writing skills
Ability to distinguish between primary and secondary details, simplifying complex information
Passion for acquiring new technical skills and the ability to translate complex technical concepts into understandable language that newcomers can grasp easily
Ability to produce diversity of learning materials, including scripts for video lectures, guides, manuals, etc.. 
Ability to work proactively in an ambitious, fast growing, and dynamic environment and be OK with adapting to change
Experience with learning management systems and understanding of their basic functionality

What you can expect to do on the job:

Support the development of corporate learning experiences to improve onboarding, performance, and the growth of employees aligned with the company's vision and values
Contribute to creation of the vision for educational products that solve business problems/needs and implement it
Work with the subject matter experts and discover learning needs within various departments, articulate why certain solutions will or will not work
Analyze diversity of our learners and contexts
Create engaging learning activities and compelling course content that enhances retention and creates an engaging culture of learning 
Create supporting material/media (audio, video, simulations, case-based learning, scenarios, games, etc.)
Be creative and seek solutions outside generally used practices
Tackle undefined, complex projects
Keep project documentation and course folders organized
Supervise Junior Instructional Designers and manage their workflow if needed
Voice out concerns to the team leads
Ability to grow into Senior ID Position within 6 months

If you recognize yourself in this and are up to the challenge, we'd be happy to hear from you!

name_location: Equinor · Oslo, Oslo, Norway Reposted  5 days ago  · 94 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Overview

 Job ID- 25981 
 Country- Norway 
 Location(s)- Stavanger, Bergen, Oslo, Harstad, Stjørdal 
 Company- Equinor ASA 
 Contact Name- graduaterecruitment@equinor.com 
 Workplace- Onshore 
 Discipline- Subsurface 
 Education Preferred- Master's Degree or PhD 
 Experience Preferred- Less than 2 years 
 Closing Date- Oct 16 2023 

Job Description

As a graduate at Equinor, you’ll be joining 21,000 colleagues delivering oil, gas, wind, and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. By 2050, we aim to become a net-zero company and deliver the energy the world needs without contributing to global warming. It’s one of the defining challenges of our time and attracting and developing the brightest minds will be critical to our success. 

The programme lasts for 2-years and includes rotations of 3-12 months across functions, business areas or locations.

The position

Subsurface ensures that Equinor finds, matures, and manages its energy resources in a profitable, competitive, safe and energy efficient manner. As a data scientist or data manager in the subsurface network, you will work and deliver within a multidisciplinary team and build your competence together with your colleagues across traditional oil and gas and new energy areas in low carbon solutions and offshore wind.

You will have the opportunity to work with a variety of projects developing your digital and data knowledge and integrate it with other key subsurface disciplines. Subsurface resources will also contribute to technology development and implementation projects .

By joining our Subsurface Data & Digital team you will have the opportunity to-

 Work on world class projects that use digital to drive efficiency and innovation safely. 
 Be a part of multidiscipline diverse agile teams where professional development and having a good time are focus. 
 Use data engineering and analytical techniques to deliver better data and new insight to our users. 
 Manage data for some of our biggest Norwegian and International assets. 
 Contribute to bringing data from current systems to integrated next generation cloud-based solutions. 

We're looking for people who want to join us and play a crucial role in the successful implementation of cloud, AI, and data engineering & management strategies in Subsurface. Your expertise and curiosity will be invaluable on this journey.

Whether you have a geosciences background and a passion for leveraging data and technology to make better decisions, or an IT or analytical education with a desire to tackle subsurface challenges, we want to hear from you.

You

Some qualities are essential for Equinor. You identify with our values, open, collaborative, courageous and caring, which guide our decisions and help us succeed and grow. You make safety your priority and contribute to our zero-harm culture. For this position, we are also looking for-

 Master’s degree or PhD with good academic record within Geosciences, Information Technology and Digitilisation , Information and Data Management. 
 Completed degree by the year of starting (2024). 
 Fluent in English. 
 No more than two years of relevant fulltime work experience. 
 Formal experience is not a requirement . 
 Extracurricular activities and/or voluntary work is an advantage. 

Your personal qualities-

 Ability to live by our safety and security expectations. 
 High ethical standards. 
 Good communication skills. 
 Global mindset. 
 Team player with the ability to work and deliver results in a diverse environment. 
 Have a positive attitude to take on new challenges and adapt to dynamic environments. 

Equinor is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all candidates who meet the educational and experience requirements, including candidates with disabilities. If you have any specific requirements for any stage in our process, then please make this clear in your application and our team will be happy to support you.

General information

Please make sure that when applying, you attach the following-

 CV/ resume in English. 
Transcripts of records (or other documents describing subjects and grades) in English or Scandinavian language obtained to this point during your studies. If you are in the process of completing a degree, please upload an official temporary transcript.

Applications submitted without these attachments will unfortunately not be evaluated.

To ensure an efficient recruitment process, please be informed that you may apply for a maximum of 3 Graduate roles per country.

Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process. Candidates will be asked for information on affiliation to high-risk countries for a security assessment. Furthermore, background checks are performed on all final candidates and all permanent and temporary hires will be screened against relevant sanctions lists to ensure compliance with sanctions law.

Why join us?

To succeed together, we all need to feel able to perform at our best . That’s why we offer-

 Learning and development. You’ll have access to on- the-job -training and mandatory physical and virtual learning modules, work rotations, networking opportunities and access to courses offered by our Equinor university. You’ll also get a buddy and a mentor to help you adapt and provide advice during the programme . 
 Wellness and work-life balance. Our benefits packages are designed to help you balance work and life at all stages of your career, including health insurance and other benefits for your physical and mental wellbeing, a flexible working policy and a global parental leave policy. We also provide access to holiday cabins in Norway and selected other locations. 
 An inclusive culture. An inclusive culture allows us to harness the unique experiences, knowledge, and backgrounds of our 21,000 employees . Ultimately, we believe we’ll be more creative, innovative, and resilient if everyone in Equinor feels safe in bringing their whole self and their ideas to work. 
 Financial rewards. Equinor’s compensation package includes competitive cash compensation and an opportunity to join our share savings plan. In most of our locations we offer pension arrangements aiming to safeguard our employees after retirement. 

For more information visit Equinor’s website-

name_location: Manpower Norway · Bergen, Vestland, Norway  3 days ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Er du glad i å snakke med folk? Har du et ønske om å yte god kundeservice? Da er dette deltidsjobben for deg! For en av våre kunder i Bergen sør ser vi nå etter deltidsmedarbeidere til deres kundesenter. Arbeidstidene gjør det nødvendig med eget transportmiddel da det ikke går kollektivtransport ved vaktslutt.

Arbeidssted: Bergen sør

Arbeidstid: Nattevakt annenhver helg og ekstravakter ved behov

Varighet: Langvarig

Oppstart: Snarest

Som vår nye kundeservicemedarbeider vil du besvare kundehenvendelser på telefon og å registrere henvendelsen i det interne systemet.

Du vil være kundens første kontakt med bedriften og vil dermed ha kontakt med mange ulike kunder. Dette gjør at du må ha gode kommunikasjonsferdigheter på både norsk og engelsk. Vi ser etter deg med erfaring fra kundebehandling og som trives godt med å bruke telefon og PC som arbeidsverktøy. I denne jobben må du være nøyaktig og strukturert og evne å holde roen i hektiske perioder.

Du vil få ta del i et godt og støttende arbeidsmiljø med mange kjekke tradisjoner. Faste vakter annenhver helg skaper forutsigbarhet, samtidig som du får mulighet til å jobbe mer ved å melde deg til ledige vakter i løpet av uken. Vi tilbyr fast lønn og god oppfølging fra din konsulent i Manpower.

På grunn av manglende kollektivtilbud ved start og slutt på noen vakter, er det vesentlig at du har tilgang på eget transportmiddel.

Interessert? Legg inn CV og søknad på manpower.no og søk på stillingen! Vi kontakter aktuelle kandidater fortløpende.

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 2 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This is a general track for first-level engineering management positions at Canonical.

We believe that open source is just starting to transform the tech sector and enterprise compute. Our goal is to make open source easier, more reliable and more secure for deployment and development. We strive to be the provider of 'most software to most companies'. To deliver on that ambition, our engineers are carefully selected from the applicants across the globe. We select for brilliance and motivation to take open source to the next level. Our engineering managers help teams achieve more than they realised they could, and feel proud of the result.

We believe that Engineering Managers should be outstanding developers themselves. They should be completely at home reviewing a patch or a software design spec. They are trusted engineers who understand the importance of a whole-team effort in creating great products, and who enjoy seeing colleagues develop. They should contribute code themselves to set the standard for coding, but know that the code they write is far less significant than their ability to shape the whole team's direction, focus and delivery. We grow management skills, and train engineers who are interested in soft skills to be managers.

A typical first-level software engineering team is based in a single time zone such as EMEA or Americas or APAC, with an Engineering Manager and a Senior Engineer dedicated to a single product, who work as a team to shape the roadmap, technical strategy, code, documentation and community engagement. They are both capable of coding, and are both leaders comfortable assigning work and maintaining expectations of delivery. They will both be expected to take management training at Canonical so they speak the same language when it comes to team behaviours, habits, routines, norms and standards, but they focus on different sides of the problem.

An Engineering Manager is responsible for line management and career guidance. The ability to develop engineering talent, to represent your team and product from a technical perspective, and to drive collaboration with other teams and customers are all critical to success in this role.

We have open manager roles across a wide range of engineering domains, including:

Python and Golang
C / C++ / Rust
Data infrastructure
HTML / CSS / JavaScript / Typescript / React
Flutter
Distro packaging and systems
SAAS and web microservices
Kernel
Servers
Graphics, Browser and Desktop 
Silicon enablement and embedded devices
Product Security

If your domain of expertise isn't listed above, yet you feel it's relevant to Canonical, then feel free to apply anyway. We will route you to the most suitable team.

Location: we have engineering management positions open in every time zone

What you'll do

Lead and develop a team of engineers, ranging from graduate to senior
Work remotely in a single major time zone, sometimes two
Coach, mentor, and offer career development feedback
Identify and measure team health indicators
Implement disciplined engineering processes
Represent your team and product to stakeholders, partners, and customers 
Develop and evangelise great engineering and organisational practices
Plan and manage progress on agreed goals and projects
Be an active part of the leadership team, collaborating with other leaders

What we're looking for in you

An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
Drive and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
A love of developing and growing people and a track record of it
Experience in leading, coaching and mentoring software developers
Organised and able to ensure your team delivers timely, high quality results
Well-organised, self-starting and able to deliver to schedule
Professional manner interacting with colleagues, partners, and community
You have advanced expertise in your own domain 
You are knowledgeable and passionate about software development 
You have solid experience working in an agile development environment
You have a demonstrated drive for continual learning
Builds trust, relationships and confidence
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments 
Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each

Additional Skills We Value

Experience in a developer advocacy or community role
Ops and system administration experience
Performance engineering and security experience

What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. name_location: Ascom · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 4 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are…
Ascom is a global solutions provider focused on Healthcare ICT and mobile workflow solutions. Headquartered in Switzerland, our business spans across 18 countries, and has been supporting the healthcare industry for 160 years by providing them with technology to enable them to support their communities.
Our systems are used in over 12,000 hospitals worldwide and handle more than 800 million alerts each year (over 2 million alerts a day!). Our solutions positively impact the lives of everyone who visits 1 of the hospitals or care-homes we work with. 
Together we can make a difference in the lives of the people who benefit from our technology.

As a Solutions Architect in the customer team, you will work tight with sales and service representatives to realize the solutions requested by the customer. As Solutions Architect, you will lead, facilitate, analyze, and design tasks required to develop the customer solution architecture and ensure all parties leverage it.

We love to give YOU…
a real-world, first-hand experience about what it’s like to work with high-end technology at the forefront of the healthcare industry.
an opportunity to help our healthcare customers save patients' lives and improve our community with new technology and professionalism

   Your days will be filled with…
  Active collaboration and participation within the customer team.
Finding suitable solutions for our customers based on Ascom's portfolio together with the solutions team through close collaboration with the customer and partners to understand their needs and challenges.
Creating long- and short-term plans for the individual customer's solutions and providing support and advice for developing the technical platforms.
Produce written specifications (i.e., Ascom configuration) to capture business process requirements for proposed standard solutions and configuration activities.
Ensure a clear understanding of customers' technology requirements; support sales and services teams; provide technical leadership and vision to win and deliver large-scale, complex solutions.
  Qualifications and Experience
A technical education on an MSc level or similar
In-depth knowledge and understanding of the wireless communication sector and the ability to understand technical system configurations.
In-depth knowledge and understanding of modern healthcare IT environments and medical device connectivity.
Proven experience in a direct sales set-up and supporting a sales force.
Excellent knowledge of Norwegian and English languages in both speech and writing
Strong and confident customer-facing / consulting skills.

  Personal skills
To be successful in this role, we believe that beyond proven technical skills, you have the following abilities:
Strong analytical & problem-solving skills.
Excellent communicator, both verbally and in writing
Ability to understand business requirements and convert them into solution designs.
Ability to adapt to new methods and work under tight deadlines.
Successful working independently and as part of a team, especially within a fast-paced matrix environment.
Able to handle multiple priorities in a fast-moving environment
Collaborative and skilled at networking.
Excellent customer management skills

Why should you work with us? 
We offer more than just a job at Ascom, we offer a career with real benefits which include: 
Flexible hybrid work environment.
Professional development with our global Learning & Development team as well as localized internal and external training opportunities.
Opportunities to work with various teams around the world and chance to work on projects in other countries in addition to your home (role dependent).
Supporting career agility through internal mobility.
Working with high-quality medical technology in the healthcare space.

name_location: AF Gruppen · Stavanger, Rogaland, Norway  1 week ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Aeron er et selskap i AF Gruppen ASA – et av Norges ledende entreprenør og industrikonsern. Aeron er en internasjonal totalleverandør av HVAC-R utstyr og systemer til marine, offshore og landbasert industri. Aeron anses å være ledende leverandør innen HVAC-R fagfeltet i offshore bransjen, noe som har gitt oss et tidlig og solid fotfeste innen Offshore Vind segmentet. Aeron har allerede levert prosjekter med positive tall til noen av de store nasjonale og internasjonale Offshore Vind prosjekter. Offshore Vind vil være et viktig satsingspunkt for Aeron, hvor vi skal posisjonere oss som den beste leverandør med innovative og attraktive løsninger. Våre rundt 100 stk høyt kompetente medarbeidere innen HVAC-R innen fagene HVAC, kjøling, elektro, automasjon og rør holder til på kontorer i Flekkefjord, Stavanger og Bergen. Aeron har over flere tiår opparbeidet et sterkt fagmiljø som blir verdsatt av ansatte, samarbeidspartnere og kunder i et krevende miljø som nå er på vei inn i en «grønn» og spennende fremtid.

Dokumentkontroller søkes til ledende HVAC-leverandør

Er du en erfaren dokumentkontroller som ønsker å jobbe med spennende prosjekter innen offshore olje og gass, samt offshore vind? Da er du kanskje den vi leter etter!

Aeron har flere langsiktige rammeavtaler for service og vedlikehold på offshoreinstallasjoner på norsk sokkel, og opplever nå stor etterspørsel fra kunder og samarbeidspartnere. Aeron skal være en positiv bidragsyter til et mer bærekraftig miljø. Dette er et område vi allerede mot, med våre bidrag inn til global utbygning innen bærekraftig segmentet. Fremtiden vil stille strenge krav til energioptimalisering, noe vi i Aeron allerede har tatt inn over oss, og jobber nå målrettet med fokus på nye innovative og miljøriktige løsninger sammen med samarbeidspartnere og kunder.

Som dokumentkontroller hos oss vil du ha ansvar for å sikre at all dokumentasjon knyttet til våre prosjekter og er i henhold til kundens krav og gjeldende standarder. Du vil være en del av et tverrfaglig team som samarbeider tett med både interne og eksterne aktører. Du vil også være med på å utvikle våre rutiner og prosedyrer for dokumentkontroll internt i bedriften.

Vi Ser Etter Deg Som Har

Relevant utdanning innen dokumentkontroll eller tilsvarende
Minst 3 års erfaring fra dokumentkontroll i offshore olje og gass
God kjennskap til dokumenthåndteringssystemer, fortrinnsvis ProArc
Evne til å se feil i prosedyrer og teknisk dokumentasjon
God muntlig og skriftlig kommunikasjonsevne på norsk og engelsk
Proaktiv, strukturert og løsningsorientert arbeidsstil
Evne til å jobbe selvstendig og i team
Komfortabel med å jobbe med høy arbeidsmengde i raskt skiftende miljø
Evne til å administrere flere prioriteringer
Proaktiv oppfølging av intern organisasjon, leverandører og kunde-dokumentasjon

Vi Tilbyr

Spennende og varierte arbeidsoppgaver i et dynamisk miljø
Konkurransedyktige betingelser og gode velferdsordninger
Hyggelige kolleger i et godt arbeidsmiljø og sterkt fagmiljø
Offshore Prosjekter: Vår virksomhet omfatter offshore-prosjekter som gir deg muligheten til å jobbe på utfordrende og spennende prosjekter mot ulike deler av verden
Ta del i det grønne skiftet ved å jobbe med spennende prosjekter innen offshore vind
Muligheter for å bygge karriere: Aeron og AF Gruppen er opptatt av den enkelte medarbeiders interesser og karriereutvikling. Vi tilbyr våre ansatte både interne og eksterne kurs innen karriere- og leder-utvikling. AF består av mange spennende selskaper og det vi har til felles er fremtidsrettede kollegaer, høy trivsel og et ønske om å bygge kompetanse og dele erfaring
Gode Forsikringsavtaler: Vi vet at livet har sine utfordringer, derfor tilbyr vi omfattende forsikringsavtaler for å sikre at du og din familie er beskyttet
Opsjonsprogram for Aksjer: Vi tror på våre ansatte og gir deg muligheten til å eie en del av vår suksess gjennom vårt opsjonsprogram for aksjer
Deltakelse i et stort konsortium: Som en del av vårt selskap, blir du en nøkkelspiller i et stort konsortium med utallige muligheter for vekst og utvikling
Mulighet for hjemmekontor: Vi forstår verdien av fleksibilitet, derfor tilbyr vi muligheten til å jobbe hjemmefra i enkelte tilfeller, slik at du kan oppnå en sunn balanse mellom arbeid og hjemmeliv
Gratis treningssenter i moderne arbeidslokaler på Forus: Vi bryr oss om helsen og velværet til våre ansatte, derfor gir vi gratis tilgang til vårt interne treningssenter

Aeron Lokasjoner Og Kjerneområder i Norge

Flekkefjord med kjerneområde: Maritime segment. Intern produksjon av HVAC-R
Stavanger med kjerneområde: Offshore, Offshore Vind og landbasert HVAC-R
Bergen med kjerneområde: Offshore, Offshore Vind, landbasert HVAC-R og Service avdeling
Egersund (Aermade): Moderne produksjonslokaler for sammenstilling av HVAC aggregater og tilhørende utstyr

Arbeidslokasjon for dokumentkontroller er fortrinnsvis i Stavanger, men kan også være mulighet for Bergen.

name_location: AF Gruppen · Landet, Trøndelag, Norway  1 month ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Kan du se for deg en jobb der du bidrar til å løse noen av vår tids viktigste samfunnsoppdrag? AF Anlegg er en viktig samfunnsbygger med gjennomføringskraft til å løse noen av de største anleggsprosjektene i Norge og Sverige. Nå trenger vi nyutdannede ingeniør- og fagskolestudenter som deler våre verdier og vil være med å skape resultater for AF. Vi trenger deg som er nysgjerrig, sulten på å lære, og klar for store utfordringer. Du trives med samarbeid og kan bidra både faglig og sosialt.

Vi ansetter hvert år en rekke nyutdannede, og vi har god erfaring med å la nyutdannede utvikle seg gjennom tidlig ansvar og krevende oppgaver. Vi tilbyr ansvar og tillit, og venter engasjement og gode løsninger tilbake. I AF utvikles du gjennom en spennende og utfordrende arbeidshverdag, samt gjennom kursing og opplæring i vårt eget AF Akademi.

Spennende arbeidsoppgaver

For deg som nyutdannet får du muligheten til å bryne deg på mange ulike fag, roller og oppgaver. Du vil både få brukt kunnskapen du har med deg fra studiet, og tilegne deg ny kompetanse gjennom nye arbeids- og ansvarsområder.

Typiske Arbeidsoppgaver For En Nyutdannet Kan Være

Oppfølging av underentreprenører og leverandører
Kontraktsarbeid
BIM
Stikning og mengdeberegning
Driftsplanlegging
Risikostyring
Kvalitetsstyring
HMS
Arbeidsledelse

Nysgjerrig på arbeidshverdagen i AF Anlegg? Sjekk ut AF Gruppens Instagram, eller AF Gruppen på YouTube.

Vi har prosjekter spredt utover i Norge og i Sverige, så du kan være bosatt hvor som helst i landet, men du må være motivert til å ukependle og være til stede i prosjekt. Normal arbeidstidsordning ved ukependling er mandag-torsdag, med fri fredag-søndag. Vi har også arbeidstidsordninger på 7/7 og 14/14, avhengig av hvilken rolle du vil få. AF dekker reiseutgifter og sørger for kvarter ved alle våre prosjekter. Det er en forutsetning at du har førerkort klasse B.

Ta gjerne kontakt med oss på stand om vi kommer på besøk til ditt studiested dette skoleåret. Du finner en oversikt over våre planlagte skolebesøk på vår hjemmeside.

I søknadsskjemaet ber vi deg om å svare på et par spørsmål slik at vi bedre kan få en forståelse av din bakgrunn og kompetanse. Husk å legge ved karakterutskrift og vitnemål.

Søknadsfrist: 12. november 2023

Om AF Anlegg

AF Anlegg utfører prosjekter innen samferdsel, infrastruktur og vannkraft og er involvert i flere av de til enhver tid viktigste samfunnsoppdragene i Norge og Sverige. Vår ekspertise er innen vei, bane, flyplass, fundamentering og tunnel. Virksomheten omfatter også nybygg og oppgradering av olje-, gass- og havneanlegg. Med nysgjerrighet utfordrer vi sammen det etablerte og etterlater varige fotavtrykk i samfunnet du kan være stolt av å ha vært med på.

Bli med å rydde fra fortiden og bygge for fremtiden, du også.

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 4 applicants
job_description:
About the job
The role of a Manager, Talent Science at Canonical

Our Talent Science team brings deep analytical thinking to how we assess our Global talent. We are pioneering experts changing how an organisation thinks about building its talent. With a Hiring Leadership team that owns and runs our hiring process, our team is responsible for developing advanced insights into the decisions we are making with the ability to best predict performances in the workplace. We are leading the way on how an organisation builds itself through identifying exceptional people, holding the highest standards whilst searching in a globally remote world.

This is a unique opportunity to connect the science behind hiring to enable us to attract game changing talent. We are highly data driven, using advanced analytics to assess the effectiveness of our process. We are responsible for ensuring our assessment process helps our leaders identify exceptional talent. We also bring deep thinking on psychometric assessments and conduct in depth behavioural interviews to provide insights on drivers and motivations of our people.

We are looking for an experienced talent leader that has proven experience of driving world class talent initiatives. Being highly data centric you will have the ability to drive change through insights and analytics, and bring unique ways to measure talent in the tech marketplace. The suitable individual will bring experience of data science, creating and using dashboarding to influence and drive our processes together with experience of conducting behavioral and psychometric assessments.

This role is home based in EMEA.

What your day will look like

In this role you will:

Lead a team of data driven behavioural experts, responsible for ensuring that our leadership teams are selecting game changing talent for our organisation. 
Building and driving deep dive analytics that impact the decisions we make when assessing talent in the Tech industry. 
Build key relationships with global Hiring Leadership stakeholders to drive our hiring agenda. 
Be seen as a thought leader on talent initiatives with an inherent belief that past performance predicts future success. 
Conduct in-depth behavioral talent interviews providing considerable insights into motivations and behaviours of talent. 
Review our assessment effectiveness to drive continuous improvement. 
Ensure our Employer branding and DEI initiatives support and drive an inclusive environment for our people. 

What we are looking for in you

An exceptional academic track record with a degree in psychology or a science based subject with a data science/analytical background. 
 Programming experience with advanced capability to build dashboards, manipulate large datasets and create complex metrics to drive positive behavioural change (SQL, Python, Scripting capabilities). 
Management experience overseeing data driven experts in the talent field including managing projects that drive efficiency and deliver results. 
Thought leadership in the talent space with the ability to influence best practice, bringing a solid point of how to build a high performance organisation. 
Experience of running and providing stakeholder training on behavioural, competency based interviews. 
Experience of interpreting psychometric assessments with a deep belief that motivations and behaviours are as important as technical domain skills. 
Proven ability of working with senior stakeholders to drive a professional outlook on hiring talent as well as challenge the status quo. 
Passionate about building a great employer brand and candidate experience. 
Experience of successful configuration of hiring tools that enable the selection process. 
 Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events

What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.

Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

About the job
For en av våre gode kunder i offentlig sektor søker vi etter en konsulent i et vikariat sentralt i Oslo. Det er ønskelig med snarlig oppstart, og vikariatet varer ut juni 2024 med mulighet for forlengelse. Arbeidstid er 08:00 – 15: 30 og lunsjtiden er betalt.

Hva: 

Her vil du jobbe med å behandle vedtaksbrev om finansieringstilskudd og holde kontroll på signerte dokumenter. Du sørger for utbetaling av lån og tilskudd, gjør ajourberegninger og følger opp endringssaker.

Vi ser frem til å høre fra deg!

name_location: Tønsberg kommune · Bø, Vestfold og Telemark, Norway  3 days ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Tønsberg kommune søker en engasjert skolefaglig rådgiver til arbeid med oppfølging og kvalitetsutvikling av Tønsberg-skolene.

Tønsberg kommune har ledig en fast 100 % stilling som skolefaglig rådgiver. Skolefaglig rådgiver går inn i oppvekststab og deltar i de spennende, utfordrende og varierte arbeidsoppgavene som sektoren til enhver tid har. Arbeidsoppgavene består i både forvaltnings- og kvalitetsutviklingsoppgaver. Skolefaglig rådgiver rapporterer til stabsleder oppvekststab.

Tønsberg kommune har 13 barneskoler, fire ungdomsskoler og to kombinerte barne- og ungdomsskoler. Oppvekststaben følger opp både skolene og barnehagene, og samarbeider tett med PPT, barneverntjenesten og virksomhet Barn og unge. Som skolefaglig rådgiver vil hovedvekten av oppgavene dine være rettet mot skole, men du må kunne bistå i samarbeid også med de andre områdene.

Tønsberg kommune har ca 55 000 innbyggere og ca 4 500 ansatte. Tønsberg har en lang og spennende historie som Norges eldste by, et variert kulturliv og flotte områder for rekreasjon og friluftsliv på land og i sjø.

Hovedarbeidsoppgaver

Rådgiving og veiledning i skolefaglige spørsmål
Bistå i arbeidet med organisasjonsutvikling, blant annet med vekt på videreutvikling av Tønsberg-skolene som lærende organisasjoner
Etablere og følge opp overordnede planer, systemer og rutiner
Saksbehandling, blant annet vedtak om logopedtjenester, skolebytte, skoleskyss, innsynsbegjæringer og andre vedtak
Følge opp innspill og pålegg fra Statsforvalteren, Udir og andre offentlige og statlige organer
Utarbeide saker til politisk behandling
Systemansvar for ulike skoleadministrative systemer, databehandleravtaler og oppgaver lagt til digital kompetanseheving, drift og utvikling
Andre arbeidsoppgaver til stillingen må regnes med

Kvalifikasjonskrav

Relevant utdanning på høyskole/universitetsnivå innen pedagogikk, skoleutvikling og/eller skoleledelse. Bred erfaringsbakgrunn kombinert med annen skolefaglig utdanning kan også være aktuelt
God kjennskap til opplæringslova, forskrift og annet relevant lovverk
God muntlig og skriftlig framstillingsevne
God IKT-kompetanse
God utredningskompetanse
Politiattest må fremlegges ved ansettelse

Ønskede kvalifikasjoner

Bakgrunn fra grunnskolesektoren
Kjennskap til/kunnskap om offentlig forvaltning/saksbehandlingserfaring 

Personlige egenskaper

Er utviklingsorientert og har god gjennomføringsevne
Har god organisasjonsforståelse og relasjonelle ferdigheter
Har gode relasjonsferdigheter og evne til å skape tillit
Har gode kommunikasjonsevner og samarbeidsevner
Har evne til å arbeide målrettet, systematisk og strukturert
Har evne til å jobbe selvstendig og i team
Personlig egnethet vektlegges

Vi Tilbyr

En jobb med store muligheter for personlig utvikling i et spennende og utviklingsorientert miljø
Pensjonsordning gjennom KLP
Inkluderende arbeidsliv-ordning
Lønn etter avtale
Stillingskode: 8530 Rådgiver
Annen tiltredelsesdato kan avtales

For stillingene gjelder de til enhver tid gjeldende lover, tariffavtaler og reglementer.

Søkerlister med opplysninger om navn, alder, stilling eller yrkestittel og bosted- eller arbeidskommune for hver søker er offentlig i hht Offentlighetsloven. Det kan gjøres unntak dersom søker anmoder om dette og grunngir dette i søknaden. Dersom anmodningen ikke tas til følge vil søkeren varsles om dette.

Kommunen ber aldri om kontaktinformasjon eller kontoopplysninger i rekrutteringsfasen, verken over SMS, e-post eller i brev via Digipost

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Ubuntu is the most widely used Linux distribution in the world, and a strong factor in its broad adoption is the security and reliability the Ubuntu Linux kernels provide for their users. Canonical, the company behind the Ubuntu Linux distribution, has an enduring commitment to not only high quality standards for a distribution upon release, but also to provide ongoing security and maintenance updates for its users for up to 10 years for the Long Term Support (LTS) releases.

The Canonical Linux Kernel Team is looking for individuals with a strong sense of determination to provide ongoing support and security updates for the Ubuntu Linux kernels. These tasks can range anywhere from diagnosing and resolving kernel issues reported by end users to assessing the latest CVE security exploit notifications for impact and integrating a resolution. Overall, you will be personally responsible for the continual delivery of updates for many of the variations of version, flavor, and architecture of Linux kernel Ubuntu provides.

What your day will look like

Collaborate regularly and proactively with a globally distributed team 
Respond quickly to assess and mitigate security exploits in the Ubuntu Linux kernel
Hone your kernel debugging techniques by diagnosing and resolving issues in the kernel reported by customers and the community
Master the art of Debian and Snap packaging for Linux kernels
Take personal pride in being directly responsible for the integration, packaging, and rigorous testing to deliver updates to millions of consumers worldwide
Contribute to the improvement of tooling and automation for the delivery and test of Ubuntu Linux kernels
Discover new means to ensure even greater Ubuntu reliability by adding and improving kernel test coverage and delivery process improvements
Utilizing a strong understand of git workflows, submit, review, and apply kernel patches, working with both internal and external upstream maintainers

What we are looking for in you

Well-organized, self-starting and able to deliver to fixed schedules
Strong commitment to quality processes and documentation standards
Demonstrated ability to present oneself in a professional manner when interacting with colleagues, business partners, and the open source community
Ability to communicate effectively in English, both written and oral
Significant programming experience in C
Solid background with git
Demonstrated experience with operating system kernel patching and debugging

Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring

Significant Python and Bash scripting ability
Broad knowledge of the Linux kernel and kernel subsystems
Knowledge/experience with Linux kernel upstream processes and release cycle
Prior experience with Ubuntu/Debian/Snap packaging
Strong grasp of device drivers, BSP's, and other low level system engineering
Contributed to or even maintained an open source project in the past or present
Understanding of CVE classification

What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

job_title: ER DU QUALITY AIRPORT HOTEL GARDERMOENS NYE NATTEVAKT?
name_location: Strawberry (formerly Nordic Choice Hotels) · Jessheim, Viken, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Det er en grunn til at det er akkurat du som ønsker å jobbe i Strawberry. Du ser muligheter på våre 100 destinasjoner. Du tror du vil passe inn i vårt mangfold blant 18.000 ansatte. Du er spent på våre fantastiske hotellkjeder og du har energi, mot og begeistring så det holder. Vil du vite mer om oss? Vi gleder oss til å høre fra deg! Quality Hotel™ er en del av Strawberry. I mars 2018 åpnet vi nye Quality Airport Hotel Gardermoen. Hotellet er et av Norges mest avanserte fullservice konferansehotell. Sammen skal vi vokse, videreføre vår inspirerende kultur – og skape møteplasser som rocker. Like ved flyplassen, midt i naturen.

NATTRESEPSJONIST I 90 % STILLING

Om stillingen:

Du må være lidenskapelig opptatt av å skape minneverdige opplevelser for alle våre gjester, slik at de kan slappe av og virkelig nyte tiden hos oss. Du blir en del av et team som brenner for å levere eksepsjonell service der vi vet at ALT er mulig, mens vi har det gøy i ALT vi gjør! På Quality Airport Hotel Gardermoen sørger vi for en varm velkomst, et hyggelig smil og vi streber etter å levere en gjesteopplevelse som overgår forventningene.

Arbeidsstedet vil i hovedsak være i resepsjon, men det er forventet at du er fleksibel og ønsker å hjelpe til i andre avdelinger på hotellet.

Din primære oppgave er å ta imot gjestene som kommer sent til hotellet. Mens alle andre sover, er du den som legger grunnlaget for dine kollegers kommende arbeidsdag ved å utføre diverse oppgaver, rydde og ha fokus på sikkerhet blant gjestene. Selvstendighet er ditt fornavn. Som nattugle er det ikke mange andre som er våken når du jobber, noe som innebærer at du må ta mange beslutninger selv. Ved å ha en god evne til å prioritere og være fleksibel er du ikke bare hotellets ansikt utad på natten, du er også alles trygge punkt når det kommer til brann og sikkerhet. Stillingen innebærer skift- og helgearbeid.

Krav

Være minimum 20 år
Snakke godt norsk/skandinavisk språk og engelsk
Liker å jobbe i team i et hektisk miljø
Fremoverlent
Serviceminded
Fleksibel
Strukturert
Gode IT kunnskaper

Er du klar for å gi full gass og for å bli en av våre gjesters nye superhelt?

Stillingen er 90 % og turnus. Oppstart er etter avtale/snarest

Arbeidsoppgaver:

Resepsjonsarbeid som inn- og utsjekk, svare på telefoner, ta imot bookinger, forberede ankomstlister, fakturering mm. 
Påse at gjestene alltid blir ivaretatt gjennom ypperlig service og høyt kompetansenivå både før, under og etter oppholdet. 
Sørge for å være oppdatert og kjent med hotellets brann- og sikkerhetstjenester.
Aktivt mersalg 
Skape en WOW opplevelse for gjestene
Holde hovedansvar for brann og sikkerhet 

Aktuelle kandidater vil bli kalt inn fortløpende.

Om oss

Hva er det som gjør et besøk hos oss helt unikt? Kanskje er det servitøren som alltid har en vits på lur, housekeeping som legger igjen en personlig hilsen på rommet ditt, eller resepsjonisten som behandler femåringen din som en kongelig?

På Quality Hotel får hver medarbeiders personlighet skinne, og det gjenspeiles i arbeidet vi gjør. Vi gjør alt vi kan for at oppholdet ditt skal bli så bra som mulig, enten du skal holde en konferanse eller nyte kvalitetstid med familien. Vi elsker å tilby det lille ekstra, slik at dere kan lene dere tilbake, være sammen og sette av tid til de små øyeblikkene i hverdagen - de som virkelig betyr noe. Våre 60+ hoteller i Norden er unike på hver sin måte, men felles for dem alle er den gode, varme atmosfæren og den personlige tilnærmingen til hver gjest. Det er nettopp det som gjør et besøk hos oss helt unikt.

Ta gjerne kontakt med oss hvis det er noe du lurer på.

name_location: Equinor · Stjørdal, Trøndelag, Norway Reposted  5 days ago  · 26 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Overview

 Job ID- 25981 
 Country- Norway 
 Location(s)- Stavanger, Bergen, Oslo, Harstad, Stjørdal 
 Company- Equinor ASA 
 Contact Name- graduaterecruitment@equinor.com 
 Workplace- Onshore 
 Discipline- Subsurface 
 Education Preferred- Master's Degree or PhD 
 Experience Preferred- Less than 2 years 
 Closing Date- Oct 16 2023 

Job Description

As a graduate at Equinor, you’ll be joining 21,000 colleagues delivering oil, gas, wind, and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. By 2050, we aim to become a net-zero company and deliver the energy the world needs without contributing to global warming. It’s one of the defining challenges of our time and attracting and developing the brightest minds will be critical to our success. 

The programme lasts for 2-years and includes rotations of 3-12 months across functions, business areas or locations.

The position

Subsurface ensures that Equinor finds, matures, and manages its energy resources in a profitable, competitive, safe and energy efficient manner. As a data scientist or data manager in the subsurface network, you will work and deliver within a multidisciplinary team and build your competence together with your colleagues across traditional oil and gas and new energy areas in low carbon solutions and offshore wind.

You will have the opportunity to work with a variety of projects developing your digital and data knowledge and integrate it with other key subsurface disciplines. Subsurface resources will also contribute to technology development and implementation projects .

By joining our Subsurface Data & Digital team you will have the opportunity to-

 Work on world class projects that use digital to drive efficiency and innovation safely. 
 Be a part of multidiscipline diverse agile teams where professional development and having a good time are focus. 
 Use data engineering and analytical techniques to deliver better data and new insight to our users. 
 Manage data for some of our biggest Norwegian and International assets. 
 Contribute to bringing data from current systems to integrated next generation cloud-based solutions. 

We're looking for people who want to join us and play a crucial role in the successful implementation of cloud, AI, and data engineering & management strategies in Subsurface. Your expertise and curiosity will be invaluable on this journey.

Whether you have a geosciences background and a passion for leveraging data and technology to make better decisions, or an IT or analytical education with a desire to tackle subsurface challenges, we want to hear from you.

You

Some qualities are essential for Equinor. You identify with our values, open, collaborative, courageous and caring, which guide our decisions and help us succeed and grow. You make safety your priority and contribute to our zero-harm culture. For this position, we are also looking for-

 Master’s degree or PhD with good academic record within Geosciences, Information Technology and Digitilisation , Information and Data Management. 
 Completed degree by the year of starting (2024). 
 Fluent in English. 
 No more than two years of relevant fulltime work experience. 
 Formal experience is not a requirement . 
 Extracurricular activities and/or voluntary work is an advantage. 

Your personal qualities-

 Ability to live by our safety and security expectations. 
 High ethical standards. 
 Good communication skills. 
 Global mindset. 
 Team player with the ability to work and deliver results in a diverse environment. 
 Have a positive attitude to take on new challenges and adapt to dynamic environments. 

Equinor is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all candidates who meet the educational and experience requirements, including candidates with disabilities. If you have any specific requirements for any stage in our process, then please make this clear in your application and our team will be happy to support you.

General information

Please make sure that when applying, you attach the following-

 CV/ resume in English. 
Transcripts of records (or other documents describing subjects and grades) in English or Scandinavian language obtained to this point during your studies. If you are in the process of completing a degree, please upload an official temporary transcript.

Applications submitted without these attachments will unfortunately not be evaluated.

To ensure an efficient recruitment process, please be informed that you may apply for a maximum of 3 Graduate roles per country.

Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process. Candidates will be asked for information on affiliation to high-risk countries for a security assessment. Furthermore, background checks are performed on all final candidates and all permanent and temporary hires will be screened against relevant sanctions lists to ensure compliance with sanctions law.

Why join us?

To succeed together, we all need to feel able to perform at our best . That’s why we offer-

 Learning and development. You’ll have access to on- the-job -training and mandatory physical and virtual learning modules, work rotations, networking opportunities and access to courses offered by our Equinor university. You’ll also get a buddy and a mentor to help you adapt and provide advice during the programme . 
 Wellness and work-life balance. Our benefits packages are designed to help you balance work and life at all stages of your career, including health insurance and other benefits for your physical and mental wellbeing, a flexible working policy and a global parental leave policy. We also provide access to holiday cabins in Norway and selected other locations. 
 An inclusive culture. An inclusive culture allows us to harness the unique experiences, knowledge, and backgrounds of our 21,000 employees . Ultimately, we believe we’ll be more creative, innovative, and resilient if everyone in Equinor feels safe in bringing their whole self and their ideas to work. 
 Financial rewards. Equinor’s compensation package includes competitive cash compensation and an opportunity to join our share savings plan. In most of our locations we offer pension arrangements aiming to safeguard our employees after retirement. 

For more information visit Equinor’s website-

name_location: Kiwa · Kongsberg, Viken, Norway  1 week ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
Arbeidsbeskrivelse  Oppsummering av stillingen

Kiwa er et internasjonalt konsern med 10 000 ansatte i 40 land. Vi opererer i TIC-bransjen og leverer tjenester innenfor testing, inspeksjon, sertifisering og kurs. Våre største kunder er ledende innen bransjer som luft- og romfart, olje, gass og energi, produksjon, infrastruktur, transport og telecom. I Norge er vi ca. 220 medarbeidere fordelt på kontorer i Oslo, Tønsberg, Rygge, Kongsberg, Stavanger, Bergen, Haugesund og Trondheim.

Om stillingen

Har du erfaring med måleverktøy for bruk i produksjon, eller ved kontrollavdelinger for industrikunder? Til vår avdeling på Kongsberg søker vi Kalibreringstekniker - Dimensjonskontrollør. Dette er en spennende stilling i et av landets ledende tekniske fagmiljøer.

Kiwa er en ledende leverandør av kalibrering i Norge, og er akkreditert i henhold til ISO 17025 for å utføre kalibrering iht akkrediteringsbevis CAL 007. Våre kunder stiller stadig økende krav til nøyaktighet, presisjon og rask levering innenfor dette viktige området.

Kiwa har, som uavhengig tredjepart, vært kjent for å utføre korrekte målinger til industrien i mer enn 30 år. I tillegg til våre laboratorier i Oslo, Kongsberg og Bergen, har vi også mobile laboratorier på veien hele året, som gjør det mulig å levere kalibreringstjenester on-site.

 Arbeidsoppgaver 
 Kalibrering av måleverktøy etter tekniske tegninger 
 Utstrakt kundekontakt

 Prosjektarbeid mot kunder, verifikasjon av prototyper o.l

 Personlige egenskaper

 Strukturert

name_location: AutoStore™ · Vindafjord, Rogaland, Norway Reposted  1 week ago  · 49 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Summer internship 2024 – HR 

Ready for an engaging opportunity that can launch your career with a Cube Storage Pioneer?

We are looking for highly engaged and self-driven students across different disciplines and locations for next year’s AutoStore Summer Internship.

The internship will generally take place in June 2024 and runs for a six-week period, until mid-August. During this period you will spend time with other interns and supervisors, and not only be surrounded by a social and fun environment, but also gain relevant work experience within a unique, multidisciplinary company.

In this specific summer internship, you will become a part of the HR department in either our office in Lysaker, or at our HQ in Nedre Vats, and get to work with a variety of HR-related tasks, such as sourcing for candidates, working to improve our ATS, develop templates, as well as following up other existing summer interns throughout the summer.

For summer interns who will work out of our HQ in Nedre Vats, we will be able to provide housing throughout the summer.

Show your interest by submitting your CV and diplomas by October 31st via our online recruitment system. The screening process may potentially take some time depending on volume and when the application is sent, but our goal is to provide offers to chosen individuals as quickly as we can, even prior to the deadline. We also aim to notify unsuccessful candidates as soon as possible.

All inquiries are treated confidentially.
