name_location: Kuoni Tumlare · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  4 days ago  · 35 applicants
job_description:
About the job
About Kuoni Tumlare

At Kuoni Tumlare, we deliver truly inspiring and innovative solutions and experiences that create value both for our Partners and Society at large. Our wide portfolio of products and solutions is built on 100+ years of destination management experience.

Our solutions include series tours, technical visits, educational tours, Japanspecialist travel consulting, as well as meetings, incentives, conferences, and exhibitions. Our product portfolio includes MyBus excursions at destinations as well as guaranteed departure tours devised and delivered by our Seat-in-Coach specialists, Europamundo (EMV) and MyBus Landcruise.

We cater to a wide range of customer needs in close collaboration with our trusted suppliers and powered by our team of destinations experts - enabling us to make a real difference to the world.

About The Function

Our Destination Management services form the core of our business. Together with our destination experts, our sales and account management teams generate business by partnering with our customers (Tour Operators, Travel Agencies) to shape exciting itineraries suited to their traveler’s needs. We take care of everything from ground support, hotel bookings, sightseeing, restaurants, and local guides; all while providing 24/7 customer support so that travelers from over 50 countries can enjoy memorable travel experiences worry free.

About The Role

The purpose of the function “Operations Coordinator” is to be responsible not only for land service bookings such as restaurants, guides, local coaches, special requests etc., but also to coordinate the tour as a whole and ensure timely confirmations within budget and high level of operational quality.

Contract type: Permanent contract

Start date: as soon as possible

Key Responsibilities:

Operating tours across Norway
Tour planning including revenue control and efficient supplier choosing for series and single groups
Preparing series and ad-hoc tours itineraries according to sales requirements, destination specifics, budget and supplier conditions
Preparing and confirming bookings for all ground services supplier categories, special arrangements for all types of tours and series tours
Establishing and keeping a good relationship with all suppliers and sales offices
Handling last minute changes when group is on the road as well as emergency cases/calls reported by tour leader or sales office
Handling customer service for own region and supporting other regions when needed


To Succeed in the Role, You Should Have:

Fluency in English, Norwegian language skills are an advantage


We Are Looking for a Person With:

Extended destination knowledge of Norway and Nordic countries
Experience in DMC/incoming/ground handling operations
Experience in Customer Service operations
Experience in working with tourism product development and/or marketing
Knowledge of source markets (Asian, European or American)
self-motivated and passionate about delivering quality customer service to our clients
Highly detail orientated, able to keep deadlines and work under pressure
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Revenue focused and driven to achieve targets


What We Offer:

Interesting and variable full time office job (hybrid working possibility)
Fun and supportive international team across Nordic countries
Different training and self-development activities
Career development possibilities

job_title: Barception 80% Nattevakt Midlertidig - Comfort Hotel Børsparken
name_location: Strawberry (formerly Nordic Choice Hotels) · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We’re Comfort Hotel® – a hotel chain that promises to give our guests what they need, and skip the unnecessary. We have great locations, urban design and we’re offering selected services, but the service we give is great. We aim to be Easy on the wallet, have Easy access, be Easy to enjoy and last but definitely not least – be Easy on the planet. Comfort Hotel® is part of Strawberry.

Comfort Hotel Børsparken "Norges Viktigste Hotell" søker etter en Barception ansatt til en 80% stillig midlertidig - er det deg?

Hvem er vi? Jo nå skal du høre.

Comfort Hotel® er en hotellkjede der vi gir våre gjester det de trenger, og skipper det unødige. Vi har sentral beliggenhet, urbane hotellrom, sosiale rom å trives i, barceptions, rooftops OG miljøfokus. Alt dette pakket inn i en beskjeden prislapp.

Comfort Hotel Børsparken har sentral beliggenhet 300m fra Oslo S. Hotellet har 248 hotellrom, Æra Fitness (hotellets gym), fresh frokost, stor lobby tilpasset co-working og ikke minst en barception. Vår barception er hotellets midtpunkt. Her sjekker vi inn og ut gjester, er sosiale, skjenker øl, lager en drink eller serverer noe å spise fra vår Deli,

Hvorfor Norges Viktigste Hotell?

I tillegg til å være et helt ordinært hotell fungerer Comfort Hotel Børsparken som et verktøy for mennesker som trenger veiledning, kunnskap og erfaring på veien til fast arbeid i et inkluderende arbeidsliv. Sammen med OsloKollega hjelper vi mennesker som har falt utenfor det ordinære arbeidslivet og har derfor flere ansatte på arbeidstrening hos oss til en hver tid. Med hjelp fra våre gjester og egne ansatte gir vi dem verktøyene og erfaringene som trengs for å komme tilbake i arbeidslivet.

"Resepsjonist 80% Nattevakt" høres gøyalt ut, men hva innebærer det?

Din primære oppgave er å ta imot gjestene som kommer sent til hotellet. Mens alle andre sover er du den som legger grunnlaget for dine kollegers kommende arbeidsdag ved å administrere arbeidsoppgaver. Selvstendighet er ditt fornavn. Som nattugle er det ikke mange andre som er våken når du jobber, noe som innebærer at du må ta mange beslutninger selv. Ved å ha en god evne til å prioritere og være fleksibel er du ikke bare hotellets ansikt utad på natten, du er også alles trygge punkt når det kommer til brann og sikkerhet. Stillingen innebærer turnus 7/7 en uke på og en uke av. Du rapporterer direkte til resepsjonssjefen på hotellet. Tiltredelse etter avtale.

Om deg:

Du har en varm og omtenksom personlighet.

Du synes det er gøy å småprate med både store og små, og å gjøre noens dag (og natt) litt bedre med små midler.

Blant dine venner er du kjent for å alltid gi de beste gavene, nettopp fordi du ser hva andre mennesker vil ha og trenger. Ofte før de vet det selv.

Du er en naturlig inspiratør som motiverer mennesker rundt deg bare ved å være deg selv.

Du ser det store i det lille og har sans for detaljer.

Du forstår at salg = service og sammen oppnår vi våre satte mål.

Du er selvstendig og fleksibel og liker høyt tempo.

Du er flytende i både tale og skrift på norsk as well as in English for å kunne møte alle våre gjester på et så personlig nivå som mulig.

Du kan ta raske beslutninger når det kreves.

Du har gode datakunnskaper eller er ivrig etter å lære deg akkurat dette.

Ettersom stillingen innebærer alkoholservering må du ha fylt 20 år.

Hovedoppgavene dine vil være blandt annet:

 Inn- og utsjekk
 Håndtering av booking via mail, telefon samt ansikt til ansikt.
 Salg og servering av snacks og alkoholfri/alkoholholdig drikke i Barception
 Kommunisere med andre avdelinger på hotellet i forberedelser til dagens ankomster
 Sørg for at gjestene trives og ønsker at komme tilbake

Hvem er drømmekandidaten vår? 

Du har erfaring fra bransjen - gjerne fra hotell, resepsjon, bar eller cafe/restaurant (dette er ikke et must)

Du er glad i å snakke med mennesker (pluss i boka for godt humør)

Du er pålitelig og liker å ta ansvar

Du er selvstendig

Du liker å holde deg oppdatert på hva som skjer i byen din og trives i sosiale settinger

Du forstår et skandinavisk språk og kan formulere deg skriftlig på norsk, svensk eller dansk

Arbeidstid 23:00-07:00,hotellet er åpent 24 timer i døgnet med tre hovedskift i Barception; dag, kveld og natt. Denne stillingen vil hovedsakelig jobbe (Natt)

Oppstart: Slutten av November

Varighet: Til Oktober 2024

Føler du dette er en perfekt match? Send din søkned nå.

Vi kaller inn kandidater til en prat fortløpende i perioden stillingen er ute.

name_location: Ampstek · Vestfold og Telemark, Norway  3 months ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Kindly share your CV to rebecca.p@ampstek.com

Permanent role

Onsite

Norwegian fluent is mandatory

Job Description

Is structured, solution-oriented, thorough and has a good level of service.

Take part in developing and digitizing the payroll processes.

Has education in payroll administration and/or many years of experience working in payroll

Overall Tasks

In-depth knowledge of Norwegian payroll processes and associated processes.
Responsible for all aspects of payroll, including execution, reporting, analysis and
control

Some Of The Expected Salary Tasks
Check that the periods are ready for payroll processing, obtain tax cards (new
employees), advance payments, final settlement, collection, salary calculation,

reimbursements and sick pay including reimbursement, etc
Registration of payroll data and maintenance of personnel data, working with HR
team to ensure that employee data is correct
Reconcile salaries against accounts
Understand time registration systems and the integration with the payroll system
Previous experience with collective agreements and their implications for pay
processes
Ensure compliance with the company's guidelines and collective agreements
Understand time registration systems and the integration with payroll
Previous experience with tariff agreements and their implications on payroll
processes
Ensure compliance with company policies and union agreements
Understand payroll system and integrations (currently using Aditro, moving to cloud-based

system G7 effective Q1, 2023)

Reporting to authorities and collection of statistics within the group.

In the role, you will help develop and streamline payroll processes, become familiar with

guidelines, process descriptions and new updates in payroll.

Accurate and structured

Good IT and excel skills

Knowledge of laws and regulations relating to Norwegian wages

Ability to prioritize and plan ahead to meet strict deadlines

Ability to proactively investigate and resolve issues related to payroll processes. Keep up-to-

date on current laws and agreements

We see it as advantageous if you have experience with the planning system Optima and

knowledge of Aditro/SD Works.

We have approximately 5,000 employees and have 16 different collective agreements

name_location: Jefferson Frank · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 months ago  · 24 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Position: Backend (Golang) Software Engineer

Location: Oslo

As a Backend Software Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, deploying, and maintaining the backend of our software applications. You will work closely with our frontend developers, data scientists, and product owners to build scalable and robust systems that support our customers' needs for years to come.

Responsibilities
 Optimise and scale our systems to support increasing traffic and data volume
 Design, develop, and maintain the backend of our SaaS products using Golang and Python
 Collaborate with frontend developers to ensure seamless integration of front and backend systems
 Work with data scientists to integrate machine learning algorithms and analytics into our products
 Write clean, efficient, and reusable code, adhering to software development best practices
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure timely delivery of high-quality software products
Qualifications
 Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field
 3+ years of experience in software development, with a focus on Golang backend development
 Strong understanding of software design principles
 Experience with databases such as PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and Redis
 Experience with cloud technologies such as AWS
 Familiarity with containerisation technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes
 Excellent communication and collaboration skills
If you are passionate about green technology and want to make a positive impact on the environment through innovative software solutions, we encourage you to apply. In addition to a competitive salary and benefits package, we offer a dynamic and collaborative work environment with opportunities for professional growth and development.

To learn more or to get involved with the process, please contact Dylan Johnston on:

d.johnston1@jeffersonfrank.com

or on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/dylan-johnston-666707130/

name_location: Ascom · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  1 month ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
We are…
Ascom is a global solutions provider focused on Healthcare ICT and mobile workflow solutions. Headquartered in Switzerland, our business spans across 18 countries, and has been supporting the healthcare industry for 160 years by providing them with technology to enable them to support their communities.
Our systems are used in over 12,000 hospitals worldwide and handle more than 800 million alerts each year (over 2 million alerts a day!). Our solutions positively impact the lives of everyone who visits 1 of the hospitals or care-homes we work with. 
Together we can make a difference in the lives of the people who benefit from our technology.

As a Solutions Architect in the customer team, you will work tight with sales and service representatives to realize the solutions requested by the customer. As Solutions Architect, you will lead, facilitate, analyze, and design tasks required to develop the customer solution architecture and ensure all parties leverage it.

We love to give YOU…
a real-world, first-hand experience about what it’s like to work with high-end technology at the forefront of the healthcare industry.
an opportunity to help our healthcare customers save patients' lives and improve our community with new technology and professionalism

   Your days will be filled with…
  Active collaboration and participation within the customer team.
Finding suitable solutions for our customers based on Ascom's portfolio together with the solutions team through close collaboration with the customer and partners to understand their needs and challenges.
Creating long- and short-term plans for the individual customer's solutions and providing support and advice for developing the technical platforms.
Produce written specifications (i.e., Ascom configuration) to capture business process requirements for proposed standard solutions and configuration activities.
Ensure a clear understanding of customers' technology requirements; support sales and services teams; provide technical leadership and vision to win and deliver large-scale, complex solutions.
  Qualifications and Experience
A technical education on an MSc level or similar
In-depth knowledge and understanding of the wireless communication sector and the ability to understand technical system configurations.
In-depth knowledge and understanding of modern healthcare IT environments and medical device connectivity.
Proven experience in a direct sales set-up and supporting a sales force.
Excellent knowledge of Norwegian and English languages in both speech and writing
Strong and confident customer-facing / consulting skills.

  Personal skills
To be successful in this role, we believe that beyond proven technical skills, you have the following abilities:
Strong analytical & problem-solving skills.
Excellent communicator, both verbally and in writing
Ability to understand business requirements and convert them into solution designs.
Ability to adapt to new methods and work under tight deadlines.
Successful working independently and as part of a team, especially within a fast-paced matrix environment.
Able to handle multiple priorities in a fast-moving environment
Collaborative and skilled at networking.
Excellent customer management skills

Why should you work with us? 
We offer more than just a job at Ascom, we offer a career with real benefits which include: 
Flexible hybrid work environment.
Professional development with our global Learning & Development team as well as localized internal and external training opportunities.
Opportunities to work with various teams around the world and chance to work on projects in other countries in addition to your home (role dependent).
Supporting career agility through internal mobility.
Working with high-quality medical technology in the healthcare space.

name_location: KONGSBERG · Kongsberg, Viken, Norway  6 days ago  · 7 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Er du ute etter en trygg arbeidsplass med lang jobbhorisont, personlig utvikling, kompetanseheving og er utdannet Ingeniør/Master innenfor mekatronikk, Elektro eller Mekanikk? Da har vi en interessant jobb til deg!

Vi er en utviklingsavdeling hvor vi designer og skaper nye produkter, og jobber med teknologi i dagens marked. Er du den personen som liker å skape nye ideer og utvikle nye produkter, og har kompetanse innen faggruppene elektro, elektromekanisk eller mekanisk design? Da er det bare å søke. Litt av arbeidshverdagen går ut på å designe mekaniske komponenter i 3D plan/modulering, og lage tegninger av kabler både skjematisk og i form av ASSY tegninger og BOM. Dette for å få riktig grensesnitt mellom komponentene. Ellers er vi en avdeling med gode kollegaer, gode jobbutsikter og en trygg og god organisasjon å jobbe i med mange muligheter. I KDA blir du tatt inn i varmen, og vil bli en del av et spennende utviklingsmiljø og mulighet for personlig utvikling er tilstede.

Vi søker etter medarbeidere med sterk interesse for elektro, mekatronikk (el-mekk) eller mekanikk.

Du vil jobbe på spennende og varierte prosjekter i tett samarbeid med andre disipliner. Vi søker nå etter ingeniører som kan styrke vår avdeling innenfor elektromekanisk design. Som utvikler innen fagfeltet elektromekanikk vil du være med på å utvikle kompleks kabling/hardwareløsninger fra konsept, detalj design, produksjon til levert produkt.

Hos oss får du muligheten til å være en del av et høykompetent teknisk miljø som består av flere tusen ingeniører i Kongsberg Teknologipark.

Arbeidsoppgavene Er Varierte Og Består Av

Utvikling, design og oppfølging av underleverandører av elektromekaniske komponenter og harness design.
Utarbeidelse av 3D-modeller, 2D produksjonstegninger, Wiring diagrams(WD), Parts lister (BOM) og Assemblies(ASSY) tegninger.
Delta i prosjektenes tverrfaglige team sammen med elektronikk, mekanikk, test, system, produksjon, CM, QA etc.
Bidra til å utvikle mekatronikk Fagmiljøet mht utviklingsverktøy, prosesser og metodikk.

Vi ser for oss at du har kjenner deg igjen i noen av punktene under:

Relevant utdanning fra fagskole, Bachelor eller Master. Søkere med lengre erfaring som elektromekanisk/elektro konstruktør/Designer vil også bli vurdert.
Nyutdannede fra fagskole/bachelor/master innen fagfeltet oppfordres til å søke.
Kjennskap/ønske om å jobbe med Design og konstruksjon med verktøy som E3-kablingsverktøy, 3D verktøy som for eksempel Catia eller Solid Works.
Gode kunnskaper i norsk og engelsk, både skriftlig og muntlig.
Analog/Power elektronikk.
Digital elektronikk.
Testsystemer.
EMC design.

Personlige Egenskaper

Gode kommunikasjons- og samarbeidsevner.
God teknisk forståelse.
Gode holdninger generelt og til faget.
Evne til å se og ta frem løsninger på problemer ifm eksisterende produkter eller ved ny design ut fra et kravsett.
Må kunne håndtere og jobbe tett i et team men også selvstendig.
Like/Evne/Ønske å dele og ta imot kunnskap med andre.

Kandidater som søker på stillingen vil i forbindelse med rekrutteringsprosessen bli gjenstand for bakgrunnssjekk og vurdering av denne vil bli lagt til grunn ved valg av kandidat.

For å være aktuell kandidat til stillingen må du kunne sikkerhetsklareres og autoriseres, jfr. Sikkerhetsloven.

Søknader behandles fortløpende, så ikke vent med å søke!

Missile Systems er en divisjon i Kongsberg Defence and Aerospace (KDA), som er et forretningsområde i Kongsberg Gruppen. Missile System sine hovedprodukter er avanserte missiler som Naval Strike Missile (NSM) og Joint Strike Missile (JSM). Vi utvikler og leverer missiler.

name_location: futureproof consulting · Arendal, Agder, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 3 applicants
NTE · Trøndelag, Norway  6 days ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
NTE Telekom skal vokse til 100 000 kunder innen 2025 ved å tilby kundene digitale kommunikasjons - og underholdningstjenester basert på fiberteknologi i verdensklasse, forbedre operasjon og utvikle nye tjenester som skal leveres over vår fiberinfrastruktur.

Vi søker derfor en Systemingeniør som ønsker å bli en del av et svært kompetent fagmiljø i kraftig vekst, og som vil være en sterk bidragsyter til at kundene er fornøyde og at avdelingen når sine mål. Du vil få ansvar for sikker drift av forretningskritiske løsninger med tilhørende integrasjoner, samt drift og overvåkning av XaaS-tjenester, servere og systemer.

Kan du identifisere deg med våre verdier; Åpen – Nær - Pålitelig? Er du en lagspiller som verdsetter og bidrar til godt samarbeid og som går «all in» for å være en god ambassadør for NTE? Da er du kanskje den rette for denne stillingen. Ta gjerne en uforpliktende samtale med Thomas Vådahl eller send inn en søknad.

Sentrale arbeidsoppgaver

Administrere og dokumentere tjenester, servere og systemer gjennom deres livssyklus 
Design, utvikling og levering av løsninger i private og hybride skyløsninger
Forbedre drift og overvåkning av skybaserte tjenester, virtualiseringsløsninger og containere i privat og hybrid sky
Sørge for at alle tjenester og løsninger leveres med størst mulig grad av ytelse, skalerbarhet, sikkerhet, pålitelighet og mulighet for gjenbruk
Samarbeide med kunder og partnere om automatisering av migrering til og fra skybaserte miljøer
Samarbeide med interne ressurser og kunder for å sikre at tjenesteleveranser, prosesser og dokumentasjon oppfyller interne og eksterne SLA-krav
Utføre tredjelinje support på systemer og tjenester
Være pådriver for koordinering mellom drift og utvikling
Sørge for at fysiske installasjoner blir vedlikeholdt og holdes ryddig
Sørge for god dokumentasjon av hendelser, henvendelser, system og gjøremål

Kvalifikasjoner vi vektlegger

Relevant høyere utdanning. Relevant erfaring kan kompensere for utdanningskravet
Gode analytiske egenskaper
Spisskompetanse på ett eller flere av følgende områder teller positivt:
virtualiseringsløsninger og teknologier for virtualisering
nettverk, internettprotokoller, scripting og overvåkning
sikkerhets- og backupløsninger for virtualisering, herunder disaster recovery
Erfaring med ett eller flere av følgende områder er et pluss:
HA-løsninger mellom DC
skytjenester, DevOps og/eller Infrastructure-as-a-Code
automasjon og konfigurasjonsstyring som f.eks. Ansible, Saltstack eller lignende
Kjennskap til telekom-nettverk, fortrinnsvis basert på fiber

Personlige egenskaper vi verdsetter

Du er inkluderende og serviceinnstilt
Du er krativ og tenker utenfor boksen når det trengs
Du er løsningsorientert og god på kundedialog
Du trives både med å jobbe selvstendig og som en del av et samarbeidende team
Du har en systematisk tilnærming til arbeidet og utfører oppgaver grundig og presist
Du evner å prioritere oppgaver selv når det er travle tider

Hvorfor skal du velge oss?

Konkurransedyktige lønnsbetingelser som belønner din kompetanse og innsats 
Et stort spekter av spennende arbeidsoppgaver som vil utfordre og utvikle din kompetanse i et av Trøndelags største konsern 
Fleksibel arbeidstid, med mulighet for å jobbe fra hjemmekontor 
Mulighet for kompetanseheving i retning ønsket karrierevei 
Solide pensjons- og forsikringsordninger som blant annet gir deg rask og enkel tilgang til behandling for fysiske og psykiske helseproblem 
En raus og fleksibel arbeidsgiver som tar godt vare på deg gjennom hele din karriere 
Et aktivt bedriftsidrettslag og gode aktivitetstilbud 
Firmahytter i Åre og Abelvær 
Sosiale og faglige aktiviteter gjennom “Ung i NTE” for ansatte under 36 år

I NTE tror vi at det beste samspillet oppstår når vi deler kunnskap og erfaringer med hverandre. Vi ønsker deg velkommen til å søke hos oss uansett bakgrunn, alder, nasjonalitet, legning, kjønn eller funksjonsnivå.

name_location: CVX Ventures · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 day ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment where you have the opportunity to become the best? Do you want to be a part of an extraordinary entrepreneurial team with young, motivated, and extremely driven individuals? And are you curious about or passionate about sales? If so, you might be our next member of the sales team at CVX Ventures Norway.

About Us

CVX is building Scandinavia's leading venture investor. We invest in carefully selected growth companies in collaboration with more than 600 active angel investors, board members, and entrepreneurs, and we have already helped around 100 companies grow by providing capital, knowledge, and networking.

Your Responsibilities

Your primary task will be to excel at selling partners on CVX, which involves:

Reaching out to and converting potential investors and board members into paying customers. Closing sales over the phone, online, or through in-person meetings.

What We Offer You

As a member of our sales team, you have the opportunity to help build Scandinavia's leading venture investor. In this role, you will develop your skills and leadership abilities through projects and coaching within the Scandinavian venture environment. You will become part of a company with high team spirit and ambitious colleagues and to ensure a continuous growth curve, we offer you:

Operational experience in a rapidly growing company, where both your work and results are very tangible and truly matter to the company. 
The opportunity to work closely with our Sales Director on sales and strategy. 
Unlimited growth potential within our company - we strongly believe in and have a track record of internal promotions. 
The opportunity to build a strong relationship with the top of the Norwegian business community. 
A unique insight into venture investments, the latest trends and technology, and the work of scaling companies. 

What We Expect From You

You have an unparalleled work ethic with a high sense of urgency. You have tremendous drive and a desire to be the very best at what you do. You take ownership of everything you do, are proactive, and conscientious. Additionally, you are humble, and you share our passion for building new businesses. We expect that you:

Have 2+ years of experience with excellent performance in sponsor sales, media sales, B2B, or B2C sales. 
Have EU work authorization
Are fluent in both Norwegian and English, both in writing and speaking
Are an excellent communicator, especially verbally
Love building and nurturing relationships
Have a natural ability to make people feel comfortable around you. 

Start Date

As soon as possible.

name_location: Tibber · Førde, Vestland, Norway  1 month ago  · 25 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Tibber is the first fully digital energy company in the world. We are also the only energy company with the mission to reduce the residential energy consumption in Europe by 20%, and let all homes use energy in a sustainable way. We are constantly challenging the dinosaurs in the market by use of new technology and fresh ideas. 
We have tens of thousands connected electric cars, heat pumps and smart home devices that the Tibber platform controls for our customers in order to optimize, and reduce their consumption and cost. We not only believe that we’re the digital energy company of the future, we are the energy company of today.
 
What the role entails 
 Tibber works in the area of IoT and we produce some of our own hardware from scratch which is what you would get to do here. One of our most appreciated products in this area is Tibber Pulse which can be used as a complement to the Tibber app. This lets you track your electricity usage in real-time, and tells you what you can do to lower it, which benefits the environment as well as your wallet. You will be building firmware in products like Pulse and Homevolt, using languages such as C, C++, and Python and you will program in RTOS frameworks for ESP32 and Silicon Labs. In other words, this position offers you to get deeper into the exciting field of IoT.

This is you! 
You wish to thrive with us as a team, as well as in your work role. We believe that you’re truly passionate about firmware development, IoT, and doing something for a greater cause. You have already worked several years with development and you're experienced in embedded languages, for example, C and C++, and you have preferably professional experience with RTOS. 

As a person, you're self-going, communicative, and not afraid to speak your mind. The team you would belong to is small and your opinions will matter and be highly appreciated. We consider it meritorious if you have experience from a startup environment, and if you're already familiar with our product.
Tibber Culture
The Tibber team is growing in a fast pace! Our offices are located in Stockholm, Helsinki, Berlin and Førde. For us it is not an issue being in different workspaces physically, we are always connected through live streaming screens. Annually though, we do gather the work force physically doing a pop-up office – to work, explore a new city and spend time together. 
We work passionately with sustainability and a circular approach, both with our own products and in the entire ecosystem that is affected with everything we do.
Aside from making the world a better place within serious matters as green energy and sustainability, we are playful as well! Take a closer look at our own product Tibber Pulse, and you’ll find both Han Solo, Chewbacca and our names on the PCB. We know, it might be looked upon as both nerdy and cheesy – but we love it! We have a  “no shoe” policy at the office which enhance the feeling of coming home, but also result in a great opportunity when it comes to showing off your slipper fashion range. We believe creative people work better without shoes. The well known facts that all people are different, and far from everyone is a morning person – are the very reasons why we work with flexible work hours. 
We are very proud of being a mission driven startup with thousands and thousands of new users every month. The majority of our investors are proudly represented by Tibber employees, Silicon Valley based Founders Fund, the entrepreneur Petter Stordalen – and more. 
Join our Tibber Tribe, it will be an adventure!

job_title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning/AI Expert & Startup Founder
name_location: Antler · Oslo, Norway  2 days ago  · 5 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Note: This ad is not for a job, but rather for the opportunity to build your own VC-backed startup!

Are you an experienced Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer with a passion to make sense of large data sets that transform entire businesses? Do you often find yourself on the hunt for rich data sources and don’t shy away from large quantities of formless data? On top of that, do you want to take ownership of your own creations and are looking to build your next tech venture from scratch? You’ve come to the right place!

Who are we?
At Antler, we lower the barriers to entrepreneurship by giving you the necessary support to find the right co-founder, test and validate your idea, and by providing funding from day one so that you can build a truly global company. We are a global early-stage venture capital firm that invests in the defining companies of tomorrow to fundamentally improve the world with groundbreaking technologies. Our six-month platform brings together experienced and driven professionals from diverse backgrounds to build strong teams and launch their own companies. We are present in 25 locations worldwide, have supported 5000+ founders through our platforms, invested in 750+ startups, and received over 80,000+ applications.

About you
For our upcoming cohort in February 2024, we are looking for Data Scientists and ML/AI Leads who want to build the next disruptive tech venture from scratch! Data Scientists and ML/AI Leads joining our platform plays an instrumental role as Co-founders, mainly being responsible for the tech/product side of the business, which requires that you:

identify as someone with deep expertise in data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence or product development
have strong analytical skills with hands-on experience in conducting technological analyses and applying advanced analytics & Machine Learning methodologies
can execute data collection plans from both structured and unstructured sources that help in data exploration, hypothesis testing and statistical modeling
can design, develop, and implement models, proofs-of-concept and pre-product prototypes
have experience leading a team and maintaining an organized oversight of specific product delivery schedules
might have an idea (optional) that will solve a problem that you’re passionate about, but you do not want to do it on your own. You understand that you need co-pilots who share your vision and values

Cohort starts: February 12th, 2024
Duration: 12 weeks
Location: Onsite in Oslo
Type: Full-time commitment

Recruitment Process
The full application process takes about 2-3 weeks to complete. Once you apply, our scouting team will guide you through the full process and will be available to answer all your questions.

The interview process follows these principles:
Apply on our website
Intro & Drive Interview
Partner Interview
Offer to join Antler!

Compensation
This program is not paid; however, it offers the potential for you to receive a pre-seed investment at the end of the 12-week program, helping you kickstart your startup journey. Please note that we do not offer visa sponsorship for this opportunity.

Antler Highlights:
Some examples of successful companies that were built as a result of Antler’s program, received pre-seed investment from Antler, and have gone on to raise substantial investment are as follows:
Treyd - a buy-now-pay-later service for supplier invoices
Evyon - planet-friendly battery energy storage system
Glint Solar - software for identifying the best solar sites faster
Modoyo - competitive gaming services focusing on inclusivity and community

Apply now to stop dreaming and start building!

name_location: EIK Servering · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 21 applicants
job_description:
About the job
EIK Servering er et norsk selskap som har tatt restaurant- og serveringsbransjen med storm de siste to årene. Vi har blitt et av Norges største selskap innenfor bransjen, og vi fortsetter å vokse og ekspandere.

Hei der! Er du en person som elsker å spre glede og gode vibber? Hvis ja, så kan vi ha den perfekte jobben for deg - som bartender på våre fantastiske barer og restauranter! Vi trenger flere servicehelter som kan stille opp ekstra når det trengs, og med vår praktiske jobb-app 📲 kan du til og med velge dine egne arbeidstider. Så uansett om du vil jobbe når solen skinner eller når månen er full, vil du finne en tid som passer for deg.

Og det beste av alt? Du vil få betalt for å spre glede og servere deilige drinker til våre gjester! Hvis du vil bli en del av vårt service-superhelt-team og samtidig tjene litt ekstra penger, så søk nå og bli med på eventyret!

Arbeidsoppgaver

Servere gjester
Holde baren ren og innbydende
Rydding underveis
Kasse/stenging

Egenskaper

Ryddig, punktlig, fleksibel og med godt humør
Ha en positiv innstilling og være utadvendt
Er ryddig og strukturert
Teamplayer
Du liker at det er høy fart og jobber godt under press

Kvalifikasjoner

Erfaring som cocktailbartender er et pluss
Over 20 år
Kommunisere godt på norsk og/eller engelsk

Vi tilbyr

Sosial arbeidsplass med hyggelige kollegaer
Godt arbeidsmiljø

Du får en lenke til en 10-15 minutters digital intervju med roboten Hubert når du søker stillingen. Formålet er å sikre like vurderinger av alle kandidater, uavhengig av kjønn, alder og etnisitet. Svar gjerne innen 48-72 timer, og om du blir aktuell, vil en rekrutterer kontakte deg for en andre intervju. Vi ser frem til å høre fra deg!

Om arbeidsgiveren

EIK Servering står for driften av Alf Nabolagsbar, Brutus, Brød & Sirkus, Bølgen & Moi (Bodø, Gimle, Stavanger, Tjuvholmen), Delicatessen (Aker Brygge, Bodø, Fredrikstad, Grunerløkka, Majorstuen, Tromsø), Der Peppern Gror (Bogstadveien, Rådhusplassen), Dobbel, Felix, Fyrhuset Kuba, Handwerk Botaniske, Hitchhiker, Hrimnir ramen, Katla, Metz, Opland Burger & Steak, Sagene Lunsjbar, Sentralen Kafe, Sentralen Restaurant, Smalhans,The Golden Chimp, The Golden Chimp VIA, Utendørs, Uvisst, Vega Snackbar, Vineria Ventitude og Østbanehagen. Felles for alle disse unike stedene er ønsket om å være nyskapende og bærekraftige i det vi gjør best: Å skape gode matopplevelser – og tilby noe nytt og givende for kundene, og lokalsamfunnet vi befinner oss i. Bli med på matreisen. Velkommen til oss!

name_location: Enode · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 207 applicants
job_description:
About the job
About Enode

Do you want to join a fast-growing climate tech startup with real impact?

At Enode, our mission is to accelerate the energy transition 🌍️

A fully renewable energy system is dependent on flexible demand that can adapt to the intermittent supply from wind and solar. To create this flexibility, we need to connect to and control the fast-growing demand coming from electric vehicles, heat pumps and other energy hardware.

This is what we’re doing at Enode. Our APIs power the next generation of green energy apps, reaching more than 60 million consumers worldwide.

We are backed by some of the best climate tech investors in the world, including Y Combinator, Lowercarbon Capital and Creandum. We already have a global presence with customers in 11 countries across Europe, US and APAC.

Yet, we’re still at the start of our journey, and we want exceptional people to join us!

If you want to learn more about Enode, click here.

What we're looking for

Enode is looking for a Senior or Staff level Backend Engineer to help bring the Enode API to even more customers and end-users. We are looking for compassionate engineers excited by leading projects setting technical direction, and mentoring those around them. In addition, we are looking for engineers motivated by creating impact for our customers, growing together as a team, shipping MVPs, and leaving things better than we found them.

You'll work mainly with a codebase written in Typescript and will work with React, Node, AWS, Docker, SQL (PostgreSQL), CDK/Cloudformation.

You must be located between UTC+3 and UTC-2.

You have
A passion for building products with high impact on the forefront of the green shift. 
The capabilities to work across the entire stack when needed and collaborate with Product & Design to set the long-term technical direction for new & existing products. 
Five+ years of production experience, core fundamentals, and a strong command of at least one language
Problem-solving. Our work frequently involves applying unusual ideas; you aren't hesitant to investigate new fields when tried approaches don't work, go over minute details, or look for non-engineering solutions to problems. 

Nice to have
Experience growing a new team or product, and are excited about helping make a great team environment. 

What we offer
A stimulating, fun and caring work environment with high drive and ambition
Opportunity to join an early-stage climate tech startup with global aspirations
Competitive compensation, including a very attractive employee option program
A remote-first setup. We also have an office in Oslo if you want to work from there
Stipend for setting up your home office / co-working space
Regular offsites with the team in various exciting locations (we went to Italy 🇮🇹 earlier this year). 

Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

name_location: Nordic Retail Group · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Nordic Retail Group leter etter ambassadører for en av våre kunder. Vi ser etter gode ambassadører som er serviceinnstilte og har en stor interesse for biler. Som ambassadør vil du sammen med sluttkundene test-kjøre kundens biler.

Om kunden

Amerikansk bilfirma som ble lansert i 2016. Grunnleggende filosofi om å kombinere tidløs design og mesterlig håndverk med teknologi i verdensklasse som inspirerer hvert eneste kjøretøy deres designere og ingeniører bringer til live. Deres oppdrag er å skape verdens mest bærekraftige kjøretøyer. Deres biler bruker mindre, bruker bedre og bruker på nytt. Ekte innovasjon ligger til grunn for alt de gjør. Uansett hva de lager – hvert eneste design, funksjon og teknologi – er de lidenskapelig drevet av å gjøre ting bedre.

Arbeidsoppgaver

Være superbruker av kundens biler (opplæring gis)
Test-kjøre biler sammen med kunder

Hvem er du?

Du har en stor interesse for biler
Du er en sosial og utadvendt person
Du er serviceinnstilt og målrettet
Du er fleksibel og liker å prøve nye ting
Førerkortklasse B er et krav

Annet

Rekrutteringen foregår omgående så send inn din søknad i dag. Hvis du har noe spørsmål angående annonsen, kontakt Sara Fooladi på: fooladi@nordicretailgroup.com

Under dette oppdraget vil du bli ansatt av Nordic Retail Group.

Nordic Retail Group

Nordic Retail Group er en fullservice byrå, grunnlagt i 1997 og er representert i alle de fire nordiske landene. Vi fokuserer på å hjelpe kundene våre med å bygge sine merkevarer og nå sine mål ved å tilby bemanning, rekruttering, kreativt studio og innovative tjenester. Vi har bygget et sterkt team og vi vet hva som skal til for at en merkevare skal lykkes i retail, og hvordan vi kan øke salget både lokalt og globalt.

Vi setter stor pris på å ha et mangfoldig team med ulike typer erfaringer og bakgrunn. Det er viktig for oss at alle føler seg verdsatt, anerkjent og som en viktig del av teamet vårt. Viktigst av alt, vi ønsker at våre ansatte skal elske å komme på jobb. Som våre grunnleggere alltid sier: "Du bør ikke bare plystre på vei hjem fra kontoret - men også på vei til kontoret".

Besøk vår hjemmeside www.nordicretailgroup.com for mer informasjon.

name_location: Energy Jobline · Harstad, Troms og Finnmark, Norway  4 days ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
As a summer intern at Equinor, you will join 22,000 colleagues delivering oil, gas, wind, and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. By 2050, we aim to become a net-zero company and provide the energy the world needs without contributing to global warming. It is one of the defining challenges of our time, and attracting and developing the brightest minds will be critical to our success.

The position

Our summer internship is a 6-week programme designed to provide the experience and skills you need in your studies and future career. Our Norwegian and UK internship will begin on 17 June and ends on 02 August 2024, with one week off starting 15 July.

You can find out more about the programme at www.equinor.com/careers/summer-interns

By joining our Operation and maintenance team in EPN (Exploration and Production Norway) you will have the opportunity to:

Perform tasks related to operation and maintenance like analyses to drive improvements within safety, regularity, environmental hazards and cost in order to support Equinor’s improvement agenda.
Participate in maintenance engineering projects
Contribute to develop and standardize deliveries within maintenance engineering in projects and operation.
Participate in maintenance planning and execution
Use digital opportunities and big data to support analysis and challenge or improve existing work processes including development of digital tools as needed.

You

Some Qualities Are Essential For Equinor. You Identify With Our Values, Open, Collaborative, Courageous And Caring, Which Guide Our Decisions And Help Us Succeed And Grow. You Make Safety Your Priority And Contribute To Our Zero-harm Culture. For This Position, We Are Also Looking For

 Cu rrently studying for Bachelor’s, Master’s degree, or Ph.D. with a strong academic record within technical subjects
 Fluent in English and preferably a second working language
 No more than two year s of relevant full-time work experience
 Have c ompleted at least two years of higher education before the internship programme starts (1 7 June 202 4 )
 Have at least one year of higher education left after the internship programme ends (0 2 August 202 4 )
 The interns need to be located in the country where the internship takes place during its entire duration. Equinor does not support any relocation for our summer interns .
 Candidates must have the necessary work permit for the country in which they are applying for a position. The work permits must be valid at the point of application and for the duration of the employment. Please note that Equinor does not support, or sponsor work or visa permits for internship applications. Read more about it on the national authorities’ pages: Norway
 Extracurricular activities and/or voluntary work are an advantag e

Skills

Every role and business area requires its own specific set of skills and personal attributes. Some of the qualities and characteristics we look for include:

 An awareness of risk and a commitment to safety for yourself and those around you.
 Effective communication skills and the ability to facilitate collaboration, influence stakeholders, and contribute to a diverse and inclusive culture.
 The flexibility to adapt to change, embrace new technology , and perform in a digitally enabled environment .
 Demonstrating a curious mind and the ability to problem-solve, innovate, and identify new ways of delivering against our objectives .

Equinor is an equal opportunities employer . We welcome applications from all candidates who meet the educational and experience requirements, including those with disabilities. If you have any specific requirements for any stage in our process, please make this clear in your application , and our team will be happy to support you .

General information

Please make sure that when applying, you attach the following:

 CV/ resume in English
 transcripts of records (or other documents describing subjects and grades) in English or Scandinavian language obtained to this point during your studies. If you are in the process of completing a degree, please upload an official temporary transcript.

Applications submitted without these attachments will unfortunately not be evaluated. To ensure an efficient recruitment process, please be informed that you may apply for a maximum of 3 Summer Internship roles per country.

Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process. Candidates will be asked for information on affiliation to high-risk countries for a security assessment. Furthermore, background checks are performed on all final candidates and all permanent and temporary hires will be screened against relevant sanctions lists to ensure compliance with sanctions law.

name_location: Nigel Frank International · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 11 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Join a Cutting-Edge Scale-Up in Oslo as a Fullstack Developer!

Are you an ambitious Fullstack Developer seeking an exciting opportunity to work with the latest technologies in a dynamic and innovative environment? Look no further! Our client is a modern scale-up company in Oslo and searching for a talented Fullstack Developer with expertise in .NET and React to join their exceptional team.

Why Work with Us?

1 Innovative Environment: Immerse yourself in a fast-paced and forward-thinking atmosphere where creativity and fresh ideas are encouraged.

2 Modern Technology Stack: Utilize your expertise in .NET and React to develop cutting-edge solutions and contribute to the evolution of our products.

3 Exciting Challenges: Tackle complex projects and work on diverse tasks that will keep you engaged and motivated, while continuously expanding your skill set.

4 Collaborative Culture: Join a team of passionate professionals who value teamwork, knowledge sharing, and open communication.

5 Career Growth: Take advantage of excellent opportunities for professional development and advancement within our rapidly growing company.

Responsibilities:

 Design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable web applications using .NET and React.
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, develop efficient solutions, and ensure high-quality deliverables.
 Write clean and maintainable code while following industry best practices and coding standards.
 Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members.

Requirements:

 Proficiency in .NET and React, with a strong understanding of their ecosystems.
 Experience with modern web development frameworks, libraries, and tools.
 Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies and version control systems (e.g., Git).
 Solid understanding of software development principles, patterns, and best practices.
 Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude towards learning and self-improvement.

If you are passionate about leveraging your Fullstack Development skills to drive innovation and contribute to the success of a dynamic scale-up, we want to hear from you!

Please contact Elizabeth Tyler at e.tyler@nigelfrank.com directly with a copy of your up to date CV to apply.

name_location: Manpower Norway · Tromsø, Troms og Finnmark, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
Manpower søker flere barnehageassistenter ved tilkalling til kommunale og private barnehager i Tromsø kommune.

Er du god til å bygge relasjoner og en trygg voksen? Er du nysgjerrig, kreativ, engasjert og har godt humør? Ser etter enten en fulltidsjobb eller en fleksibel jobb på siden av studiet? Da kan dette være noe for deg!

Som barnehageassistent i Manpower vil du få en fleksibel og givende arbeidshverdag i både korte og lengre oppdrag i de ulike barnehagene. Arbeidsoppgaver vil være å legge til rette for og gjennomføre lek og læring, både innendørs og utendørs, du vil bistå med tilberedning og servering av måltider, samt assistere ved på- og avkledning og andre daglige gjøremål.

Kvalifikasjoner

Erfaring fra barnehage/SFO eller annen jobb med barn og mennesker er en fordel, men ikke et krav.
Du har plettfri vandel - Politiattest må fremlegges før oppstart.
Språk: Ved annet morsmål enn norsk eller svensk, må man ha bestått språkkravet som er minimum nivå A2 i skriftlig fremstilling og B1 i leseforståelse, lytteforståelse og muntlig kommunikasjon, i henhold til barnehageloven.

Ønskede egenskaper

Du er glad i barn og sammen med dem er du ivrig og inviterer til lek og aktiviteter.
Du er pålitelig, tålmodig, forståelsesfull og en god rollemodell.
Du er fleksibel og kan stille på kort varsel.
Du tar initiativ, er nysgjerrig og tør å spørre om du lurer på noe.
Du har en stor porsjon humor - sprer glede!
Du tilpasser deg ulike arbeidsmiljøer og mennesker.

Vi tilbyr

Fleksibel arbeidstid.
Egen app for din tilgjengelighet og oppdragsforespørsler.
Mulighet for lengre oppdrag og eventuelt en fast ansettelse på et senere tidspunkt.
Spennende og varierte arbeidsoppgaver.
Lønn etter tariff.

Virker dette som en interessant stilling?

God oppfølging fra konsulent i Manpower som er tilgjengelig for dine henvendelser, og som bistår deg i din utvikling i jobben som barnehageassistent.

Lønn etter gjeldende avtale.

Register deg med en jobbsøkerprofil på www.manpower.no og søk på stillingen der. Ha telefonen tilgjengelig, aktuelle kandidater vil kontaktes fortløpende.

Vi gjør oppmerksom på at vi ikke kan ta imot cv og søknader på e-post.

Klikk deg inn på «søk her»

Vi ser frem til å lese din søknad.

name_location: Stretchgruppen NO · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 3 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Som Atlassian-ekspert i Stretch Addera blir du en del av et team med hjertet på rette stedet, vilje av stål og kunder som tror på styrken i teamarbeid!

Jira Software, Jira Service Management og Confluence, er en stor del av arbeidshverdagen vår.

Stretch Addera er Atlassian Platinumpartner, og konsulentene våre er eksperter på hele produktporteføljen til Atlassian. Produktene er en støtte som gjør at team kan arbeide effektivt og nå sitt fulle potensial. Teamene våre konfigurerer og administrerer Atlassians produkter, slik at kundene kan fokusere på kjernevirksomheten.

Din rolle hos oss

Som Atlassian-ekspert i Stretch Addera blir du en del av et internt team, og i løpet av kort tid også et kundeteam. Vi arbeider nesten utelukkende med teamleveranser til kundene våre, noe som fører til smidig kompetanseutveksling, støtte og mye latter.

Du er med på å levere tjenester i bred skala, som konfigurasjon, oppgradering, ytelsesforbedring, produktekspertise og prosess-/implementeringsstøtte.

Gjennom regelmessige sertifiseringer innen ditt ekspertområde fyller du aktivt på med ny kunnskap og verdi for kundene.

Å arbeide i team og bygge god lagånd er høyt prioritert hos oss. Vi har en flat organisasjonsstruktur der hvert team får ta stort ansvar for ulike oppgaver i selskapet, noe som styrker lagånden.

Hva kan du bidra med?

Vi søker deg som har høyere utdanning innen IT. 
Interesse for teknologi og ønsker å jobbe med oppgaver som konfigurasjon av prosesser, skripting, brukeradministrasjon og support
Det er en fordel om du har vært i kontakt med Atlassians produkter Jira, Jira Service management og Confluence, da disse verktøyene utgjør en stor del av arbeidshverdagen vår.

Har du lyst til å arbeide med ny teknologi og de heteste produktene på markedet? Ser du potensialet i hva teamet kan utrette? Da kan Stretch Addera være den perfekte arbeidsplassen for deg!

name_location: Element Logic® · Kløfta, Viken, Norway  2 months ago  · 28 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are Element Logic. Optimizing warehouse performance has been our goal since 1985, and we began working with automated products early on. The magic happened in 2003 when we met the inventor of the AutoStore robots at a trade show and fell in love with what others called "a crazy robot idea". Smart automated technology is our core business today, supported by our own software.

Let's be honest: we operate in an industry that has a lot of wind in its sails. The market for warehouse automation has matured, so we are growing at a rapid pace. And as we grow as fast as we do, there is still a lot we have yet to learn. That's why we need you - someone who can help build on what we've started and help us learn along the way.

For Element Logic, our employees come first. We know that results come with well-being. We foster an environment where everyone's ideas and opinions are valued. And we are aware that you have a life outside of work. That's why we are Great Place to Work certified for the fourth year in a row.

Join our dynamic IT department in a thrilling phase of growth, as we build a new structure to support global operations. We need an ambitious IT Cloud Engineer to drive our transformation and make your mark by owning the areas of responsibility. You'll have the opportunity to improve our services in Europe, USA, and Asia. Are you ready to make a difference?

Main Responsibilities

Optimize setup, operation, and monitoring of Azure infrastructure and services, to have the best possible setup for managing our IT services
Management and operations of MS365 environment, including troubleshooting and resolving issues with tenants
Participate and/or lead projects for establishing new IT services, including companywide projects where IT is involved
Continuously improve, develop, and maintain architectural design to support our business needs based on Azure Framework
Maintain the necessary level of security
Manage subscriptions, cost, utilization
Implementation of new technologies and services to support our business needs, including documentation.
Implement and manage integrations/federations (SSO)
Contribution to information security and risk assessment
Assist and support our other IT disciplines as part of the team

Desired Skills And Experience

We believe you have a background / strong knowledge from multiple disciplines below:
Microsoft 365 products and services
Azure Active Directory (i.e., conditional access, guest users, dynamic groups, and policies)
Azure Services (Compute, Storage, AVD, Network and Security) 
Enterprise Applications and SSO
Azure processes related to automation
PowerShell scripting, ARM, CLI
Project and activity management in matrix organizations and international settings

In addition, we think you have

Relevant education at minimum Bachelor level (in some cases, relevant experience can compensate for lack of education)
4-5 years of IT experience with at least 3 years in a similar position, including operational work and solution establishment/improvement
Background from operations of IT servers, network, and infrastructure
Work experience from international environments is an advantage
Extensive knowledge within the IT area
Certifications within Microsoft portfolio is considered and advantage
Professional English language skills both oral and written are a requirement 
Professional language skills in a Scandinavian language are preferred, both oral and written

Who are we looking for? 

We are looking for a curious and technically interested person with a structured approach and a strong focus on security. The ideal candidate will be proactive, possess good communication skills, and have a keen eye for details. You must be confident, independent, and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. You will be a great fit if you describe yourself as somebody who is flexible, open-minded, and willing to consider new ideas. You enjoy a fast-changing organization, and you are able to adapt to changing circumstances.

Place of work: Kløfta, Norway

Start date:  To be agreed upon

Form of contract: Permanent employment 

For further questions about the position or process, contact Emilia Styka at +47 900 64 739 or by email: emilia.styka@elementlogic.no.

Be You, In Your Element

At Element Logic our people are our greatest asset. We want people to be in their element, so we recognise, celebrate, and cultivate the strength that is our diversity. We provide equal opportunity and welcome applications from candidates regardless of their age, race, ethnicity, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, language, national origin, mental and physical abilities, religious and political affiliations, life phase or family status. We want a workplace where people thrive with their unique abilities, perspectives, and life experiences.

More About Us

Since 1985, Element Logic® has been optimizing warehouse performance. We are the world’s first, and largest AutoStore®partner. In 2022 Element Logic acquired SDI, making us one of the largest system integrators in the world. Our industry is experiencing continued double digital growth towards 2025. Growth is driven by strong underlying fundamentals as performance requirements and cost increasingly put manual operations under pressure, while demand for e-commerce continues to increase exponentially.

Element Logic continues to grow, and we therefore need more skilled and committed people on our journey. If you want to work in a company with high competence, with the vision to make our customers' warehouses the most efficient in the world, this is the place to be! The company operates in an industry driven by the e-commerce trend and the ever-increasing need for automation and is extremely well positioned for the future.

name_location: 1X · Viken, Vestfold og Telemark, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 13 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Targeted start date: Immediately. 

1X designs androids built to benefit society. Since 2014, we’ve been building androids with the product design mindset of safety first, balanced performance, and smart behavior. Our mission is to build androids that work alongside people to meet the world’s labor demand and build an abundant society. Our wheeled model, EVE, is engineered to work with you, from guarding to logistics, and our bipedal model, NEO, is designed to become a general-purpose android, with a broad deployment in various applications, and, eventually, assisted living.

Founded in Moss, Norway, 1X has grown into an international team with offices around the globe. 1X envisions a bright new future: humans and androids, working and learning, Side by Side.

What You’ll Get By Joining Our Team

You can shape the future of humanoid robots
You will have the autonomy to improve all aspects of your technical skills
You’ll join an agile and diverse, global team

Responsibilities

Take on varied roles or tasks as needed, demonstrating a can-do attitude, especially in high-demand situations.
Help with the ongoing maintenance, updates, and support for the operating system used within our hardware products.
Take the lead in managing, optimizing, and securing our Terraform and Ansible-based cloud infrastructure.
Set up, monitor, and manage CI/CD pipelines and runners to ensure seamless code integration and deployment.
Help development teams for timely code releases, ensuring that every release adheres to quality standards.

Must-Haves:

3+ years of professional software engineering experience.
Proficiency in multiple programming languages: C/C++/Python/Java/Rust.
Experience with Linux deployed in hardware products (e.g., IoT, robots, drones, automotive).
Experience with product development in the context of release mechanisms, continuous integration, and continuous deployment.
Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.

Nice-To-Haves:

Experience working with Bitbake and Yocto and supporting developer workflows.
Experience with setting up CI pipelines and runners, infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible).
Familiarity with a wide range of networking protocols, topologies, and architectures and their secure implementation.
Familiarity with edge computing and its applications in IoT or other hardware products.

Interview Process

Introduction Stage - Initial conversations to get to know you better

[30m] Recruiter Screen with Win Yu
[45m] Hiring Manager Screen with Ralf Mayet

Team Interview Stage - we then dive into your experience in more depth and introduce you to members of the team. This is also when you will do a take-home challenge

[60m] Technical Deep-Dive conversation with Ralf Mayet and team

Final Interview Stage - we move you to our final round

[15m] Expectation management with Ralf Mayet
[30m] Conversation with CEO Bernt Øivind Børnich

You are welcome to request additional conversations with anyone you would like to meet, but didn’t get to meet during the interview process.

Not sure if this is you?

If you’re excited about this role, but not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Location: 1XHQ, Moss

Our new headquarter in Moss, Norway, is a short train ride from Oslo. 1XHQ offers food, showers, and outdoor activities. All employees are supported with a comprehensive relocation package to handle all logistics. Join us in Moss, where performance meets great company culture.

Joining our team means becoming a valued member of one of the biggest brands in humanoid robotics, where you'll play a part in shaping the future of Androids.

Working at 1X

The ideas that express our team’s culture and how we work.

Be Nice

Collaboration is our driving force. Our team creates an open, trusting environment where everyone can be their most creative.

Stay Smart

A world-changing team needs the brightest minds in every discipline. This is where people come to work, learn, and grow to their full potential.

Make History

Everything we do gets us closer to one ambitious vision: general-purpose androids helping people around the globe. We believe what we build today will impact generations.

1X is an inclusive and equal-opportunity employer that values diversity. We consider all qualified applicants regardless of race, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected class. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don't hesitate to let us know during the interview process. We will do our best to accommodate your needs.

We're excited to have you on board!

job_title: Software Engineer - Identity Management for Canonical Products
name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Summary

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

Bring your Python and Golang skills to bear on identity, authorization and access management across Canonical's suite of enterprise products and web services.

As a software engineer for Identity Management products of Canonical, you will modernize and expand the capabilities of the identity management solutions we use for authentication and authorization in our products, as well as our canonical.com and ubuntu.com websites. Your work on Identity Management will directly impact the users of all Canonical products.

Technical excellence and a background in software engineering are necessary prerequisites for this role. You will be expected to own the design and delivery of the system, facilitate integrations and work with your team on strategy and execution.

What you'll do

Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang). 
Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale. 
Review code produced by other engineers
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions. 
Create and enhance management, authentication and authorization API endpoints
Craft end-user authentication flows from design to implementation
Modernize the identity stack of our websites and products by driving adoption of best-of-breed IAM technologies 
Deliver great products that users love by maintaining a culture of quality and engineering excellence
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks per year for internal and external events

Who you are

You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are a software engineer, with specific experience building identity and access management products 
You are familiar with the open source software, standards, protocols and concepts in the identity space (e.g. OpenID, OAuth, LDAP)
You have experience implementing authorization frameworks in distributed systems
You value secure coding and standards, and enjoy working on teams that do the same
You have solid experience working in an agile development environment
You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people. 
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform. 
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You love embracing new technologies and pushing the boundaries of what is possible, with a view to building products that improve how people operate software and infrastructure everywhere 

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.

What Canonical offers:

Work from home
Learning and development allowances
Competitive Salary
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Generous annual leave
Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
Priority Pass for travel
Exposure to international business and technology

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

#stack

job_title: Product-focused author for business and technical audiences
name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  2 months ago  · 7 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Tell the story of open source in business and IT

Canonical, the publisher of Ubuntu, has a growing portfolio of open-source products and solutions. We aim to be the default provider of open source to the world, making it easier for organisations and individuals, from governments to startups and students, to benefit from the extraordinary wealth of innovation that open source provides. Our product management organisation has a team of writers with the mission to tell our integrated story - not the details of specific products, but rather the woven narrative that brings them together to shape the IT landscape and experience. This is effectively the voice of the company from a product perspective, and we are looking for people who are as passionate about open source as we are.

You will work closely with product managers and marketing managers on content production and planning. You will ensure quality and consistency, and improve our content strategy to achieve business objectives. You might review product-specific materials to help a product manager tell that story, but your responsibility will be to tell cross-cutting narratives that connect the dots between products, or groups of products. From IoT to the data centre, from cloud to the desktop, Ubuntu and Canonical bring together the best of open source to enable visionaries, entrepreneurs and changemakers to achieve their goals. This team tells that story.

Location: This team works in Europe, Middle East and Africa time zones and positions can be filled anywhere from Cape Town to Tromso.

What your day will look like

Write content for Canonical.com to deepen understanding of our portfolio
Review and provide feedback on content to help our product and marketing teams tell engaging stories
Collaborate to map the buyer's journey and implement a content strategy that optimises that journey
Maintain an editorial calendar for your content and provide progress updates to the broader team
Perform content performance audits to understand the effectiveness of your content
Participate in person in quarterly content planning sessions

What we are looking for

Demonstrated interest in technology, preferably with open source at heart
Ability to write authoritative and engaging content - portfolio of written work required
Appreciation for the written word and the ability to write persuasive copy
A problem solver: you don't shy away from taking on challenges
A finisher who sees projects through to completion
Attention to detail and appreciation for standards
Appreciation for knowledge sharing and a collaborative attitude
Practical experience with search engine optimisation
Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events

Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring

Applied skills in product marketing
Applied knowledge of content marketing attribution
An eye for layout and design

What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
