Godkjent bibliotekfagleg utdanning
Erfaring frå bibliotekverksemd og leiarskap
Gode norskkunnskapar skriftleg og munnleg
Gode samarbeids- og kommunikasjonsevner
Gode kunnskapar innanfor digital formidling og informasjonskompetanse
Du må være omgjengeleg, serviceinnstilt og ha evne til nytenking og utvikling
Personlege eigenskapar vil bli vektlagt

Me Kan Tilby

Varierte og spennande arbeidsoppgåver saman med gode kollegaer
Arbeid i ein veldriven kommune med gode og sikre rammevilkår
Eit godt og stabilt arbeidsmiljø med høg fagkompetanse
Gode moglegheiter for fagleg utvikling
Kommunale tilsetjingsvilkår med gode pensjons- og forsikringsordningar
Løn etter gjeldande tariff og avtaleverk

Andre opplysningar 

Administrasjonsmålet i kommunen er nynorsk
Alle faste nytilsetjingar vert gjort med ei prøvetid på 6 månader
Me gjer merksam på at i følgje offentleglova
25, 2. ledd kan opplysningar om søkjaren bli offentleggjort sjølv om du har oppmoda om ikkje å bli ført på offentleg søkjarliste. Dersom du har bedt om unntak frå offentleg søkjarliste vil du alltid bli varsla før søkjarlista vert offentleggjort

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 days ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Field Software Engineer - French

Ingénieur logiciel de terrain - EMEA

Canonical

Basé à domicile - EMEA

Aidez les entreprises mondiales à adopter les dernières infrastructures de cloud privé, les opérations Linux et cloud native, et les applications open source. Notre équipe apporte des connaissances spécialisées aux problèmes réels des clients, permettant l'adoption de Linux Ubuntu, OpenStack, Kubernetes et d'un large éventail de technologies associées, par les entreprises.

Ce rôle comporte de diverses responsabilités. Les membres de l'équipe sont des architectes de solutions Linux et cloud pour nos clients, concevant des solutions d'infrastructures cloud privées et publiques, adaptées à leurs besoins. Ce sont des consultants cloud qui travaillent directement avec nos clients pour déployer les technologies open-source développées par Canonical. Ce sont également des ingénieurs logiciels qui utilisent Python pour développer des opérateurs Kubernetes et améliorer nos outils d'automatisation pour l'infrastructure en tant que service (IaaS).

Les personnes qui aiment ce rôle sont des développeurs qui aiment résoudre les problèmes des clients à travers l'architecture, les présentations et la formation.

Ce que vous ferez :

Travailler sur l'ensemble de l'infrastructure Linux, depuis le système d'exploitation aux applications, en passant par le système réseau et stockage. 
Travailler avec Python pour développer et publier du code open source
Architecturer des solutions d'infrastructure cloud comme OpenStack, Kubernetes, Ceph, Hadoop et Spark sur site ou dans un cloud public (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). 
Travailler de près avec vos collègues pour livrer des solutions complexes pour nos clients
Développez une culture d'ingénierie saine et collaborative
Travaillez depuis le confort de votre domicile
Voyagez dans le monde entier jusqu'à 25 % du temps pour des événements internes et externes

Qui êtes-vous ?

Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme universitaire en informatique ou d'une expertise en ingénierie logicielle
Vous avez de solides connaissances des concepts et technologies de cloud computing, tels que Kubernetes, Openstack, AWS, GCP, Azure, Ceph, etc
Vous avez une connaissance pratique de Linux et des réseaux
Vous avez des compétences en programmation Python de niveau intermédiaire à avancé
Vous êtes une personne dynamique qui aime se lancer dans de nouveaux projets et interagir avec les gens
Vous faites preuve d'une volonté d'apprentissage continu
Vous avez d'excellentes compétences en matière de communication et de présentation (anglais et français)
Vous avez d'excellentes capacités d'organisation et de suivi des engagements

Ce que vous apprendrez

Infrastructure OpenStack et Kubernetes
Linux Ubuntu et connaissance des réseaux
Un large éventail d'applications et de compétences open source
Travailler directement avec des clients de différents secteurs d'activité 
Exposition réelle et pratique à un large éventail de technologies et d'outils émergents. 

Nous offrons :

Le remboursement de frais de scolarité liés à l'apprentissage et au développement
Des groupes de ressources sur la diversité
Travail à domicile
Salaire compétitif
Récompenses de reconnaissance par vos collègues
Congés annuels
Priority Pass pour les voyages

Remarque : la principale langue de travail chez Canonical est l'anglais. Un niveau élevé de maîtrise de l'anglais est attendu, et le processus de recrutement se déroule uniquement en anglais. L'ingénieur de terrain sélectionné pour ce rôle travaillera également avec les clients en langue française.

À propos de Canonical

Canonical est une entreprise internationale de logiciels en pleine croissance qui travaille avec la communauté des logiciels libres pour fournir Ubuntu, le système d'exploitation cloud le plus répandu au monde. Notre mission est de réaliser le potentiel des logiciels libres dans la vie des individus et des organisations. Nos services aident les entreprises du monde entier à réduire leurs coûts, à améliorer leur efficacité et à renforcer leur sécurité grâce à Ubuntu.

Nous sommes fiers de promouvoir un lieu de travail exempt de toute discrimination. La diversité des expériences, des perspectives et des antécédents conduit à un meilleur environnement pour nos employés et à une meilleure plate-forme pour nos utilisateurs et nos clients. C'est quelque chose que nous valorisons profondément et nous encourageons tout le monde à venir faire partie du monde d'Ubuntu. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour l'emploi sans égard à la race, la couleur, la religion, le sexe, l'identité ou l'expression de genre, l'orientation sexuelle, l'origine nationale, la génétique, le handicap, l'âge ou le statut d'ancien combattant.

About the job
About The Unit

Mastering technology and development has always been a key to the commercial success of Yara’s products. Yara Technology Center, located in Porsgrunn, Norway, is a vital contributor to this success working to improve existing processes and technologies as well as to develop new and innovative solutions for processes and products.

We are now looking for students to work on an interesting project during this summer: Process Modeling

During the internship, different process simulation software will be used to model parts of Yara's production processes. The work will be connected to tasks in the Process Modeling and Control department.

Responsibilities

Plant wide process simulation using ProSimPlus HNO3
Model specialization and integration via ProSimPlus Visual Basic customization
Plant wide process simulation using Aspen Plus
Model optimization with external Python solvers
Contribution to Yara’s best practice on above topics
Reporting and presentation in English

Profile

Preferably you should be heading towards the last or the second last year of the master's degree in chemical engineering
We are looking for a person that is self-driven, responsible and able to communicate in a diverse working environment.
You are fluent in English
Experience with sequential-module process simulators is an advantage, in particular ProSimPlus, so is a keen interest in coding (for instance in Python and VB).

Additional Information

The project will last for 8 weeks from June to August 2024

Location Porsgrunn, Norway.

Contact details

Volker Siepmann

Email: volker.siepmann@yara.com

Apply no later than

About the job
El Miembro del Equipo es un socio responsable para cumplir con el propósito de Whataburger, garantizando con prontitud que la experiencia de cada cliente, cumpla o exceda las expectativas. El miembro del equipo cumple con estas expectativas garantizando a cada cliente un producto caliente, recién preparado, ingredientes de la más alta calidad, hecho a la medida, y puntualmente servido en un restaurante cómodo, limpio, y amistoso.

 Obligaciones

 Proporcionar servicio de calidad Whataburger a todos los clientes. 
 Demostrar la capacidad de explicar con precisión la "diferencia de Whataburger" a los clientes. 
 Comunicarse de manera efectiva con la administración y de manera oportuna con respecto a los problemas de programación. 
 Reconocer y comunicar los problemas de servicio al cliente a la gerencia. 
 Seguir todos los procedimientos de seguridad y directrices para seguridad personal, uso de equipo y la manipulación de alimentos y almacenamiento. 
 Notificar a la administración de los fallos en el equipo de la cocina. 
 Garantizar que todos los productos son preparados según las normas de calidad Whataburger. 
 Registra inventario correctamente usando Primeras Entradas/ Primeras Salidas (PEPS) (First-In /First-Out (FIFO)). 
 Limpieza de las áreas de servicio al cliente, siguiendo los procedimientos apropiados según lo indicado por la gerencia de servicio, incluyendo jardines exteriores, entradas de edificio, mesas de comedor y las estaciones de condimento, baños, y la producción de alimentos y unidades de almacenamiento. 
 Asegurar la certificación en las estaciones específicas asociadas con los diferentes puestos, así como la limpieza y procedimientos de salubridad. 
 Demostrar responsabilidad fiscal con todos los activos de la empresa y seguir las políticas de la empresa en cómo manejar el efectivo. 
 Aceptar responsabilidades adicionales como sea asignado. 

Para iniciar el camino al éxito profesional, los miembros del equipo Whataburger participarán en un programa de desarrollo de habilidades y estarán obligados a obtener la certificación en estaciones específicas asociadas con la posición.

name_location: Nel Hydrogen · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 97 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Nel has a history tracing back to 1927 and is today a leading pure-play hydrogen technology company with a global presence. The company specializes in electrolyser technology for production of renewable hydrogen, and hydrogen fueling equipment for road-going vehicles. Nel’s product offerings are key enablers for a green hydrogen economy, making it possible to decarbonize various industries such as transportation, refining, steel, and ammonia.

Do you share our passion for renewable energy and want to be a part of the green transition? Apply for our summer internship program!

What can you expect?

 Technical insight: By joining our summer internship program, you will get the opportunity to understand the technical complexity in designing and delivering a cost-effective, safe, and reliable hydrogen plant. 
 Collaborative and global environment: You will be working with an integrated and highly competent team of engineers on a variety of different interface tasks and engage in interdisciplinary coordination activities.
 Responsibility and hands-on experience: You will gain valuable first-hand experience from working in a global technology company, with real work tasks and challenges.


Who are we looking for?

High performing Engineering students enrolled in a master’s program (graduating in 2025), within the following disciplines: System Engineering, Process, Safety, Controls/Automation, Electrical or Mechanical Engineering.

As a person you are

Adaptable and flexible to meet demands and variability associated with project work.
Accurate and methodical, with the ability to focus on quality and continuous improvement.
Self-driven and positive with excellent collaboration and communication skills.


Why should you apply?

Apart from getting paid for learning and developing skills that will prepare you for working life, you will gain valuable insight into a company with a clear and ambitious vision of improving our future.

At Nel we unlock the potential of renewables and enable global decarbonization. Providing you with the chance to shape a forward-facing career, we invite you to join by applying now.

Additional Information

The summer internship program lasts for approximately eight weeks and starts in mid-June 2024. Our office is located in Karenslyst Allé, close to all public transport at Skøyen.

To participate in our internship program, you must have a valid work visa/student permit, allowing you to work in Norway. Nel do not offer reimbursement for travel expenses or accommodation for individuals coming from abroad.

Application process

The application deadline is 15.10.2023. Only applications received through our online system will be considered, not via e-mail. Applications will be reviewed after the application period closes.

Remember to enclose copies of your CV, transcripts of your academic results, and a cover letter in English. Interviews will be conducted on Teams in November.

Any questions related to the Summer Internship Program can be sent to:

Head of Global Talent Acquisition, Hilde Wildhagen (hiwil@nelhydrogen.com)

Nel is a global, dedicated hydrogen company, delivering optimal solutions to produce, store and distribute hydrogen from renewable energy. We serve a range of different customers with leading hydrogen technologies. Our roots date back to 1927, and since then, we have had a proud history of development and continuous improvement of hydrogen technologies. Today, our hydrogen solutions cover the entire value chain from hydrogen production technologies to hydrogen fueling stations, enabling industries to transition to green hydrogen, and providing all fuel cell electric vehicles with the same fast fueling and long range as fossil-fueled vehicles – without the emissions.

job_title: Summer Internship 2024 – Safety, Security and Sustainability
name_location: Equinor · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  5 days ago  · 7 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Overview

 Job ID- 26743 
 Country- Norway 
 Location(s)- Stavanger, Oslo, Bergen, Trondheim, Stjørdal, Harstad 
 Company- Equinor ASA 
 Contact Name- internships@equinor.com 
 Workplace- Onshore 
 Discipline- Safety and Sustainability 
 Education Preferred- Master's Degree or PhD 
 Experience Preferred- Less than 2 years 
 Closing Date- Nov 13 2023 

Job Description

As a summer intern at Equinor, you will join 22,000 colleagues delivering oil, gas, wind, and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. By 2050, we aim to become a net-zero company and provide the energy the world needs without contributing to global warming. It is one of the defining challenges of our time, and attracting and developing the brightest minds will be critical to our success.

The position

Our summer internship is a 6-week programme designed to provide the experience and skills you need in your studies and future career. Our Norwegian and UK internship will begin on 17 June and ends on 02 August 2024, with one week off starting 15 July.

You can find out more about the programme at www.equinor.com/careers/summer-interns

Safety is our first priority and working in Safety and Sustainability means being part of a highly skilled and professional global network at Equinor. You will have the opportunity to engage in improvement initiatives, promote functional excellence, and ensure compliance with climate, environment, and sustainability standards.

When joining our team in Safety and Sustainability you will have the opportunity to work with-

 Safeguarding people and assets, promoting a strong safety culture.
 Engaging in improvement initiatives and promoting functional excellence.
 Ensuring compliance with climate, environment, and sustainability standards.
 Collaborating with the health and working environment function to enhance employee well-being.
 Contributing to emergency preparedness and crisis management.
 Working on governance, assurance, and risk management activities.
 Supporting the development and implementation of safety and sustainability strategies.
 Conducting safety inspections and audits.
 Analysing data and trends to identify areas for improvement.
 Participating in the development and delivery of safety training programs.
 Collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive safety and sustainability initiatives.
 Contributing to technology development, digitalization and innovation

We are looking for summer interns who are collaborators, eager to learn and have an analytical mindset with a strong attention to detail .

You

Some qualities are essential for Equinor. You identify with our values, open, collaborative, courageous and caring, which guide our decisions and help us succeed and grow. You make safety your priority and contribute to our zero-harm culture. For this position, we are also looking for-

 Cu rrently studying for Bachelor’s, Master’s degree, or Ph.D. with a strong academic record within a wide range of relevant areas such as leadership, technical, social, economic, safety, process, sustainability, chemical, sustainability, risk, environmental, technology, digitalization, innovation, petroleum, renewables, marine, biological, legal, working environment, communication, psychology etc
 Fluent in English and preferably a second working language
 No more than two year s of relevant full-time work experience
 Have c ompleted at least two years of higher education before the internship programme starts (1 7 June 202 4 )
 Have at least one year of higher education left after the internship programme ends (0 2 August 202 4 )
 The interns need to be located in the country where the internship takes place during its entire duration. Equinor does not support any relocation for our summer interns .
 Candidates must have the necessary work permit for the country in which they are applying for a position. The work permits must be valid at the point of application and for the duration of the employment. Please note that Equinor does not support, or sponsor work or visa permits for internship applications. Read more about it on the national authorities’ pages-
 Extracurricular activities and/or voluntary work are an advantag e

Every role and business area requires its own specific set of skills and personal attributes. Some of the qualities and characteristics we look for include-

 An awareness of risk and a commitment to safety for yourself and those around you.
 Effective communication skills and the ability to facilitate collaboration, influence stakeholders, and contribute to a diverse and inclusive culture.
 The flexibility to adapt to change, embrace new technology , and perform in a digitally enabled environment .
 Demonstrating a curious mind and the ability to problem-solve, innovate, and identify new ways of delivering against our objectives .

Equinor is an equal opportunities employer . We welcome applications from all candidates who meet the educational and experience requirements, including those with disabilities. If you have any specific requirements for any stage in our process, please make this clear in your application , and our team will be happy to support you .

General information

Please make sure that when applying, you attach the following-

 CV/ resume in English
 transcripts of records (or other documents describing subjects and grades) in English or Scandinavian language obtained to this point during your studies. If you are in the process of completing a degree, please upload an official temporary transcript.

Applications submitted without these attachments will unfortunately not be evaluated. To ensure an efficient recruitment process, please be informed that you may apply for a maximum of 3 Summer Internship roles per country.

Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process. Candidates will be asked for information on affiliation to high-risk countries for a security assessment. Furthermore, background checks are performed on all final candidates and all permanent and temporary hires will be screened against relevant sanctions lists to ensure compliance with sanctions law.

Why join us?

The summer internship is an opportunity for you to get to know Equinor, our people and culture, and the way we work. You will work on various tasks and projects that will provide value for you and Equinor. You can also expect-

Hands-on experienceYou will spend roughly 80% of your internship working on tasks and projects within the discipline you have applied for, giving you first-hand experience of your team's strategy, processes, and culture. Interns will spend the remaining 20% on learning experiences and a group project.

Learning and developmentYou will join a series of learning sessions that provide an overview of our business and introduce you to some of the processes we use at Equinor. These will include introductions to key areas of our strategy and learning opportunities covering various professional skills that will help you in your future career.

Multi-disciplinary projectYou will work on a group project with other interns from various academic backgrounds, guided and supported by an experienced employee. Over the course of this project, you will develop critical skills such as collaboration, leadership, communication, presentation, planning, and time management.

A balanced and rewarding work cultureOur interns have the same opportunities to work flexibly as the rest of our employees, allowing you to balance work with the things that matter away from the office. We also recognize that your internship is an opportunity to build lifelong relationships and networks. We encourage all our interns to take advantage of this.

For more information, visit Equinor's website www.equinor.com/careers/summer-interns

As a summer intern at Equinor, you will join 22,000 colleagues delivering oil, gas, wind, and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. By 2050, we aim to become a net-zero company and provide the energy the world needs without contributing to global warming. It is one of the defining challenges of our time, and attracting and developing the brightest minds will be critical to our success.

name_location: Canonical · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  1 month ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
The role of a Marketo Specialist at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of technology adoption, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a performance marketing manager to join our team and own our paid strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like

Support marketing team members with strategic expertise, setting up and monitoring Marketo campaigns and automations
Monitor overall Marketo performance and health
Build on automation and AI to improve lead management
Develop Canonical's martech stack to industry leading standard

What we are looking for in you

Advanced proficiency with Marketo
Experience in setting up integrations and automations between CRM systems and other platforms
Ability to work with at least two of the following languages: Python, JS, SQL, Velocity
A solid understanding of lead generation data with reporting experience
Experience in data analysis
Exceptional interpersonal skills and aptitude for forging trusting relationships across diverse, cross-functional teams
Proven ability to prioritise and differentiate what matters from the noise, meeting deadlines without sacrificing quality
Growth mindset - someone who is not afraid to think big and take on risks. 
Engagement with the latest trends in marketing technology

What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

name_location: Kiwa · Greater Oslo Region  3 weeks ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Arbeidsbeskrivelse  Oppsummering av stillingen

Kiwa er et internasjonalt konsern med 10 000 ansatte i 40 land. Vi opererer i TIC-bransjen og leverer tjenester innenfor testing, inspeksjon, sertifisering og kurs. Våre største kunder er ledende innen bransjer som luft- og romfart, olje, gass og energi, produksjon, infrastruktur, transport og telecom. I Norge er vi ca. 220 medarbeidere fordelt på kontorer i Oslo, Tønsberg, Rygge, Kongsberg, Stavanger, Bergen, Haugesund og Trondheim.

Om stillingen

Kiwa søker kalibreringsteknikere for instrumentkontroll, hovedsakelig på bil- og lastebilverksteder. Dette er en selvstendig og til tider hektisk stilling med mye reisevirksomhet. Du vil bli godt kjent med alle kriker og kroker i vårt langstrakte land og må regne med 2-3 reisedøgn per uke. Dette er arbeidsplassen for deg som er lærevillig, nysgjerrig og ønsker å bli en del av landets ledende tekniske fagmiljøer! Vi holder til på Økern i Oslo og her har vi også vårt laboratorium.

For å kunne utføre periodisk kjøretøykontroll kreves det at verkstedet har rutiner for kalibrering av sitt måleutstyr og at dette blir utført av en kompetent leverandør. Våre kalibreringsteknikere utfører standard sporbar kalibrering etter mer enn 20 forskjellige standarder. I tillegg utfører vi ved behov justeringer og reparasjoner. Vårt mobile laboratorium utfører oppdrag for mer enn 800 verksteder landet rundt, fra Kirkenes i nord til Mandal i sør.

Som Kalibreringstekniker Vil Dine Arbeidsoppgaver Inkludere
 Kalibrering av test- og måleutstyr 
 Kundekontakt 
 Reisevirksomhet 
Har du det som trengs?

Vi Ser Etter Deg Med Følgende Egenskaper
 Fagbrev som bilmekaniker, eller tilsvarende 
 Teknisk fagskole eller annen relevant påbygging er et pluss 
 Kjennskap til måleverktøy som brukes på bilverksteder. Annen relevant kompetanse vil også være interessant 
 Erfaring fra ISO 17025 er det et pluss, men ikke et krav 
 Generelt gode datakunnskaper 
 Førerkort klasse B 
Vi Ønsker At Du
 Evner å jobbe selvstendig 
 Er nøyaktig og effektiv 
 Fleksibel, serviceinnstilt og gode evner til relasjonsbygging i møte med nye kunder 
 Har godt humør og er samarbeidsvillig 
 Har lyst til å reise og bli godt kjent med Norge som en del av jobben 
Hva kan du forvente tilbake?

 Hva kan du forvente tilbake? 

I Kiwa kan vi tilby deg en rolle med stor frihet innenfor eget ansvarsområde og muligheten til å påvirke egen arbeidshverdag. Stillingen byr på v arierte og utfordrende arbeidsoppgaver med gode muligheter for både personlig og faglig utvikling. Du vil bli en del av et faglig sterkt arbeidsmiljø med gode kolleger i en bedrift med sterk posisjon i markedet. De første seks månedene er du med i Kiwas introduksjonsprogram som lar deg bli ekstra godt kjent med bedriften. I Kiwa får alle ansatte gode pensjons- og forsikringsordninger.

Høres dette interessant ut og du har spørsmål, skal du ikke nøle med å ta kontakt med Avdelingsleder for Kalibrering Oslo, Jonny Kvam, jonny.kvam@kiwa.com, telefon 982 27 801.

Vi gleder oss til å motta søknaden din!
Desired Skills and Experience
UNAVAILABLE

About the job
Our client is a dynamic agri-tech pioneer, leading the way in developing innovative applications for farmers and data-centric solutions for industry partners. With pride, we serve over 95% of Norway's dairy farmers, playing a crucial role in fortifying the agriculture sector with state-of-the-art data solutions. At the heart of our success lies a committed team of skilled engineers.

Presently, we are in the process of expanding our backend developer team.

We leverage the potential of Go, Kotlin, K8S, and AWS to forge scalable B2C and B2B solutions. Our methodology is agile, driven by the requirements set forth by product owners in cross-functional teams.

Our driving force is a vision that embraces technology as a catalyst for revolutionizing agriculture, envisioning a future that is both better and more sustainable. In close collaboration, our product owners, deeply rooted in agriculture, work hand in hand with leading designers and developers to create digital solutions that are both instinctive and customized to meet the future demands of farmers. Our ambition is nothing short of leading the global charge in agricultural solutions, excelling in user-centric design, cloud-based applications, Internet of Things, and data security.

As a Backend Developer/Senior Golang Engineer, your responsibilities will include:

 Collaborating within cross-functional teams to bring products to fruition based on product owners' visions.
 Contributing to deliberations on architecture, technology selections, deployment, and development workflows.
 Perpetually refining our solutions.
 Coordinating with infrastructure engineers to ensure the solidity and resilience of our solutions.

We are on the lookout for individuals who bring:

 Over five years of hands-on experience in producing top-quality code.
 Proficiency in product development.
 A commitment to exacting standards for solution robustness and code excellence.
 Proficiency in crafting code that is easily testable and maintainable.
 Experience or a strong interest in working with and learning Go.
 A genuine curiosity and passion for agri-tech.
 Ideally, proficiency in both Norwegian and English.

Personal Attributes:

To thrive in this role, you should be characterized by responsibility, a bias for action, and a spirit of adventure, embodying the core values of our company. Curiosity and a hunger for exploring new technologies and domains will be your key assets. Effective communication is a cornerstone of your skill set.

We extend an invitation with the following offerings:

 A stimulating and professional work environment that fosters engagement.
 Substantial avenues for personal growth and development.
 The opportunity to contribute to the progression of efficient and sustainable agriculture.
 A competitive compensation package, inclusive of benefits.

Should you find this opportunity aligning with your aspirations, we invite you to reach out with an updated CV to e.tyler@nigelfrank.com.

name_location: Timely · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  4 weeks ago  · 314 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Product Owner

We are seeking an experienced Product Owner to guide the continued development of Timely. The ideal candidate will balance diverse stakeholder inputs with the product's overarching vision, ensuring Timely's direction remains consistent and true to its core objectives. They will report directly to the VP of Product & Engineering and act as the main liaison between users and our development team.

Key Responsibilities:
Idea Translation: Convert high-level ideas into detailed user stories and requirements that are actionable and clear for the development team.
Product Backlog Management: Create, prioritize, and maintain the product backlog, ensuring the development team has a well-refined set of tasks ready for upcoming sprints.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Engage with customers and internal stakeholders, gathering, refining, and prioritizing product requirements. Exhibit strength and decisiveness when managing stakeholder and customer expectations.
Team Leadership: Inspire, guide, and motivate a diverse team of developers, designers, and QA specialists. Foster a collaborative environment that encourages innovation and high-quality output.
Product Releases: Oversee Timely's release activities, coordinating with commercial and support teams to support their go-to-market activities efficiently.
Performance Tracking: Monitor Timely's performance using key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectives. Report findings regularly to the management team, influencing product strategy.
Commitment Management: Ensure all product-related commitments are delivered within agreed-upon timelines.
Continuous Learning: Stay updated with industry best practices, competitor products, and emerging technologies.
Feedback Loop: Incorporate a robust feedback mechanism from both users and internal teams, ensuring that insights are driven by data. Use analytics to deepen understanding of the user experience, directly informing product enhancements and driving better commercial outcomes.

Qualifications:
Proven (3+ years) experience as a Product Owner or in a similar product management role, preferably within a high-volume SaaS environment.
Strong understanding of Scrum and Agile methodologies.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated ability to think strategically and tactically.
Experience in leading and motivating remote teams, with proficiency in remote collaboration tools.

job_title: Vi søker en ambisiøs Frontend utvikler til økt satsing i Norsk Rikstoto
name_location: Jefferson Wells Norge · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  4 days ago  · 19 applicants
job_description:
About the job
I Rikstoto drømmer vi om å skape engasjerende hestespill til alle – hvor vårt viktige samfunnsoppdrag er å sikre ansvarlig pengespill på hest, med overskudd som går tilbake til hestesporten.

Årlig har vi nesten 200 000 kunder som enten spiller aktivt eller fra tid til annen synes det er spennende å spille på hest. Vårt oppdrag er å tilby attraktive spill, sørge for engasjerende kundeopplevelser, og sørge for at alt skjer innenfor trygge rammer for spillerne.

Nå søker vi flere utviklere som kan bli del av vårt in-house utviklingsteam hos Norsk Rikstoto, hvor du som frontend-utvikler kan være med på å utvikle virksomhetskritiske systemer og tjenester i et spennende marked. Vi har opprettet et eget område i Rikstoto, Produkter og Tjenester, som samler alle innen produkt, design og utvikling til å skape team og ta ansvar i fellesskap for kundereisen. Sammen med erfarne kolleger vil du spille en sentral rolle i ulike produktteam og bidra til å forbedre våre produkter og skape engasjement.

Her vil du ikke bare jobbe side om side med erfarne utviklere, dyktige UX-designere og dedikerte produktledere, men også få sjansen til å utvikle og drifte våre tjenester med stadig utvikling av spillprodukter som spilles 24/7. Vi leverer våre spillprodukter på tvers av web, mobil, retail og TV, og hver dag er en spennende utfordring. Du vil ha betydelig innflytelse på din egen arbeidshverdag og spille en sentral rolle i spennende prosjekter som vil forbedre produktene våre i årene som kommer. Enten om du har kortere eller lengre erfaring, kan vi tilby spennende og utfordrende muligheter innenfor frontend utvikling.

Arbeidsoppgaver

Arbeidsoppgavene i rollen som utvikler hos oss vil være varierte. Vi jobber med nyutvikling og kontinuerlig forbedring av eksisterende løsninger, hvor rett kandidat vil være en fagressurs som involveres tidlig i designprosessen.

I enkelte av våre tjenester er det for eksempel mye data som skal inn på små flater – en spennende nøtt å knekke! Videre ønsker vi noen som tar eierskap på klientsidekode for webbaserte tjenester, og som aktivt deltar i diskusjoner og utviklingsoppgaver i teamet. Rammeverk, verktøy og metodikk er stadig i bevegelse og her vil du kunne påvirke veien videre. I dag er verktøy som Storybook, Chromatic og Cypress ting vi liker. Er du interessert og motivert for å gå inn i en Tech Lead rolle, vil det for rett kandidat være muligheter til dette.

Kvalifikasjoner

Vi ser etter deg som har relevant høyere utdannelse, noen års arbeidserfaring fra tilsvarende rolle, og som liker å holde deg faglig oppdatert på nye teknologier og trender. Erfaring med agil utviklingsmetodikk som Kanban eller lignende vil være viktig for å lykkes. Videre ser vi etter:

Dokumentert erfaring med HTML, CSS
Erfaring med front-end utvikling med Angular eller lignende rammeverk
God kjennskap med universell utforming og WCAG
Kjennskap til Signalr eller websockets generelt
Erfaring med komponentbibliotek i f.eks Storybook
Erfaring med unittester i Jest eller Mocha
Erfaring med verktøy for analyse av brukeradferd og A/B testing er en fordel

Vi tror at rett kandidat er løsningsorientert, har et øye for godt design, og motiveres av faglige utfordringer. Selv om du jobber godt selvstendig, samarbeider du gjerne med dyktige kollegaer for å komme i mål med utfordrende prosjekter. Vi ønsker at du deler din kunnskap med oss, og at du trives i et mindre team hvor alle kjenner alle.

I Norsk Rikstoto kan vi tilby blant annet:

Faglig sterkt og trivelige arbeidsmiljø
Eget kompetansebudsjett for faglig utvikling
Konkurransedyktige betingelser
Gode pensjons- og forsikringsordninger
Fleksibel arbeidsdag på 7,5t inkl. lunsj

Vi holder til på Bjerke Travbane, og har parkering til våre ansatte.

Skulle du ha noen spørsmål om stillingen eller prosess, ta gjerne kontakt med vår rekrutteringspartner i Jefferson Wells: 

Birgitte B. Sandvik på telefon 918 41 121 / birgitte.sandvik@jeffersonwells.no

Herman L. Nordli på telefon 921 29 120 / herman.lund.nordli@jeffersonwells.no

Vi har et sterkt engasjement for mangfold og inkludering i alle aspekter av vår virksomhet. Vi ønsker å speile mangfoldet i befolkningen, og oppfordrer alle kvalifiserte kandidater til å søke. Send din CV og en kort søknad som beskriver din relevante erfaring og hvorfor du er den rette personen for denne stillingen.

Vi ser frem til å høre fra deg!

name_location: Lyse · Mariero, Rogaland, Norway  5 days ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Jobbeskrivelse:

 Bli en del av vårt fremtidsrettede teknologi- og analysemiljø som datadrevet analytiker i Lyse Produksjon! 
 Vi i Lyse Produksjon tar daglige avgjørelser i et utfordrende marked. Vår fleksible produksjonsportefølje setter oss i en unik posisjon i Norden. Vår hovedoppgave? Levere strøm når det trengs som mest, og få mest mulig ut av hver dråpe vann! 
Vi bygger nå for fremtiden og er midt i et utviklingsløp både teknologisk og kommersielt. Vi søker deg som trives med utfordrende problemstillinger og ønsker å bruke kode for å gjennomføre analyser. I Lyse Produksjon vil du sitte i grenseskillet mellom et godt teknologimiljø, intrikate problemer og skarpe avgjørelser. 
Du trenger ikke å kjenne til kraftmarkedet fra før for å lykkes hos oss. Vi verdsetter kunnskapsdeling og personlig vekst, og vi vil at alle som jobber hos oss ønsker å bli ledende på analyse og teknologi. 
 Arbeidsoppgaver 
Vi handler i ulike markeder, både fysiske og finansielle. Dette krever grundige analyser og gode matematiske verktøy. Vi jobber både med egne modeller og i samarbeid med ledende miljøer på feltet. Dette betyr at du vil jobbe med analyse, koding og innovasjon i et dynamisk team. 
Dine ansvars- og arbeidsoppgaver vil blant annet være: 
Utvikle kompetanse på kraftmarkedet og tilhørende markeder som kull, gass og karbon. 
Utvikle ferdigheter innenfor programmering og data science. 
Utforske nye metoder og nye datasett for å utvikle bedre modeller. 
Videreutvikle et sterkt analysemiljø. 
Mulighet for å delta i rotasjon som operasjonell analytiker, med tilhørende agering i finansielle markeder. 
 Kvalifikasjoner 
Høyere utdanning innen analytiske fagfelt. 
Noe erfaring med programmering, vi bruker Python. 
Gode kommunikasjonsevner, norsk og engelsk. 
 Personlige egenskaper 
Nysgjerrig 
Analytisk 
Lagspiller 
 Vi tilbyr
Vi mener Lyse konsernet er arbeidsplassen for deg som verdsetter et sterkt tverrfaglig miljø, gode kollegaer, faglig utvikling, fart og ja, til og med litt spenning! Lyse er en del av folks hverdag. Som vår datadrevne analytiker vil du få muligheten til å jobbe hos en miljøorientert og sentral samfunnsbygger med store ambisjoner. 
Vi tilbyr betingelser som ikke står tilbake for resten av bransjen. Du vil møte et åpent og uformelt arbeidsmiljø med takhøyde og fleksibilitet. Her er noe av det vi kan tilby av goder: 
En svært gunstig innskuddspensjon- og forsikringspakke
Firmahytter både på fjellet og ved sjøen
Bedriftsidrettslag og subsidiert trening
Ekstra fridager og gode velferdstiltak 
Kjekke sosiale sammenkomster 
Kompetanse- og karriereutviklingsmuligheter
 Og så gjør det godt å vite at vi jobber for et konsern med stort samfunnsengasjement. Bonus, ikke sant?
 Hvor er kontoret? 
Hovedkontoret vårt er plassert på Mariero i Stavanger. Kontoret ligger sentralt med bare få minutters gange til tog og buss, og vi tilbyr Hjem-jobb-hjem-ordning, sykkelparkering og garderobe. 
 Kontakt
Nærmere opplysninger om stillingen får du ved å kontakte Gjert Hovland Rosenlund, direktør analyse, på telefon 480 28 129.  HR-relaterte spørsmål rettes til Brita Haugsdal, gruppeleder rekruttering, på tlf. 473 77 593.
 Vi håper du kjenner lysten boble litt, og sender oss en søknad. Vi gleder oss til å lese den!
 Lysekonsernet leverer samfunnskritisk infrastruktur og tjenester. Vi følger sikkerhetskrav fra norske myndigheter ved ansettelse. Kandidater forventes å åpent tilby all relevant informasjon om seg selv under rekrutteringsprosessen.
Vennligst legg ved kopi av CV og relevante vedlegg som vitnemål, attester, sertifikater og karakterer.  Bakgrunnssjekk på aktuelle kandidater kan bli gjennomført.  Aktuelle kandidater kan bli spurt om informasjon angående tilknytning til høyrisikoland i tilfeller hvor dette er nødvendig for en videre sikkerhetsvurdering.

job_title: Summer Project 2024 - Software Developer - News article system
name_location: Sandvik Coromant · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  3 days ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Our sensorized tools and software are used globally to increase efficiency and sustainability in production processes. The software provides an opportunity as a new direct channel of communication from us to our end user. The task is to develop the “news article”-system that we use to provide information to our end users in the application.

We are looking for 1-2 students with skills within software development for an exciting summer job in 2024!

The summer job period is from early June until mid-August, but the selected students will be invited to spend a few hours per month with us to get to know the team and the task during the spring and be well prepared for summer. We go on vacation week 29 and 30 and expect you to do the same.

Sandvik Coromant is leading the industry in developing sensorized tools, applying sensor measurement and software technology to help our customers’ machine better products, with less environmental impact. We believe this to be a key enabler for a more automated, and more sustainable future within metal cutting processes.

As part of your work, you will need to learn how our solution is set up, define and design the desired development tasks and improvements, and implement them. You will be working both together with our software team and individually.

We are looking for tech-savvy and quick learning students with some coding experience. Having a positive attitude and working well in a team is a great benefit. We think work should be serious fun!

We can offer a great work environment, the opportunity to directly impact our software and our customers’ experience, and a broad technical competence in our team to hang out with and learn from.

Are you still interested? Apply then! Write a little about yourself, what you study, what your talents are and why we should choose you for this project.

Application deadline: 17 November 2023

Job ID: R0060409

Sandvik Coromant Trondheim er en del av næringslivsprosjektet Workation i Trondheim som tilbyr et unikt sommerprogram for alle studentene som får jobb i de 20 deltakerbedriftene. Sommeren 2023 var vi blant annet på Høyt & Lavt klatrepark, Escape Room og ølsmaking på ØX. Alt dette er gratis for deg som student! Dette sommerprogrammet er en god mulighet til å bli kjent med nye mennesker på tvers av bedriftene og få venner for livet. Vi og Workation skal sørge for at du får en uforglemmelig sommer her i Trondheim!

name_location: 1X · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 months ago  · 53 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Targeted start date: Immediately.

1X designs androids built to benefit society. Since 2014, we’ve been building androids with the product design mindset of safety first, balanced performance, and smart behavior. Our mission is to build androids that work alongside people to meet the world’s labor demand and build an abundant society. Our wheeled model, EVE, is engineered to work with you, from guarding to logistics, and our bipedal model, NEO, is designed to become a general-purpose android, with a broad deployment in various applications, and, eventually, assisted living.

Founded in Moss, Norway, 1X has grown into an international team with offices around the globe. 1X envisions a bright new future: humans and androids, working and learning, Side by Side.

Safe, robust and efficient locomotion lies at the core of enabling humanoid robots to interact with the world. As a Robotics Software Engineer at 1X Technologies, you will develop real-time software systems that enable efficient, robust, and safe robot locomotion for a wide range of behaviors and environments. Every day, you will work with other software and controls engineers to conceptualize, implement and test the algorithms and tools needed to reach this goal. We believe that if it doesn’t work on a robot, it doesn’t work - so get ready to be hands-on with our state of the art hardware. To thrive in this role, you must have strong analytical skills, a burning desire for action and progress, and be motivated to make a positive impact in the world of robotics.

Why this job is exciting

Every day is different! You will get to

work in a nascent industry and shape the future of humanoid robots
drive the architecture and design of a highly reliable, maintainable, and testable code for humanoid robots deployed to real world applications
implement tools for deploying, testing, debugging, logging and maintaining the real-time controls stack
test and debug algorithms on our robots
collaborate with an interdisciplinary team of experts in an environment of learning and support
thrive in an inclusive, supportive, and global culture 
learn the ropes about our humanoid system and get familiar with the controls and autonomy stack

Within one month, you will…

learn the ropes about our humanoid system and get familiar with the controls and autonomy stack

Within three months, you will…

take the lead in the development of a specific subsystem and contribute to the controls stack

Within one year, you will…

drive solutions that enable efficient, robust and safe locomotion of our robot for a wide range of environments and behaviors

Must-Haves

Masters degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Mechanical/Electrical Engineering, or similar with several years of relevant experience
Proven track record of developing reliable, efficient, and maintainable multithreaded software systems
Proficient in C++ within a Linux development environment
Thorough understanding of Object Oriented Programming, Real Time Programming, linear algebra, data structures and algorithms
Familiarity with modern software development practices, source control and testing methodologies, encompassing both unit and integration testing
Aptitude to grasp large code-bases and intricate software systems rapidly
Excellent communication and documentation skills with the ability to set technical direction within your responsibilities

Nice-To-Haves

Familiarity with Java, Unity/C#, Python, ROS2, and DDS
Knowledge in Robotics, Controls, Dynamical Systems, Machine Learning, Perception
Hands-on experience on cyber-physical compute systems (Robotics, IoT, Controls, Embedded)
Troubleshooting on hardware

Interview process 

Introduction Stage - we have initial conversations to get to know you better…

[30m] Recruiter Screen with Win Yu
[30m] Hiring Manager Screen with Manuel Yves Galliker

Team Interview Stage - we then dive into your experience in more depth and introduce you to members of the team.

[60m] Technical Deep-Dive conversation with the Controls team

Final Interview Stage - a brief conversation introducing you to our leadership team

[15m] Expectation management with Manuel Yves Galliker
[30m] Conversation with CEO Bernt Øivind Børnich

You are welcome to request additional conversations with anyone you would like to meet, but didn’t get to meet during the interview process.

Not sure if this is you?

If you’re excited about this role, but you’re not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Location

Our new headquarter in Moss, Norway, is a short train ride from Oslo. The facility is designed to be state-of-the-art, with a variety of 3D printers, an electronics lab, and controls test studio. 1XHQ offers food, showers, and outdoor activities. All employees are supported with a comprehensive relocation package to handle all logistics. Join us in Moss, where performance meets great company culture.

Joining our team means becoming a valued member of one of the biggest brands in humanoid robotics, where you'll play a part in shaping the future of Androids.

Working at 1X

The ideas that express our team’s culture and how we work.

Be Nice

Collaboration is our driving force. Our team creates an open, trusting environment where everyone can be their most creative.

Stay Smart

A world-changing team needs the brightest minds in every discipline. This is where people come to work, learn, and grow to their full potential.

Make History

Everything we do gets us closer to one ambitious vision: general-purpose androids helping people around the globe. We believe what we build today will impact generations.

1X is an inclusive and equal-opportunity employer that values diversity. We consider all qualified applicants regardless of race, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected class. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don't hesitate to let us know during the interview process. We will do our best to accommodate your needs.

We're excited to have you on board!

name_location: Strawberry (formerly Nordic Choice Hotels) · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 19 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Head-Kitchen Assistant/ Steward

Oslo, Norway

Opened on the 1st of September 2022, Sommerro is an exciting new addition to Oslo’s hotel scene and we are looking for passionate team members to join our community.

Occupying the former headquarters for Oslo Lysverker - the city’s electrical company - Sommerro is Oslo’s first neighbourhood hotel and marks the rebirth of a 1930s landmark. It is a dynamic open house for the culture hungry, with 242 comfy rooms and suites, three in-house restaurants, meeting and events spaces, a subterranean spa, and the city’s first rooftop pool and terrace that overlooks Frogner, one of Oslo’s oldest and finest areas.

We are looking for someone organised, passionate, and professional, who will play a crucial role in creating the Sommerro experience and our shared conscious attitude towards sustainability. The successful candidate will work efficiently alongside the management team as part of a strong and effective department that will oversee the support of our food and beverage offerings including our events catering, breakfast, room service and three of our in house restaurants: Ekspedisjonshallen, an all-day dining outlet with a menu of classic brasserie favourites, Tak & Izakaya our Japanese Nordic concept by Frida Ronge from Tak Stockholm and To Søstre, an elegant venue that serves afternoon.

Responsibilities

Follow routines and systems in place at Sommerro for hygiene/cleaning
Ensuring shifts are covered and organised in line with business
Control of cleaning equipment and stock control for all outlets
Communication -- Work closely with other departments and communicate important issues in a timely way.
IK-MAT -- Ensure that internal control routines are followed and documented in the appropriate format.
Cleaning -Conduct cleaning tasks as required, 
Assist with basic kitchen production when needed
Training of effective and correct use of equipment and chemicals
Report and communicate with department heads to ensure organised running of all outlets
Waste control
Training of new employees

Requirements:

Read, write and communicate effectively in English or a Scandinavian language
Computer literacy is a bonus
Previous kitchen steward experience 
Structured and organised
Ik mat/haccp experience
Reliable and Structured

We offer:

Possibilities for professional and personal development
Competitive pay 
Working culture characterised professional competence, pride and engagement
Staff benefits in Nordic Choice Hotels 

For more information contact-

Jonathan Howell

Food & Beverage Director

Mail: jonathan.howell@sommerrohouse.com

Mobil: +47 483 55 184

name_location: Yara International · Porsgrunn, Vestfold og Telemark, Norway Reposted  1 week ago  · 14 applicants
job_description:
About the job
About The Unit

Yara’s mission is to responsibly feed the world and protect the planet. To convert this into action, Yara Technology located in Porsgrunn, Norway, works to optimize utilization of assets and identify solutions for long-term competitive advantage, including technologies for emission free production of fertilizers based on renewable energy.

Our focus is to improve existing processes and technologies as well as to develop new and innovative solutions for processes and products. We work together with plants and the market organization on product development, problem solving and advisory to support production of high-quality fertilizers. Our aim is to contribute to maintain Yara's leading position in sustainable fertilizer production.

We are now looking for students to work on an interesting project during this summer: Prilling optimization, Optimize mass and energy balance model for prilling tower. Build on the existing mass and energy balance model for prilling tower in NPK3. The student will focus on optimizing the prilling process and reducing emissions.

This internship is an opportunity to experience and influence the industrial scale production of fertilizers in Porsgrunn. In close connection to an industrial plant the technical support and innovative solutions of tomorrow are investigated. The work will be connected to ongoing projects in the NPK & Environmental Technologies Department.

Responsibilities

The tasks will include, but are not limited to;

Literature review
Method development, laboratory work and analysis
Process descriptions and calculations
Reporting and presentation in English 

Profile

Student on his/her way to a master degree in chemistry, chemical engineering, analytical chemistry, physical chemistry or process chemistry. Preferably you should be heading towards the last or the second last year of the master degree
Practical experience with safe working in laboratory is an advantage
We are looking for a person that is self-driven, responsible and able to communicate in a diverse working environment.
Fluent in English

Additional Information

The project will last for 6-8 weeks from June to August 2024

Location Porsgrunn, Norway.

Contact details

Anders Ytterbø

Email: anders.ytterbo@yara.com

Phone: +47 930 08 153

Apply no later than

29.10.2023

About the job
Ønsker du å bli med på denne spennende reisen her i Trondheim?

XLENT Trondheim ser etter mange systemutviklere som elsker faget og som har ambisjoner om å utvikle seg videre. Vi søker deg som er nysgjerrig og oppdatert på ny teknologi, som kommuniserer godt med andre og liker å jobbe prosjektbasert og i smidige team. Du er opptatt av kvalitet og «best practice», og motiveres av ansvar, autonomi og ikke minst av det å skape nye innovative digitale løsninger sammen med andre.

For oss er det et stort pluss dersom du har høyere teknisk utdannelse og at du er strukturert og nysgjerrig.

Erfaring fra f.eks C#, .NET Core og Azure er midt i blinken!

HVA TILBYR VI DEG?

Et selskap med ambisjoner og ett spennende muligheter her i Trøndelagsregionen. Vi har en kultur som er preget av autonomi, engasjement og trivsel.

Mulighet til å påvirke arbeidshverdag ved å bli med i oppstartsfasen til ett selskap med sterk vekst.

Hos oss får du:

Fast stilling i et selskap med et inspirerende seniormiljø 
Utfordrende og varierte oppgaver for interessante kunder 
Faglig utvikling, kurs og sertifiseringer

Hybridkontor - fleksibilitet og mulighet til å styre egen arbeidshverdag og lokasjon 
En unik mulighet til å være med å bygge opp din drømmearbeidsplass 
Din egen mentor som vil følge deg opp i prosjekt 

 
VÅR JOBB ER Å SØRGE FOR AT DU TRIVES!

Derfor lover vi deg sterk faglig utvikling, de beste folkene rundt deg og spennende, samfunnsnyttige prosjekter å jobbe på, basert på fremtidsrettet teknologi. I tillegg lover vi at du får tid til å utvikle deg videre gjennom fagdager, konferanser og kurs, i et supert og inkluderende arbeidsmiljø hvor vi har fokus på kompetansedeling og å lære med og av hverandre.

Vi tilbyr en kultur som er preget av stor takhøyde, åpenhet, humor, ambisjoner, nysgjerrighet og et ønske om å utgjøre en forskjell. Det beste med å jobbe i XLENT er menneskene, fleksibiliteten og den gode stemningen. Engasjementet, trivselen og utviklingen til våre ansatte er det som skiller oss fra andre. Er du klar til å bli XLENT?

About the job
Zem opplever en sterk økning i etterspørselen etter våre løsninger for maritime batteri systemer og elektriske og hybride drivlinjer. Vi ønsker derfor å styrke vår tekniske stab med flere erfarne automasjonsingeniører.

Vi er på utkikk etter flere strukturerte og resultatorientert personer som vil øke vår operasjonelle kapasitet. Du vil bli del av et ledende kompetansemiljø innen elektrifisering av maritim sektor og bidra til gjennomføring av banebrytende teknologiske løsninger for det grønne skiftet.

Personene som kommer inn, vil bli en del av vårt tekniske team som pr. i dag utgjør 16 personer.

Dine Hovedoppgaver Vil Være

Bidra til å videreutvikle Zems automasjonsløsninger for elektriske og hybride drivlinjer for skip
Utarbeide tegningsgrunnlag og annen nødvendig dokumentasjon som underlag for skapbyggere og installasjon på skipsverft (vi bruker E3 og Sysmac Studio).
Delta på igangkjøring av systemene på skipsverft i Norge og utlandet
Bidra til problemløsning og service etter at systemene er levert
Delta i prosjektgjennomføring og møter med leverandører og kunder (alle våre ingeniører er med i hele prosjektgjennomførings løpet vårt)
Noe reising må påregnes

Ønskede Kvalifikasjoner

Utdanning på Bachelor eller Masternivå innen automasjon
3-5 års erfaring (eller mer) - nyutdannete helt uten erfaring vil ikke bli vurdert
Nøyaktighet, fleksibilitet og god arbeidskapasitet
Resultat orientert
Gode skriftlige og muntlige engelskkunnskaper

Vi Kan Tilby

Ledende faglig miljø
Personlige utviklingsmuligheter i et firma i sterk vekst
Godt arbeidsmiljø i lyse og moderne kontorer
Konkurransedyktig betingelser

Om ZEM

ZEM ble etablert I 2009 av nøkkelpersoner fra den norske el-bil produsenten THINK. Basert på erfaringene fra produksjon av 2500 THINK biler har vi utviklet en markedsledende elektrisk og hybrid drivlinje for mindre skip som vi nå opplever stor etterspørsel etter.

Vi arbeider tett med ledende leverandører av batterier, elektriske motorer og kraftelektronikk og har utviklet vårt eget PLS baserte styrings og kontrollsystem.

Staben består av seniorer med lang fartstid fra batteri og elektriske drivlinjer og yngre ingeniører som er rekruttert rett fra skolen.

Majoritetseier i ZEM er Volvo Penta og gjennom Volvo systemet får vi tilgang til både teknologi, ressurser og en solid kapitalbase. Vi har hatt 50% årlig vekst de siste årene og med god lønnsomhet.

ZEM holder til i moderne kontorlokaler i Veritas parken på Høvik i Bærum.

Kelly Services fungerer som rekrutteringsbyrå i forbindelse med denne stillingen. Hvis du velger å søke, vil opplysningene dine behandles i samsvar med Kellys personvernerklæring.

Vi er som oppdragsgiver opptatt av mangfold og like muligheter og oppfordrer derfor alle kvalifiserte kandidater til å søke, uavhengig av rase, kjønn, funksjonsevne, religion/tro, seksuell orientering og alder.

Kelly Services are acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this role. Should you choose to apply, your information will be processed in accordance with Kelly's Privacy Statement.

As an Equal Opportunities employer, we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

name_location: UiT- The Arctic University of Norway · Tromsø, Troms og Finnmark, Norway  1 week ago  · 2 applicants
job_description:
About the job
The position

A PhD position is available at the Department of Chemistry , Faculty of Science and Technology with the research group of Prof. Bjørn Olav Brandsdal and will be part of the research project “Evolutionary principles of biocatalysts from extreme environments” financed by the Research Council of Norway. The PhD candidate will be part of the Hylleraas Centre for Quantum Molecular Sciences ( http://www.hylleraas.no ). The Hylleraas Centre is a Norwegian Centre of Excellence, established by the Research Council of Norway in 2017 for a period of 10 years. About 70 scientists, post-doctoral fellows and PhD students in the field of theoretical and computational chemistry are active at the centre.

The position is for a period of four years. The nominal length of the PhD programme is three years. The fourth year is distributed as 25 % each year and will consist of teaching and other duties. The objective of the position is to complete research training to the level of a doctoral degree. Admission to the PhD programme is a prerequisite for employment, and the programme period starts on commencement of the position.

As a student, you will enter an international and collegial environment, and be enrolled in the Department of Chemistry PhD school ( https://site.uit.no/phdchem/ ), and the Norwegian ‘BioCat Graduate School in Biocatalysis’, which provides top-level graduate courses in both scientific and transferable skills, arranges national PhD conferences and offers generous travel stipends for student research visits to collaborator laboratories.

The workplace is at UiT in Tromsø. You must be able to start in the position within a reasonable time after receiving the offer.

The position’s field of research

The successful candidate will become a member of an international and interdisciplinary research team focusing on the investigation and design of novel enzyme catalysts using computational and experimental methods ( http://site.uit.no/cube ). The candidate is expected to work together with collaborators at the Department of Cellular and Molecular Biology at Uppsala University in Sweden and the Department of Chemistry at the University of Bristol in UK.

The appointed candidate will work with temperature dependence of chemical reaction rates and substrate binding using computer simulations to explore the fundamental principles of evolutionary enzyme adaptation. This knowledge will be used to design new enzymes with potential industrial applications. The candidate is also expected to spend up to 1 year at Uppsala University, Sweden and/or University of Bristol, UK.

The candidate will also be involved in development and application virtual reality (VR) for visualisation and data analysis using the group’s VR lab facilities.

Contact

For further information about the position and UiT is available by contacting Prof. Bjørn Olav Brandsdal:

phone: +47 776 44057
email: bjorn-olav.brandsdal@uit.no 

Qualifications

This position requires a master’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field of chemistry, such as computational chemistry, quantum chemistry or biochemistry with an average of Norwegian equivalent grade of C or better on relevant courses.If you are near completion of your master’s degree, you may still apply.

Applicants must document document proficiency in English that satisfies the Norwegian Higher Education Entrance Qualification, either as a native language, via undergraduate education in a Nordic country, or by test scores as described below. Nordic applicants can document their English capabilities by attaching their high school diploma. Working knowledge of Norwegian or a Scandinavian language is also desirable due to teaching obligations.

Previous experience with machine learning, molecular dynamics simulations, hybrid quantum mechanics/molecular mechanics and/or quantum mechanics is required. Software development and use of free energy methods will also be considered favorably. Both a strong academic record and a genuine interest in conducting research are essential to qualify for the position. This must be demonstrated by your Master’s thesis, academic record, and other application materials (see below).

In the assessment, the emphasis is on the applicant's potential to complete a research education based on the master's thesis or equivalent, and any other scientific work, relevant research experience and academic performance and teaching experience and/or qualifications. Teaching experience and/or qualifications will be considered an advantage. In addition, we may consider work experience or other activities of significance for the PhD studies. You must be willing to engage in the ongoing development of your discipline and the university as a whole.

We will also emphasize motivation and personal suitability for the position. We are looking for candidates who:

Have good collaboration skills
Have good communication and interaction with colleagues and students
Wants to contribute to a good working environment

As many poeple as possible should have the opportunity to undertake organized research training. If you already hold a PhD or have equivalent competence, we will not appoint you to this position.

Admission to the PhD programme 

For employment in the PhD position, you must be qualified for admission to the PhD programme at the Faculty of Science and Technology and participate in organized doctoral studies within the employment period.

Admission Normally Requires

A bachelor's degree of 180 ECTS and a master's degree, or an integrated master's degree.

UiT normally accepts higher education from countries that are part of the Lisbon Recognition Convention.

In order to gain admission to the programme, the applicant must have a grade point average of C or better for the master’s degree and for relevant subjects of the bachelor’s degree. A more detailed description of admission requirements can be found here .

If you are employed in the position, you will be provisionally admitted to the PhD programme. Application for final admission must be submitted no later than two monthsafter taking up the position.

Inclusion and diversity

UiT The Arctic University of Norway is working actively to promote equality, gender balance and diversity among employees and students, and to create an inclusive and safe working environment. We believe that inclusion and diversity are a strength, and we want employees with different competencies, professional experience, life experience and perspectives.

If you have a disability, a gap in your CV or immigrant background, we encourage you to tick the box for this in your application. If there are qualified applicants, we invite at least one in each group for an interview. If you get the job, we will adapt the working conditions if you need it. Apart from selecting the right candidates, we will only use the information for anonymous statistics.

We offer

Involvement in an interesting research project 
Good career opportunities 
A good academic environment with dedicated colleagues 
A large degree of independence in work
Flexible working hours and a state collective pay agreement 
Pension scheme through the state pension fund 
PhD Fellows are normally given a salary of 532 200 NOK/year with a 3% yearly increase

Norwegian health policy aims to ensure that everyone, irrespective of their personal finances and where they live, has access to good health and care services of equal standard. As an employee you will become member of the National Insurance Scheme which also include health care services.

More practical information about working and living in Norway can be found here: https://uit.no/staffmobility

Application 

Your Application Must Include

Cover letter explaining your motivation and research interests
CV - summarizing education, positions and academic work
Diploma for bachelor's and master's degree
Transcript of grades/academic record for bachelor's and master's degree
Explanation of the grading system for foreign education (Diploma Supplement if available)
Documentation of English proficiency , with a preferred minimum score of 6.5 on each part of the IELTS test, or minimum scores of 22, 22, 22 and 25 (reading, listening, speaking and writing, respectively) on the TOEFL test.
Documentation of proficiency in Norwegian (or a Scandinavian language) if applicable
2-3 references with contact information
Master’s thesis, and any other academic works

Qualification with a master’s degree is required before commencement in the position. If you are near completion of your master’s degree, you may still apply and submit a draft version of the thesis and a statement from your supervisor or institution indicating when the degree will be obtained. You must still submit your transcripts for the master’s degree with your application.

All documentation to be considered must be in a Scandinavian language or English. Diplomas and transcripts must also be submitted in the original language, if not in English or Scandinavian. If English proficiency is not documented in the application, it must be documented before starting in the position. We only accept applications and documentation sent via Jobbnorge within the application deadline.

General information 

The appointment is made in accordance with State regulations and guidelines at UiT. At our website, you will find more information for applicants .

Remuneration for the position of PhD Fellow is in accordance with the State salary scale code 1017. A compulsory contribution of 2 % to the Norwegian Public Service Pension Fund will be deducted. You will become a member of the Norwegian Public Service Pension Fund, which gives you many benefits in addition to a lifelong pension: You may be entitled to financial support if you become ill or disabled, your family may be entitled to financial support when you die, you become insured against occupational injury or occupational disease, and you can get good terms on a mortgage. Read more about your employee benefits at: spk.no .

A shorter period of appointment may be decided when the PhD Fellow has already completed parts of their research training programme or when the appointment is based on a previous qualifying position PhD Fellow, research assistant, or the like in such a way that the total time used for research training amounts to three years.

We process personal data given in an application or CV in accordance with the Personal Data Act (Offentleglova). According to the Personal Data Act information about the applicant may be included in the public applicant list, also in cases where the applicant has requested non-disclosure. You will receive advance notification in the event of such publication, if you have requested non-disclosure.

Eallju - Developing the High North

UiT The Arctic University of Norway is a multi-campus comprehensive university at the international forefront. Our vision is to be a driving force for developing the High North. The Northern Sami notion eallju, which means eagerness to work, sets the tone for this motive power at UiT. Along with students, staff and the wider community, we aim to utilise our location in Northern Norway and Sápmi, our broad and diverse research and study portfolio and interdisciplinary advantage to shape the future.

Our social mission is to provide research-based education of high quality, perform artistic development and carry out research of the highest international quality standards in the entire range from basic to applied. We will convey knowledge about disciplines and contribute to innovation. Our social mission unites UiT across various studies, research fields and large geographical distances. This demands good cooperation with trade and industry and civil society as well as with international partners. We will strengthen knowledge-based and sustainable development at a regional, national and international level.

Academic freedom and scientific and ethical principles form the basis for all UiT’s activities. Participation, co-determination, transparency and good processes will provide the decision-making basis we need to make wise and far-sighted priorities. Our students and staff will have the opportunity to develop their abilities and potential. Founded on academic integrity, we will be courageous, committed and generous in close contact with disciplines, people and contemporary developments.

We will demonstrate adaptability and seek good and purposeful utilisation of resources, so we are ready to meet the expectations and opportunities of the future. We will strengthen the quality and impact of our disciplines and core tasks through the following three strategic priority areas.
