job_title: Postdoc within Simulation-Based Testing with Automatic Scenario Generation and Adaptation
name_location: Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU) · Trondheim, Trøndelag, Norway  1 month ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
About the job
About The Job

We are seeking a highly motivated postdoctoral fellow to join our team for a two-year fellowship position. The primary objective of this position is to qualify for senior academic roles while contributing to the project "SIMPLEX: The role of simulation in assurance of intelligent and complex systems". This collaborative initiative involves DNV, Zeabuz, and NTNU, and focuses on the development of a comprehensive framework for simulation-based testing of autonomous systems.

The need for new sustainable modes of urban transportation is driven by factors such as growing coastal cities, congested roads, increased demand for personal mobility, the establishment of zero-emission zones in urban areas, and the general public's call for sustainable transport solutions. To address this, one promising solution is the utilization of urban waterways for small and medium-sized electric passenger ferries. However, realizing the potential benefits of these ferries hinges on reducing or eliminating the need for on-board manning. Despite the rapid development of technology for autonomous passenger ferries, the lack of trust in their safety remains a primary obstacle to their widespread deployment.

The main goal of the SIMPLEX project is to address this challenge by developing a framework for holistic simulation-based testing of autonomous systems that will help build the trust needed to deploy the systems into society.

The postdoc's role in the project will be to contribute to this framework by focusing on the development of methods and tools for automatic simulation-based testing. This includes the building and automatic adaptation of relevant scenarios, developing ways of ensuring sufficient scenario exploration and coverage, and research how to evaluate test outcome automatically in an efficient manner. The candidate will also contribute towards testing the developed tools and methods on real-world use cases focused on urban passenger ferry systems.

You will work within an interesting research project, benefiting from cooperation with highly engaged and diverse industrial partners. The main supervisor is Associate Professor Børge Rokseth who has a background in system modelling and simulation, system safety assessment and system assurance. The immediate leader is Prof. Sebastien Gros, Head of Dept. of Cybernetics.

Duties of the position

Develop and Refine Framework: Develop and refine a comprehensive framework that combines safety requirements and automatic testing of autonomous systems. This includes designing methodologies, algorithms, and tools to ensure that safety requirements are met and to identify any potential weaknesses in the system. Focus on creating innovative approaches for scenario generation and exploration, ensuring a wide range of test scenarios are covered to thoroughly evaluate the performance and safety of autonomous systems.
Collaborative Work: Collaborate closely with DNV and Zeabuz to understand their requirements, develop relevant tools and methodologies, and integrate them into their work processes and simulators, ensuring practical applicability and industry relevance.
Use Case Demonstrations: Collaborate with the project team to demonstrate the developed framework on specific use cases within the SIMPLEX project. This involves selecting appropriate scenarios, executing simulations, and analyzing the results to validate the capabilities of the testing framework.
Publication and Dissemination: Actively publish research findings in reputable scientific journals and present at relevant conferences to contribute to the academic community's knowledge in the field. Ensure effective dissemination of research outcomes and insights to research partners within the SIMPLEX consortium, fostering collaboration and knowledge exchange.
Supervision and Mentoring: Assist in supervising and mentoring master students involved in the project. Provide guidance, support, and technical expertise to ensure their successful contribution to the research objectives.
Continuous Learning and Professional Development: Stay updated on the latest advancements in autonomous systems, simulation techniques, and safety assurance methods. Engage in professional development activities, attend relevant workshops or training, and actively participate in discussions and forums related to the field.

Required Selection Criteria

You must have completed a Norwegian doctoral degree or corresponding foreign doctoral degree recognized as equivalent to a Norwegian PhD, in a field relevant to the goals of this position, for example: formal verification, systems engineering, system modelling and simulation, control engineering, or computer science. If you can document that the PhD thesis has been submitted, your application can be assessed even if you have not yet defended your dissertation. Documentation of the obtained doctoral degree must be presented before you can take up the position.
You must have experience in scientific computing within development environments such as Python and/or C++.
Good oral and written English.

The appointment is to be made in accordance with Regulations on terms of employment for positions such as postdoctoral fellow, Ph.D Candidate, research assistant and specialist candidate.

Preferred Selection Criteria

Industrial or academic experience with modelling and simulation, simulation-based testing, smart testing or system verification activities.
Industrial or academic experience with autonomous system development within robotics, autonomous driving or other relevant fields. 
Good collaborative skills as the candidate will work closely with other people in the project.
Good track record of publications in reputable journals. 

Personal characteristics

Motivation and a desire to make an impact on the development and application of autonomous systems. 
Adaptive and oriented towards finding solutions.
Good at communication.

Emphasis will be placed on personal and interpersonal qualities.

We offer 

exciting and stimulating tasks in a strong international academic environment 
an open and  inclusive work environment with dedicated colleagues 
favourable terms in the Norwegian Public Service Pension Fund 
 employee benefits 

Salary and conditions

As a Postdoctoral Fellow (code 1352) you are normally paid from gross NOK 604 900 per annum before tax, depending on qualifications and seniority. From the salary, 2% is deducted as a contribution to the Norwegian Public Service Pension Fund.

The period of employment is 2 years.

The engagement is to be made in accordance with the regulations in force concerning State Employees and Civil Servants , and the acts relating to Control of the Export of Strategic Goods, Services and Technology. Candidates who by assessment of the application and attachment are seen to conflict with the criteria in the latter law will be prohibited from recruitment to NTNU.

After the appointment you must assume that there may be changes in the area of work.

It is a prerequisite you can be present at and accessible to the institution on a daily basis.

About The Application

The application and supporting documentation to be used as the basis for the assessment must be in English.

Publications and other scientific work must follow the application. Please note that your application will be considered based solely on information submitted by the application deadline. You must therefore ensure that your application clearly demonstrates how your skills and experience fulfil the criteria specified above.

If, for any reason, you have taken a career break or have had an atypical career and wish to disclose this in your application, the selection committee will take this into account, recognizing that the quantity of your research may be reduced as a result.

The Application Must Include

CV and certificates 
Transcripts and diplomas for bachelor's-, master's- and PhD degrees. If you have not yet completed your Ph.D, you must provide confirmation on your estimated date for the doctoral dissertation, or that your PhD thesis has been submitted
A copy of the doctoral thesis. If you are close to submitting, or have recently submitted your thesis, you can attach a draft of the thesis. Documentation of a completed doctoral degree must be presented before taking up the position.
Academic works - published or unpublished - that you would like to be considered in the assessment
Name and contact information of three referees.

If all, or parts, of your education has been taken abroad, we also ask you to attach documentation of the scope and quality of your entire education. Description of the documentation required can be found here . If you already have a statement from NOKUT, please attach this as well.

Joint works will be considered. If it is difficult to identify your contribution to joint works, you must attach a brief description of your participation.

In the evaluation of which candidate is best qualified, emphasis will be placed on education, experience and personal and interpersonal qualities. Motivation, ambitions, and potential will also count in the assessment of the candidates.

NTNU is committed to following evaluation criteria for research quality according to The San Francisco Declaration on Research Assessment - DORA.

General information 

Working at NTNU

NTNU believes that inclusion and diversity is a strength. We want our faculty and staff to reflect Norway’s culturally diverse population and we continuously seek to hire the best minds. This enables NTNU to increase productivity and innovation, improve decision making processes, raise employee satisfaction, compete academically with global top-ranking institutions and carry out our social responsibilities within education and research. NTNU emphasizes accessibility and encourages qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender identity, ability status, periods of unemployment or ethnic and cultural background.

NTNU is working actively to increase the number of women employed in scientific positions and has a number of resources to promote equality .

The city of Trondheim is a modern European city with a rich cultural scene. Trondheim is the innovation capital of Norway with a population of 200,000. The Norwegian welfare state, including healthcare, schools, kindergartens and overall equality, is probably the best of its kind in the world. Professional subsidized day-care for children is easily available. Furthermore, Trondheim offers great opportunities for education (including international schools) and possibilities to enjoy nature, culture and family life and has low crime rates and clean air quality.

As an employee at NTNU, you must continually maintain and improve your professional development and be flexible regarding any organizational changes.

A public list of applicants with name, age, job title and municipality of residence is prepared after the application deadline. If you want to reserve yourself from entry on the public applicant list, this must be justified. Assessment will be made in accordance with current legislation . You will be notified if the reservation is not accepted.

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Associate Professor Børge Rokseth, telephone 922 42 259, email: borge.rokseth@ntnu.no . If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please contact HR consultant Berit Dahl, e-mail: berit.dahl@ntnu.no .

If you think this looks interesting and in line with your qualifications, please submit your application electronically via jobbnorge.no with your CV, diplomas and certificates attached. Applications submitted elsewhere will not be considered. Upon request, you must be able to obtain certified copies of your documentation.

Application deadline: 15.10.2023. 

NTNU

NTNU - knowledge for a better world

The Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU) creates knowledge for a better world and solutions that can change everyday life.

Department of Engineering Cybernetics (ITK)

Engineering cybernetics is the study of automatic control and monitoring of dynamic systems. We develop the technologies of tomorrow through close cooperation with industry and academia, both in Norway and internationally. The Department contributes to the digitalization, automation and robotization of society. The Department of Engineering Cybernetics is one of seven departments in the Faculty of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering .

About the job
Do you want to play a role in the transition to sustainable energy production?

At Aker Solutions we are committed to helping the energy industry and broader society #PowerTheChange towards a low-carbon future.Our ambitions are high. By 2030, renewables and low-carbon solutions for oil and gas will make up two-thirds of our business. Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?

The Life Cycle segment takes care of energy assets in a Life Cycle perspective. From the start to end of production, Life Cycle ensure safe operations. Our objective is to be a leading supplier of low carbon solutions and electrification projects. We focus on optimizing field life solutions, driven by decarbonization and environmentally sound offerings.

Our Reliability & Maintenance department in Stavanger is now looking for Graduate and Young Professionals Reliabilty & Maintenance Engineer to help us in our mission to #powerthechange.

What will you be doing?
As a graduate in 2024 in Aker Solutions, you will be a part of a graduate program. This includes professional network, meet other graduates across locations and visit to our headquarter and one of our yards
As a permanent employee in Aker Solutions, you will participate in project teams that proudly deliver world class projects. You will work together with some of our most experienced and knowledgeable engineers and gain valuable experience
You will be joining a dedicated team of engineers and learn the methods as you go
You will be involved in a wide variety of projects ranging from smaller Front End Studies to Major Modification Projects and various Specialist Services
Training will be given and you will receive a mentor to guide you while developing your skills
Main Tasks Will Typically Touch The Following Competence Areas
Reliability & Maintenance engineering analysis/assessments
Calendar-based maintenance development and implementation
Condition-based maintenance (incl. predictive and prescriptive) development and implementation
Inspection and integrity engineering 
We Think You Should Have
Student graduating in 2024 or recent years
Area of study relevant to the role you are applying for
If you like to like to plan, manage and execute tasks you will thrive in this role
Being proactive and have the ability take initiative are great personal skills that will be appreciated in this role
You will be given all the tools you need to succeed, and the rest is up to you!
More Reasons To Work With Us
As an employee in Aker Solutions, you have many career opportunities. We ensure that our employees get the chance to work across disciplines, build expertise and develop their own potential. This contributes to a vibrant and engaged working environment at all our locations.
A healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your life journey
Competitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker Care
Access to welfare club with free gym facilities, sports equipment hire and cabins for rent in the mountains and by the sea
You will be a part of our Solutioneers, an international employee network that brings together our young talents for professional development, networking and fun. In addition, Aker offer a wide range of welfare activities and training options for all our employees.
We can promise you it will be both challenging and fun!
Interested? Contact us.

Please send us a motivation letter together with your CV and transcript by 29.10.2023 If you are currently enrolled in a program, you can send a preliminary grade transcript. Please note that applications without a diploma/transcript will not be evaluated. Background checks will be performed on final candidates. For questions about the position, please contact: Christer Knag, Junior Recruiter NES Advantage Solutions, tel. +47 980 87 641 christer.knag@nesfircroft.com

NES Advantage is Aker Solutions’ global recruitment services provider responsible for permanent and temporary staffing service.

Diversity and Inclusion

Aker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce. We ensure a good working environment where equal opportunity, diversity and inclusion are considered vital to our success. We believe diversity creates value, attracts talent, and makes life more interesting. We therefore encourage and welcome applications from diverse backgrounds related to race, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender, ethnicity, disability, age, and more.

This is Aker Solutions

Aker Solutions delivers integrated solutions, products and services to the global energy industry. We enable low-carbon oil and gas production and develop renewable solutions to meet future energy needs. By combining innovative digital solutions and predictable project execution we accelerate the transition to sustainable energy production. Aker Solutions employs approximately 15,000 people in more than 20 countries.

About the job
Ascom er et selskap hvor du vil kunne samarbeide med alle deler av verdistrømmen, fra utvikling til salg, markedsføring, produksjon og tjenestelevering. Hvis du er motivert av å gjøre en reell forskjell i arbeidet ditt og tror på teknologi med mening, er du sannsynligvis en av oss!

Blir du motivert av å gjøre en reell forskjell i arbeidet ditt? Er du opptatt av teknologi 
med mening? Da er du sannsynligvis en av oss! Ascom vokser, og vi har mange spennende prosjekter hos våre kunder i spesialisthelsetjenesten og de fire regionale helseforetak, samt kommunale kunder innen helse og omsorg. 

Et sentralt aspekt i arbeidet er et ønske om å skape kundeverdi i alt vi gjør. Dette 
innebærer at vi tar kalkulerte risikoer, er nysgjerrige, kreative, lidenskapelige og 
inspirerende. Vi tilbyr et åpent og internasjonalt miljø, der vår kultur reflekteres av Vi er Ascom ; kundefokus, engasjement, innovasjon og teamarbeid. Vi er ca. 50 ansatte som holder til i nyere flotte lokaler på Alnabru i Oslo.
 Vi kan tilby deg:
◾ En sentral rolle med stor handlefrihet i et selskap i vekst.
◾ Spennende prosjekter hos Norges største kunder innen helse og omsorg.
◾ En spennende arbeidsgiver med solide verdier og et viktig samfunnsoppdrag.
◾ Et inkluderende og internasjonalt arbeidsmiljø.
◾ Konkurransedyktige betingelser
Vi har akkurat ansatt en applikasjonsforvalter men vi trenger enda en i vårt Applikasjonsteam! Vi styrke vår serviceavdeling og forbedrer oppfølgning av 
eksisterende kunder med ytterligere en ressurs. Arbeidet skjer remote og onsite.
 Arbeidsoppgaver:
◾ Tilrettelegging, forberedelser, konfigurering og utrulling av og mellom Ascoms applikasjoner og kundenes servere i prosjekter hvor det benyttes Microsoft plattform med Asp.Net og MSSQL. Dette kan også være feilsøk, forslag til rettinger, skriving av spesifikasjoner ol.
◾ Kommunikasjon med utviklere, teknikere, kunder på norsk, svensk, dansk og 
engelsk.
◾ Feilsøking gjennom logger og verktøy.
◾ Opplæring av kunder og kollegaer i Ascoms løsninger.
◾ Utarbeidelse av teknisk dokumentasjon.
 Kompetanse/personlige egenskaper:
◾ Du kan gjerne ha en Bachelor i IT, som for eksempel Anvendt data, IT og informasjonssystemer, el. eller tilsvarende kompetanse innen tele, data eller elektro.
◾ Du må ha genuin teknisk interesse, forståelse og ønske om å lære mer.
◾ Du må kunne skrive og kommunisere godt og flytende på norsk og engelsk.
◾ Du må trives med å arbeide prosjektorientert i tverrfaglige team sammen.
◾ Du må være serviceinnstilt og kundeorientert og like å snakke med mennesker.

snarest. Vi ser frem til å høre fra deg!

name_location: Energy Jobline · Stjørdal, Trøndelag, Norway Reposted  2 days ago  · 4 applicants
job_description:
About the job
As a summer intern at Equinor, you will join 22,000 colleagues delivering oil, gas, wind, and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. By 2050, we aim to become a net-zero company and provide the energy the world needs without contributing to global warming. It is one of the defining challenges of our time, and attracting and developing the brightest minds will be critical to our success.

The position

Our summer internship is a 6-week programme designed to provide the experience and skills you need in your studies and future career. Our Norwegian and UK internship will begin on 17 June and ends on 02 August 2024, with one week off starting 15 July.

You can find out more about the programme at www.equinor.com/careers/summer-interns

By Joining This Position Within Process And Chemical Engineering, Interns May, In Addition To The Common Summer Internship Programme, Be Offered Technical Challenges, Tasks And Group Work Within One Of The Three Following Business Areas

Technology, Digitalisation & Innovation
Exploration and Production Norway
Marketing, Midstream and Processing

Your exact assignment will be decided based on our business needs, combined with your field of expertise and your interests, and may comprise.

Operational support and tasks related to operation, maintenance and modification on plants onshore and offshore, or
Participation in research and technology development projects within gas production, carbon capture and storage (CCS) and low carbon solutions (Hydrogen, Ammonia and low carbon fuels). Relevant tasks include simulations, digitalization of process data, experimental work, field data analysis and conceptual design studies.

You

Some Qualities Are Essential For Equinor. You Identify With Our Values, Open, Collaborative, Courageous And Caring, Which Guide Our Decisions And Help Us Succeed And Grow. You Make Safety Your Priority And Contribute To Our Zero-harm Culture. For This Position, We Are Also Looking For

 Currently studying for Bachelor’s, Master’s degree, or Ph.D. with a strong academic record within Process technology, Energy technology, Chemical engineering, Fluid Mechanics, Multiphase flow, Physics, Cybernetics and other related technical disciplines.
 Fluent in English and preferably a second working language.
 No more than two years of relevant full-time work experience.
 Have completed at least two years of higher education before the internship programme starts (17 June 2024).
 Have at least one year of higher education left after the internship programme ends (02 August 2024).
 The interns need to be located in the country where the internship takes place during its entire duration. Equinor does not support any relocation for our summer interns.
 Candidates must have the necessary work permit for the country in which they are applying for a position. The work permits must be valid at the point of application and for the duration of the employment. Please note that Equinor does not support, or sponsor work or visa permits for internship applications. Read more about it on the national authorities’ pages: Norway
 Extracurricular activities and/or voluntary work are an advantage.

Skills

Every role and business area requires its own specific set of skills and personal attributes. Some of the qualities and characteristics we look for include:

 An awareness of risk and a commitment to safety for yourself and those around you.
 Effective communication skills and the ability to facilitate collaboration, influence stakeholders, and contribute to a diverse and inclusive culture.
 The flexibility to adapt to change, embrace new technology, and perform in a digitally enabled environment.
 Demonstrating a curious mind and the ability to problem-solve, innovate, and identify new ways of delivering against our objectives.

Equinor is an equal opportunities employer. We welcome applications from all candidates who meet the educational and experience requirements, including those with disabilities. If you have any specific requirements for any stage in our process, please make this clear in your application, and our team will be happy to support you.

General information

Please make sure that when applying, you attach the following:

 CV/ resume in English
 transcripts of records (or other documents describing subjects and grades) in English or Scandinavian language obtained to this point during your studies. If you are in the process of completing a degree, please upload an official temporary transcript.

Applications submitted without these attachments will unfortunately not be evaluated. To ensure an efficient recruitment process, please be informed that you may apply for a maximum of 3 Summer Internship roles per country.

Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process. Candidates will be asked for information on affiliation to high-risk countries for a security assessment. Furthermore, background checks are performed on all final candidates and all permanent and temporary hires will be screened against relevant sanctions lists to ensure compliance with sanctions law.

About the job
Om rollen

Vi ser etter en som kan bygge opp og lede vårt “Farmer Success" team! Du brenner for å gjøre bondens hverdag enklere og sikre at våre brukere elsker produktet og tjenesten vår. Ansvaret som leder av vårt Farmer Success team strekker seg fra å sørge for at kunder får god opplæring, gi kontinuerlig støtte, hjelpe til med mersalg og sikre fremtidige abonnementsinntekter. Farmer success blir også bøndenes stemme i selskapet og skal sørge for at tilbakemeldinger og behov er med når vi videreutvikler produktet.

Identifisere og implementere forbedringer i prosessene våre.
Systemansvar for vår plattform for kundesupport.

Dette er en spennende mulighet for deg som ønsker å jobbe med å forbedre kundesupport og styrke vårt forhold til kundene våre.

B.sc eller m.sc i teknisk fag eller markedsføring

Empatisk og flink med folk

name_location: Bouvet ASA · Bergen, Vestland, Norway  5 days ago  · 2 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Brenner du for innovasjon og å forbedre digitale tjenester i samfunnet? Ønsker du å jobbe i tverrfaglige team med spennende og utfordrende IT-prosjekter? Ja, da vil vi høre fra deg! Vi i Bouvet jobber både med små og store kunder, offentlige og private, og er genuint opptatt av å skape verdi for våre kunder, samtidig som vi har en kontinuerlig faglig utvikling. Vi er en gjeng fra ulike fagområder, som til sammen danner et av Bergens beste og triveligste fagmiljø. Dette er vi stolte av, og vi brenner for solide løsninger og fornøyde kunder.

For å møte økt etterspørsel fra våre kunder søker vi etter nye kollegaer med erfaring innenfor prosessledelse, med relevant utdannelse fra universitet eller høyskole.

I Bouvet har vi en raus og inkluderende kultur der fokus er på fellesskap, fremfor at hver og en tenker på seg selv. Fellesskapet bygger vi blant annet gjennom våre mange sosiale og faglige aktiviteter. Vi praktiserer overskuddsdeling og har et unikt aksjeprogram for alle ansatte. Vår kompetanse er det vi lever av og vi setter høye krav til faglig dyktighet hos våre ansatte. Vi søker hele tiden utfordrende oppgaver og vi tilbyr kurs og faglig utvikling. I tillegg «leker» vi mye med ny og spennende teknologi.

Vi Ønsker

Du er opptatt av prosess- eller prosjektledelse som fag og vil kontinuerlig utvikle deg innenfor dette.
Du har relevant erfaring innen prosessledelse, prosessutvikling eller prosessmodellering.
Du trives godt med utvikling og vedlikehold av arbeidsprosesser og kvalitetssystemer
Du jobber for å sikre felles metodikk for prosessutforming, etterlevelse og kontinuerlig forbedring av definerte prosesser
Du ønsker å utvikle deg innen stakeholder management og fasilitering
Du trives med å gjøre andre gode og bidra til å få et team bestående av ulike fagdisipliner til å fungere.
Vi ser gjerne at du har en teknisk bakgrunn og at du er opptatt av teknologiske trender og utvikling.
Vi ønsker at du har eller ønsker å utvikle flere faglige bein å stå på. Dette kan være innenfor fagområder som rådgivning, endringsledelse, arkitektur eller testing.

Det er viktig at du setter fellesskap og samarbeid høyt da dette er kjerneverdier for oss. Du må trives med å jobbe tverrfaglig og gjerne ute i prosjekter hos våre kunder.

Vi har oppdrag hos mange av Norges mest spennende selskaper, og får ta del i utformingen av fremtidens løsninger.

Er dette noe du synes virker spennende? Vi gleder oss til å høre fra deg.

name_location: KONGSBERG · Kongsberg, Viken, Norway  3 weeks ago  · 11 applicants
job_description:
About the job
An exciting opportunity has arisen as Principal Engineer Network and Security. In this role, you will be a part of the front-end team in our Emerging Markets organization steering the direction of studies, feeds, and tenders as part of our expanding KM Offshore Production Systems.

As our Principal Network and Security Engineer, you'll be at the forefront of defining and driving our network and security architecture in critical sectors such as Safety and Automation Systems (SAS) in the offshore energy market, ICSS in the FPSO market and the ever-evolving offshore wind market. You will be a pivotal contributor to our ambitious projects in delivering large scale industrial technical network solutions and pioneering OT infrastructure initiatives.

Key Accountabilities

Design and develop resilient and secure network architectures tailored to the unique needs of the offshore energy and maritime industry.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate OT infrastructure seamlessly with our ICSS, SAS, and SCADA solutions.
Ensure our systems are compliant and ahead of industry standards, with a particular emphasis on IEC 62443.
Provide expert insights and thought leadership on emerging technologies, ensuring Kongsberg Maritime remains at the cutting edge.
Mentor and guide other team members, helping them to elevate their technical proficiency and problem-solving skills.

Qualifications And Experience

Deep expertise in network design and security, especially within OT infrastructure.
Knowledgeable with IEC 62443 and a commitment to stay updated with its evolving standards.
A proactive approach, with the ability to lead and inspire teams towards achieving common goals.
Prior experience or keen interest in the offshore energy or maritime sector would be advantageous.
Bachelor or Master within relevant field, relevant experience can compensate for formal education.

Security Requirements

This employment requires security clearance by the Norwegian National Security Authority. The successful candidate may start work with limited accesses whilst the clearance is being processed. For more information visit www.nsm.no.

You are able to

act on own initiative, make things happen and accept responsibility for the results
identify commercial opportunities and you have a strong positive impact on business growth and profitability
understand the organization's informal rules and structures and utilize political processes effectively to get things done
communicate in a clear, precise and structured way

What We Can Offer

An exciting and important position working for the world-leading supplier of maritime solutions
International work environment and multidisciplinary team collaboration
Professional development and career opportunities
To take part in the green shift for the ocean space
We offer hybrid working arrangement

Work location

Kongsberg

Point of contact

Thomas Andreassen

Kongsberg Maritime is a technology pioneer, enabling a more sustainable future for our oceans. Our zero-emission integrated technologies advance the maritime industry and solve our customers' toughest problems. With unmatched competence, domain knowledge, innovation, and market reach, we are the trusted maritime partner. Headquartered in Kongsberg, Norway, the company has manufacturing, sales and service facilities in 35 countries

Our Automation & Control division develops technology, products, and solutions applicable for maritime vessels and offshore production units. We look at the ocean space as our operating area where we deliver a wide range of products and services. Our deliveries ranges from single products to fully integrated systems and solutions. Automation & Control serve a wide range of market segments. Through our comprehensive portfolio of offerings Automation & Control has been recognized as a world leader in our core markets for the last decades.

KONGSBERG is a leading global technology group. Throughout our proud two hundred year history, we have continuously advanced, applying innovative solutions to the needs of our customers, partners and society at large. We believe diversity is our strength. By fostering an inclusive and diverse culture we nurture and ensure space for different perspectives and ideas. We work determined to mature and improve our ability to utilize our diversity and culture of differences to create positive business results.

Protechting people and planet

job_description:
About the job
GodtlevertGruppen AS er Norges største matkasseprodusent og leverer hjem til kunder i hele Norge. Nå er vi på utkikk etter medarbeidere til å pakke matkassene på Furuset. Vi ser etter personer som er fleksible og kan jobbe for å sikre at leveransene er klare i tide. 

Vil du være med å produsere Norges største matkasse?

Har du erfaring fra produksjonsbedrift? Er du arbeidsvillig og pålitelig? Da er det kanskje DIN søknad vi venter på!

Vi er på jakt etter positive medarbeidere som vil være med å pakke matkasser, og å håndtere varer inn og ut av lageret.

For å jobbe hos oss må du

Jobbe effektivt og strukturert
Være ansvarlig, nøyaktig og pålitelig
Bidra til et godt arbeidsmiljø for alle
Kunne kommunisere godt på norsk eller engelsk
Være i god fysisk form, kunne jobbe i 2 - 4oC og være over 18 år

Hovedvekten av vår produksjon foregår torsdag og fredag, både på dagtid og kveldstid. I perioder med stor pågang vil det også være behov for produksjon i helgene. Det er viktig at du kan være fleksibel og tilpasse deg ulike arbeidstider.

Vi ansetter medarbeidere som skal jobbe to dager i uken, primært torsdag og fredag i 40% stilling. I perioder kan det være mulig å jobbe mer.

Det er fint om du har erfaring med å jobbe i produksjon eller på lager.

Det er også en fordel om du har truckførerbevis.

Søknadsfrist: Vi vurderer søknader fortløpende. Dette betyr at annonsen kan bli tatt ned før søknadsfristen utløper dersom vi finner de riktige kandidatene.

Cheffelo was founded in 2008 with the vision of simplifying everyday life by offering a large variety of inspiring meals delivered directly to our customers’ front door. Today, we are the largest supplier of meal kits in the Nordic region and consider ourselves a leader in Scandinavian “food tech”. We are located in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark under the brands Linas Matkasse, Godtlevert, Adams matkasse and Retnemt.

We at Cheffelo go to work every day to deliver customized meal solutions with everything failies need to prepare tasty, inspirational and varied meals from high-quality, locally grown ingredients. Our mission is to innovate the mealtime experience and let people enjoy homemade dinners together.

job_title: Quality Hotel Skifer søker ny hotelldirektør
name_location: Strawberry (formerly Nordic Choice Hotels) · Oppdal, Trøndelag, Norway  1 week ago  · 4 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Det er en grunn til at det er akkurat du som ønsker å jobbe i Strawberry. Du ser muligheter på våre 100 destinasjoner. Du tror du vil passe inn i vårt mangfold blant 18.000 ansatte. Du er spent på våre fantastiske hotellkjeder og du har energi, mot og begeistring så det holder. Vil du vite mer om oss? Vi gleder oss til å høre fra deg! Quality Hotel™ er en del av Strawberry.

Quality Hotel Skifer søker en sulten og engasjert direktør med en sterk

forretningsforståelse og et lidenskapelig engasjement for bransjen. Som

direktør vil en være ansvarlig for å lede, utvikle og drive hotellet med fokus

på å oppnå utmerkede gjesteopplevelser, optimalisert drift og bærekraftig

vekst.

 Erfaring og kompetanse: Vi søker en kandidat med relevant erfaring innen hotellbransjen, inkludert ledelse, operativ drift og helst innen mat og drikke, økonomistyring, salgsfokus og gjesteservice. Erfaring med implementering de strategier som styret gir og som er viktig for å sikre lønnsomhet og suksess.
 Ledelsesstil: Du må ha en sterk og inspirerende ledelsesstil som fremmer samarbeid, utvikling og motivasjon blant teamet. Evnen til å delegere ansvar effektivt og sette klare mål er avgjørende for å oppnå overordnede mål.
 Gjestefokus: Vi legger stor vekt på å skape minneverdige opplevelser for våre gjester. Som direktør skal du være dedikert til å opprettholde høy servicekvalitet og gjestetilfredshet gjennom effektiv opplæring og motivasjon av personalet. Tilstedeværelse er avgjørende.
 Resultatorientering: Du må ha erfaring med å oppnå forretningsmål, kostnadskontroll, inntektsøkning og optimalisering av driftseffektivitet. Evnen til å analysere og tolke nøkkelindikatorer for ytelse er avgjørende for å gjøre velinformerte beslutninger, gjennom eksisterende systemer hotellet har.
 Bærekraft og samfunnsansvar: Vi søker en leder som forstår viktigheten av bærekraftig drift og sosialt ansvar. Evnen til å gjennomføre bærekraftige praksiser og bidra positivt til lokalsamfunnet vil være en fordel.
 Kommunikasjon og relasjonsbygging: Sterke kommunikasjonsferdigheter, både internt og eksternt, er nødvendig for å etablere gode relasjoner med gjester, ansatte, styret, samarbeidspartnere og lokale interessenter.
 Innovasjon og utvikling: Vi søker en kreativ og nyskapende leder som kan identifisere nye forretningsmuligheter, iverksette innovasjon i tjenesteleveransen og kontinuerlig utvikle hotellets tilbud for å møte gjestenes behov.

Lønn: etter avtale

Søknadsfrist: Vi vurdere søknader fortløpende

For mer informasjon, kontakt styreleder Rune Nordstokke på epost: rune.nordstokke@oppdal.com eller mob 99 38 92 33

Litt om hotellet: Quality Hotel Skifer på Oppdal, åpnet i 2010, og har opplevd betydelig vekst og utvikling i denne perioden. Hotellet drifter nå 177 rom, en stor konferanseavdeling, flere spisesteder, inkludert Alpenhaus Oppdal, som ligger i nærheten av hotellet. I tillegg har vi også vårt eget aktivitetssenter, Carousell by Alpenhaus. Vi er en del av Strawberry innenfor Quality-merket. Totalomsetningen er rundt 80 millioner kroner, og vi søker nå etter muligheter for ytterligere vekst.

About the job
I over 200 år har KONGSBERG laget løsninger som gjør det mulig for mennesker verden over å levere ekstrem ytelse under ekstreme forhold.

Ved avdelingen på Kjeller foregår det en spesialisert produksjon av deler til elektro optiske sensorer.

Vi har behov for å utvide vår produksjonskapasitet, og vi søker derfor etter deg som ønsker å bidra til vår spesialiserte produksjon på Kjeller.

Vi har spennende arbeidsoppgaver og du vil blant annet kunne jobbe med:

Utføre test av IR-sensorer
Utføre test av elektronikk komponenter
Prosessforbedringer
Utarbeidelse/oppdatere av prosessbeskrivelser og underlag
Vedlikeholde testmiljøer

Du Har

Ingeniør med teknisk bachelor, primært maskinteknikk/elektronikk/fysikk
Erfaring fra produktutvikling/produksjon er foretrukket.
Kjennskap til CAD-verktøy er en fordel

Du er PC kyndig og har evne til å omsette teori til praksis. Du er vant til å arbeide strukturert og selvstendig med et analytisk tankesett og problemløsende tilnærming til oppgaver. Du har også gode kommunikasjonsevner muntlig og skriftlig både i Norsk og Engelsk.

Vi Kan Tilby Deg

Arbeidssted på Kjeller med Norges mest spennende utviklingsoppgaver. Du får muligheten til å jobbe med produkter i verdensklasse i et høyteknologisk miljø med engasjerte og positive kolleger. Vi har gode parkeringsmuligheter, er lett tilgjengelig via kollektivtransport og kan tilby eget kontor. Vi har konkurransedyktige betingelser, pensjons- og forsikringsordninger, samt et fordelaktig aksjeprogram for deg som er ansatt. Vi tilbyr også firmahytter, rabatterte billetter til kultur- og sportsarrangementer og lignende.

Kandidater som søker på stillingen vil i forbindelse med rekrutteringsprosessen bli gjenstand for bakgrunnssjekk og vurdering av denne vil bli lagt til grunn ved valg av kandidat. For å være aktuell kandidat til stillingen må du kunne sikkerhetsklareres og autoriseres, jfr. Sikkerhetsloven.

Søknader behandles fortløpende så ikke nøl med å ta direkte kontakt om du har ytterligere spørsmål om stillingen - vi ser frem til å motta din søknad!

Missile Systems er en divisjon i Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace. Vårt hovedprodukt er avanserte sjømålsmissiler helt i verdensklasse. Vi utvikler, sammenstiller, tester og leverer missiler til fartøy, kystartilleri, helikopter og kampfly.

name_location: Aker Solutions · Stavanger, Rogaland, Norway  2 weeks ago  · 78 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Do you want to play a role in solving global energy challenges for future generations?

At Aker Solutions we are committed to helping the energy industry and broader society #PowerTheChange towards a low-carbon future.Our ambitions are high. By 2030, renewables and low-carbon solutions for oil and gas will make up two-thirds of our business. Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?

The Life Cycle segment takes care of energy assets in a Life Cycle perspective. From the start to end of production, Life Cycle ensure safe operations. Our objective is to be a leading supplier of low carbon solutions and electrification projects. We focus on optimizing field life solutions, driven by decarbonization and environmentally sound offerings.

Our Process department in Stavanger is now looking for Graduate and Young Professionals Process Engineer to help us in our mission to #powerthechange.

What will you be doing?
As a graduate in 2024 in Aker Solutions, you will be a part of a graduate program. This includes professional network, meet other graduates across locations and visit to our headquarter and one of our yards
As a permanent employee in Aker Solutions, you will participate in project teams that proudly deliver world class projects. You will work together with some of our most experienced and knowledgeable engineers and gain valuable experience
You will be joining a dedicated team of engineers and learn the methods as you go
You will be involved in a wide variety of projects ranging from smaller Front End Studies to Major Modification Projects and various Specialist Services
Training will be given and you will receive a mentor to guide you while developing your skills
Be part of develop discipline deliverables, such as; process simulations, P&ID, PFD, process datasheets, line sizing and line list, calculation and calculation reports, process and system documentation, and participate in HAZOP, design reviews and other relevant safety reviews
We Think You Should Have
Student graduating in 2024 or recent years
Area of study relevant to the role you are applying for
If you like to like to plan, manage and execute tasks you will thrive in this role
Being proactive and have the ability take initiative are great personal skills that will be appreciated in this role
You will be given all the tools you need to succeed, and the rest is up to you! 
More Reasons To Work With Us
As an employee in Aker Solutions, you have many career opportunities. We ensure that our employees get the chance to work across disciplines, build expertise and develop their own potential. This contributes to a vibrant and engaged working environment at all our locations.
A healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your life journey
Competitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker Care
Access to welfare club with free gym facilities, sports equipment hire and cabins for rent in the mountains and by the sea
You will be a part of our Solutioneers, an international employee network that brings together our young talents for professional development, networking and fun. In addition, Aker offer a wide range of welfare activities and training options for all our employees.
We can promise you it will be both challenging and fun!
Interested? Contact us.

About

Please send us a motivation letter together with your CV and transcript by 29.10.2023 If you are currently enrolled in a program, you can send a preliminary grade transcript. Please note that applications without a diploma/transcript will not be evaluated. Background checks will be performed on final candidates. For questions about the position, please contact:

Christer Knag, Junior Recruiter NES Advantage Solutions, tel. +47 980 87 641 christer.knag@nesfircroft.com

NES Advantage is Aker Solutions’ global recruitment services provider responsible for permanent and temporary staffing service.

Diversity and Inclusion

Aker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce. We ensure a good working environment where equal opportunity, diversity and inclusion are considered vital to our success. We believe diversity creates value, attracts talent, and makes life more interesting. We therefore encourage and welcome applications from diverse backgrounds related to race, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender, ethnicity, disability, age, and more.

This is Aker Solutions

Aker Solutions delivers integrated solutions, products and services to the global energy industry. We enable low-carbon oil and gas production and develop renewable solutions to meet future energy needs. By combining innovative digital solutions and predictable project execution we accelerate the transition to sustainable energy production. Aker Solutions employs approximately 15,000 people in more than 20 countries.

name_location: Equinor · Stavanger, Rogaland, Norway Reposted  2 weeks ago  · 41 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Overview

 Job ID- 25981 
 Country- Norway 
 Location(s)- Stavanger, Bergen, Oslo, Harstad, Stjørdal 
 Company- Equinor ASA 
 Contact Name- graduaterecruitment@equinor.com 
 Workplace- Onshore 
 Discipline- Subsurface 
 Education Preferred- Master's Degree or PhD 
 Experience Preferred- Less than 2 years 
 Closing Date- Oct 16 2023 

Job Description

As a graduate at Equinor, you’ll be joining 21,000 colleagues delivering oil, gas, wind, and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. By 2050, we aim to become a net-zero company and deliver the energy the world needs without contributing to global warming. It’s one of the defining challenges of our time and attracting and developing the brightest minds will be critical to our success. 

The programme lasts for 2-years and includes rotations of 3-12 months across functions, business areas or locations.

The position

Subsurface ensures that Equinor finds, matures, and manages its energy resources in a profitable, competitive, safe and energy efficient manner. As a data scientist or data manager in the subsurface network, you will work and deliver within a multidisciplinary team and build your competence together with your colleagues across traditional oil and gas and new energy areas in low carbon solutions and offshore wind.

You will have the opportunity to work with a variety of projects developing your digital and data knowledge and integrate it with other key subsurface disciplines. Subsurface resources will also contribute to technology development and implementation projects .

By joining our Subsurface Data & Digital team you will have the opportunity to-

 Work on world class projects that use digital to drive efficiency and innovation safely. 
 Be a part of multidiscipline diverse agile teams where professional development and having a good time are focus. 
 Use data engineering and analytical techniques to deliver better data and new insight to our users. 
 Manage data for some of our biggest Norwegian and International assets. 
 Contribute to bringing data from current systems to integrated next generation cloud-based solutions. 

We're looking for people who want to join us and play a crucial role in the successful implementation of cloud, AI, and data engineering & management strategies in Subsurface. Your expertise and curiosity will be invaluable on this journey.

Whether you have a geosciences background and a passion for leveraging data and technology to make better decisions, or an IT or analytical education with a desire to tackle subsurface challenges, we want to hear from you.

You

Some qualities are essential for Equinor. You identify with our values, open, collaborative, courageous and caring, which guide our decisions and help us succeed and grow. You make safety your priority and contribute to our zero-harm culture. For this position, we are also looking for-

 Master’s degree or PhD with good academic record within Geosciences, Information Technology and Digitilisation , Information and Data Management. 
 Completed degree by the year of starting (2024). 
 Fluent in English. 
 No more than two years of relevant fulltime work experience. 
 Formal experience is not a requirement . 
 Extracurricular activities and/or voluntary work is an advantage. 

Your personal qualities-

 Ability to live by our safety and security expectations. 
 High ethical standards. 
 Good communication skills. 
 Global mindset. 
 Team player with the ability to work and deliver results in a diverse environment. 
 Have a positive attitude to take on new challenges and adapt to dynamic environments. 

Equinor is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all candidates who meet the educational and experience requirements, including candidates with disabilities. If you have any specific requirements for any stage in our process, then please make this clear in your application and our team will be happy to support you.

General information

Please make sure that when applying, you attach the following-

 CV/ resume in English. 
Transcripts of records (or other documents describing subjects and grades) in English or Scandinavian language obtained to this point during your studies. If you are in the process of completing a degree, please upload an official temporary transcript.

Applications submitted without these attachments will unfortunately not be evaluated.

To ensure an efficient recruitment process, please be informed that you may apply for a maximum of 3 Graduate roles per country.

Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process. Candidates will be asked for information on affiliation to high-risk countries for a security assessment. Furthermore, background checks are performed on all final candidates and all permanent and temporary hires will be screened against relevant sanctions lists to ensure compliance with sanctions law.

Why join us?

To succeed together, we all need to feel able to perform at our best . That’s why we offer-

 Learning and development. You’ll have access to on- the-job -training and mandatory physical and virtual learning modules, work rotations, networking opportunities and access to courses offered by our Equinor university. You’ll also get a buddy and a mentor to help you adapt and provide advice during the programme . 
 Wellness and work-life balance. Our benefits packages are designed to help you balance work and life at all stages of your career, including health insurance and other benefits for your physical and mental wellbeing, a flexible working policy and a global parental leave policy. We also provide access to holiday cabins in Norway and selected other locations. 
 An inclusive culture. An inclusive culture allows us to harness the unique experiences, knowledge, and backgrounds of our 21,000 employees . Ultimately, we believe we’ll be more creative, innovative, and resilient if everyone in Equinor feels safe in bringing their whole self and their ideas to work. 
 Financial rewards. Equinor’s compensation package includes competitive cash compensation and an opportunity to join our share savings plan. In most of our locations we offer pension arrangements aiming to safeguard our employees after retirement. 

For more information visit Equinor’s website-

name_location: Manpower Norway · Oslo, Oslo, Norway  5 days ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Har du lyst på spennende arbeidsoppgaver innenfor varehåndtering, ordreplukking og truckkjøring? Hos oss vil du spille en viktig rolle i å opprettholde et smidig og effektivt lagermiljø, med et hovedfokus på nøyaktighet og kvalitet.

For vår kunde i Oslo ser vi nå etter en gjeng med terminalmedarbeidere som kan hjelpe til i en travel periode inn mot jul. Hvis du kan jobbe fulltid fra slutten av oktober til slutten av desember - kan du her tjene gode penger, skaffe deg verdifulle referanser for fremtiden og utvide din kompetanse innenfor logistikk. Noe du kan nyte godt av, uansett hva fremtidsplanene dine er.

Her får du muligheten til å:

Prøve deg i arbeidslivet uten langvarig forpliktelse – perfekt for å utforske ulike karriereveier og super erfaring for å få et nytt spennende oppdrag fra Manpower.
Skaffe deg verdifull erfaring, bygge kompetanse og øve deg på å mestre hektiske situasjoner.
Arbeide i skift = varierte arbeidstider og gode lønnstillegg!
Bli en del av et miljø som vektlegger god oppfølging, opplæring og utvikling

Kort om stillingen:

Hos vår kunde finnes det flere forskjellige terminaler, og de har alle ulike arbeidsoppgaver å by på. Noen typiske oppgaver kan være:
Lasting og lossing av varer
Kontroll, skanning og sortering av varer
Avvikshåndtering og andre administrative oppgaver
Truckkjøring
Andre forefallende oppgaver på terminal

Hvem ser vi etter?

For å trives i jobben tror vi at du har et stort pågangsmot og en evne til å takle dager med høyt tempo. Du bør også være kvalitets- og sikkerhetsbevisst, og en lagspiller som samarbeider godt sammen med andre.

I tillegg til dette er det noen formelle krav som må oppfylles, hvor du må ha:

Fylt over 18 år
Plettfri vandel
Gode norskkunnskaper, både skriftlig og muntlig
Trucksertifikat for T1-T4 (eller være villig til å ta dette før oppstart, til et rabatert pris)

Høres dette interessant ut og du vil bli en del av gjengen vår? 

Da vil vi gjerne høre fra deg! Trykk på søk her og legg inn din CV. I søknadsprosessen trenger du kun å laste opp din CV og svare kort på noen stillingsrelaterte spørsmål. Søknadsbrev er ikke et krav, men du kan selvfølgelig laste det opp som et vedlegg om du ønsker.

Vi vurderer søkere fortløpende og søknadsfrist er søndag 22. oktober.

Vi ser frem til å høre fra deg!

name_location: 1X · Viken, Vestfold og Telemark, Norway  2 months ago  · 24 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Target start date: Autumn 2023

We are on the lookout for a self-driven CNC Programmer and Operation Specialist to join our team at 1X Technologies AS. Imagine being the person who starts up our brand new prototyping workshop. Your job is not going to be just to program the various CNC machines, but also to contribute to establishing the infrastructure of our internal machine park. This park will be used as an asset to continuously experiment with new products and to optimise the various designs for manufacturing. Picture yourself as a pivotal person in this venture, leading the way in turning engineering designs concepts into reality often within a single day.

Your in-depth expertise in 5-axis programming for mill/turn machines, proficiency with SIEMENS controllers, especially the SINUMERIK ONE controller, and hands-on experience with DMG Mori machines like the NTX and DMU series, will be your main asset to succeed in this job. In addition, machine simulation and collision detection are going to be the tools you will leverage daily, ensuring the transition from concept to reality is both swift and smooth.

If you harbor a passion for technology, data, and spearheading the future advancements in the robotics industry, this is your golden opportunity to leave a big mark in history!

About 1X

1X designs androids built to benefit society. Since 2014, we’ve been building androids with the product design mindset of safety first, balanced performance, and smart behavior. Our mission is to build androids that work alongside people to meet the world’s labor demand and build an abundant society. Our wheeled model, EVE, is engineered to work with you, from guarding to logistics, and our bipedal model, NEO, is designed to become a general-purpose android, with a broad deployment in various applications, and, eventually, assisted living.

Founded in Moss, Norway, 1X has grown into an international team with offices around the globe. We envision a bright new future: humans and androids, working and learning, Side by Side.

Why this job is exciting

You will help build and operate 1X’s first machine park - a world-class advanced prototyping and manufacturing asset.
Influence how our products are designed through making suggestions on modifications that allow for better manufacturability and higher volume production technologies
Fast paced environment: Ensure a quick turnaround for engineers - often within a day.

Roadmap 

Within first month, you will...

Get familiar with the portfolio and complexity of parts that build up our products
Define the machining strategy for each part, start setting up CAM and machine simulation
Programming our parts and machining them in the suitable machine (incl. Measuring that they are within spec)

Within three months, you will…

Be self-sufficient, and lead the programming/operation planning, execution and implementation of tasks relate to the implementation of the machine shop and CMM machine
Collaborate closely with R&D teams and drive the implementation of changes in design for better manufacturability
Own all processes (From CAD to the finished part on the table) related to the prototyping Machine Park in the company

Within one year, you will…

Be the go-to person related to the machining and low-volume production of parts
Manage a fully functioning machine park (incl. CNC machines, EDM equipment, a CMM machine)
Oversee the production of parts, ensuring quality and short lead times

Must-Haves:

Proven experience in CNC programming and operation, specifically with 5-axis programming for mill/turn machines.
Proficiency in working with CELOS with MAPPS, FANUC (F31iB5) and/or CELOS with HEIDENHAIN (TNC7) controller.
Skilled in machine simulation and capable of foreseeing potential collisions before machine operation.
Experience in working with lightweight materials such as Al, Mg alloys, Ti and others.
Ability to measure parts as they get made, often to a high degree of precision, to ensure they are within spec
Adhering to safety regulations and maintaining a clean and organized workspace.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and team collaboration skills.

Nice-To-Haves:

Experience with DMG Mori machines (NTX series and DMU series) will be considered a significant advantage.
CAMWorks Manufacturing Engineer Associate certificate and/or Mastercam Multiaxis Certificate or similar.
Hands-on experience in programming and operating CMM machines and other measurement methods relevant for quality checks of machined parts.
Assisting with troubleshooting and resolving machine-related issues promptly to minimize downtime.
Data-driven mindset and ability to analyze performance metrics, enabling data-based decision-making for process optimization and product design improvements (making changes to products to suit a particular manufacturing technology).

Interview Process

Introduction Stage - Initial conversations to get to know you better

[30m] Recruiter Screen with Win Yu
[45m] Hiring Manager Screen with Armin Parsian

Team Interview Stage - we then dive into your experience in more depth and introduce you to members of the team. This is also when you will do a take-home challenge

[60m] Technical Deep-Dive conversation with Csaba Hartmann and Armin Parsian

Final Interview Stage - we move you to our final round

[15m] Expectation management with Csaba Hartmann and Armin Parsian
[30m] Conversation with CEO Bernt Øivind Børnich

You are welcome to request additional conversations with anyone you would like to meet, but didn’t get to meet during the interview process.

Not sure if this is you?

If you’re excited about this role, but not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Location: 1XHQ, Moss

Our new headquarter in Moss, Norway, is a short train ride from Oslo. The machine shop is designed to be state-of-the-art, with a variety of 5-axis CNC and EDM machines and a quality lab with a CMM machine and other equipment. 1XHQ offers food, showers, and outdoor activities. All employees are supported with a comprehensive relocation package to handle all logistics. Join us in Moss, where performance meets great company culture.

Joining our team means becoming a valued member of one of the biggest brands in humanoid robotics, where you'll play a part in shaping the future of Androids.

Working at 1X

The ideas that express our team’s culture and how we work.

Be Nice

Collaboration is our driving force. Our team creates an open, trusting environment where everyone can be their most creative.

Stay Smart

A world-changing team needs the brightest minds in every discipline. This is where people come to work, learn, and grow to their full potential.

Make History

Everything we do gets us closer to one ambitious vision: general-purpose androids helping people around the globe. We believe what we build today will impact generations.

1X is an inclusive and equal-opportunity employer that values diversity. We consider all qualified applicants regardless of race, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected class. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don't hesitate to let us know during the interview process. We will do our best to accommodate your needs.

We're excited to have you on board!

name_location: COWI · Oslo, Oslo, Norway Reposted  4 days ago  · 25 applicants
job_description:
About the job

Application deadline: 18 October 2023 -
 Norway - Location: Oslo - Infrastructure & Transportation
  
Kick- start your career!
Do you want to elevate your knowledge and gain valuable experience from COWI – a frontrunner in sustainability? Join our summer internship, COWI Try! You’ll work with actual, on-going projects in close companionship with our leading experts on some of the most prestigious infrastructure, building and renewable energy projects in Norway.


Together with the other COWI Try students, you’ll participate in an innovation project. Working in interdisciplinary teams you will explore new and innovative solutions that push a sustainable development and liveable societies. Former COWI Try students say the internship provides valuable learning in a friendly workplace.


Sommerjobb for studenter | COWI Try


Who are we looking for?
We are looking for a Summer Intern Engineering Geologist to join COWI Try. Is this a description that suits you and your background?

Ongoing Masters (3rd -4th year) in engineering geology, rock mechanics or equivalent
You have good presentation skills in Norwegian and English (written and spoken)
The ability to work independently, while being a team player
Proactive attitude Confident with assigned responsibility
You are motivated by working with digital tools


On a day-to-day basis, you'll be working with:

Engineering geological mapping, consulting, design and engineering
Analysis of field data and geological modelling
Competence sharing through professional guidance, sparring and quality assurance
Contribute to the further development of the section and the subject area


We are strong believers in co-creation and think this is a great way for you to test your skills and gain valuable experience. As part of the COWI Try internship, you will get a dedicated buddy who will support you on professional tasks and include you in social activities. We genuinely care about our colleagues and want to create a safe environment for you to grow, develop and succeed. There are no stupid or wrong questions – only learning.


If you want to apply to this opportunity, we strongly recommend you do it as soon as possible. We are interviewing relevant candidates as they apply, so don’t hesitate and apply today. We are happy to receive your application in English or Norwegian.


The COWI Try internship program

COWI Try is our summer internship for students, which runs from mid-June to mid-August
The internship is paid
You will spend 70% of your time working on our ongoing projects
30% of the time you will participate in COWI Try's innovation project, where you develop innovative solutions together with the other summer students
You get a mentor who guides you through everyday tasks and includes you in social activities


Participating in COWI Try is a great way for you to get to know COWI, the industry and expand your professional network. It is also a good way for us to get to know you, and a possibility for you to start a career in COWI.


Got more questions?
If you have any unanswered questions about the role or what we have to offer, please reach out to Inger Søreide our Head of Section Geotechnics and Engineering Geology on IJSE@cowi.com


About the company
At COWI, we work together with our customers to shape a sustainable and liveable world. We do it by applying our knowledge and curiosity – and sometimes even our courage – to create the solutions the world needs today to enable a better tomorrow. That is why we say no to fossil fuel-based projects and aim to have 100 percent of our revenue come from activities that move our customers towards sustainability.


We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you, at work and at home.
With offices primarily located in Scandinavia, the UK, North America and India, we are currently 7,300 people who bring their expertise in engineering, architecture, energy and environment into play.


Equal- opportunity employer
COWI provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

name_location: JYSK · Arendal, Agder, Norway  6 days ago  · 2 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Selskapsbeskrivelse

JYSK er en internasjonal møbelbutikkjede med skandinaviske røtter som gjør det enkelt å møblere alle rom i ethvert hjem og hage.

Med mer enn 3000 butikker og nettbutikker i 48 land har JYSK alltid et godt tilbud og kompetent service i nærheten, uansett hvordan kundene ønsker å handle.

Gründer Lars Larsen åpnet sin første butikk i Danmark i 1979. I dag sysselsetter JYSK mer enn 30 000 kolleger.

JYSK er en del av det familieeide Lars Larsen Group med en samlet omsetning på 39,1 milliarder DKK i regnskapsåret 2020/21. JYSKs omsetning var DKK 36,2 milliarder i regnskapsåret 2021/22.

Jobbeskrivelse

Ønsker du å utdanne og utvikle deg selv? Er du klar til å kickstarte karrieren din i et av landets beste utdanningsprogram innen retail management? Er du ivrig etter å ta ansvar for din egen butikk innen 10 -12 måneder?

Da er det riktige valget for deg å søke på JYSK Butikksjef Trainee programmet!

Hva vi tilbyr deg

Du får sjansen til å jobbe i et retail selskap som tilbyr deg en utdanning som sikrer deg et sterkt grunnlag for din videre karriere. I JYSK er vi dynamiske og hos oss blir dine innspill hørt, du blir involvert og din utvikling er avgjørende for oss. I tillegg får du som JYSK-ambassadør følgende:

Et traineeprogram som består av fem ukers trening i de ulike feltene du trenger for å drive en JYSK-butikk. Med erfarne retail og HR-fagfolk som coacher deg gjennom programmet. 
En erfaren mentor i organisasjonen, tilgjengelig for deg og ditt utviklingsbehov
I løpet av programmet, ansettes du som assisterende butikksjef hvis den stillingen er ledig i butikken, hvis ikke går du utenpå butikkens organisering som ren trainee og mellom opplæringsmodulene jobber du i butikken for å sikre praktisk erfaring fra modulenes teori og treninger
Muligheter for egen utvikling og eget ansvar
En fleksibel arbeidsplan for å ivareta arbeid, familie og fritid
20% rabatt hos JYSK og alle Lars Larsen konsernselskaper
Bedriftspensjonsordning
Øvrige ansattgoder som f.eks. Firmahytter i Danmark, Årsfest for alle ansatte med følge, 20% rabatt hos JYSK og alle Lars Larsen konsernselskaper (Sofacompany og BOLIA Norge) og 5 uker ferie

Hva programmet går ut på

Vårt varierte program består av kvalitetsopplæring innen ledelse og butikkdrift, og består av både praktiske eksempler fra butikk og teoretisk kunnskap. Generelt sett vil du jobbe og lære i et nært samarbeid med andre trainees og gode mentorer.

Opplæringen finner sted på vårt eget hovedkontor i Oslo og på utvalgte samlingssteder sentralt på østlandet
Fem moduler på en ukes varighet hver: teorigjennomgang, caser og rollespill, gruppearbeid, teambygging og klasseromsundervisning
Mellom modulene vil du få opplæring og veiledning på jobb med en tildelt Butikksjef som vil coache og veilede deg
Programmet avsluttes med en eksamenspresentasjon foran Retail Managere fra JYSK Norge, HR Manager og HR Business Partner fra din egen region

Det endelige målet med Butikksjef Trainee-programmet er å forberede deg på å drive din egen butikk i nær fremtid

Møt en av våre Butikksjef trainees og lær mer om programmet her: https://jobb.jysk.no/no/butikksjef-trainee

Hva har du med deg til oss?

Forpliktelse til å ta eierskap av egen utvikling, ta fullt ansvar og ta beslutninger i en dynamisk hverdag
Du har gode kommunikasjonsevner og klarer å skape et positivt arbeidsmiljø
Du er dreven og resultatorientert
Du vet hvordan du får ting gjort: Du holder hodet kaldt og guider andre, selv i stressende situasjoner
Du blir ikke skremt av fysisk arbeid

ER DETTE EN MULIGHET FOR DEG? SØK I DAG!

Rekrutteringsprosessen i JYSK:

Vi behandler søknader løpende og sluttfører rekrutteringen når vi har funnet den rette kandidaten. Vi holder alltid intervjuer – og for enkelte utvalgte funksjoner kan du forvente å få tilsendt videointervju hvor vi ønsker å høre mer om din motivasjon for jobben du søker på. Til enkelte stillinger sender vi også ut en adferdsanalyse som vi bruker i våre forberedelser til intervju for å sikre den beste og mest relevante opplevelsen for både deg og oss. Vi bruker ikke adferdsanalyse til selektering, kun til intervjuforberedelser.

Ytterligere informasjon

Vi mener at våre ansatte er nøkkelen til vår suksess, fra én butikk i 1979 til mer enn 3000 butikker over hele verden i dag. Derfor streber vi etter å tilby utvikling og vekstmuligheter innenfor JYSK, og vi setter vår ære i å belønne engasjement og innsats blant våre ansatte. Våre tre grunnleggende JYSK-verdier – Kjøpmann Kollega og Lagånd – uttrykker adferden og holdningen vi kan forvente av hverandre. Vi stoler på hverandre, og vi tror på delegering og frihet med ansvar.

JYSK ønsker å inkludere alle, uansett alder, kjønnsidentitet, rase, seksuell legning, fysisk eller mental evne, etnisitet og erfaring. Sammen, sikrer vi en inkluderende kultur som oppmuntrer, støtter og feirer de ulike stemmene til våre ansatte. For en flott blanding av ulike mennesker, talenter og unike personligheter gjør oss til et sterkere team. 

For mer informasjon, besøk vår karriereside: https://jobb.jysk.no/

Se også vårt internmagasin: https://gojysk.com/no

About the job
About Us

CBRE Data Centre Solutions (DCS) is a part of the global CBRE Group with over 115.000 employees worldwide and delivers fully integrated real estate, facilities and technology solutions for data centre owners, occupiers and investors across the globe. As a dedicated business line within CBRE, DCS is dedicated to solving complex challenges within every stage of the data centre lifecycle.

We provide our employees the best conditions to develop professionally and personally and to realise their full potential in the course of their career.

Join us now in OSLO (Norway) and bring your unique talent and skills to our Team.

Your Responsibilities

Job Purpose

This is a customer and team facing role to provide exceptional customer service and business support to contribute to the continued growth and success of the Business, to provide a comprehensive and flexible administration service to the Service Delivery Manager and the Finance & Lead Contract Support Manager of the Business Unit.

Further Responsibilities

Ensure that all supplier contracts within their allocated sphere of responsibility are negotiated with suppliers on price, lead time, quality and service for multiple services and commodities
Take a lead on supplier contract negotiations/reviews
Support the technical and infrastructure teams
Utilizing defined systems, raises purchase orders, approves invoices for payment and manages the closure of Purchase orders as part of the full management of the purchase order cycle
Identify and help drive implementation of savings opportunities to ensure customer and financial savings targets are maximized

Positively respond to both our internal and external customers (often in a matrix environment) through effective communication and personal accessibility/credibility.

Ensure integrity of financial transactions for contract maintain WIP, OPO’s and Debt to within agreed contractual and company defined parameters
Ensure the raise of PO, payments of invoices and billing to client in set timeframe.

YOUR PROFILE

Experience of working in a fast paced, operational service environment
Organised but flexible attitude with the openness to break new grounds to challenge inefficiencies
Business fluency in both English and local language
Capable of working in a matrix environment
Results/ task orientated, with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent time management and organisational skills
Commitment to continuous improvement
Ability to work as part of a team, as well as independently
Calm manner, able to work under pressure and with changing demands and priorities
Customer focus skills with a passion for customer service
Effective communication skills enabling the individual to work with clients, suppliers, and staff at all levels
Strong background in invoicing and controlling
Excellent capabilities to manage and organize the monthly reports
Demonstrate ability to work close with different teams and improve the output

OUR BENEFITS - WHAT YOU´LL GET IN RETURN

Future-proof job opportunity with a true development guarantee in one of the fastest growing Data Centre markets worldwide

ARE YOU IN?
